review.title: Sheraton Fisherman's warf
review.reviewText: Totally overrated hotel. We paid an outrageous price for a view of some sort of machinery outside of our window. Poor staff. Ripoff.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower their prices to reflect the quality of the hotel.

managementResponses.response:
We are glad that you found our location and our staff members to be a good choice. We offer offsite valet services for vehicles over six feet high.

We look forward to seeing you again.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Nice hotel close to pier 39
review.reviewText: Great hotel close to peir 39. If you have a a cargo rack dont plan on parking in hotel lot. We had to park in public lot. Other then that staff was very helpful!!

managementResponses.response:
Dear SL,

We loved you for staying with us at Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf and for posting this five star review. Glad that you found our rooms clean and comfortable. Yes, parking here is expensive but not more here than other hotels.

We look forward to your next trip to San Francisco.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Nice, pleasant hotel.
review.reviewText: We loved staying at the Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf Hotel.  It is a very nice, clean, hotel.  We loved our room and enjoyed all the comforts.  The only downside of this property is that we were charged $59.00 to park and we only stayed for one night.  I think this is a bit much to charge to park.   I was told that all the parking in the Fisherman's Wharf area is expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Great location in Fisherman's Wharf. We walked to everything.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Martha,

Thanks for the feedback and for the nice comments about our location and staff members. Sorry that we failed to follow up on the maintenance issue. We will get right on it. 

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: A nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf.  Needs to be updated in some sectors and $25.00 for breakfast is a bit much in light of the fact that many hotels in San Francisco offer free breakfasts.  WiFi only free in public areas.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to Fisherman's Wharf.  Pleasant staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The toilet in my room ran constantly; informed the front desk; only thing I got was an apology for the inconvenience, no effort to remedy.
review.locationRemarks:
Fisherman's Wharf; it is touristy and kinda cheesy, but everybody gravitates there anyway!
All of the tour companies work out of here.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Darryl,

We were very pleased to read your outstanding review of your recent stay with us at Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf. Thanks so much for the nice comments about our location, attractive decor, heated swimming pool and, especially, for our staff members. We are delighted that we exceeded your expectations.

It was our pleasure to serve you. We all look forward to welcoming you back.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Great location Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: We stayed three nights, family of five in two seperate rooms. Whilst the outside of the hotel may look dated, it's the inside that counts. The inside is great. Kids aged 14, 17&18 found the swimming pool, they thought it was excellent. Very little noise from our room overnight, other local hotels are noisier as they front onto busy road. Excellent location for Fishermans Wharf. Free WiFi in Lobby, expensive WiFi in room. A non hotel tip as travellers from Australia T-Mobile offer a 21 day SIM with 2GB wifi and 1000 minutes outgoing local calls and free texts to Australia for US$37 including taxes. Everything quoted excludes taxes, buyer beware when you go to pay. Lombard zig zag street a mile away, a must do is cable car. Staff at hotel excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Outside looks dated, don't be mistaken, the inside is great.
review.locationRemarks: Close to all things Fishermans Wharf offer. A definite pick for Fishermans Wharf.

managementResponses.response:
Thanks for the return stay and for your feedback. We are sorry that the bed was uncomfortable. Had we know, we would have replaced it immediately but have taken care of it since.

We hope that you will return and enjoy another stay.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This was our 4th time staying at the Sheraton and sadly, even though the room itself was nice, the bed was absolutely horrible - it was like a sheet was put across a boxspring - very uncomfortable.  We had 3 terrible nights of sleep.  We did tell reception on check-out that they should consider replacing the bed immediately as no-one should have to sleep on that.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds need to be improved - for $400/night there is no excuse for uncomfortable beds.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39 is a 5 minute walk.  Lots of restaurants and stores

managementResponses.response:
Dear Cazza,

We appreciate the four star rating and nice comments about your stay with us at Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf. It is great to know that our convenient location made it easy to do everything.

It was our pleasure to serve you. We look forward to welcoming you back.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Great location in Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay and were in a convenient location for many activities.

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Good location in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Nice hotel steps away from Pier 39, Alcatraz Cruises, Ghiardelli Square. Hotel does not have a restaurant but there are plenty to choose from nearby. Room was modern, spacious and clean. Staff helpful. Second time staying here and would stay again if in San Francisco.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Niki,

We are glad that you enjoyed our convenient location. Thanks for your suggestions for upgrading.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Good location but dated hotel for the price
review.reviewText: You can't beat the location. 1 block off of the Wharf! Perfect! But, the hotel itself is dated. The rooms are small. The bathroom area is tiny and not user friendly if you have more than one person in the room. We made it work, but not ideal. Especially for the price. I would probably look at the other properties in this location next time.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathrooms. Update the carpets. Lower cost of eating at the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Absolutely everything to do is within walking distance of the hotel. The restaurants, bars, shops, Pier 39, Pier 33 (Alcatraz pier).

managementResponses.response:
Dear Hanna,

We appreciate your feedback. Thanks for your recommendations.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Tiny rooms, thin walls, good location.
review.reviewText: The room was super tiny compared to any other sheridan. We could hear the kids one floor above us screaming and running around. The building is only 3 stories and must have been built using thin w ply wood because you can hear everyone outside and in the rooms next door.  The hotel was in a very good location though which is the only upside. Use the street meter parking to avoid $60 vallet/self parking fee.

managementResponses.response:
Sorry to see that your stay was not up to expectations. We will work extra hard to ensure that every Guest leaves satisfied.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Would not stay again
review.reviewText: Stayed here to be close to Fishermans dwarf for a night. Stay somewhere nice 10 minutes away like the Hyatt regency. Room smelt, and staff turned us away from overpriced breakfast buffet wit an outside coffee. Can't think of anything good about this place.

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Great friendly staff!
review.reviewText: It was a perfect little getaway in SF!  My friend came from out of town and we needed a moms night out

review.title: Perfect location, great pool area for in the city
review.reviewText: We were tourists and everything that we did was in walking distance.  The hotel staff was also very helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast buffet was very good, but over priced when most hotels include it.  Also it's so old fashion to charge for wifi.
review.locationRemarks: Hop on Bus, Alcatraz, Pier 39 with the sea lions---great location.

review.title: Great location near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Great location - easy walk to Fisherman's Wharf.  Staff went out of their way to be helpful.  Particularly loved the outdoor firepits where guests could relax and enjoy a beer.  Stayed two nights on prior to a trip up the coast.  Grocery store right across the street was a great convenience.  Car rental on site - no need to rent at the airport!

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Very nice relaxed hotel for its size
review.reviewText:
The room was a lovely one and the location, near Fisherman's Warf was excellent, though no sea views sadly. It is well placed for public transport. The facilities at the hotel are good and it has a warm, friendly atmosphere. The room was large and comfortable and well appointed apart from a lack of anywhere to hang the towels. 

Staff were helpful and friendly. We had a good stay and enjoyed San Francisco.

review.title: Excellent .

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText:
Enjoyed our stay. Our first trip to San Fransisco, so much to see and do. Beautiful city even though it was pretty chilly at times! Don't forget your warm clothes! 
Hotel was so close to the piers which was great. Good gym and pool. The hotel was a little older than I was expecting but still fine.
I would recommend it would definitely go back.

review.title: Very good hotel near to Pier 39

review.reviewText:

review.title: VERY noisy location.  Windows were extremely dirty
review.reviewText: Overpriced in my opinion.  The building needs renovation desperately.
review.negativeRemarks: I understand that the price per night is based on other factors, but this place needs some serious renovation and cleaning.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco is small enough that next time I visit I will stay in another location further out of the center knowing I can easily get around.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the kudos about our location. We will work on the other stuff.

review.title: Good location but noisy, mediocre
review.reviewText: Once you pay for the room, everything else is an extra charge.  Coffee and pastries in the lobby not only not complimentary but cost twice as much as elsewhere.  Key card system in elevator SUCKS and we took the stairs to avoid it.  Once we agreed to "Green Housekeeping" to not have our sheets changed, we had no housekeeping at all.  Beds never made, no toilet paper, tissues, towels or coffee packets.  We chased maids down in the hall to get toilet paper.   Free Wi-Fi in the lobby only.  Our room was facing an alley with a generator parked in it and we heard traffic from the main road all night long.  No fridge in room.  The location was central to Fisherman's Wharf (one block from waterfront) with Big Bus and Tower Tours right across the street and MUNI bus and streetcar stops very close.  For all that, it was a very busy place with people coming and going all day long.  The lobby was like Grand Central Station.

managementResponses.response:
Dear CK,

We are thrilled that you had a five star experience with us at Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf. Thanks for the nice comments about our location and all the things we were able to do from here.

It was our pleasure to serve you. We look forward to welcoming you back.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Great hotel, walking distance to all the fun.
review.reviewText: We had a really fun time in SF. Went to Napa, Alcatraz, went on a tour bus to Sausalito. Ate at many great restaurants. Rented mini yellow cars and traveled the city.

managementResponses.response:
Dear JJ,

Sorry for the mix up on your reservation. We will work hard to ensure that every Guest leaves satisfied.

review.title: good location bad experience
review.reviewText: We reserved this hotel on Expedia and paid in advance.  We knew we were going to be late check in and called 3 times and asked them to save our room, each time they said it was saved.  We arrived at hotel 9:30pm and they gave our room away.  The front desk clerk was trying to give us a room for 2 people but our reservations was for 4. I told him we reserved a double and he said we reserved "A" room. He was a little rude  It took 45 minutes to find us a room to sleep 4 and get us checked in. When we arrived at the room it wasn't very clean and it was located next to the entrance/valet.  It was very loud.  This room was overpriced for the experience we received, when it could have been much better.  I would not stay at this hotel or a Sheraton again.  They need to learn customer appreciation.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer Service and commitment to reservations.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Barb,

We are happy to know that our staff took such good care of you and our location was excellent. Please be sure to look for the packages we offer as they may provide a bit more value.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: sherston Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice and well cared for. Staff was nice and helpful. Had to pay for wifi and it didn't work very well. Location was excellent. Bathroom was tiny. Noisy street outside the room. Breakfast was $24.95 per person. Hotel was very expensive!! Parking was $60/ day.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Allan,

We are sorry that the room selected was not to your likely. Where we are happy that our team made an appropriate gesture, we are unsure why a room better suited to your needs was rejected.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Terrible room location
review.reviewText: Opposite street generator, above exit for indoor garage.  Never was told at check in. Did not realize this until we tried to go to sleep. Noise prohibited sleep. On record with guest services at 3:30 am. Finally got to speak to hotel room manager after speaking to someone else he sent out. Offered free breakfast and to change room. Did not want to change room because we were only staying in San Francisco for one day and did not want to waste 2 hours packing, repacking, and unpacking again. Finally agreed to be comped for first night. Manager refused to comp us for second night only to change room. Again did not want to waste the time. Same problem next night, very unfair, hotel was expensive
review.positiveRemarks: Housekeeping very nice and efficient and good location
review.negativeRemarks: That room 2608 be never rented

review.title: Excellent location!

review.title: Sheraton stay
review.reviewText: Our stay was generally pleasant but probably wouldn't stay again. The hotel lobby constantly looks like a backpackers hostel with noisy teenagers everywhere using hotels free wifi. The hotel seemed understaffed. Tried calling front desk - no answer. No one at concierge twice when we required help. We had 4 people in our room but were only ever given 3 towels..having to request extra each day. A little disappointing from Sheraton.

review.title: Family get away
review.reviewText:
The locale is great. Easy access to most of the city. On site r parking was convenient, but pricey. Older property, but updated.Only Double beds avail, but very comfortable. Very small bath and vanity area, with  limited counter space for your stuff, and no where to hang your towels.
Typical "city" hotel...$50/day parking, $15/day Wi-Fi, $5 lobby coffee.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Sandra,

Thanks for the feedback. Look for our packages in the future that may be a bit more value for you.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Nice but pricey
review.reviewText: This is a nice place, close to all the tourist venues at Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco. But by the time you pay the outrageous summer price and then pay for any "extra" things like Wi-Fi, coffee, a fridge or microwave in your room, and $60 each night for parking, it really adds up. We could only get a king bed room, so my 17 y.o. had to sleep on the floor (another outrageous fee for a rollaway). Stay a little bit further out and get some comfort.  City busses are pretty easy to use. Fisherman's Wharf is overrun with tourists and tourist-money-grabbing shops and restaurants, and if I went to San Fran again I'd stay elsewhere.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the feedback. We will definitely work to provided every Guest the room that works for them.

review.title: only good thing is location
review.reviewText: The best thing about this hotel is the location. The bathrooms are too small. There's not much space for anything because there's no counter, it's pretty much just the sink. Our window was right in front of a bus parking space so needless to say, it was very noise. I know the costs in San Francisco are high but for the price I paid for the hotel, I was expecting a little better room.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for the feedback.

review.title: Reservation for 3, one bed in room.
review.reviewText: I reserved the king room for 3 with a 16 year old son. I have reserved many many rooms previously and have always had a pull out in the room. At check-in, was told "We don't know how old your child is, it could be an infant you sleep in between the two of you." Which I found ridiculous! They did switch our room to 2 doubles but acted like it was some big favor they were doing us. Fortunately we were hungry because our room was not going to be ready for a couple hours. Both rooms overlooked An ugly interior roof-no view. Not exactly nice for the wharf area-out of town visitors. Must have been in the missed fine print-was a but surprised at the $52 daily parking fee. Upside-they had in and out priveliges.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Debi,

Sorry about the mix up about the sofa bed. The request was not received at the hotel but glad you did finally get it. We will take a look at the spacing. Sounds like the bed got moved a bit.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Don't ask for a fold out, sleeper sofa...
review.reviewText:
I was extremely disappointed by the negative, arrogant greeting I received upon arrival. I had just spent two lovely days in the wine country, the desk clerk's treatment of me was equal him finding chewing gum stuck on his shoe.  

My husband and I were traveling with our 10-year-old son.  I had reserved king bedroom with a request for a fold-out bed.  The clerk said, "You did not made that request."  He and then looked down his nose at me and said, (Oh,... you made your reservation through Expedia [emphasis added]"  

I finally received the room key.  My family and I entered to the room.  It appeared very clean and nice, however the fold-out completely blocked the right side of the bed causing me to climb over the bed every time I wanted to use the bathroom or move to another side of the room.  It was dangerous to be so blocked.  

To add to the sense of unrest, they experienced a fire (or drill) and we all had to evacuate down the stairs and out of the building.  Fortunately it was during waking hours, but it did emphasis the unsafe condition of the room's small square footage.

Very disappointed.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Dawn,

You were very kind to post this five star review of your stay with us at Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf. Thanks for pointing out our perfect location, heated pool and outdoor living rooms.

It was great to have the whole family here. Please come back soon.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

Walls are a bit thin so you hear a lot of the noise from the other rooms both around us and above.

review.title: Walk to Fisherman's Wharf from an okay hotel.
review.reviewText: Fine, dated, hotel which could be nice if you like retro furnishings, but our chair was missing buttons and the light fixtures over the bed were loose. Beds were okay but not great. Everything was clean, so that's a plus. Our room looked over the bus depot so piles of spare tires were all we saw, even being so close to the waterfront. Easy walk to all of the tourist traps of Fisherman's Wharf - including the crowds that come with it. Self parking/valet was available if you drive in but is expensive, might want to consider parking garage that sits caddy-corner to hotel instead. No free wifi. Staff were best part of the experience - front desk staff at check in/out were super friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy walkability to wharf and Embarcadero.
review.negativeRemarks: Old furnishings are fine, as long as they're in good repair - maintain the furniture and fixtures.
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks to Fisherman's Wharf. A couple of blocks to the trolley station, catch an easy ride up the BIG hills to Lombard Street and other SF locales

The noise levels were ok -- we did hear everything in the hallway but were otherwise undisturbed during our short stay.

review.title: Nice beds, colorfull room
review.reviewText:
Outside the hotel looks very average. But the rooms are very bright, with white chair, and colorful carpets. What I liked the most was the bed. Usually the beds are just soft and plush and it is impossible to sleep. I slept more then 9h in this bed. Woke up couple of times - for sleeping in a hotel that is actually good. 
In addition everything is close by, Safeway, Trader Joe's, Pier 39. You can park in nearby or other SF garages and avoid paying overnight parking at the hotel.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent 3 days and 2 nights in San Francisco for a mini vacation.  The location is perfect to all the sights and happenings on Fishermans Wharf.  Check in was fast and easy.  It took about 4 minutes and we got a great room (3508).  It was quiet, clean, and comfortable.  We called down to get extra towels and the brought us the of every size within 5 minutes.  The bed was comfortable and the pillows were the best (I wanted to buy 2). We did go green and got vouchers which we used the next morning to get some red bulls with ease.  We did not eat at the hotel but went to the wharf.  There is a Safeway and CVS less than 50 yards away if you want snacks.  The concierge service was great!  Very knowledgable and helped us out by printing out our tickets with ease when we forgotten them at home.  The bellhop watched our bags after we checked out for several hours before out shuttle picked us up.  Very good staff, the service makes it a four star place to stay.

managementResponses.response:
Thanks for this four star review of your stay at Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf. We are glad that we met your overall needs.

It was our pleasure to serve you. We look forward to welcoming you back.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Nice location but the service could be better.
review.reviewText:
Location was very close to the piers, walking distance. Within the perimeter, there are supermarket, 7-11, and few restaurants. 

However, a road trip (to the hotel) was not recommended. Carpark is chargeable for about USD50+ per day. We had to park at the opposite mall's carpark for about USD30+ per day (Of course, we chose the cheaper one!!).

I booked the room for 4 pax, which was stated clearly when I made the reservation. Upon arriving at the room, there were lack of toiletries (towels, toothbrushes, ...). # Towels given for 3 pax; 0 toothbrush sets. # From my experience with other hotels, they will provide complimentary toiletry packs without request. Then, a call was made to the guest service. A while later, a guy (not in uniform) came to the room to pass us the packs. Seriously...?
review.negativeRemarks: Staffs are friendly but i thought the service provided by the hotel could be better.
review.locationRemarks: Bigbus company are around the corner should tourists wants a ride around San Fran tourists area.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the feedback. We are glad that you found our hotel clean and our staff helpful. Our pricing is clearly noted on Expedia and other partner sites.

review.title: Nickel and dime
review.reviewText: This hotel is clean and well located, however it is not 4 star.  They staff was helpful, but the "special" advertised on Expedia was misleading.  The hotel is ala cart.  If you want to use the refrigerator - $20, wifi $16, parking $59.  Parking is understandable, however guests should get a break from the public imo.

review.title: Bad staff, Spider in the room.
review.reviewText:
We spent two nights at the hotel. Arriving at the hotel we had to deal with a 20-minute line, after a 6 hours trip it's not a pleasant wait. The attendant that was making our check-in didn't help to make the wait worth it. He didn't look us in the eyes at all, he was talking with a very low-voice making really hard for us to hear him, he said that they didn't have any room with king beds (but they were upgrading the two people before me to king beds when they didn't want it??)
Not apologizes for the wait, for not having a room with a king bed, not courteous at all for a 4-star hotel.
I didn't complain, I was tired and just wanted to sleep.
Arriving at the room, surprise: I found a spider in the bathroom.
For a 4-star hotel I was expecting more, in road trips usually I stay in Holiday Inn / Americas Best Value / Travelogde, hotels and my experience was always good.
I'm disappointed and I don't think I will come back to the hotel, since I have better options in the same range of price that I paid.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was good and it's modern.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff! People can be nicer and they don't need to treat you different just because you booked through a promotion.
review.locationRemarks: It's close to Fisherman Wharf and it's in a good area.

review.title: Close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: On arrival at our initial room, we were greeted by 2 dogs off the leash outside our room. The room overlooked an inner atrium that contained noisy air conditioning plant, which stopped us sleeping well after 2 am. At 1200 am I had tried to request a room change but none was available. At 6am we manged to change rooms before our tour excursion for the day. Reception did deal with our complaint politely in the end, but we would have preffered more urgency on their part, to have changed rooms much earlier. We were very dissapointed with the Sheraton on this occasion.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to the San Francisco Fishermans Wharf hub, and piers.
review.negativeRemarks: Timeleness in dealing with complaints, review of the dog policy, consideration of guests needs for a restful stay.
review.locationRemarks: Central location to activities.

review.title: Very pricey but you are at Fishermans Wharf!
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, had a pool and gym, outdoor fire pits and so close to Fishermans Wharf.  The staff there was very good and especially Jen at the concierge desk.  We did not try the bistro there as there are many restaurants nearby.  Although after booking through Expedia(my first time) and not reading the fine print of the hotel(lose one night stay to cancel or change your reservations), the morning after the first night I got a rate your check in  from Expedia.  I told them of my concerns, wifi costs about $15 night, fridge costs $20 and the noise from the street was very loud.  When we returned from our day out I had received an email from the manager of Sheraton offering to change my room if needed and to give us free wifi for our stay.  We did have to sign up to be Starwood members but that part was easy.  I really appreciated that by booking through Expedia I was able to get the help needed.  The room was very noisy but did not want to pack up everything and change rooms( single pane windows I think) so we kept the white noise of the window style air conditioner on all night.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Fishermans Wharf and all those attractions.  I really appreciated the offer of a new room and also the free wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise off the street thru the "single pane" windows was very loud at night.  The rattling of the air conditioner had to turned on and off manually
review.locationRemarks: Close to Hop On/Off buses, lots of restaurants, Pier 39, Ghiradelli Square, Alcatraz.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Vicky,

Thanks for staying with us and for your feedback. We are sorry that it took longer than expected to get you checked in. From the look of it, we selected one of our most popular rooms - a Loft room - for you and the previous Guest left later than usual. 

We are glad we got it sorted out and the remainder of your stay was pleasant.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Hotel staff made first impression very bad.
review.reviewText: Checked in around 10:00 a.m.  Did not expect the room to be ready, but wanted to check in and leave bags.  We were told that one room would be ready at 1:00 pm and the other around 3:00 pm.  We  checked back at 2:00 and neither was ready and we were treated rudely by another person at the counter and asked to leave our phone # and they would call when rooms were ready.  5:00..... still no call; checked back at the counter with yet another person and we had to back through the check-in process.  Given keys to two rooms on same hall..... one had not been cleaned from previous occupants!  Told that it would be cleaned asap...... it was not!  Maid was on break!  Finally got a room on another floor at around 7 pm!  Far from our traveling companions.
review.positiveRemarks: Courtyard view room was nice and bright, once we were able to settle in.
review.negativeRemarks: New staff and training and communication!
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf area was great!

review.title: Nice hotel, excellent location!
review.reviewText: We went to SF for a long weekend with our two daughters (ages 6 and 8) and even though it was a cold few days, I chose to stay here because they had the pool.  So glad I did!  The accommodations were great, clean room, friendly staff and helpful when I asked about travel tips/places to go, they had a snack bar/drinks which made it easy since we had the kids.  The location was the best part because I was there with kids one night on my own the location made my life so easy we could just walk out the door and so close to places to eat and attraction for the kids (Pier 39, Musee Mechanique, Boudin Bakery, Ghirardelli Square and the waterfront, Lombard Street) and even though it was freezing my kids still had a great time playing in the pool.  We definitely plan to come back!

review.title: Close to beach but kinda dumpy
review.reviewText: When we arrived we tried to turn on the heat since it was cold and windy outside.  It was blowing freezing cold air.  We called twice to have someone come and look at it and no one arrived.  We ended up falling asleep due to jet lag with freezing cold air blowing on us all night.  Woke up the next morning sick!  They finally came out the next day after I called them AGAIN and had to replace the heating until.  Tried to get a credit but was told they cannot due that.  Also, parking was $52.00/day and WI-FI was $16.00/day.  Kind of a rip off considering the room itself wasn't cheap.  Would not stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel needs to be updated.

managementResponses.response:

We look forward to welcoming you back.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and accommodated us nicely. However, I was shocked by all of the hidden fees. I listed 2 adults and 1 child on my reservation and was charged $25/day to have extra blankets and sheets for my daughter to sleep on the couch. I could have had two beds for the same price of the room I was given.  I was also surprised to have to pay $52/day to park at the hotel. Where else was I supposed to park? Internet access was also not free. I'm surprised they didn't charge extra for towels!

review.title: Great location, nice hotel, good service
review.reviewText: We liked this hotel - the location was great, close to Pier 39, Union Square and other attractions. There was an expected level of noise from a hotel in the city - I am a light sleeper and it didn't bother me with the fan running on low at night. The hotel was clean and comfortable. We thought a few updates would spruce it up even more - updating some of the windows, the carpet seemed like it wasn't installed quite right, and a hot tub would have been amazing. However, these are cosmetic and luxury complaints so not a deal breaker by any means. We also thought larger towels at the pool should be available - they seemed even smaller than the bath towels. Overall, this was a very pleasant, comfortable, clean hotel in a great location for an affordable price!
review.negativeRemarks: Detailed above - minor updates, larger towels at pool, a few more coffee creamers/sweeteners on hand in the room (there was only two of each item)
review.locationRemarks: Close to a lot of great places, Pier 39 in walking distance, short drive to Union Square, many other great attractions and shopping

review.title: Quiet Room
review.reviewText: We asked for a quiet room and were given just that on the top floor. It had a king size bed in a well decorated, large room, which was all very nice on the eye. There was a desk/bench running the length of the wall below the window which allowed us to lay out our meals on a tablecloth, using tasty food we bought from the Supermarket across the road. It was just a short walk to Pier 39/ Fisherman's Wharf. An excellent stay at a price we could afford!
review.positiveRemarks: An excellent location. It is a big hotel but has a welcoming atmosphere and although many people were staying there, we were not overly aware of this.

review.title: Adequate, but fails the "soap test"
review.reviewText: I always do the "soap test" on hotels. Do they actually care enough about their guests to give them a decent bar of soap or do they give you one of those rock-hard worthless "wafer bars" to save a few pennies and show their contempt? We know where most hotels come out on this test, they fail miserably. When they fail on the soap, they naturally fail on everything else, giving you just what they have to, and not a grade above. That's pretty much the Sheraton, it could be any hotel, adequate enough, but charmless and "corporate" where pencil pushers have determined your "hospitality."

The smokers took over the fire pits outside and were not mannerly.  The reading lights on the headboards didn't work in our rooms.  
The rooms were quiet and comfortable.  The ladies making our coffee at the coffee bar downstairs were extremely pleasant.  The hotel front staff were delightful and made check in and check out easy.

The hotel was older than we expected.  The walls were banged up and scuffed up, up on the 2nd floor.  Our air conditioning quit working the first night that were there, and got quite warm by the next evening.  They did fix it very quickly.  We were disappointed that the Wifi wasn't included in the price of the room.  All of the extras were more money, which most other hotels include them in the price of the room.  
The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.  The maids did a great job of cleaning.  Not much of a view. 
The computers and printers didn't work.  We tried and tried to get one of them to work, but never did have any luck.
review.positiveRemarks:
The location was great.  Within walking distance of most everything.  The staff was great and very helpful. 
Everyone there were very friendly.

As a resident of San Francisco, I can attest that parking everywhere is expensive. Parking meters in this area are $3 per hour! However, our charges are similar of other hotels in this area. We also allow unlimited in and out privileges, 24 hr staffing and a covered, direct access to the hotel's lobby.

It was our pleasure to serve you. We look forward to welcoming you back.

Sincerely,
Michael Hirsch

review.reviewText:
The Sheraton is a good centrally located spot on Fisherman's Wharf.  The hotel was very clean.  Reading past reviews was helpful as they charge additional for wireless access and parking.  I had a wireless card from work that I brought and we only rented a car when we went to Yosemite for a couple days.  There are rental car companies within 1 block of the Sheraton.  You do not need to rent a car while in San Francisco.  

For some reason they only give each room 3 towels and we had 2 adults and 2 kids.  So had to call housekeeping to get another set of towels.  The air conditioner did not work at first but was fixed while we went out on the town in the morning.  It would be nice to have a frig in the room as breakfast can get spendy.  There is a grocery store half block away where we bought cereal for the morning but could not store the extra milk anywhere.  The beds were comfortable.  In the end, we would definitely stay at this hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: Put 4 towels in each room if the room can hold 4 people.  Put a frig in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Trolley Tours, public transportation, grocery store.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Sabina,

We were very happy to hear that your stay was amazing. Thanks for pointing out our welcoming staff, comfortable and clean room and, of course, our great location. Sounds like to covered a lot of ground from here.

It was certainly our pleasure to serve you. All of us at Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf look forward to your next trip here.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Amazing hotel in the center of the city
review.reviewText: Had an amazing experience the staff was very welcoming. Our room was very comfortable and clean and was kept that way throughout our stay. The hotel was located right in the middle of everything. We were able to walk straight to pier 39, ghirardelli square, Chinatown and other tourist places. I extremely recommend!

It was our pleasure to serve you. We look forward to welcoming you back.

review.title: Great location to get out and about
review.reviewText: Very well appointed hotel in iconic SF location.  Clean, safe, efficient, good staff.  If you want cheap go to a suburb location.  This is a well appointed, class facility, in a premier world class California location.

review.title: Tourist Trap.
review.reviewText:
This hotel is incredibly overpriced. We paid ~$300 for a 300 square foot room that didn't even have a refrigerator. The bathroom was also incredibly small and lacking in quality fixtures. 

We were first put in a ground floor, street facing room with a door that would not close all the way. After waiting 20 minutes for maintenance to take a look at our door, we decided to go to the front desk and request a new room. Luckily, we were able to change rooms, otherwise we would have been dealing with vehicle noise all night long. Even after moving to the fourth floor, the noise from the street was still very audible. 

Also, as other reviews have mentioned, parking is $57 a night and does not include valet service. Wi-fi will also set you back an additional $14 a night, because you haven't spent enough on this room already. 

I'm not sure if it's because it's a Sheraton or because the hotel is located in a tourist trap of a neighborhood, but the price of a room here is exorbitant for what guests are provided with. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this hotel, and ideally, far away from the Wharf.
review.locationRemarks: Tourist trap. Too many people, too many cheap trick tourist attractions.

We had no issues at all getting to our destination.

review.title: Road Trip
review.reviewText:
Great location where all the action is by Fisherman's Wharf.

1- Parking was a major issue and was very chaotic.  After driving for 5 hours, one usually wants to have an easy, uneventful check in to their hotel.   It took 20 minutes to eventually get our car parked after driving up to the hotel and another 15 minutes to get checked in and actually be in our room.  There was a long line of cars waiting to check in and absolutely no one directing traffic or taking control. There were two options for parking - $50 to park at the hotel or $35 to park in the garage across the street.  No one offered valet parking.

2- The hotel was very noisy all during the night.  The rooms were not well insulated.  The people in the  room across from us had several kids and the parents yelled at them all night long.  The people in the room above us walked around in what sounded like combat boots; we're talking from 12:00 at night to the wee hours of the morning.  Also, our room faced the street, so there was a lot of noise early in the morning starting around 6:30 am.  The blinds did not shield out the morning light either.  One crappy night's sleep in an expensive place; you would expect better.
review.positiveRemarks:
Rooms were nice and clean.  Beds were comfortable.
Good location - close to everything.
review.negativeRemarks:
Parking and checking in process.
Better insulated rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Great location and everything within walking distance.  Nothing lacking in Fisherman's Wharf area - lots to do and something for everyone.

review.title: A bit disappointing for the price. Overall nice.
review.reviewText: Pros: Hotel was blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 which allowed us to walk to many activities including our Alcatraz tour.  Parking is challenging and expensive so this was a plus. I was unaware that we would be charged a fee for parking our car in the underground garage of the hotel so this was a surprise but still cheaper than street parking.  The room was very clean and pleasantly decorated. Beds were comfortable with ample pillows. Staff was friendly and helpful. Cons: The toilet flushed only when the handle was held down for some time.  It required the handle to be jiggled a minute or two later because it wouldn't stop running.  The sink filled with water very quickly and appeared to need the drain unclogged.  The heater/AC unit did not have any temperature control that functioned.  It blew air but we were unable to change the temperature. Also was disappointed there was no frig for the cost of the room.

review.title: Walking distance to Fisherman's wharf area
review.reviewText:
Expected a little bit more of a Sheraton hotel.  Other hotels we'd stayed in on our trip delighted us more than this hotel.  Very large hotel with many rooms that takes the entire block.  We were on the 3rd floor with no view except for the roof and our friends were on the first. Room was fairly recently refreshed by the looks and was comfortable however with just a bed, armchair and TV.  King bed was very comfortable.
No fridge in room and only appeared to be one ice machine on floors 2-4. On our first day 2 out of the 3 ice machines were not working.
1st floor rooms did not use lift and did not have access to ice machines as these were only accessible via the lift with your room key and first floor guest keys did not work in the lift.  
Bathroom accessories only included soap, shampoo, conditioner and lotion - no shower cap or other accessories which was a little disappointing given the other cheaper brand of hotels we'd stayed in over the 3 week stay in the US provided many other accessories and hospitality -  including sofa's in the room rather than just a chair, complementary bottled water.

review.reviewText: Had a very good time in Fisherman's Wharf, plenty to see and do.  Enjoyed going round the historic ships.
review.locationRemarks: Good location close to Fisherman's Wharf.  Loads of shops and restaurants there.  Close to the cable car rides as well.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Clive,

Thanks for the four star rating and nice comments about your stay at Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf. We loved reading how much you enjoyed our comfort, value and amenities. Sounds like a nice way to visit San Francisco.

It was our pleasure to serve you. We look forward to welcoming you back.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: this is a nice hotel,in a great location
review.reviewText: We have stayed in a few hotels in the wharf area. This is the best by far for comfort, location, value for money, and amenities. Room very comfortable, plentiful stock of towels and toiletries. Starbucks coffee as standard in the room. Good size pool and lounging area. Well stocked bar/cafe area in the lobby, with free Wi-Fi.
review.positiveRemarks: "home-from-home". staff very customer focused. treated more as a family friend, less as a paying guest. outside social area very welcoming.awesome
review.negativeRemarks: due to length of our stay, we found the closet space and drawers a bit limited for the items we brought with us. bathrobes as standard would be good.
review.locationRemarks: close to the wharf area. pier 39, cable car lines, "f" line trams, restaurants, cafes, good views across the bay to Alcatraz. good public transport.

managementResponses.response:
We are glad that your experience was satisfactory and that your accommodations were comfortable. Please note that parking charges are clearly stated on our website and mention of parking fees are noted on Expedia. Sorry this was a surprise to you.

We also offer a host of packages for those Guests who know that they will use some of the other services.

We look to seeing your next direct reservation and to welcome you back.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Nice but expensive
review.reviewText: Our stay was fine, beds very comfy but was shocked after having paid in full thru Expedia that we were charged $57.00 nightly parking after paying $512.00 for two night stay and think parking should just be included as we need to drive to get there and hello we can't park in our room. Its a no brainer that you expect us to drive there but charging so much just to park our car to stay in the hotel...Its ridiculous!! We have traveled lots and never had to pay to find garaging space for our vehicle...also I just looked at my credit card I used for payment and I see two charges, one for each day of $100.00 on top of the $57.00 per day for parking space which I will dispute this my credit card company once its not a pending charge...I will NEVER use Expedia again either as their discounts are stripped of all using of the room like refrigerator, microwave, wifi as they are all additional charges which drops the price obviously to make it look like its a great deal!! Its so deceiving to pay for a special offer only to find out we will be charged extra for each and every incidental which are all usually included in a hotel stay!! Live and Learn
review.positiveRemarks: The beds and the gentlemen in the parking area were very courteous and helpful in giving us directions
review.negativeRemarks: Include all parking and room using of items mentioned above..

managementResponses.response:
We are so glad that your anniversary trip turned out so well. Thanks for pointing out our great location, friendly staff members (especially Jenn at the concierge desk) and free wifi in the lobby.

It was our pleasure to serve you. We look forward to welcoming you back.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Anniversary Stay
review.reviewText:
We stayed here for a week.... and it was wonderful!!!
Location AMAZING we could walk to the water easily. We felt safe in the hotel and neighborhood. We were always well greeted. The hotel is busy nearly all the time. But they seem to handle it well. We had a room on the 4th floor (requested a quiet room). The lobby was great full of life, and FREE WIFI
Jennifer at the concierge desk was amazing and super sweet.
review.negativeRemarks: Free Wifi would of course be nice in rooms, Mini Fridges would also be great!
review.locationRemarks: SEA LIONS!!!, Food, Shopping, Boating Tours, Biking, Walking.....

managementResponses.response:
Dear Roger,

Thanks for staying with us and for your feedback. Your input is as appreciate as your patronage.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Water Bill at Check Out
review.reviewText: Be careful when comparing prices to this hotel.  Everything is extra.  I'm surprised I didn't get a water bill when I checked out.  Parking was $50/day and Internet was $15/day. When I checked in, the person at the front desk said the hotel could charge whatever they wanted for parking because the guests have no choice.  What a disgusting attitude. Shame on Expedia for not cautioning about these rip-offs.
review.negativeRemarks: Honesty in quoting room rates.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location.  Close to everything.

managementResponses.response:
Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your patronage and your feed back. We regret that the view was not what you expected and hoped that you have brought that to our attention whilst you were here.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.reviewText: Hotel was nice, but for the price I paid the view should have been better than looking at A/C unit in front of the window.
review.negativeRemarks: Better hotel price.

review.title: Great location. Room very dated.

review.title: No privacy and damp room
review.reviewText: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and was extremely disappointing. The room opened into a courtyard area and then you are able to see other room through the window. The other rooms can see your room the same way. We asked for room change because of this and they said we can give you top floor but you will see rooftop from window. We said ok and changed the room. The new room was on top but still had no privacy. You can see other people through the window and they can see yours. There was no way you can open the windows so rooms were damp and because of privacy we had to keep the blinds down so no sunshine. We booked 2 rooms before but had to cancel one room more than 1 month in advance. They charged us for 1 night. Very very bad service. Customer service don't reply to your emails. There are other hotels in that area which are much better than this. Will stay away from Sheraton in future and will recommend others people as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve customer service
review.locationRemarks: Location was ok. It was in Fisherman's wharf. But lot other hotels are close by. So it was nothing special for this hotel.

managementResponses.response:
Dear LM,

We are sorry that the room assigned did not meet your expectations. Had we known, we would have cheerfully worked with you to find something that better fit your needs.

We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch

review.title: Disappointing

review.negativeRemarks: Internet in the room
review.locationRemarks: Too touristy

review.title: Nice Hotel right in the middle of Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Stayed here and booked four rooms for myself and co workers for a convention.  We all loved it.  The beds were super comfortable, staff was great, outside fire pit was just what we needed at the end of a long day, and staff were nice.  Can't say anything bad about this hotel.

review.title: Overall-was pretty good
review.reviewText:
Well situated to Fisherman's Wharf- lots of stuff within walking distance. 
We had to say for Internet even though we thought we were connecting to the free one and parking, even though discounted, was VERY expensive at the hotel. 
The mattresses weren't very comfortable. However, the outdoor seating areas that had gas fireplaces going were very nice. 
Staff that greeted you were very friendly.

managementResponses.response:
Thanks for the four stars. It is great to know that our accommodations were clean and comfortable, and our staff friendly and helpful. Glad that your overall experience was excellent.

The extras that you mentioned are often included in packages that we offer. Be sure to look for them as they do provide a bit more value for those Guests planning to use them. Also, our Starwood Preferred Guests who book using web or mobile applications now receive free in-room internet. If you not already, now is the time to sign up.

It was our pleasure to serve you. We look forward to seeing you again.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch, General Manager

review.title: Nice hotel well located
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very nice - clean and comfortable and employees are very friendly and helpful. There are 2 things that leave you with a bit of a sour taste and make you feel as if you are being taken advantage of.
1) The whole ridiculous cost of parking - $50!. I would expect the hotel to provide free or at least reasonably priced parking and not force its guests to find parking elsewhere in other lots or on the streets.
2) Free WIFI is only provided in the lobby. I am not sure in this day and age, forcing the guest to come down to the lobby in order to connect to WIFI makes sense in a hotel of this standard.
Overall, I was very pleased with my stay but these 2 points were annoying.
review.positiveRemarks: See above - clean, comfortable and well located
review.negativeRemarks: See above - parking and WIFI
review.locationRemarks: All the major sights of San Francisco are walking distance from the hotel including of course Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Good location. Rude staff. Overprice.
review.reviewText:
Only thing good about this hotel is location and the beddings.

Room problems:
On the first night / first room:
 TV remote not working, shower head annoying noise whenever it's turned on.

Second night : room telephone wiring is broken, challenging to call for guest/ room service since connection is very poor.

Customer service :POOR

The guest service person had an attitude, used a tone on me while I was patiently explaining why the 3rd kettle she sent that night is broken and burned and she cannot insist on it working if it's smelled like burning inside the bathroom where they insist on plugging it because the plug by the TV is not working.

After I checked inside the kettle , the coil that heats the water is actually burned! 

I've stayed on many different hotels and this hotel tops my terrible guest service list!

For a hotel at this price range ,
While I wasn't expecting a 5 Star service ,  at least the hotel should have a courteous and professional staff, and room amenities that are at least in good and safe working condition like the  shower head and plug-in sockets, open and loose telephone wire connection .

Use this hotel at your own risk.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Mom,

I must say that your review of your stay at Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf was everything that we could ask for! Thanks for the nice comments about our swell location, friendly and helpful staff members and attractive, clean accommodations.

Glad you enjoyed your experience here. Come back again soon.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch, General Manager

review.title: Everything you can ask for in a hotel
review.reviewText: My family of 4 stayed for one night as a rest day on our way to Hawaii to visit Alcatraz we were within walking distance of all that fishermans wharf has to offer the hotel staff were friendly and helpful the room was clean and nicely decorated and they were kind enough to let us check in 3 hours early. I would definitely stay at this hotel again

Walking, wading or wobbling worry free in the area but watch for the homeless.

Plus for the price this hotel there should be more amenities...free continental breakfast, bagels, something.  Vending machines should take cash, coins not just credit cards!

We loved The area and if We went again we would stay at the hotel again.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch, General Manager

review.title: Location Is Great, But That's Really It
review.reviewText: This hotel is great for it's location but it's very crowded and pretty run down.  It's not what you would expect from a Sheraton.  They charge for an in-room refrig, wi-fi, everything!  Parking of $50 a day is crazy but that's San Francisco.  The people upstairs from us were jumping on our heads at 5 am - you could hear everything!  I really don't think we would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is awesome.  Tons of restaurants and activities within a block or two.  The outdoor fireplaces are also a nice touch.
review.negativeRemarks: It needs a remodel with toned down colors, larger beds, and better noise insulation.  Also we shouldn't have to beg for 4 towels and 4 coffees in doub
review.locationRemarks: One to two blocks from the best parts of Fisherman's Wharf.  One block from a trolley route.  One block from all the hop on hop off bus tours.  Great!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Sara,

Thanks for staying with us and sharing your experience. Where were glad to hear that your pre-arrival and check-in experiences were good, we regret that there was a mix up on the room cleaning. Our records showed that you elected to participate in Make A Green Choice, our sustainability initiative where Guests opt out of housekeeping services.

We hope that this did not unduly detract from an otherwise enjoyable experience. We look forward to welcoming you back.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch, General Manager

review.title: Not what I had expected from a Sheraton
review.reviewText: Pre travel contact with hotel was positive. Check in was great and they had the crib and refrigerator that I had requested, as I was traveling with my 14 month old daughter, delivered as soon as we entered our room. Tuesday was the last day that our room was cleaned and we left on Friday. Wednesday we arrived back to an unmade room so we contacted housekeeping to bring us new towels to get us through until the next day. They did offer to clean the room  but it was 8:30PM and my daughter needed to sleep. Again on Thursday night, we arrived at the same unmade room. Called again and got the same response. So when we checked out on Friday our room had overflowing garbage (a diapered 14 month old),  a knee high pile of wet towels, and a floor that was in desperate need of a vacuum. It was not a pleasant experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping!!!!!

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Birthday trip for daughter and friends
review.reviewText: We had a girls weekend in San Francisco for birthdays. It is walking distance to the waterfront. It allowed us to walk and party. Sheraton is comfortable place to stay, this was not our first stay there and I am sure it won't be the last. Staff was helpful and friendly. The cherry on top when we were checking into getting a taxi for six of us they offered their limo at a very good price...and then picked us up when we were ready to head back to the wharf. Great weekend!

review.title: Staff

review.title: Close to Fishermans Wharf and tourist attractions
review.reviewText: Sheraton Fishermans Wharf was close to everything in Fishermans Wharf.  On arrival we found out that our room wasn't booked but after showing them my booking letter they found us a room which was quite spacious. Our room was cleaned everyday and the foyer/lobby was very welcoming.  The concierge team were very helpful in getting us a car to the airport and we were impressed that it was a limo which was the same charge as a taxi. The tram stop was right outside our hotel so we could get access to downtown San Francisco. There was a shopping centre right across the road.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were very friendly and helpful with our needs.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi is only available in the lobby, it would have been good to access it from your room.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the wharf, shops, sightseeing and tram to downtown San Francisco.  Buses were also close.

managementResponses.response:

Outdated facilities. Very compact bathroom. Out of 5 hotels in which we stayed from San Francisco to Mendocino this was the only one which charged for internet service. 

One plus: the lady behind the beverage and food counter was helpful and made a terrific Makers Mark Manhattan.

The young woman at the desk was very friendly and helpful and courteous

review.reviewText: I had a nice stay here and there were no surprises which is what I expect from a 4 star hotel. The room was clean and everything in working condition. It would be nice if they provided a small refrigerator and microwave, but that would exceed my expectations. I also liked that there is a Safeway grocery store about a block away.
review.positiveRemarks: Location relative to Fisherman's Wharf and the Embarcadero. Large grocery store about a block away.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide a small refrigerator and microwave.

review.title: Trip to San francisco
review.reviewText:
The hotel is ideally located for access to a lot of the tourist attractions. You are able to get a good nights sleep, in the comfortable large beds. A nice touch is the ability to be able to make a Starbucks coffee in the room. It's got good amenities like the iron and ironing board in the room. 
In summary a great hotel for you to stay at for access to tourist locations and good transport connections to the rest of the city. The hotel will make your stay a comfortable one. A large spacious bed and room. 
I have stayed at the hotel twice in two different visits to the city.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Nicole,

Thanks for staying with us. We are glad that you found our location perfect and our decor attractive. We regret that the parking charges were a surprise. Our prices are comparable to other hotels in this area and less than those in the downtown district. Public parking is charged by the hour with a maximum well in excess of what Guests pay. All this information is on our website.

We hope that you will consider a return stay with us.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch, General Manager

review.title: $50 per night for PARKING?!
review.reviewText: I had stayed at this hotel over 10 years ago and was pleased to see it has been updated and some areas redone.  It is also in a great location if you want to spend time at the Wharf.  Just a short walk away.  Check in was confusing as the employee helping us could barely speak English.  We found out at check-in that parking was $50 per night! I realize parking is at a premium in San Francisco, but this is outrageous.  They were charging the public $35!  The room we were given was in the adjacent building which isn't as nice as the main building. The room was clean and amenities acceptable but I will NOT stay here again. There are many other hotels on the same block and in the vicinity to choose from.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking charges, communication of staff
review.locationRemarks: We love Fisherman's Wharf.  It's a fun place to spend a few hours, grab some lunch and do some shopping.

review.title: Nice location.
review.reviewText:
I have stayed at this hotel before, but was disappointed this time. The location is terrific, but the price of parking and WiFi is outrageous when you consider the price of your room. Our room was tiny and on the first floor, people walking by could look in our window. I thought perhaps this is where they put people that prepaid with Expedia prices? 

Coincidentally I had to stay at the Holiday Inn for one night during this stay due to competition time changes. I felt I got a much better value for my dollar at Holiday Inn. Just a few block further from the wharf, but I got free WiFi and the parking was $20 cheaper! The room was WAY better too!

Very disappointed and do not think I will return to the Sheraton again due to the low value for the $$.
review.negativeRemarks: Prices of WiFi and parking. Gouging guests with these prices.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, etc.

review.title: Great location for SF
review.reviewText:
Great location for the hotel, walking distance to everything. All the restaurants on Pier 39 are 10 min walk away, there is Safeway just behind the hotel and a couple of car rental companies with after hours return facilities on the Beach St. It takes about 10-15 min to walk to the cable car and all the SF tours can be organised just around the corner. Feels like a safe area as well.
We travelled with 2 small children and the room was adequate for us, although a fridge in the room would be a bonus (there is an extra cost for it). Also no complimentary internet in the room, although we signed up for some program and got free internet, however, it is a bit strange that a hotel these days does not offer free internet (only in the lobby area).

managementResponses.response:

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the feedback.

review.title: No Power
review.reviewText:
Firstly I would like to say that I was very disappointed that this hotel was sold to us despite the hotel having no power at the time of sale. The hotel also failed to contact us prior to our arrival to inform us of the situation. After 17 hours of travel I did not find their customer service of 'heres some other hotels you could try' agreeable.
That being said we only needed a place to rest our heads at the end of a day site seeing, so we continued to stay here. We were provided with glow sticks for our room and complimentary coffee and pastries each day. Staff on day 2 were much more sympathetic and helpful with the situation.
review.positiveRemarks: Good central location for fisherman's wharf and the piers
review.negativeRemarks: Policies on informing customers of hotel issues prior to arrival and general customer service in these matters
review.locationRemarks: Good central location for fisherman's wharf and the piers

managementResponses.response:
Dear Pamela,

Gee, what a nice review of your stay at Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf. So glad that you enjoyed your experience here including our location, nice room and helpful staff. (Sorry for the mix up on the hot dog - you really don't have to be 6 to order one!)

We look forward to your next trip here. Make it soon.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch, General Manager

review.title: Wonderful stay with some SMALL complaints.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very convenient to the Wharfs, especially Wharf 39.  There is a grocery store and mall right across the street that made it easy to grab any missing items from our trip.  Starbucks and IHOP are also very conveniently located, as well as picking up one of the cable cars.  Using our card to access the floors made us feel very safe.  Our room had a nice view to the hotel's pool.  The staff was very helpful and courteous to us.  I would definitely stay again.  However, the parking is very expensive - $50 a night - but cheaper than surrounding areas which charged an average of $5 per hour.  The food bar in the lobby was also a bit expensive i.e.,  $9 for a hot dog.  The server would not allow me (an adult) to buy the hot dog because it was on the child's menu.  Doesn't make sense to me.  Finally, after the first night I had to request that my bed be made as if we were new tenants.  Housekeeping did not spread the bed appropriately and there were still a lot of wrinkles and folds under the comforter.  After bringing the registration counter this information, we did not have any other problems for the rest of our stay.  Again, we WOULD stay here again.

Convenience to cable cars
Location
Cleanliness
Quietness
Staff was very courteous and helpful
Fitness center

Parking prices
Add a nice restaurant

review.title: Great location!!...way too noisy at night!
review.reviewText: This hotel was in the perfect location! Close enough to walk to pier, Safeway across the street. Cute dcor, decent room but the sound of trucks unloading ALL Night right outside kept me up all night both nights!! They need some sound proof windows and this place would be perfect.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Paul,

Thanks for staying with us. We regret that it took two tries to get you a room that met your needs but am glad to hear that our staff was polite and professional.

Please note that parking charges are commonplace for hotels in San Francisco. Our hotel fees are similar to others in this area and less those in the downtown district.

We hope to see you again soon.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch, General Manager

review.title: Budget quality hotel for extremely high cost
review.reviewText: When I first arrived I was surprised to find the hotel did not provide parking for vehicles, but would charge $50 extra per night to use the hotel parking!!!  Then, I was provided with a room that stank of cigarette smoke in all fabric and of course throughout the room.  I had requested a non-smoking room.  I called and they provided me a room number, and sent someone up to meet me and give me the new card which was done quickly and professionally.  The new room was fine, but not worthy of the expensive cost and additional parking fee.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to Fisherman's Wharf.  The security requirement for the elevator to activate to your floor requiring your key-card.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking costs at the hotel should be as reasonable as public parking.

managementResponses.response:
We were delighted to read this review of your stay at Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf. Thanks for pointing out our convenient location, clean, comfortable accommodations and value for the price paid. Sheraton is a pet-friendly brand and it was our pleasure to have the whole family with us.

Come back soon. Happy New Year.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch, General Manager

review.title: Great Solution
review.reviewText: Very clean, comfortable, pet friendly, conveniently located and a very attractive price.
review.negativeRemarks: parking fees are high
review.locationRemarks: it is right at the Warf, so there are a lot of tourist attractions at walking distance; Alcatraz, eating, cable cars.

managementResponses.response:

review.reviewText: nice hotel really close to everything, only has no parking and its expensive

review.title: Overly pricey but fun area
review.reviewText:
We chose this hotel to be near Pier 39 to celebrate my daughters 18'th bd. The staff was wonderful, clean rooms and very comfortable beds. I have NEVER stayed in a hotel that required $15 to access their WiFi.  Parking is offensively expensive as well. I think if you're paying to stay there you should be given a better rate to park not the same rate they charge the general public who want to park by Pier 39.  $50 is excessive.
That said, the location is fun easy access to all the tourist destinations the wharf has to offer. We had a blast.
review.negativeRemarks: Accommodate your guest with free WiFi and discounted parking.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39. Rainforest Cafe.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Dave,

Thanks for this kind review. We appreciate the 5 stars and enjoyed meeting you here.

It was our pleasure to serve you. We know we'll see you soon.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch, General Manager

review.title: Besides the power went out while we were there it
review.reviewText:
We'll besides the power going out while we were there it was a ok stay they accommodated us 
Because of the fact they couldn't get the power back up until the last day we were there
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39 and fisherman wharf in walking distnace

managementResponses.response:
Dear Bernie,

Thank you for your comment. We appreciate the feedback and would be pleased to discuss this with you personally. Contact information (email and phone) is provided on our website.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch, General Manager

review.title: Nightmare
review.reviewText:
Supposed to be a 4 star hotel in a good area.

Power outage on Dec. 12 - total darkness. Guests were evacuated 3x on false alarms. Firefighters went and checked and cleared us to go back for false alarm number 1, but the alarm triggered 2 more times...

Power outage continued until I checked out Dec. 15. 
There was no central command - no one would OFFICIALLY talk to the guests. Front desk personnel was full of inaccurate statements saying, "power will be restored in 2 hours..." and its been day 3 and they still saying that... 
All the flashlights given to guests don't work. They only lit for 10 minutes and went out Front desk people said they need to buy more batteries... then why can't somebody from the hotel buy them?
This is so unacceptable for a 4 star hotel especially for the Sheraton brand - so embarrassing! It wasn't easy to move out since hotels around the area are fully booked. A lot of people were still checking in - not knowing the situation ( I wonder if they ever gave an advisory ).

Overall, it was a nightmare!
review.negativeRemarks: Ability to handle emergencies
review.locationRemarks: Close to Pier 39

managementResponses.response: Thanks for your feedback.

review.title: Disaster Struck
review.reviewText: The power went out and they were not able to restore it. The original problem was not the hotel's fault but how the staff handled the situation was pathetic. For the most part, the staff seemed to be avoiding the guests. The guests were told to evacuate but there was no staff to guide them or tell them what was going on. It started around 11pm so many guests were in their pajamas and had to stand outside, in the rain, not knowing what was going on. The power was still out the next morning, so no hot water, no computers for check-out and no offers of compensation of any kind.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Darryl,

Thanks for the feedback. We will be pleased to discuss this with you. Contact information is located on our website.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch, General Manager

review.title: Without Power - Without a Clue
review.reviewText:
Checked in to the hotel on Friday, Dec 12th and that evening around 11:00 the power went out and remained out through the rest of the night.  Proceeded to the registration desk the following morning to inquire when electrical services would be restored.  We were told between 12:00 and 2:00 that afternoon.  After no resolution on the third day of our stay, the hotel offered and we accepted to cancel our reservation and move to another hotel across the street (the Tuscan).  The power remained out at the Sheraton over the remainder of our stay in San Francisco (until 17 Dec). 

The hotel staff fell short of the mark in numerous ways:  1) failure to communicate an accurate status of the facility, 2) insufficient staff to assist guests in getting back to their rooms due to unfamiliarity with the facility layout, 3) handing out faulty flashlights and batteries, and lastly 4) a definitive lack of attentiveness/assistance to hotel guests.

Although this was a complex issue placed upon the staff, they appeared to be poorly trained/not prepared to deal with the magnitude.
review.positiveRemarks: Not much...would have to be the valet (Jason).
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Nice location and near all of the activities around Pier 39.  Great places to eat (if you like seafood).

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the feedback.

review.title: When the lights go out--> get out!
review.reviewText: After traveling all day to get to CA from NY We were in the hotel for a few hours when the fire alarm went out and the power shut off. It was complete chaos which ensue from 10pm-3am, no staff member was comforting or providing information- all we got was to be handed a glow stick and instructed " go back to your rooms". No explanation of what was going on or why as the firemen were called back to the hotel twice. When we woke up next day the power still wasn't on. They did give everyone a free breakfast and refunds but the staff that was on during the night shift was horrible!

managementResponses.response:
We are glad that you found Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf clean, comfortable and pleasant. We appreciate your patronage and look forward to your next visit. Hope it's soon!

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch, General Manager

review.reviewText: Room was clean and comfortable.  A little outdated. Quite a bit of hallway noise coming through, but overall was a pleasant experience.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking fees are ridiculous.  I met my daughter there so we had two vehicles to park.  Parking fees were $50 a night for each of us.  Total $200.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to everything.  Scoma's was an absolutely awesome place to dine.

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Only good part is the location.
review.reviewText:
Now I'm not saying don't stay here. Just expect it to be very "meh". We saw the bad reviews and said to ourselves it can't be that bad. Well the downstairs lobby looks very nice. But you go up stairs and there are tray tables and wine glasses that stayed sitting outside of rooms for the entire trip (3 nights). There were scuff marks on a lot of the walls. When they replaced our sheets one looked like it had a cigarette burn and the second replacement had a stain. The bed was extremely hard. 

With all that said, the location is great and all the downstairs staff was nice.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Rob,

We appreciate the 4 star rating and nice comments about our location and friendly staff. It is nice to know that you had a good time.

It was our pleasure to serve you. We look forward to welcoming you back.

Can be loud with bus station nearby.

review.reviewText: We were vacationing with adult children and had a wonderful time.  The staff was very friendly and the rooms were very clean.  The hotel lobby is nice, but when out of the lobby, it is very funky.  I couldn't tell if we were in Candyland or Beach Party Bingo.  We did have a nice stay, but felt there was a bit of a time warp transitioning from the lobby to the elevator, to the rooms.  Would stay again though.

review.title: Girls' Trip
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to everything we enjoy doing during our yearly trip to 'The City'.  It's a ten minute walk - taking our time - to the Italian section or to the China Town area.  It's only minutes to Pier 39.  We know every Starbucks location within ten miles of the hotel.  We saw the Christmas Tree lighting this year and enjoyed the 'snow' and the Disney characters.  The weather was fabulous and the food was excellent as always.  We love eating our fill of the fresh seafood and plan some of our days around the type of food we want to eat.
review.positiveRemarks: Check in is always easy and the staff is cheerful and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking at the hotel is horribly expensive, but it is a seller's market and one must pay the price.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is in a safe, well-lighted area and close to everything.

managementResponses.response:

review.reviewText: Great location situated conveniently to Pier 39 and all that the Wharf has to offer.  Easy In and Out for parking.  We enjoyed the social hour that Sheraton provided with nicely rated wines.    It rained one day and the Sheraton provided umbrella's.  It was a nice touch.   This is our preferred hotel when we stay in The City as it was centrally located.  Within one block of the hotel you had a full grocery store, two drug stores, several restuarants and, of course, the Wharf.

managementResponses.response:

review.reviewText: Convenient location, accommodations were fine.  Very close to Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf, and other tourist attractions.
