One-day rate (also good for overnight stay) runs about $57.00.  Added amenities will cost extra:  microwave $20, mini fridge $20.  Some parts of the hotel and our room seemed run down (i.e. old dusty air conditioner unit, musty rug scent, flat comforter, scrapes on the walls, worn fixtures, broken doorknob lock, etc.).  Not great, not bad.  Just convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: Maintenance and upkeep

I wasn't expecting a view but I didn't want to look at the pool of stagnant water and the old rags that someone had left laying on the ground. It appeared that they had attempted to do a little updating in the room but just this DEFINATELY doesnt hit the four star mark. I Would compare it to three star hotel.

review.title: No frills

The entry and lobby were nice enough but the room was as plain as could be. It didn't even have a table and chairs in it the window would only crack open so there was no way to cool off. The a/c did not cover the whole room. I woke up in a sweat during the night. The beds and bedding were the only high points. The bathroom sink was way to small. Things kept falling off. 
Needless to say I won't stay there again.

managementResponses.response:

However, we regret that this perception occurred and will try to alleviate this notion for future stays.

We appreciate your patronage and hope that you will consider a return stay here.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch, General Manager

review.title: Expect better quality at such a price
review.reviewText: With a Sheraton name on the building, and a $289 per night price tag, We expected the hotel rooms to be much nicer, and the facility to be in much better condition. The hotel is showing its age and the room was very modest. We booked a king bed and got a double bed instead. The breakfast was standard American with nothing special either, even with the $32 price tag per person! for the same date/time, we could have booked Le Meridien for $169 and got much better quality. Sheraton needs to evaluate this property a bit closer.
review.negativeRemarks: overall quality of the hotel and the service

managementResponses.response:
Dear Jessica,

Thanks for staying with us. We are glad that you found our hotel's location so convenient. Sorry that other aspects were not as good. We will take your suggestions in mind as we plan future improvements.

We hope that you will consider a return visit.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch, General Manager

review.title: Nice hotel but costly
review.reviewText: We booked through Expedia for a king size room but when we arrived we got 2 double bed instead. Everything costs money there, valet parking was $55 for a day and extra $14 for wifi connection. The ac was old and it made a lot of noises throughout the night. On the good side it is close to everything but that's about it.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Pa'Mela,

Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your 3 star rating. Our renovation was not so long ago with a somewhat retro theme. Some of our Guests love it and some not so much. We will count you in the later group and keep your comments in mind for future plans.

We look forward to the next opportunity to serve you.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch, General Manager

review.reviewText: The hotel was rated 4 star. I would have given it only 2 stars. It was in desperate need of updating.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Jim,

Sorry that your experience here was not all you expected. One of our best features is that we located right in the middle of the action. That also makes it sometimes hard for those more sensitive to sounds that all this activity creates. However, we are pretty good at working with our Guests to find one of our 531 rooms that suits their needs.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch, General Manager

review.title: Not really value for money overpriced

review.negativeRemarks: Complimentary breakfast should be included

managementResponses.response:

It was our pleasure to serve you. Come back soon.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch, General Manager

managementResponses.response:
Dear Kim,

Thanks for the 4 star rating of your stay at Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf. We were happy to read that your experience was great including our location, early check in, beautiful lobby and nicely decorated, clean room.

Please note that we do provide free Starbucks coffee in every Guest room.

We look forward to your next visit here.

review.title: A good place to stay
review.reviewText:
Great find! We knew we we're going to be close to Embarcadero the, but were super excited to did that it is a block from the wharf! We're able to check in early, beautiful lobby, the room was clean and well decorated. Did not find the air conditioning to be loud as others have commented. 

The only drawbacks I would mention is $50/day for parking, $55 for valet. Coffee is available in the lobby in the mornings but they want $2.50 for it, for the price of the room I would definitely expect free coffee. And charging for wifi in the rooms is ridiculous, again I reference the room price. Luckily I have hotspot on my phone so was able to use that to use my iPad and not pay $15/day for internet access. Would have received 5 'stars' if not for the silly charges. 

Overall I enjoyed my stay, would gladly stay there again.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Pamela,

We hate to disappoint and regret that you missed a refrigerator in your room. We do have them available upon request and in all our Deluxe rooms. Pity that we were not made aware of your needs during your stay.

We hope that you will consider returning. We will definitely have a refrigerator waiting for you.

Sincerely, Michael Hirsch, General Manager

review.title: Dissapointed as there is no refrigerator

review.title: Perfect loaction to wharf
review.reviewText: Yes hotel is older but eeverything in San Fran is old.Room was spacious, bathroom small but manageable unless it's four girls to a room.Parking is a problem. If you dont want to valet your car there is meter parking all around hotel. The meters can be pricey but after 6pm you Can park or free until 7 am depending on street sweeping days. There is also parking garage across the street for 35 $$  for 24hr parking. The hotel is within walking distnace of pier 39. Concierge was super helpful with seting tours for San Fran like Big Bus tours.
review.positiveRemarks: Location,  location location!!! Friendly staff!!! Starbucks inside
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, was distance to cable car and Alcatraz landing. There is good Italian restaurant up mason street..Walking distance to get on the bus tours.

The cost is driven by the exorbitant cost of constructing an underground structure due to seismic and water table concerns. Having said that, our charges are similar to other hotels in this area and actually less than those in the downtown district.

review.title: Overpriced and underwhelming
review.reviewText:
My partner and I stayed with another couple in San Francisco for 4 nights. We were excited about the trip but the Sheraton at Fisherman's Wharf was a real disappointment. 
Our room was small and the bathroom was tiny. There was not enough room to shower comfortably.

In addition to this the air conditioner was massive and noisy, but we were forced to use it to drown out the loud thumping noises coming from the room above!

I feel that this room was overpriced by far, and the hotel does not deserve its star rating. Also given the price we paid, I feel that the additional parking and wifi charges are extreme.

I recommend not to book this hotel or you will be disappointed.
review.negativeRemarks: Larger bathrooms, free wifi and cheaper parking.

Our hotel was completely renovated a short time ago with a somewhat retro theme. Some Guests love it, some not so much. We will count you in the later group and keep it in mind as we plan the next redo.

We look forward to seeing you again.

Michael Hirsch,

review.title: Basic hotel close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText:
Hotel has comfortable beds in clean rooms. Good access to Fishermans Wharf but noisy at night. Try and insist on being away from the bus depot as this is the focus of constant activity including a congregation point for some of the many homeless that you will see in San Francisco during your stay. 
Overall the hotel feels a little tired and stuck in the seventies in terms of decor. Its a great staging post for a few days to explore Fishermans Wharf, Alcatraz, Muir Woods, Sausalito etc, but do not come here believing that the Sheraton will present you with luxury!
review.positiveRemarks:
Access to Fishermans Wharf
Helpful maids and convenient coffee shop to help you get out and on with your day to explore the area.
review.negativeRemarks:
Seperate toilet lighting in rooms.
Pool area basic and could be focal point!
Old air con units in the room - noisy
Free WiFi - Come on Sheraton!
review.locationRemarks:
Alacatraz
Fishermans Wharf
Muir Woods
Sausalito Ferry
Cycle hire to cross Golden Gates

Our room was great except that we were in an end room overlooking the main street and it was very noisy in the early hours of the morning.  The air conditioning unit was very loud and we had to turn it off to sleep which made the room very warm.  Also, we were disappointed that the hotel did not have a spa.

review.title: Great location, that's it.
review.reviewText:
Great location but high prices for Wi-Fi in room and parking detract greatly. The room itself was spacious, except for the bathroom which was so small that to close the door while inside, you very nearly need to step into the tub to do so. Also, the same light switch turns on the small powder room ( sink and mirror ) and the tiny toilet / tub room lights, so that a late night bathroom call floods the room with light, not great for anyone else trying to sleep. Horrible set-up. 

If you want to get away from the craziness of Fisherman's Wharf for a quiet night cap and unwind, there's no real lobby bar. It's more of a service bar that sells snacks, zero atmosphere. Not what I expected from a pricy hotel at all.
review.positiveRemarks: location was great, room size was good, the bed was comfortable ( despite a scary-looking, badly stained sheet on my bed one evening )
review.negativeRemarks: reduce or remove the price gouging-level prices for WiFi and parking

My only complaints no free wi Fi? For the premium price, come on, throw in the wi Fi. It comes across wrong for a premium property. (Nickel and dimed)

Otherwise....very nice stay!,,,

review.title: Memorial day holiday
review.reviewText:
We arrived, with paid reservations. For a two bed room. I had a baby, and back surgery. Reason for separated beds. We were sent to the wrong room. After calling the front desk we were sent up new keys. And couldn't locate the room. I passed the front desk two times the desk clerk never asked if I needed anything. Finally I left my husband baby, stroller and luggage cart on the second floor. As he drove and baby was sound asleep. . The handy man then told me the only way to the new room was up stairs.Walking, omg. I was so upset and in pain. I then went back to the front desk and asked to be accommodated with a room that had elevator access. Or upgrade us to anything with two beds and elevator access. She would not. She said it was my fault for not sharing withthe hotel that I had physical limits. . I then told her to change us back to the first room but asked does the sofa turn into a sleeper. She said yes sure and I won't charge you for using it! WOW! I then returned to my family, we arrived in the room that had no linen for the sofa bed. IT TOOK ANOTHER 30 minutes to get that after I called. . We were in bed 3 Hours after check in. The baby woke and then it took another hour to change feed and get him back to sleep..while my poor husband slept on a very uncomfortable sofa bed.. . They would only give us back our parking fees. CLAIMING EXPEDIA was at fault. BUT THAT MADE NO SENCE TO ME. I will never stay at the Sheraton again.
Unhappy
Gina Fuentes

managementResponses.response:
Thanks for staying wtih us. Glad that our location was convenient for touring the city. Sorry that our breakfast buffet did not provide the value that you were looking for. We also offer our Spressi cafe which provides lighter choices for breakfast.

Sincerely,
Michael Hirsch,
General Manager

review.title: Best and worst
review.reviewText:
Worst was the size of the rooms, specifically the closet, and bathroom. Could not believe how tiny they were. The room was clean, the staff accommodating. Felt like a rat in a maze trying to find my room. They just spent millions to upgrade - didn't get their monies worth. Don't eat in the cafe in the lobby: one small sandwich, one small slice of dessert, one drink = $25.
Best was proximity to Fishermen's Warf. One block away from everything.
For the price and overall experience, do not recommend.

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Wonderful hotel near the Wharf and Pier 39
review.reviewText:
Stayed just one night as the tail end of a business trip...but the hotel is in a great location. Staff is very knowledgable and service-oriented; wonderful people.
The rooms are spacious and comfortable; as well as clean and modern.
The only minor gripe I have is the rather exhorbitant parking fees (but I suppose it's the same all over the city)....set me back $55 for valet parking (versus $50 for do it yourself parking).

review.title: Nice hotel close to the piers.
review.reviewText: After finding our way into the hotel by car ( which wasn't very easy ) everything went smoothly. We checked in early because the room was available. The staff were friendly and attended to our needs promptly. Car parking was expensive but we didn't need to find a park the next day when we went on our Alcatraz tour as they let you park until 6pm on the day you check out. Overall a good experience but the most expensive of our trip.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the fact that our car was allowed to stay in their carpark until 6pm on the day we checked out.
review.negativeRemarks: The signage for car entry could be clearer and bigger.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is close to the piers. The Alcatraz tours leave from pier 33 which is about 15 minutes walk.

managementResponses.response:

We hope that you would consider a return trip.

General Manager

review.title: Had one main benefit and only one...(location).
review.reviewText: Overall disappointed in our stay at this hotel. Although the location is ideal, the hotel itself was disappointing. The hotel is very dated, and has no free Wi-Fi in the rooms. We checked in as a family of 4 yet every morning had to call room service to get a 4th towel for showering. The Kleenex was out and never restocked, and the bed sheet was not sized correctly and would not stay on the bed.. the night before leaving for the airport I ran down to print our airline tickets in the computer room and the printer had no toner and was "out of order". "Really!!"...How can a large hotel not have a plan to have things like this on site.. I would definitely not stay at this hotel in the future.

review.reviewText: After reading some of the other reviews we knew that this would be a "gently used" hotel. We got just what we expected. The location was good with lots of food venues all around. Two blocks to Pier 39. The room was VERY quiet as it was on the inside of the hotel - with a view of a dirty, trash-laden rooftop, so we just kept the curtains closed. The rooms were no-frills. If you wanted a refrigerator, microwave, extra cot, etc. there was an extra charge per night. The staff was fine. The check-in had a little wait but not bad. The hotel has signs of wear every where. Just grab a cocktail or glass of wine, keep the lights low, and you will be fine.
review.negativeRemarks: It needs to be "refreshed."

Our shower felt as if it had been recovered in vinyl instead of being replaced (wobbly) to say the least. It was an okay stay but not first class as many Sheraton's are.
review.positiveRemarks: The concierge staff was very friendly and responded to our requests kindly and promptly. Although the lady who ran the breakfast bar was not!

review.title: Ok, Not Great
review.reviewText: Hotel is very dated, at least the room we stayed in. The bathroom was extremely small with the toilet inside the same room as the tub. You had to get inside before you could close the door. No where to really change in private. Also, beds were comfortable but if you get a room with doubles they are extremely small and room area is small as well. There were stains on both lamp shades and one was broken ( not sure how that happened, the stains). Wallpaper bubbling and peeling not what you would expect for over 200.00 per night. When I asked front desk about check in they said that I would have to contact expedia so they couldn't help me. The room they gave us looked out on top of the roof area with some sort of equipment in view. Also, you had to keep your window blinds shut because you could see in other rooms. It was like a fish bowl. No view of street, pool, or anything except other hotel rooms. Sometimes I feel like the "less attractive rooms are reserved for customers who went to a discounted site for their reservation. That was the impression that I had about the staff and the room received. Location was great. Parking was $50.00 a day and was never indicated on the reservation site. Would not recommend or stay again very disappointed.
review.negativeRemarks: see above. attitude toward guests booking through discounted sites.
review.locationRemarks: Entire fisherman's warf area. Good walking distance to the waterfront.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Judith,

Gee, not sure what happened here. So sorry that we failed to provide the service that we promise and that you expected. Rest assured that we have reviewed this with our staff to ensure no further incidents.

We regret that we did not have the opportunity to address this during your stay and hope you can forgive us.

Sincerely,
Michael Hirsch,
General Manager

review.title: Good location, expensive parking and terrible serv
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel based on having okay reviews and its location. The only good this this hotel has going is that is walking distance from Pier 39 and other distractions in the city. The room service staff was unethical and rude. My friends and I was a party of 3 so we booked a room with 2 beds/3 people. The hotel brags how they have complementary "Starbucks Coffee" so we called to ask for an extra cup because there were only 2, they were so rude saying we only provide two I explain there was 3 of us, can we please get an additional cup, big deal. Wow, their response so rude and it made it seemed and as if she was being forced to provide me the cup and hung up the phone very rude.. Then $57 parking, really? go across to Safeway $35, and other cons; no free WiFi in the rooms, no fridge, no microwave.... and the list goes on. I will never stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: train their employees what customer service consist of.
review.locationRemarks: to name a few nearby there is; safeway is across, trader joes, ross shopping center, starbucks

review.title: Comfortable beds. Walking distance to many places.
review.reviewText:
I've stayed at Sheraton Hotels numerous times and I always enjoy staying there. The beds are always comfortable and the rooms always clean as well as the hotel. There are just a few little things I didn't like but I was willing to deal with it considering I was on a budget as far as hotels go.
I kind of wished this room had a refrigerator. I believe you can request one.
The walls are thin and I could hear my neighbors which is why I rated a 4 on room comfort.
Our room was right next to the city bus parking lot--not cool. I could hear the buses backing in, etc. But we solved that issue by turning on the air conditioner all night long.
I rated a 4 on staff because we went to the bar to have a drink and the bartender did not know what he was doing.
Everything is pretty close. We walked everywhere. China Town is a mile away and Union Square not too much further. Otherwise you might want to figure out the bus routes ahead of time or take cabs. Of course, Fisherman's Wharf is right there which is nice to just walk along the bay or take some tours like Alcatraz. Overall, I liked the Hotel.

managementResponses.response: We appreciate the feedback.

review.title: OK hotel. Recommend to a friend with reservations.
review.reviewText:
Biggest surprise was the $55 dollar parking fee. Figure that into your plans. Staff was great. Interesting lobby with a kiosk area that changed items offered during the day. Breakfast buffet was over-priced for the offering's (speaking from a professional food service orientation). Colors used for carpet and accents were dated.

On the flip side, great location. Easy access to the Wharf, and a great walk to Chinatown. If you are there on the weekends, walk down to Pier 2 and the Market area. Absolutely wonderful. Go hungry.
review.positiveRemarks: Very attentive staff, especially the Valet team
review.negativeRemarks: Include Wi-Fi free. Reduce parking fee for guests. Parking across the street is $30 per day. Hotel should charge same.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, tons to do. Short walk to trolley lines. Something everyone should do. Be aware, it is a very hilly place. It will kick your butt.

I book Hotels at the starwood chain all the time for other people in my line of work this is a regular thing. This is the first time they didn't let the person I booked the hotel for check in.

Parking is located below the hotel, didn't state on Expedia that there is a $58 + tax for parking at the hotel. Would be nice for a hotel in SF, especially near the Pier's to not charge so much for hotel parking, or not charge at all! Already paying $150+ for one night stay.

Staff was friendly. The hotel itself is nice, can't deny that. Our room however was all the way at the end, seemed like forever to get to the room from the elevator! The tub is kind of small. No fridge or microwave, come on! Step your game up!! Even cheaper rooms have these amenities and they are nice hotels.

The plus to staying here is the distance to Pier 39, and all around. Not even a 5 minute walk to Pier 39. There is a 7 Eleven about 2 minute walk away for drinks - if you didn't bring any from home town where it's cheaper at the corner store. Jack & Coke at the hotel was $12.00 and it was a small glass. Always remember to pack your own bottle folks!

It does not matter if the staff is helpful and friendly because when you do not get a good nights sleep you do not recall the staff and the positives of an establishment. review.title: Rude people
review.reviewText: This hotel is supposed to be a four star hotel. I would NEVER say that about this place. Almost every employee was rude to me based on my appearance. I stayed here for 3 nights and at least 3 times a day in various places in the hotel was asked to show my key card/ scan it to make sure it was legit. I was also put in a room that was right next to the gym so conveniently every morning would b woke up by someone running on treadmills. Sounded like someone beating on the otherside of the wall. There was no fridge or microwave. The bathroom was the smallest ever. The door almost hit the tub/toilet when opening and closing. I am extremely upset that I wasted my money on 2 rooms for 3 nights. I would never recommend this hotel or ever go back!

managementResponses.response: Thanks for adding your viewpoint here.

review.title: Good reviews unjustified.
review.reviewText: Booked online thinking that it was a good price. Was a good price, but nothing was included. Parking was $50 per night, internet $15 per day, no continental breakfast. When we arrived there were three young men (unoccupied by anything but directing people to the check-in counter) in the concierge area and one woman behind the desk checking people in. Stood in line for twenty minutes before we were checked in. Our room was 3520-furthest possible from any elevator. Got there our key didn't work--the one they just gave us. Tried to find someone to help us get in, happened to see a handyman, who was going to let us use a house phone, but the house phone did not work. Waited 20 more minutes for the security guy to get there to let us in. The bathroom sink was slow, causing a leak onto the bathroom floor. We were not impressed.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was clean before the bathroom sink began to leak.
review.negativeRemarks: The service was terrible. The hallway directions to our room were confusing--had to walk through half the hotel to get to our room.

review.reviewText: We chose this hotel for it's location and price. We wanted to park the car and walk everywhere around Fisherman's Wharf. So it met our needs for that. ($50 per night for parking.) Unfortunately our view was of the driveway leading to the parking garage, and straight across were the windows of the other hotel rooms, so we kept the curtains closed. There were 4 of us, but only 3 towels. In-room coffee maker, but just enough for 3 cups. No mini frig. In room Wi-Fi, if you pay $14.95 per day. Awkward bathroom set-up. Shower and toilet behind closed door. Sink and mirror open to rest of room, no door separating. One light switch turns on lights in both areas, so if you get up during night or earlier than others in room, you can't block the light and sound from them. Appeared clean. And again, good location.

review.title: Big Disappointment!
review.reviewText:
This place does not live up to the reputation of a Sheraton hotel...at least not the reputation they used to have! While we paid a fairly high room rate, we were expecting a classy, elegant hotel. There was absolutely nothing to warrant the room rate we paid!

We had one large window right next to our bed in a second floor room. Single-pane glass so that we heard ALL the street noises ALL night including the bus maintenance yard that ran ALL night. The glass was not tinted so that everyone walking by could see completely into the room. The window had no curtains and the only option on the window blinds were completely open or completely closed....either darkness or all the pedestrians looking into your room.
Moving on to the bathroom: the shower/toilet area had one small recessed bulb that lit the small room very dimly. No towel racks anywhere in the shower/toilet are OR the sink/mirror area.

The toilet/shower area had not ventilation fan...only a vent that didn't provide much odor extraction.

There was no menu for room service....don't know if they even had any.

A breakfast "room" in the lobby that provided ONLY breakfast buffett for $25/person.

TV room checkout not working.

The GOOD things?
The room was clean....not immaculate, but just clean.
The staff was very friendly and helpful.
The location....a block from the water on Fisherman's Wharf.
Will we stay there again? No! Another Sheraton? Most likely not!
review.positiveRemarks: "Fairly" clean and friendly staff. Location was great as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Quite a bit!! Read our experience above.
review.locationRemarks: Great location! A block from the water at Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39...including the Alcatraz tours departure points.

review.title: The Perfect Location for first time Visitors
review.reviewText: Location is everything in busy San Francisco and The Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf is excellent for the first time visitor. It is a quick and easy walk to great sightseeing spots and we could get bus, bicycle and boat tour tickets just a block away. Our family rented a car and an RV to continue our California tour. While in San Francisco we used buses and ferry system. The rental car is a couple of blocks away, ready for pick up. The rooms are very small and it was difficult to have 2 suitcases open at the same time. The beds are comfortable and everything looked clean enough until we discovered peanuts and chips under the beds when the blankets were removed. Free WiFi is only available in the lobby and outside. I even "caught a tour bus" Wifi , while it was standing in front of the hotel. It worked better than in-house WiFi... until it left.
review.positiveRemarks: We really enjoyed using the many seating areas throughout the hotel for work, meetings, and the many cozy lounge areas each with a fire-pit.
review.negativeRemarks: 1. More attention to room cleaning. 2. Time to update the rooms and the hallways with new carpets, doors, bath tiles, wall paper and paint.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, the marinas, Pier 49 (all Piers) , Ghirardelli Square and Boudin Sourdough Bakery & Cafe are all within comfortable walking distanc

managementResponses.response: So happy to learn that your stay was exceptional. Come back soon.

review.title: Nice Hotel, one block from Wharf
review.reviewText: Our room was on the 4th floor & had a veiw of the Coit Tower. At night it lit up RED! Had a nice view if the bus station, the Piers, the Bay Bridge and the Celebrity Solctice that was docked. If the big ship was gone, we would probably had a better view. Everyone on the staff was friendly that we encountered. Room was very clean, bed and pillows comfy. You can tell it was an old hotel but they have done ALOT to revamp it and make it contemporary/nautical chic. I liked it. I will stay there again. Downtown is too busy...Up by the Wharf its real laid back. Lots of places to eat around there. IHOP is across the street, 2 markets 1 block south. one block north and you are on Embarcadero..the main street on the Wharf. Pier 39 is an easy walk, more sightseeing there. You can walk to Lomard St BUT ITS A HARD WALK UP! But you will love the view! I didnt know our couch turned into a foldout bed. It didnt say that on their website, but plenty of room to walk in the room. Nice long dresser which the Tv and coffee maker was on. The Radisson is across the street, but double the price. Id rather stay here at the Shereton. Yes parking was $46.00 but its SF & touristy...so its gonna cost us... OVERALL good expirence!
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were simple and comfortable. AC worked great. Bathroom a lil small but workable. Starbucks coffee in your room to make in the am.
review.negativeRemarks: Beware if you get a room near the bus station that is on the East side of property. Buses run early so its a lil nosey just sleep w/ ac on :)
review.locationRemarks: Location GREAT! Everything you want to do on the Wharf is there. Alcatraz, Boudin Sourdough Cafe, Ghiradelli Chocolates is not that far up the street

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: I would give this hotel 5 stars if the business center computers were not in disrepair and if the use of them were free. there was a charge per minute for its use, although flight check-in functions were free. Very nice area around the hotel. Love the beach resort feel. the outdoor pool and numerous fire pits outdoors were very, very nice. . Rooms were on the smaller side but not as small as some rooms in NYC. So much to do, within walking distance, and a nicer area, i.e. less homeless, than downtown San Francisco. Would most defintely stay here again. the concierge was extremely helpful. A very goo concierge staff. The check in staff seemed a bit grumpy, feel like they are overbooked,as it was a very busy hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The cozy,casual beach resort feel, the outdoor pool and outdoor firepits.Plus location, wonderful spot with so much to eat around it.

review.title: Good location but lacks personality
review.reviewText: Near the Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf areas. Hotel is clean and comfortable but rather spare and is more suited for the business traveler than to those seeking out a nicer hotel. Parking is required and $45 daily. There is NO street parking due to the limited spaces and local ordinances so build this fee into your rate shopping. This fee is pretty standard for hotels in the busier areas of SF. The prices for water $6 and other assorted sundries are crazy so make sure you remember EVERYTHING you will need. The location is VERY GOOD but with the prices for food and wines in the small shop near the desk, I found myself walking down to Walgreens (which is only 2-3 blocks away) for bottled water. Wine was very overpriced. The hotel itself is quiet, but don't expect much in the way of a view...We were looking down on a non-nondescript roof and the air-conditioning units. If you are looking for a view, you won't find it at this hotel. The staff was efficient and helpful. I gave this hotel a 3 star rating bordering on 3.5 mostly due to its excellent location. If this hotel was anywhere outside of the SF area, most travellers would rate it a 2.5 to a 3.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and quiet at night. Location was very good.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are a bit sterile. Sundries, and items sold at the small store (bar) were silly expensive. $4 bananas, $6 water, $60 wine...etc.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39 and Fisherman's wharf are both a short walk away.

review.title: Excellent hotel, Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is right at Fisherman's Wharf, near pretty much everything a typical tourist would want to do. The staff is very friendly. We were going to a magic show near union square on our last night and wanted the doorman to get us a taxi. Instead, for the price of a taxi, he arranged for myself and my two adult kids to be taken to the venue in their Lincoln Town Car. On another day, we had left the room late in the morning. When we returned, in the early afternoon for a short time, we were in the beds for a short time resting before going out again. When we returned, our room had again been made up. That was very nice. The only concern I have about the hotel is that one switch operates both lights in the sink area and in the shower area. There is no door to close between those areas and the sleeping areas, so a person who wants to get up early to shower and get ready for the day cannot prevent the light from disturbing those who are still sleeping. Otherwise, the hotel is clean, comfortable, and allowed for a very enjoyable stay in Fisherman's Wharf.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us.

review.title: Closed to many tourist sights
review.reviewText: My family and I pre-paid for our stay at your hotel. When I paid for the 8 nights, I requested a room on the top floor to reduce the noise level. The day of our arrival to your hotel, we were told that our pre-paid room was no longer available. We were given a room next to the elevator on the first floor. Despite the ear plugs, my family and I experienced a very restless night due to increase noise levels. We were very dissatisfied by this new arrangement and requested another room in a quieter location of the hotel. We were told that there were no other rooms available and that we had no choice but to remain in the room that we were given. I then requested that my family be moved as soon as possible. The next day, we were relocated to another room. My family and I were satisfied with this room until several days later we realized our keys failed to open our door. Subsequently 1 of the 2 keys provided for our room kept malfunctioning. We informed the hotel staff and they suggested that we do not place the keys next to our cell phones or credit cards. After stating my dissatisfaction with the hotel, we were given a glass of wine, some chocolates and a free breakfast meal. Although I appreciated the effort by the staff in rectifying these unfortunate events, I am reluctant to recommend your hotel to others.
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: I already did!

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel based on its convenient location in Fishermans Wharf, but would have to say that it really didn't match other Sheraton Hotels I've stayed at in terms of quality, I had expected more. The hotel itself was fairly 'run of the mill', with a rather poor bar area, and basic furnishings. Other Sheratons have been especially nice, particularly the one in Boston, yet having made this point I couldn't fault the staff or the cleanliness of the Sheraton Fishermans Wharf, nor it's location, which was the biggest plus, but consider this - we had just spent 3 nights at the Waldorf Astoria in New York, and later spent 3 nights a Caesar's Palace in Las Vegas, and the Sheraton was the most expensive of them all for 3 nights! Great location, fairly basic hotel - you are paying for the location.

review.title: HOTEL WITH GARAGE
review.reviewText: I reserved Sheraton cancelling the reservation of Hyatt because Sheraton announce self parking and Hyatt has only valet, and I do not use valet for bad past experiences. I told to the hotel people before go ahead with my reservation that I was driving a Hummer 2 and they warranty me that will be not a problem to park. I find out at checking in that my car do not fit their premises and offer to me a valet 2 blocks away and I refuse. Finally the manager very professionally make arrangements with the manager of the City Valet to let stay my H2 in front the hotel. It cost me more of $122.00 for 2 nights park and left knowing that the City of San Francisco charge also 14% taxes on top of this. Any more comments...? You tell me.

review.title: Expected More Got Less
review.reviewText:
What was mostly disappointing was the staff, especially the concierge services. They appeared annoyed and at least twice were sarcastic when answering two separate questions. Almost the entire stay I felt as if the staff was being put out anytime I had a question or needed to interact with the hotel staff.

What was pleasant was the the hotel service staff; waiters, room service, cleaning service - they were in touch, aware and helpful.

The rooms were clean with crisp pressed bedding, the only issue was one night cleaning service did not get to the room until almost 5pm; we had returned to the room to freshen up before going out to dinner but needed to wait for fresh towels.

The room itself provides only the basics. Everything else you pay additional for; Internet service, refrigerator, roll away bed, breakfast. The hotel does offer free internet in the lobby, but in your room it cost you additional - go figure that out?

The Hotel is very close to Fisherman's Wharf, about one block, making it convenient, to access the sights, sounds and food of the wharf.

Although in itself the Hotel was nice, the staff made the stay less than I was expecting, and I will not consider it again on future visits. There are a few other hotels as close as this one, and next time i will give them a try.
review.negativeRemarks: Rotate in new concierge staff, people who like to help, not sarcastic attitudes that provide incorrect information.

review.title: Overpriced comfort.
review.reviewText: Location vs Comfort. The hotel looks and feels nice when you first walk in the lobby. But once you're walking down the small smelly, carpet stained halls to your room, you hope that the room is at least somewhat reminiscent of the lovely fire pit lounges and airy first floor lobby. It isn't. It is in reality just somewhere to sleep that is within walking distance of the Wharf...if you can sleep through the loud noise that is inevitable when staying so close to the Wharf. With all the parking fees, internet fees, you're better off staying at a clean and quiet facility blocks away where you can get a good night's rest after a tiring day of seeing the sights. Since the entire city is only seven miles long you can EASILY walk, ride the trolley or take public transportation everywhere and not have your hotel stay bill match your flight bill.

review.title: Location was great. Right next to fishermans wharf
review.reviewText:
Our stay had its ups and downs. Service varied from staff member to staff member. Our initial bellhop was great. He walked us up to the room and noticed with us that there was a faint smell of cigarette smoke. He immediately offered to call the front and had our room changed. He also ran downstairs and got us our new keys so kudos to him being proactive to make sure we were happy.

The room was clean, as expected, but I realized then we didn't have a fridge or microwave. After reading closely into the initial terms, there it was, fee for additional fridge or microwave. So that was disappointing but my fault for not reading so I won't hold that against them.

We went to the concierge on day 2 for dinner suggestions. He was very animated and helpful and directed us to Tarantinos because my friend wanted to have a lobster roll. He said "oh that sounds great. Tarantinos can whip you up an awesome one you should go there.". We go, sit down, and realize they do not serve lobster rolls... At all. So we ended up just getting drinks, appetizers, and changing locale completely. So as far as we know the concierge doesn't know anything about what is served and where to get it...

Last day, I inquiries about their continental breakfast. Apparently it isn't really included at all and you have to purchase a room with breakfast included...
review.negativeRemarks: Service, knowledge about the area. Overall. I think we were caught off guard with all the additional fees that could be tacked on.

review.title: Good location. Everything else was terrible.
review.reviewText:
I would not recommend this hotel based on my experience. This is not a 4-star hotel by any stretch of the imagination.
Parking is extremely expensive which is to be expected for that part of SF but the service is bad. Valets have a bad attitude because they are overworked. Room was a bit dirty. There was a fixture on the wall hanging by the wire because the screw had come loose and no one had fixed it. Phone in the room was not working. It made calls but the person on the other end could not hear me. The way rooms are on the 4th floor, if you leave the blinds open, everyone passing in the hallway can see inside your room. If you shut them, it's completely dark since that's the only window in the room. I think the same issue exists on the 3rd floor. I had a late check-out but they checked me out of the room without me leaving so once I came back to the hotel after lunch, my keys were not working. I had to go back down and they had to check me in again. Just a horrible experience. Lobby is clean and modern-looking but the fire pit area is on the side of the valet car service so as you sit there, you get all the car fumes. Concierge is not helpful. Restaurants he recommended were really bad and rated low on Yelp.
Overall a bad experience.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the Wharf
review.reviewText: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights after the 3day for the Cure in San Fran this year. Needless to say, I was exhausted by the time I got to the hotel so it was a little disappointing to have to walk all the way across the hotel to my room, but it was a very nice, clean, and comfortable room. I ordered room service Sunday night. The food was delivered promptly and was delicious. On Monday I utilized the helpful Concierge desk for some directions and to book my airport shuttle, and I also used the Business Center to check in for my flight and print my boarding pass--for free. In all, the hotel is conveniently located to the Wharf (easily within walking distance) and the rooms are updated, clean, and comfortable. Very nice property.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf Sheraton Review
review.reviewText:
With my daughter and two teenage grandchildren along, I stayed at the Fisherman's Wharf Sheraton. It was very adequate and pleasant for a 4 star hotel rating. We especially liked the Northpointe Shopping center across the street, and frequented the Walgreens and Grocery market almost daily for yogurt, bagels, drinks, and other items. We also frequented the IHOP (also across the street) for breakfast/brunch. We enjoyed the closeness to public transportation, bike rental, and Pier 33 and 39. We biked the Golden Gate Bridge and visited Alcatraz and Angel Island.
Keeping the convenience in mind, we had a wonderful adventure. Another highlight was the freshly brewed coffee one cup at a time we were able to make in the room daily.
review.negativeRemarks: It was fine for the price. Stay as sweet as you are.

managementResponses.response: Glad our staff treated you well.

review.title: Noisy, dated
review.reviewText:
Any hotel that provides a noise generator in your room to drown out room to room and street noise needs to consider refurbishing their establishment. They actually didn't need the noise generator as the in room a/c was so noisy it performed the function itself.

The rooms are old and small and as mentioned have almost no soundproofing. We were on the first floor and with the windows shut you could hear the conversations of people in the street and constant noise from the bus depot across the street. That is In addition every footstep from the room above.

The only positives are the staff, who were excellent and the location that is very convenient for the Fishermans Wharf area.

Unless you like getting no sleep and enjoy dated 1960's style decor I would not recommend this hotel.

No wifi in rooms but worked well in Reception. Only the bed size an issue. Everything else great.

review.title: Sheraton San franscisco - fishermans wharf
review.reviewText:
We had just come from Vegas so were looking forward to a nice relaxing break. We got to the hotel about 9pm & checked in and were given keys to a room on the 3rd floor (floors 2,3,4 are where the guest rooms are). The room was very plain and bathroom very compact, after Vegas it was a bit of a come down. As we were tired we went to get a drink and were then settle to bed. My husband went to the bar in reception & found that they wanted $4.50 for a bottle of coke so he went outside the hotel & within a 2 min walk found a 7-11.

we found that the people in the room above us were early rises & stomped when they walked. Between that and the loud traffic outside I had a pretty rubbish nights keep. At 6am I went down to reception & asked if I could move rooms, there was no qualms but I was told I couldn't move until later that day when they had rooms available. I repacked & then went out for the day. When I got back that night all my things had been moved & the clothes I'd left on hangers were in the wardrobe waiting for me. We were moved to a quiet room on the 4th floor which was much more spacious (although the bathroom was still compact).

If you do stay here you should try jimmy rockets diner on the sea front, lovely old style american diner.

Do all the normal sightseeing things pier 39, Alcatraz (which was fab - book a couple of days in advance) union square etc and if you wan the true San Fran cable car experience go to Powell and Hyde street junction.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of bathroom & noisy room. Don't settle for the bar cos it's close this is more like a canteen, not what you'd expect from this caliber of hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Although I doesn't look close you're only a block from the pier

review.title: Would recommend
review.reviewText: We spent a week at the Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf while in San Fran, it was a very positive experience and I would definitely refer this hotel to my friends and family. When we checked in we were given a room on the second floor which was not what we had requested originally. (We requested a room on the 4th top floor) When we got to the room our view was of the roof and that just wouldn't do so we went back downstairs and they accomodated us by giving us a room on the top floor.... The staff was excellent however we were most impressed with the concierge service. They were awesome, they were extremely knowledgable about their city and what to do while visiting it. We actaully commented to one another on several occasions how there where always people up at their desk talking to them and most often then not it was about nothing to do with organizing things it was just having pleasant conversations with very friendly people.
review.negativeRemarks: The construction going on outside
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location when visiting San Fran - you are in walking distance to a lot of great things.

review.negativeRemarks: The view from our room and noise

The hotel is very big and what I missed were small personal touches like a welcoming bottle of water. They only offered tea or coffee making facilities in the room. I missed the hot chocolate and the minibar in the room. There was also no guide to the use of the tv and the radio did not sound very good. I would also have appreciated getting some more information when I checked in. I saw that they gave out maps the next day, but I never got one. A map would definitely have helped - but then I should have asked for one, I guess.

review.title: Just OK, But Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is your basic hotel room that needs some updating. Its nothing like Wow! what a nice room! when you first walk in. We had a two double bed room and the beds and pillows were very comfortable. The room was bright and roomy, however I hate staying at places where you fork over $200/night and you don't get a mini fridge. No convenient outlets to plug in smart phones or ipads. No Free WiFi. We made a mistake of renting a car from the Airport and parking it at their facility. The parking costs are $52 per day so I felt I got screwed on that. Lesson learned. They have a little sit down area with a coffee/pastry stand that was kinda weak. It would be nice if they had a restaurant area with a bar with TV's to relax at. This is a good place if you want to just go and sleep at night and be out an about all day, which is what we did. If I go to SF again, I will try a different place.
review.negativeRemarks: Knock it down and build a new one.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, Starbucks, Safe-Way, Walgreens, Fishermans Wharf, Bike Rentals, Tour Busses, 7-Eleven

review.title: Lovely hotel, but noisy.
review.reviewText: The staff where somewhat friendly, the rooms where lovely and very clean modern hotel. Just a short walk to fishermans wharf which is what we wanted. The only real down point is how noisy it was at night. We stayed 3 nights and every night between 1-3am for a few hours a garbage truck or loading truck would come and make a ruckus. Because it was next to a tram line every time on went past at full speed the bed would slightly vibrate. I don't blame the hotel I think anywhere you would stay that close to the wharf is going to be noisy with transport trucks.If you want a room with a view you won't really get one, but if you want to be close to the wharf, great rooms and friendly staff it's very nice.

Hotel is a little older and the only complaint is that when the people in the room a floor above us were walking around their room, it sounded more like stomping and the floor was creaking like old wood when they walked. Had to take a sleeping pill to be able to get to sleep because of that.

review.title: Best for the money
review.reviewText: As with many real estate properties this one is all about location location location!! The short 5 minute walk to Pier 39 is by far the most attractive quality this hotel has to offer. Many, not all, of the staff were bitter or borderline rude. I have yet to figures out if this is was because of the potential language and/or cultural barriers or the individuals were just having a bad day. Everything was overpriced, but that is common in the area. The Hotel rooms were small, full size beds; and the toilet was so low you almost felt as if you were sitting on the floor. The beds were sometimes made Late into the afternoon and on one occasions the coffee wasn't replaced. The free internet in the lobby was continually in and out of service. The internet in the room worked well but at an extra cost of course. If you are looking for a great location and just a place to rest your head at night that I believe this is a reasonable hotel for the price especially for the area.

review.title: Stylish hotel in a fun area of SF
review.reviewText: This is an old hotel that has been given a really lovely upgrade in appearance with nice lobby and hotel decor. Contemporary, stylish, fun.... The staff was pleasant and helpful. The room was clean and nice. The rooms are on the small side, and this is understandable since it is in San Francisco. The bathroom, however is really tiny and cramped. There is limited space to put your personal items. What I found most annoying was that the room that the sink/vanity area was in did not have a separate door to the room, which would be fine except the light that is for the separate toilet area was on the same switch as the sink area, so if someone gets up in the middle of the night to use the restroom, the whole room is lit up. Additionally, our room was above the loading dock and there were several deliveries involving large trucks making beeping noises in reverse and using their loud lift system to unload. So, a good nights rest was not had on either night..but it was a lovely setting in which to be awake!
review.negativeRemarks: the bathroom lighting, bathroom shelving/ space to put personal items. night time deliveries on the loading dock below our room

The day of I arrived at 1 AM they dont respect my request, I had to take a room with 1 bed and smoking
review.negativeRemarks: They dont respect my room request

review.title: Expensive for what it is

I will be looking for a different hotel next time, I hear nearby Hilton is decent. The location is convinient though.

review.title: Great hotel. Great location.
review.reviewText:
No complaints, except parking- $46/day plus tax. Ticket dispenser for parking was jammed and there was no attendant available. Room was clean and spacious. The sink area in the bathroom was tiny and there was no place to put toiletries. I liked the outdoor fireplaces with the sitting area, specially in SF where it can get pretty cold in the summer.
The location is great!

review.title: Good Fisherman's Wharf Hotel
review.reviewText:
Turned up at 9am straight from a cruise ship. They had a room ready and available!
Dropped bags off in room then went to explore SF- walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. Comfy room, good TV, slightly noisy AC and child noise from swimming pool. Starbucks coffee in room.
$55 for hotel Executive taxi to airport - very good service.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from Swimming pool
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance from Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: great family location

review.title: Great location, good service, nice for price.

Staff was helpful and pleasant, rooms were clean and fairly modern.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location - and heated pool.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are noisy. Could hear the ice maker down the hall everytime it was used, air conditioner was like a plane engine

review.title: Great for anyone

Concierge was very helpful with directions, suggestions, and arranging an airport limo for our return.

We enjoyed having the outdoor fire pits with sofas outside and would relax every evening for a glass of wine after a busy day.

review.title: Sheraton Fishereman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Good location -- next to Trader Joe's, Safeway, Walgreens and ATM. Clean, quiet, comfortable. Internet is too expensive but maybe that's San Francisco. Parking is WAY too expensive but suspect that's the area.

review.title: Nice hotel.

review.title: Sheraton in March 2013
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean tidy and comfortable location great and i would recomend this to others , however what was Disapointing was that the WIFI was not free......only in the lobby. Big deal. That was a cheap shot Sheraton, and also parking is not included and is expensive per night.
review.negativeRemarks: had to pay for Wifi and cost of parking

review.title: Great location and ambiance
review.reviewText:
We chose this hotel based on the great reviews on Expedia and were pleased. Few points that others pointed out:

- Parking is $45+tax but it's valet with in and out privileges. The may seem steep but it's one less thing to worry about your car being out on the streets, having to find parking, period, in SF which is a nuisance, and other garages don't allow in and out privileges. The garage is right below the Sheraton with 24 hour valet. We found this very worth it.

- The hotel just underwent a $33 million renovation. Our bed was the most comfortable bed we've slept in (and we travel a lot) with a cozy comforter and four pillows. The room was clean and had cute summery decor, as well as the halls. It's a very vibrant hotel on the inside.

-Downstairs in the lobby is a huge 'iPad' that you can use to find nearby eateries, tourist attractions etc accompanied with reviews and star ratings. This was very convenient. Try breakfast at The Hollywood Cafe -- good portions at a good price.

- The only reason why I gave the hotel 4 stars for hotel upkeep is because our balcony was a bit run down and dirty BUT.. Who really is going to spend time on the balcony when you've got the pier..

-I would recommend doing the double decker red bus tour that is $38. It has on and off privileges and 28 stops around the city at the tourist spots: Golden Gate bridge, Art museum, six painted ladies etc. The ticket is good for 24 hours from purchase and offers a great tour + transportation around.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the bed, the decor and staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Balcony was a bit run down but who really is going to spend time on the balcony when you've got the pier but mentioned in case someone is interested.
review.locationRemarks: You are within walking distance of the most beautiful parts of SF - the Pier and great wharf restaurants. Recommend doing the double decker tour.

review.title: Parking Costs High!!
review.reviewText: My Stay at this Hotel was very nice, however, guests of this Hotel should be aware that they will pay a high rate of $45 per day to park in the Hotel's parking garage. Because this is a high cost I would not stay at this Hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking prices extremely high at hotel garage
review.locationRemarks: Close to the tourist areas and piers

review.title: Excellent Staff
review.reviewText: The location was ideal. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our only complaints were that the bathroom was small and we could hear other guests in the next room and above us, but these were minimal inconveniences and our overall experience was very enjoyable.
review.negativeRemarks: Walls not sound proof
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to all we wanted to see and do, i.e. wharf, open top bus touring, cable cars, shopping

review.title: Great location

The only complaints I had was super noisy in the night, from cars driving by to people outside talking. Walls were super thin so anything would wake you up. Would've been nice to have a jacuzzi for the cold nights.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise level

review.title: Terrific hotel for a mother/daughter trip!
review.reviewText: Our room was very clean and nicely decorated. The beds and pillows (4 each) so comfortable. The bathroom was clean and nice to have the sink area separate from the shower area. Even the coffee in the room was good! Usually hotel water makes it nasty but not here. There's a comfortable chair for reading and a desk area w/chair. All entrances and hallways were clean as well. The staff was friendly and helpful. There's an Ihop right across the street within the block and the Hollywood Cafe in less than 2 blocks. Fisherman's Wharf is close by as are the Sightseeing Tours. We could have used more than two drawers but I would still definitely stay here again and hopefully I will:)
review.negativeRemarks: Only two drawers.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Close to Fisherman's Wharf, Sightseeing Tours and lots of restaurants.

review.title: Excellent!

review.title: Perfect location

Great location! Hotel was nice an clean and staff friendly and accommodating.
Would stay here again and recommend to others,

review.title: enjoyed my stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice. We like staying there because of the great location. Was a little disappointed that they turn off the firepits outside so early. They should at least stay on until 12am.

review.title: Quick stop in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This was definitely a transient hotel for business travelers and tourists. We were thrilled with the location since we were very close to the wharf and the bay. We were able to walk everywhere and never felt uncomfortable about being out walking late. The hotel is close to lots of great restaurants and sightseeing venues. The hotel itself is basic with long halls and absolutely no flair. Due to it's location it does not have a front entrance presence. You literally turn into a long narrow driveway between buildings which then goes straight into the parking structure. I didn't even know we were at the front of the hotel. But it was what we needed and was clean and comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Great location, BUT....
review.reviewText: This hotel offers a great location that's close to all of the "touristy" stuff (Fisherman's wharf, Piers 33 and 39, the Alcatraz loading dock, cable car stops, etc). You can walk to just about everything. However, the hotel needs a major facelift. The carpet is worn, the walls are scuffed, the rooms are dated, the window coverings were dirty, etc. I am NOT usually a picky person (and this is the first review I've ever written), but I felt compelled to let others know that the pics are misleading - this hotel is not as nice as it looks. Also, the coffee bar (which becomes a regular bar in the evening) is staffed by less-than-friendly employees both day and night. Downright rude, actually. I should say, however, that the front desk folks and concierge were friendly and helpful. In all fairness, I should also note that the beds were super comfy. So, if you're not going to be spending much time at the hotel and are simply looking for a landing spot at the end of a busy day of sightseeing, it's fine. But I'd personally look for something in the same vicinity that's more updated and less dingy!
review.negativeRemarks: Tired and worn...
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to many tourist attractions

review.title: highway robbery
review.reviewText: they charge $16.00 per day for wi-fi in room and $45 per day for parking. The former is unconscionable. The latter is usurious.

review.title: Good experience

The staff were very friendly and helpful and very accommodating. I was more than happy with the service, staff and the location. The hotel is slightly outdated and the walls are very thin. I could hear the neighbors next door walking and talking during bedtime but you can turn the a/c or heater fan on within the room to drain the noise. It works well. However, overall it was a good experience.

review.title: Good times in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: My husband and I and our grown son had two room next to each other in the hotel. Both were clean and comforable. One complaint was that outside were the trash bins which were collected early in the morning and operators were very noisy. One great compliment was your hotel lobby where we congregated with relatives who were in another hotel across the street. We shared drinks, snacks and conversation with them in the lobby and watched the Superbowl there on Sunday. We had a great waitress named Meta who took special care of us and who I would recommend in a heartbeat anytime. She was terrific. We did enoy your hotel and will tell friends to use it when they come to San Francisco. It was recommended to us by a family member. Thanks. R. Allegretto

I told them that that wasn't what our reservation was for, feeling too tired to deal with any hassling at all. They moved us to a room with a king bed, but if that room was their top of the line PURE King room, I feel sorry for anyone staying in any of their other rooms.
The staff were all friendly and helpful enough & the lobby was nice. We won't stay there again.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and staff was helpful. I do NOT think they should stiff you for $50.00 per night to park your car. That adds significant cost to the stay. Although it is "optional" you really have no choice as parking in that area of the city is at a premium. Other than that gouging, I liked the hotel and would recommend it to friends.
review.negativeRemarks: $50. per night to park my car was over priced.

review.title: worst experience ever.
review.reviewText: This hotel seems to be remodeled so the room has very morden theme. However, the room is not sound proof. You will hear every sigle foot step who's above you. We were an able to sleep until 1 AM( or before the guy above us goes to sleep). We called front desk but they were unable to help (and it sounded more like it's non of their problem so we have to deal with it). Also, parking is $51, so if you bring a car this is not the best place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: very noisy, and staffs are awful

review.title: Came in for the game!
review.reviewText: Good location. Rooms need update, nothing special . No restaurant. Bar hostess was a little snappy. Overall good stay and nice value

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: First class service start to finish. Perfect location to enjoy San Francisco
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is crazy
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location

review.title: Comfy beds
review.reviewText: First they put usnright next to GYM so noisy and road right outside tried to drown out with heAter much worse noise worse, went to manager they moved us and then fine. Beds comfortable rooms need upgrade very old. Overall was nicenbut wouldn't stay again unless did remodel.
review.negativeRemarks: Old
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman wharf

review.title: Few things could be improved
review.reviewText: I noticed makeup on the blankets so that is why I feel the cleanliness could be improved upon. The breakfast selection was too minimal and overpriced as well. Internet a little pricey and slow. Room was comfortable. Overall it was a great stay however.

review.title: Excellent location - friendly service
review.reviewText: The hotel's location is excellent in Fisherman's Wharf, close to all the main activities. The staff was very friendly and lent my a wife a wheel chair for our stay so that her broken foot did not impede on our holiday. Although they do not have free wifi in the romms, there is wifi in the lobby. I can recommend them strongly.
review.negativeRemarks: No free wifi in the hotel room
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf in downtown San Francisco

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText:
Fine in general, however the room we had seemed to back onto a busy area. There was a lot of noise one morning around about 5am which sounded like the garbage being processed which woke us up.

Location was great though and nice staff.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff. The only downside is the expensive parking, an overall great experience

review.title: Great for family.
review.reviewText:
Probably a really good spot for a family but not so much of if you're looking to see the real San Francisco night life. Very touristy area with very little to offer any singles or foodies who are going to SF for the experience.
Parking at $45 night was not a good deal at all.

review.title: Good value in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel is perfect for a family or couple planing to spend time at Fisherman's Wharf or the Marina District. Hotel staff was great, parking was easy, beds were comfortable. Bathroom was a little small without very much counter space.

review.title: A sleepless night in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
I was in a rush when I booked this hotel and wished later that I had done more research.

The pros: Close to Fisherman's Wharf and the trolley lines; reasonably clean room.

The cons: I have never experienced a noisier room. We were kept up all night by the rumbling, squeaking and banging going on outside our window. We didn't get up to investigate, but I imagine it came from the transit bus yard directly below us. The room itself was OK, although the bathroom was so small that you couldn't open/close the door if someone was inside. The in-room amenities were barebone - so don't expect a mini fridge, shower cap, more than one cream for your coffee, etc.

I wouldn't book here again.

review.title: Great Location for all
review.reviewText: this was a great choice. Good location and great staff and the room was outstanding. We ended up in a room at the end, therefore no noise what so ever.

review.title: Not what you'd expect from a Sheraton.
review.reviewText:
Got a good price for the hotel on Expedia, but upon check in they wanted to charge us $51 for parking! (That's not a typo: fifty-one dollars for parking.)

We got directions to an alternative parking spot; before going there, we went to the room to drop off our luggage -- and could not get in. Someone across the hall had the same problem getting into their room.

The desk clerk came to help us; he had fixed the key, so it worked. When he opened the room, we saw that someone had forgotten a crib inside. To make up for the inconvenience, he allowed us to park at the hotel without charge.

I went out; came back; and the key again did not work. (It did work the time after that.)

As to the room, which was on the ground floor: the restroom door did not lock. The door itself was damaged at the bottom -- its best days were well behind it. The window opened to a street opposite the loading dock of the Safeway supermarket. A semi-trailer had to maneuver hard to get in; the tractor was twenty feet from our window (the driver did an amazing job: the access is really tight).

Next time we will stay farther away, and drive to Fisherman's Wharf, as we've always done.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy room; trouble with the keys; hotel tried to overcharge for parking; restroom door didn't lock and was damaged.
review.locationRemarks: At the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. Walking distance to key attractions, and to our favorite restaurant (Scoma's).

review.title: Nice hotel. Don't bring a car!
review.reviewText: I really liked the fireplaces in front of the hotel. They were wonderful places to enjoy the rain we had all weekend. Rooms were ordinary. Overall good, not great. Location is good, but they charge $50 per night for parking.

review.title: great hotel for family
review.reviewText: it is a very nice place to stay, close to everything. i liked the fire pits outside.

review.title: Great running location
review.reviewText: Staff went above and beyond to help me get some materials printed for a meeting
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the water- was a great location to run.

review.title: A Qualifed recommendation
review.reviewText:
Room overlooked the bus depot which was noisy at times and when the window opened, fumes were unpleasant. Bathroom was very small and cramped. Staff very friendly and accommadating.
Breakfast was very expensive with a limited menu. All the food and drink were overpriced.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was important to us, but. Fisherman's Wharf is a good place for families, but a little too tacky and touristy for us.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf area could be cleaner andd smell better!

review.title: Great hotel for everyone!
review.reviewText: The staff are really friendly and helpful with knowledge and provided good customer service! Very please with the location, is in the centre spot of most of the attractions!!
review.positiveRemarks: Centre point to most if the attraction locations
review.negativeRemarks: The bed is too soft
review.locationRemarks: 5 mins walk away from pier 39 in Fisherman's Wharf!!

review.title: Needs more TLC
review.reviewText: So the hotel elevator was being worked on and that slowed things up a bit. My air conditioning unit made a terrible noise that made it difficult to get a solid night sleep. The firepit for the smokers was broken so we were isolated in the cold. The doorman were very helpful. Security was readily available. FYI:Purchase your Alcatraz tickets a month in advance. I don't believe my postcard was mailed off because my family has still yet to receive it and that was given to the concierge the day I arrived so I suggest mailing it off yourself. I bought a coke and sprite 20 oz for $8.80 at the hotel restaurant and thought that was outrageous so I decided to go to a grocery store and purchase drinks for the remainder of my stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were so clean and modern. The workers were very helpful, especially Jason.
review.negativeRemarks: Broken firpit, broken elevators, expensive food and drinks.
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect for visiting Pier 39 and for hop on hop off bus pick up.

review.title: An OK place overall.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a good location. We went for a double bed in a room. The room was congested with an out dated air conditioner. No one at bell desk, the guy standing outside valet gave us the luggage cart and asked us to bring it down. I do not think it was a Sheraton experience.
Only positive thing is a fire place outside which can be very warming.
review.negativeRemarks: Service
review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: Great Hotel.
review.reviewText: the bathroom isn't large enough. I could hardly turn around and close the door when i got in hte bathroom. There is no free wifi, which kanda made me mad. Apart from these, the hotel is all good.

review.title: A Weekend Getaway for My daughters and I
review.reviewText: Very Nice, retro remodeled hotel. Fun, clean. The employees were very nice and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The concierge. I spoke with several and they all were very helpful.

review.title: excellent place to stay near the wharf
review.reviewText:
awesome experience, would recommend to anyone

A++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

review.title: Hotel review
review.reviewText: The elevator didn't work and they charged $50 to park. That's ridiculous. It costs $60 if you were NOT a guest.
review.locationRemarks: Location was excellent

review.title: Good Choice!
review.reviewText: Hotel was lovely...clean, newly done. Staff was most helpful. Great location. Reasonable rates. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay there.
review.negativeRemarks: had great outside seating with fires going but fires were not generating heat the way they were situated. Frustrating and cold
review.locationRemarks: perfect....everything so accessible

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel seems a little dated. the decor is recent and up to date but there are some small details which make it look like a renovation was not a complete renovation - more like a "make over" without any structural updates. The elevators were pretty dirty. The beds were comfortable and so were the pillows.

review.title: Great Hotel Location, but expensive parking!
review.reviewText: Hotel is nice, and a great location since it is in the Fisherman's Wharf area. Just be aware that parking at the hotel is EXTREMELY expensive! We were not aware of this when we booked the room. $45 a night!!! Ouch!!! Also, their breakfast buffet was mediocre and expensive, especially considering all the great restaurants nearby. (We just looked at the buffet, and we not willing to pay $25 for what they offered.) If we stayed there again, we would take a taxi to avoid parking, but other than those two things, we really enjoyed our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking and Hotel Buffet
review.locationRemarks: Right in the Fisherman's Wharf area!

review.title: Great location to the Wharf
review.reviewText: My experience was good however, the $50 car parking is outrageous and the heater in my room was very loud which made it hard to sleep so I had to turn it off. Boy did the room get cold. The walls and windows seemed thin too! I could here the couple in the room next to me coughing and talking. Also outside my room was where the buses parked for tours and they were loud as well.
review.negativeRemarks: the $50 parking fee and loud heater noise
review.locationRemarks: Awesome...

review.title: A liitel disappointing
review.reviewText: Adequate service. The hotel appeared a little in need of maintenance and repair in the public use areas. It was also noisy.

review.title: Better options elsewhere
review.reviewText: There was not any single major thing wrong with this hotel... just lots of small annoyances, compared to other possibilities. The concerige was largely useless, and had an attitude like it was a big inconvenience to talk to people. Parking is expensive at $45/day. The decor is pretty strange... Internet access costs extra.... I had to wait 10 minutes for someone to show up at the front desk to check out... etc. Overall, for the price, there are just a lot of better options.

review.title: great location and staff
review.reviewText: Margariet at the front desk was a wonderful help. Other staff were all wonderful too. A problem was fixed quickly with our coffee machine. We were on the main floor by the entrance windows & it was a bit noisy at night, but overall a great location and stay.
review.positiveRemarks: location of hotel and helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: room location
review.locationRemarks: walk to wharf, downtown, restaurants

review.title: Good location, but disrupted sleep
review.reviewText: We were placed on the 2nd floor, our window & view were directly onto airconditioning units just outside our room. They were noisy and turned on and off during the night, disrupting sleep. Apart from that the room was very clean & comfortable, and the hotel was in a great location. Definately would recommend, just ask for a room that isn't on the 2nd floor!
review.negativeRemarks: room too close to airconditioning vents
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking distance to Fisherman's wharf & cable cars. F-line Streetcar stop just outside hotel

review.title: Clean and modern
review.reviewText: Was modern and clean. Forgot stuff in room and was returned.
review.negativeRemarks: Locked bathroom in lobby
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Was doing work on elevators and they need it. They were slow and did not always go the right direction, but room was nice and it is a good location.

review.title: Best hotel in location
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Sheraton and it was probably the nicest hotel in the Fisherman's Wharf area. We were able to see many hotels around the area and the Sheraton definitely is the most pleasing on the eye in terms of outside appearance but the same goes for inside. We really have nothing negative to say about this place except for the elevators were a bit slow (although they did have a worker each day fixing this problem). The pool was lovely, we enjoyed the outdoor firepits, staff were very friendly and approachable! I give this hotel a 5 out of 5 since it met all of our needs at a very reasonable price!
review.locationRemarks: excellent location, minutes away from the wharf and transit, cable cars

review.title: The Sheraton at the Wharf
