review.reviewText: Best thing about this hotel is its location. Close to everything. Worse thing is the price of breakfast buffett at $28.75US + tax.

review.title: Look at other hotels you are paying for the name
review.reviewText:
1. Upon check in, room was pre-paid. Found out on 2nd day by checking my bank account that they charge $100 per day. That's a hold for incidentals.
2. Rented a car and found out that it costs $50.00 per day to park your car in their lot. Even though you are a guest.
3. The bathroom was so tiny that you have to get in the tub to open the door.
4. Internet access is an additional $15.00 per day!!
5. Room is outdated and needs an upgrade bad.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf location
review.reviewText: The lobby of this hotel looked nice, but hallways were old and tired looking. The Sheraton is an adequate hotel if you are looking to be close to Fisherman's Wharf, but there were so many nicer hotels in the area. Slightly dissapointing.

review.title: The Sheraton a nice place to sleep.
review.reviewText: We were greeted first by the parking valets. They were very friendly. Are room was ready and clean. I liked the location a lot. They have couches and chairs near the entrance with a fire pit to relax by. Nice touch. It was walking distance to the Fisherman's Warf and close to many restaurants and shops. The only thing that I found frustrating is that asking for something special seemed like a big deal. Like when I asked for a wine glass to take up to our room, they did not have enough glasses to spare?? Also there is no real bar or restaurant on site, only a cafe.
review.negativeRemarks: Some of the wait staff had poor english. No real bar or Restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Great location - Close to the Warf and many attractions

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: Staff was Great!! Doggy friendly!! Great location!!! Average room size.. didn't feel that i paid for what i got. Rooms were average size, almost felt like i was at an average hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Small
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: RETURNING CUSTOMER!
review.reviewText: I have returned to this hotel several times, and was not disappointed! It is located in a central location to many of the important sights for first-time visitors like my 25-year-old niece who accompanied me! She kept saying what a perfect location we were in because so MUCH was within walking distance (including a Safeway Market right behind the hotel)!! We walked to Pier 39, walked to our tour buses, walked to Ghiradelli Square and Trolley stop. Upon returning to the hotel after a full day of walking, we enjoyed the lovely outdoor seating area the hotel provides around a gas fireplace! I will be a returning customer!
review.negativeRemarks: There is no door to the vanity where the light must be turned on if you want light in the middle of the night in the toilet area.
review.locationRemarks: TWO blocks from Pier 39 and walking distance to Aliotto's for the freshest Clam Chowder, Crab, and Calamari ever!! The trolley is close by too!

review.title: Almost superb!
review.reviewText:
The Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf is in a perfect location for "wharfing" activities and offers a friendly attractive environment. The hotel staff was efficient and helpful; the two times we asked for something from housekeeping they showed up immediately. Also it is one of few hotel rooms in which I have stayed that actually had enough electric outlets for all of our many gadgets to charge. My granddaughter, studying for an exam in the middle of the night, adjourned to the lobby/cafe area where there is free wifi and access to snacks and she felt very secure and comfortable.

The only reason I am not rating this hotel as superb is because the size of the room and the fact it has double instead of queen-size beds made it a bit tight for my two granddaughters and myself and it is VERY pricey considering those ordinary features. But then it is San Francisco and it is Fisherman's Wharf so I am really not complaining too much. If permitted I would give it a 4.7!
review.negativeRemarks: Double beds.
review.locationRemarks: Truly next door to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Happy dance
review.reviewText:
Being a first time traveller, I was surprised at how wonderfully accommodating the hotel was. Our flight was badly delayed and we did not arrive until the next day. Even though we called them very late concerning our delays, they took care to make sure everything was ready for when we arrived the next morning. Checking-in was hassle free! The concierge was very helpful, and didn't once make us feel like we were a group of ignorant inconvenient tourists.

The little restaurant at the front was charming, with access to outdoor firepits which made breezy evenings very comfortable. Very ideal place for families and/or couples!
review.positiveRemarks: outdoor firepits! Since it was off season, they were often free and we could watch the rain while staying warm and dry!
review.locationRemarks: Super Ideal! Very close to the piers, easy to walk to Ghirardelli Square (Cable Car station) or Ferry Buillding, and right beside Safeway for fruits!

review.title: Close to everything, great location!
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is excellent, walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and only few miles from all other attractions. Bed was comfy, shower was clean, I'd stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: The carpet

review.title: OK but could be so much better.
review.reviewText: It was just ok. Not much more to add as it wasn't bad but I was glad to leave.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText:
Hotel is in a great location.
Interior of room was somewhat worn, but it appears the hotel is doing some updating.

No need to have a vehicle-parking is expensive.
Free Wi Fi only in the lobby
review.negativeRemarks: Wi Fi in the room is expensive
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Fishermans wharf

review.title: Great location, foyer & cafe
review.reviewText:
I booked this hotel based on the Sheraton name and their brand. The location and foyer area are great and look to be newly renovated.

I was traveling and had booked the rooms with family & asked to be as close as possible. This meant that we were placed 10 rooms apart, about 150 meters.

The receptionist who provided us with our keys was barely civil.

On entering our room I was hit with the smell of old socks.

review.title: Terrific hotel, clean and plush bedding
review.reviewText: The hotel clearly was recently rennovated. It was extremely clean. The bedding was very plush and comfy. The concierge staff was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the outdoor seating with the fireboxes.The location is great if you want to be close to Fisherman's Wharf, and public transportation -- the stop is just outside the door of the hotel -- makes it easy to get into town although the buses are jam-packed with tourists. That was the only downside. Otherwise, great experience. I'd definitely stay there aain.
review.positiveRemarks: Euro-style comfy bedding, outdoor lounge area with fireboxes, clean, friendly, helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: street noise
review.locationRemarks: good location, public transportation easy though it was generally packed

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is easy walking distance to Pier 39 and other local attractions. If you want to save money, go across the street to the Safeway or Walgreens to purchase bottled water, soda/pop, beer/liquor, fruit, snacks, etc.

This is not a hotel with a lot of frills, it appeared they run expenses tight but they don't let service suffer. For example, you will not find a hotel shop here.
review.positiveRemarks: The fire pits were popular - if you are sensitive to cigarette smoke, make sure you grab one without ash trays around it.

review.title: Nice Hotel Choice for San Francisco
review.reviewText: Friendly, comforting, clean and convenient. I think the parking is over-prized but otherwise, this is a great choice for the Fisherman Wharf area and easy access to Chinatown, Union Square, as well as the Bay Bridge to Oakland.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff and easy access to Fisherman Wharf
review.negativeRemarks: The parking price
review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: San Fran good location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is well situated and the 2 double bed rooms are reasonably sized.
Front desk and concierge service is excellent.
The airconditioner is very noisy. There is no refrigerator in then room.
Good spot if you do not want any time spent in the room nor do you want to eat at the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: No refrigerator, noisy airconditioner, limited food.

review.title: Fire on the Wharf
review.reviewText: I particularly liked the outside sitting areas, by the natural gas firepits. They showed consideration for smokers and non-smokers alike.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy breakfast area and sometimes noisy crowds waiting for the elevator (our room was just beside the elevator).

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: It's a good location but the concierge staff was not very friendly. I was assisted by three different people and all of the seemed annoyed by my questions. They were not cordial and made me feel uncomfortable. The staff at the front desk were helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge
review.locationRemarks: It's close too everything you can walk to Fisherman's wharf

review.title: weekend getaway
review.reviewText:
pros: check in clerk was amazing and very sweet. recommended places to eat in the area and provided us a map. the breakfast buffet was yummy! excellent. the outdoor lounge and fire pit areas were amazing! the extra touch that would make us want to book again. location was great... walking distance to any and everything.

cons: a few complaints... no bus shuttle from the airport. long list of hotels that provide free shuttle service from airport but the sheraton was nowhere to be found. no free wifi in the rooms. weird... lots of money for no wifi. no frig in the room.... movies on the tv was expensive, more than usual. bell hop and concierge area only had one employee and there were 5+ people in line. waited a long time.
review.positiveRemarks: fire pit and lounge area outside.
review.negativeRemarks: no buss shuttle to and from airport
review.locationRemarks: excellent, best location.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Location great. Great staff, from check in to concierge, to bell hop, to valet parking. I would go there again!
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to pier 39

review.title: just fine...
review.reviewText:
its was fine, but i feel little upset because your free wi-fi is just the lobby. why not in the room?
how come some other is free wi-fi, hate this i have to pay 14.95 just for the 24 hrs stay. it was so inconvienient for the customer to go down the lobby just for web browsing.
review.negativeRemarks: why your room doesnt have any microwaves?
review.locationRemarks: i stay in room 2226.

review.title: Good times
review.reviewText: Clean, well-lighted. Lobby was very busy though, tight.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking. This should be complimentary to hotel guests.

review.title: Great Location, Good Staff, Expensive Parking
review.reviewText: Great location, very nice housekeeping staff, over all good staff, but the charge for parking was too much considering the cost of the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Style, pool and gym, very comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of Parking
review.locationRemarks: 2 Blocks from the water. An excellent spot if you plan on not having a car.

review.title: Great family hotel
review.reviewText:
Location is perfect. It's within walking distance
of lots of attractions. The hotel itself is very
nice too.

review.title: Great Location and Hotel...
review.reviewText: Friendly staff... Nice room; specially the bed was firm exactly what I like...

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: My room was large clean and comfortable. The only problem I had was the noise. I was on the second floor and I heard every footstep of the person above me. This really kept me awake.
review.locationRemarks: Great location though

review.title: Good for business/leisure in tourist area
review.reviewText: Fresh, clean international style hotel with small pool, in central position, good for business or family trips, easy to walk to Piers/Wharf and tourist attractions, cable car and buses. Coffee shop with free wifi and helpful staff able to give local information. Very comfortable beds. AC a little old style.
review.positiveRemarks: Some outdoor seating and coffee shop
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi charge in rooms

review.title: Great location close to the Embarcadero / Pier 39
review.reviewText:
The hotel location and decor or great. But, the hotel, even with a face lift, is older. The bathrooms are very small, motel like. The staff I encountered was OK, not overly inviting and not rude, something was missing ( except for front desk ). The snack counter staff were understaffed and with flat personalities. Breakfast was expensive and so was parking, 45.00 per day. The heating / cooling system in the room seems old.

Pluses, besides location, include comfortable beds, quiet rooms, and fresh colorful decor.
They also have several outdoor fireplaces that were inviting and comfortable. I would stay here again based on location, close to everything. But was not one of my favorite hotel stays. I would put it in the OK nice 3 star cagtegory.
review.positiveRemarks: location, location, location, and the bed was very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: cost of breakfast, small bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: sad excuse for a 4 star hotel
review.reviewText:
While the hotel was recently redecorated and clean, structurally it was lacking. Both my colleague and myself had to call maintenance; one for stopped up bathtub and one for broken TV. Also, my air conditioner was so loud it sounded like a diesel truck running its engine all night long next to my bed. I also heard someone in the elevator complaining about his room as well.

One last thing, We tried to get restaurant info from two separate concierges and neither were helpful and one was plain rude.

review.title: Wonderful location for San Francisco
review.reviewText: Elevators need to be fixed, but overall this is a lovely hotel and the staff is wonderful

review.title: Absolutely not up to Sheraton standards
review.reviewText: It is hard to believe Sheraton would put their name on this property. It was shabby, dirty, noisy and horrible. There were no amenities in the room and there was a bus lot next door so that all night we heard busses starting and stopping and backing up with the beep-beep-beep sound. The walls were paper thin not only between the rooms but to the outdoors. The in room air conditioner blew right onto the bed. Just an awful experience. We left after one sleepless night and moved to another hotel for our next two nights.
review.positiveRemarks: leaving after one night, when we were booked for three nights.
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: horrible, loud, inconvenient

review.title: Really enjoyed oursleves
review.reviewText:
Bed and bedding fabulous!!!
Swimming pool and other areas where they have outdoor fires were great..
Bathroom and closet not well planned, e.g,, no towels or towel rack near bath tub, no hand towel rack near sink, awkward closet rods, very small vanity.
Our room was right beside the ice machine so a bit noisy.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location very close to Pier 39!

review.title: Nice location, but disappointing room
review.reviewText: We were extremely disappointed with the room we were assigned. We booked this reservation in early March and yet ended up in a room on the seond floor with a view of a major air conditioning unit. In addition, we had to keep the window covering closed as there were no privacy sheers. Other rooms could look right in. Furthermore, we were told that nothng else was availble and yet it appeared that there were people checking in that did not have reservations. On the plus side, the concierge was very helpful and gave us great tips on things to do in the city and where to dine. The interior decorating of the hotel was in bright California colors which were very lovely.

review.title: The best part was the colorful carpeting
review.reviewText: The sheets were dirty with hair and black things, parking was outrageously EXPENSIVE, hotel rate was high, when we arrived to check in we sat in the area for valet for 20 minutes before someone could help us with parking. Not the best.
review.negativeRemarks: dirty sheets
review.locationRemarks: Close to wharf which was nice

review.title: Terrific Hotel!
review.reviewText: Great location - easy to walk to Fisherman's Wharf. The room was terrific - size was nice, bed was very comfortable, room was exceptionally clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again. My only comment for folks planning to stay there is that the parking lot for the hotel was very full so if you stay there, don't self park, use the valet parking and let them worry about where to park your car.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is superb and the rooms are terrific!
review.negativeRemarks: Finding a parking spot in their garage was tough; use their valet parking service
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location if you plan to explore Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Great Stay in a nice hotel
review.reviewText: Great location close to Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39 and tour operators. Very friendly and efficient staff. Comfortable beds, very clean but small bathroom otherwise very good rooms. Lovely breakfast at nearby IHOP and handy Safeway acroos the street. Would definitely stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Small bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: Brilliant

review.title: Brilliant hotel staff
review.reviewText: I have stayed at The Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf before and always enjoyed it. Always clean and comfortable and I was very pleased to get a room here at quite short notice, during a very busy time in San Francisco. It is probably worth asking for an "inner" room, however, as the rooms overlooking the street can be quite noisy. We asked for extra tea bags and these arrived within 5 minutes. Similarly, maintenance staff arrived very promptly to replace a light bulb.
review.positiveRemarks: I think the best thing about this hotel has to be the staff, who are always pleasant and helpful, nothing is ever too much trouble.
review.negativeRemarks: This is a big hotel with a long walk to some of the rooms. it would be helpful if there was a second entrance at the opposite end of the building,
review.locationRemarks: Brilliant location, so close to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, the cable cars and F line streetcar.

review.title: great hotel for anyone visiting .
review.reviewText: the hotel was great. everyone there was polite,curtious and friendly.

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: We had an upgraded room and the bathrooms were very small, no TV's in the bar area and no Restaurant in hotel, but they do have room service.
review.positiveRemarks: very clean, service was great, room was big, excellent location
review.negativeRemarks: Our room was on the side where the bus yard was. You had a nice view of the bay bridge and coit tower, but the bus lot ruined the view.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel was 2 short blocks from Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: In the center of Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Great location, quiet, comfortable room. Within walking distance of Pier 39, Coit Tower, and numerous restaurants. Covered parking is safe and convenient, but expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking.
review.locationRemarks: One can walk anywhere.

review.title: If your want a good night sleep, don't stay here!
review.reviewText: Here is the deal. The beds are wonderful. THAT'S THE ONLY GOOD THING ABOUT THE ROOM. They are very small. Poor lighting. You can't turn on the bathroom lights without having light pour into the sleeping area. One complete side of the hotal is extremely LOUD. Trucks start loading and being cleaned EVERY MORNING around 3am and you'll hear traffic ALL NIGHT EVERY NIGHT. HORRIBLE. We even changed our room the first night and the next room was only slightly better. Food is overpriced. $6.50 just for two teabags!!!!! Don't expect the doorman to help you into the hotel w/your bags. Not happening. That being said, the staff is very pleasant. Hotel is clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything besides the beds
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient

review.title: Great location near Pier 39
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay, but we were disappointed with lack of a real restaurant.

review.title: Fisherman's wharf Good & Badd re Sheraton
review.reviewText: Very exoensive Have to oay for phones & Internet Bellagio at Las Veags is far less expensive
review.negativeRemarks: Bit on the high side

review.title: Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Excellent room and service....friendly staff....close to everything...fairly priced.
review.negativeRemarks: Not enough clerks when busy
review.locationRemarks: Unmatched

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a good location. There is a 7-11 on the next block as well as a Safeway.

The fact that there is no fridge in the room is odd though. That would have been nice to have.

Everything is walking distance from this hotel, and there is a Dollar Car Rental in the lobby which was extremely convenient. The staff at the Dollar was also very helpful.

Parking was $45 a day though...if you rent or bring your own.

review.title: Great hotel for everyone
review.reviewText: The hotel is very confortable and close to the main atractions. The personnel in general are very kind people. The only point I was not confortable was the space at the bathroom to put the cosmetics and the air dryer is not installed at the wall so it is not easy to manage. They do not include shower cup neither as it is usual in most of the hotels.
review.positiveRemarks: The room in very confortable. The service in general is very good
review.negativeRemarks: The food is too expensive. The details about the bathroom that I mentioned before.
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Not a four star!
review.reviewText:
Nothing was said about a parking fee. Being from Idaho, we did not expect to pay for rental car parking. Not to mention $45. per night. Rediculous.
This was an old motel with mediocre updates. Pricing for the motel, food and drinks was way too high for the lack of quality.
Room was extremely noisey.
We will return to the area, but will find a different location to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Price and noice.

review.title: Great hotel for pet owners
review.reviewText: They don't charge a pet fee. The hotel is walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, and close to shops and grocery stores.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was right on the street.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Very friendly and helpful staff!!!!
Beautiful rooms and close to everything!

review.title: location and service hard to beat
review.reviewText:
best feature is the location
outdoor fire pits were a nice touch on chilly afternoon or evenings
my only negative was our room was on the side of the complex closest to the bus depot...we heard the buses as if the window was open (such that each of the four of us independently checked the window numerous times)...our only conclusion was the noise from the street was coming through the a/c unit
review.negativeRemarks: bus depot noise and smell

review.title: Good hotel and great location.
review.reviewText:
Great hotel! Nice Heated swimming pool. The kids loved it!

I would have loved to have a few more things in the room like a mini bar and maybe a microwave to heat the baby's milk. But other than that everything else was great.

The location was great. We didn't need to take out our car for 2 days. You can walk to most location or take a bus or cable car to everywhere else.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of mini bar and microwave in room.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great. Walking to distance to bus tours, ferry tours and alcatraz. Decent restaurants within couple of blocks.

review.title: Great hotel for the Family to stay and Enjoy
review.reviewText: The hotel was great.It is close to everything in walking distance. To the wharf to the piers. To the sightseeing tours and the cable cars. It was a great location for what we went to S.F to do. The sheraton was a perfect place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is pricey.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything a block away from the wharf.

review.title: Beware extra charges
review.reviewText: To make their room rates competitive, they bill separately for 'extras' that are included in most good hotels. And every so-called 'extra' has a hefty tax. Allow an extra 30% for unexpected extra charges.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was convenient, pretty, comfortable, and very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: The 'extra' charges felt abusive.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything in Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Pretty good
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a good location, especially for families, steps from Fisherman's Wharf. However, there are no free amenities (e.g. parking, wifi, room fridge, etc. etc.) and if you are looking for a hotel in an area with nightlife, look elsewhere. Overall though we were pretty satisfied.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy bed, convenient location for tourist attractions
review.negativeRemarks: Few hotel amenities
review.locationRemarks: Steps from fisherman's wharf

review.title: Not great for dogs.
review.reviewText: They say dog friendly. But, they really mean tolerante. Not a good place for pets.

review.title: disappointing
review.reviewText: Many things within the hotel were not working and out of order.... made the stay challenging and for the price very disappointing.
review.negativeRemarks: Upkeep
review.locationRemarks: Close to pier 39

review.title: Good overall
review.reviewText: Good, but very noisy in the early morning. The room we stayed in was by a street that had people up early and very noisy.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to pier 39 and most other attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: Adjacent to a noisy street
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

review.title: Don't expect much
review.reviewText: Tired hotel. Looked and felt cheap. Noisy room, noisy residents.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: The Sheraton is at a wonderful location! It is very close to wonderful restaurants, rental bicycle places and the Hop On / Hop Off bus. We could walk to many different places to see. The Sheraton is very clean. There was an elevator who had a mind of its own, but otherwise, we loved it. The front staff was very friendly and helpful. Our young adults liked the pool in the afternoons. We also liked the fireplaces outside where you could talk and meet people from other places. I thought the breakfast prices were expensive. So we went to Safeway, next door, and bought breakfast bars.
review.positiveRemarks: The restaurant was close to everything! We enjoyed the fireplaces outside. Our young adults liked the pool in the afternoon. It was very clean!
review.negativeRemarks: The middle elevator wasn't working properly. Also, the valet person was hard to find in the early morning. He did not help put the bags in.
review.locationRemarks: The Sheraton is very close to great restaurants, The Hop On Hop Off bus, and to our place where we rented bicycles! It was near a Safeway/Walgreens.

review.title: Nice room
review.reviewText:
Very good location.
Very Nice room but no wifi and the breakfast is very expensive 30 dollars per person and soso. I would book again.

review.title: "Want to stay there upon next SF trip!!!"
review.reviewText: One thing we liked was that they were constantly busy cleaning and maintaining the property. Some travellers have complained about the noise. We were worried beforehand but after staying there, we didn't find the rooms to be all that excessively noisy. I think it depends on the other guests around your room whether or not one experiences extreme noise. The beds were plush and comfortable. About the only drawback in terms of noise (and reason I gave all 4s instead of 5s#, is housekeeping starts cleaning each and every day between 8 and 9AM weekdays and weekends, rain or shine, regardless. Maids can be unintentionally noisy even with the do not disturb sign on the door. The room walls and doors are thin in those regards, so you have to watch tv very quietly in the rooms. And they can be a bit stingy about providing extra wash linens. Otherwise, this place is a charm. We intend to go back there upon our next San Francisco trip. Tip: There's a small mall with a Safeway grocery store #drinking water, snacks, fruits, beer and liquor#, Walgreens #travel size toiletries, drinking water, SF souveniers#, Bay Cleaners for same, next day or 2 day service #also has internet access for 30 cents per min), and Shipping store for USPS, UPS, etc. This tiny mall can be entered from the pay parking lot and is located directly across the street behind this Sheraton.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean. Walking distance to wharf and convenient location.
review.negativeRemarks: Some noise from housekeeping every morning unless very early riser.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent! Has a wonderful little mall located across the street behind the hotel. Please see tip in review

review.title: I would not recommend this one ..
review.reviewText: Disappointing 4 star hotel . More like 2 star hotel , although , located very good.

review.title: Good Value - Excellent Location
review.reviewText:
Our second time here with two adult children. We will always stay here when we visit SF.

What I love:
- the beds are very comfortable
- the concierge desk is very helpful
- the location is superb

What could improve:
- the hotel is tired compared to the Sheraton quality you would typically find in similar properties
- no free Wifi in the room - but free in the lobby. In the morning, this is annoying because the bandwidth is maxed out with slow service for all
-

review.title: Tired property - awesome location - great value
review.reviewText: Not the typical Sheraton experience from a property perspective - but the staff are exceptional as you would expect. A bit tired - but the location is awesome - we'll be coming back. Good value overall.

review.title: Hotel very charming, location is perfect.
review.reviewText: Very comfy beds very clean bath and bedding. Hotel concierge was very helpful in every way. The elevators were a bit out of sync, and not always working properly. They did work, but would open on the wrong floor, for buttons not pushed, etc... Overall nice hotel. The carpeting in common areas was worn and probably should be replaced. Overall the hotel itself was very clean and accomodating to our family. Great location!
review.positiveRemarks: The firepits outside were really nice to gather around.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators were tempermental.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal. Within walking distance of so many great places to see, dine or hang out at.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Could not be in a better location. Easy to get to any other neighborhood via cablecar, streetcar, bus or walking.

review.title: LOVELY
review.reviewText: LOVELY HOTEL, CLEAN ROOMS MY SECOUND TIME THERE, CLOSE TO THE WHARF AND ACTION
review.positiveRemarks: CLOSE TO ALL THE ACTION SAFE
review.negativeRemarks: NONE
review.locationRemarks: PERFECT

review.title: Good Hotel - Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location. In walking distance to attractions. Very clean and hotel staff were very friendly.

review.title: Business trip
review.reviewText:
The staff were very helpful
Wifi was free in the lobby, but $18-$24 per 24 hours in the room which seemed expensive
There was no hotel restaurant, but the hotel gave a good list of recommended restaurants within 5 mins walk
Breakfast was OK
The lifts (elevators) were very slow and had a mind of their own
review.positiveRemarks: Very close to the bay front, with lots of good restaurants
review.negativeRemarks: No free WIFI
review.locationRemarks: Close to the bay and piers

review.title: THE hotel for families!
review.reviewText: Our family stayed at the Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco. Conveniently located near popular attractions, shopping, restaurants and ground transportation, this is the hotel to stay at! The staff was overly gratious and made us feel right at home -- these people will take care of you! The rooms are nicely appointed, the outdoor fireplaces are a wonderful resting spot afer a day of touring, and they have an outdoor pool for the kids. I highly recommend this hotel to families! Thanks Sheraton and thanks Expedia! We had a memorable and flawless trip to San Francisco! We are definitely coming back!
review.positiveRemarks: The entire staff was polite, gratious and took great care of us.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to everything - attractions, ground transportation, restaurants, shopping.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is a little older.......but great staff make up any shortfall. Great location for a holiday.

review.title: A rubbish hotel. Waste of money
review.reviewText:
A dirty hotel. Unclean and needs a complete refurbishment. Overpriced . Unhelpful staff. Overpriced parking, no restaurant in hotel. Poor bar service. Poor breakfast. Its a cattle market not fit for human beings. Porr quality staff with poor english. Its America!!
Starwood should be ashamed. Over priced rubbish. Never stay at this hotel
review.negativeRemarks: NONE Whatsoever
review.locationRemarks: OK

review.title: Good for business, but not for romance
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Sheraton as our first stop on our honeymoon, but despite emailing them the hotel weren't able to offer any upgrades. We've rated the hotel as OK as it was fine but nothing special. The location in Fishermans Wharf was great as a start for sightseeing but we were itching to get more into the heart of San Fran.

All in all, we had a good stay but more of a business hotel with a pool.
review.negativeRemarks: Fishermans Wharf location too touristy

review.title: Great Hotel and Location
review.reviewText: Our stay was great! close to everything that we wanted to see. All within walking distance.

review.title: Professional Staff
review.reviewText: Staff was pleasant and helpful from the bell hops to the domestics.
review.positiveRemarks: Outside seating with gas fire - needed for the cool San Francisco weather.
review.negativeRemarks: Extremely busy.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Needs some help...
review.reviewText: Property is in desperate need of a renovation! In general, hotel seems outdated and the rooms seem disproportionate.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms in rooms and the VERY slow elevators.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for the Fisherman's Wharf area!

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Excellent location but the hotel was dirty and crowded. Dirty cafeteria and ridiculous little dinning room for breakfast.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Good location. Close to the wharf. Very comfortable. A little noisy on the side of the building of my room. Across the street from bus garage.
review.negativeRemarks: Getting around inside the building. Very spread out. City block long.
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Great place, great price
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel if you don't mind being a few miles away from the city. The train station is literally right outside your doorstep which was great. Not walking distance to all the touristy spots but given the price, it was fabulous for us - considering we were travelling with 2 young boys. The breakfast was great and staff were very accommodating as well.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom towels were pretty old
review.locationRemarks: Great spot - away from the touristy areas but short train commute to Paris

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: The stripes everywhere made the hotel seem less "fancy." Just not my kind of decor, kind of makes you dizzy. We did have a good time though.
review.negativeRemarks: Stripes...
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Made our trip one less worry to think about!!!!
review.reviewText: The conceirge was the most helpful esp. with booking tours, discount coupons etc. The housekeepers kept up our room better than I expected.....when I had a question or needed something, they came right away.
review.positiveRemarks: the cheerfulness, the decor, the staff
review.negativeRemarks: needs an indoor pool on the chilly San Fran nites!!!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect!

review.title: Definitely disappointing.
review.reviewText: Definitely disappointing. Not awful, but certainly expected more. The room wasn't particularly clean, I could hear every step taken in the room above us, valet took 30 minutes to retrieve my car, etc.

review.title: very nice hotel
review.reviewText: its agreat hotel but the parking is very expensive
review.negativeRemarks: the parking
review.locationRemarks: it has avery good location its near everthing

review.title: It's ok
review.reviewText:
Just ok, very dated. Great location though.
Granted you don't spend much time there, but for the price, I think nicer would be more satisfying.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to the wharf is great
review.negativeRemarks: Dated and rickety (elevators)...hello 1980
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Good location near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location. It's one block to Fisherman's Wharf. Hotel looked nice. The room had every amenity possible. A couple of negatives....it's really loud in the rooms. You can hear everyone going down the hall and people in the parking lot. They really need to come up with alternative choice for breakfast. $22 a person is more than most people want to pay. Also, parking fee is $45 a day. As much as you pay for this hotel, parking should be free or some minimum fee.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Very nice and comfortable. Great location to shops and activities.

review.title: Internet
review.reviewText: Its ridiculous in this day and age of free wifi everywhere that the hotel charges a fee of approx $15USD per day for in room wifi. Outdated and overpriced business practices.
review.positiveRemarks: Conveniently located close to transport and Fishermans Wharf
review.negativeRemarks: Looks tired
review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: Pleasant hotel
review.reviewText: Too expensive Internet access. Very convenient place!!! Very nice stay!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Price for unternet
review.locationRemarks: Very good

review.title: great hotel for family trip
review.reviewText: good location, good for family. may need upgrade on elevators

review.title: Inflexible....
review.reviewText:
My disappointment stems from the hotel's strict adherance to it's non-refundable policy. I attempted to cancel the reservation made through Expedia 4 days prior to the stay, and was rebuffed at every turn, despite having stayed 3 nights at another Sheraton property on this trip. There should have been more consideration given by local management, and it's unfortunate because I travel frequently and use Sheraton often. I'm now reconsidering my position.

Note: I get the concept of Expedia & it's relationship with hotels, but in this case there was way too much rigidity on the part of Sheraton.

review.title: Great hotel for first e visitors.
review.reviewText:
Extremely convenient location, priced affordable
We enjoyed our entire experience. Very helpful staff.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf Sheraton
review.reviewText:
Bathroom was too small to turn around without bumping into door , wall or both.
Light for bathroom was located on outside wall and turned on the light for the bathroom and the sink area. (this would wake others in the room if you got up at night)
review.negativeRemarks: Striped color scheme in halls was uncomfortable and bathroom size too small

review.title: Nice Hotel - shame about extra charges...
review.reviewText:
Hotel was as you'd expect - very well appointed, clean and in a relatively good location for tourists.

The only negative point is that you have to pay $15 for 24hrs wifi access in your room (and for that the signal is pretty poor too). We'd been travelling for 2 1/2 weeks along the pacific coast and this was the only hotel that charged for this service (and for local calls) - given the cost of the hotel, charging for what has become a basic service for US hotels seemed unnecessary.

Breakfast at $24 is a pretty pricey extra too...
review.negativeRemarks: Extra wifi charges
review.locationRemarks: Good location for tourists

review.title: comfortable
review.reviewText: The hotel was close to the area we wanted to be in and it was very pleasant. The staff along with the people in the area were very friendly and helpful. The vanity is on the small side and is lacking in couner space and wall hooks. Was a little crowded for a girls trip. There is also no small fridge for drinks.
review.negativeRemarks: counter space and no fridge

review.title: Manageable
review.reviewText: The location is good, but the quality services and facility was a bit low for a 4-4.5 star.
review.negativeRemarks: Services
review.locationRemarks: Right behind the heart of Fisherman's Wharf area.

review.title: One of the best hotels in the world.
review.reviewText: Convenience, just a walkaway to fisherman, wharf and Pier 39. The room was very clean and very comfortable.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: hotel location is excellent for visitors, also very frindly staff . rooms are wide and big enough for small family. overall , hotel is very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast buffet is expencive.
review.locationRemarks: Kuwait

review.title: Only one night
review.reviewText: Older style hotel. Confusing entrance. Need your room key for every door ... not convenient. Fun wharf location .. Easy walk to that areas sites.

review.title: good choice for tourists
review.reviewText: quiet but convenient location for tourist visit to San Francisco

review.title: Excellent week in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel had everything we needed. Rooms taken care of, lobby chairs, tables, computer desks available, little cafe for coffee, danish, bagel, etc., All staff was cordial at all times. Hotel very close to the wharf which made it so convenient. Entire stay was good.
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby area and outside "fireplace" setting areas.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything was good.
review.locationRemarks: The location to the wharf area was superb.

review.title: Very nice hotel in the perfect location!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was located in a very convenient spot, not on the Wharf, but a short block away. The room was immaculate. The bed and bedding were extremely nice. The only issue was that the toilet and tub were in a room so small that you had to practically straddle the toilet to close the door. Other than that, it was great! The staff was pleasant and very helpful in answering questions. The breakfast was very expensive, so we chose to walk around the corner to McDonald's each day. We would definitely recommend the hotel and would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was extremely clean and modern.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom was very, very small.
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect for Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 and all the restaurants and shops.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: This hotel is over priced for what you get, hotel hallways looked beat up and worn, nice vinyl chair in the room needed cleaning, front desk staff were friendly on the surface but I got the felling that they really didn't care. Considering the price of the room parking should have been free .... $50 per day for parking is ridiculous!
review.negativeRemarks: parking fee
review.locationRemarks: Great location but for a lot less money I'll be staying at another location next time and walking a few extra blocks to the Wharf.

review.title: Extras cost
review.reviewText: My problem with this hotel doesn't show up with the stuff that is listed here...the Internet costs $15 per 24 hrs. per devise. Parking is also another charge. They say they have Breakfast on the site it is a buffet that costs $25 a person, I Hop is just across the street! Starbucks is in the lobby and you can get free wifi there. So if you know the extra charges and can deal with them, I think it's the same for all hotels, it's a good hotel and close to Pier 39 and on the trolley line. I guess I am to use to resorts and east coast places where the " extras" are free or included in the cost.
review.positiveRemarks: Good beds, we stayed on the go enough that we weren't at the hotel long hours
review.negativeRemarks: Not having free Internet, having two teenagers with me could have cost a bundle. I also had trouble getting online, so I had to call help line.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to pier 39 and 45, on the trolley line and bus line, so you can park your car and leave it if you want.

review.title: Great price, value, and location!
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel! The room was big, clean, and comfortable. The staff was so kind and helpful. The short walk to Fisherman's Wharf was perfect and the price was great. We will definitely stay there again!
review.negativeRemarks: No continental breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Close to fine dining, Fisherman's Wharf, and Ghirardelli Square

review.title: don't trust star ratings
review.reviewText: this is more like a 2.5 star hotel. bathroom was very small. there was a musty smell to the room.they don't provide shower caps. plastic cups instead of glass. the location was probably its best feature

review.title: US Open
review.reviewText: Very Quite, never spent much time at the hotel. Was only there to sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Didn't have any
review.locationRemarks: Good location one block off Fishermans Wharf, nice

review.title: Ok, but should have been better for a Sheraton...
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. We booked a king bed room and they gave us a twin bed! They argued that reservations can not always be "guaranteed" until arrival. Also, the room was confy but very noisy. Elevators were a bit old and needed maintanenace.
review.negativeRemarks: Satff not very polite and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Great.

review.title: Weekend in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I was taking some time out of a business trip to see San Francisco. I arrived late but that wasn't a problem, the staff were helpful, happy to assist.
Concierge were brilliant helping me sort out all my tours, my only advise to those going is book your tours way in advance...
review.positiveRemarks: Room was fantastic just what you needed when crashing after days sightseeing
review.locationRemarks: Excellent loacation for all the tours and bay piers.. not more than 10 min walk from anything

review.title: Nice location, Clean hotel
review.reviewText: Good location, very clean, spacious, and comfortable room
review.negativeRemarks: No free wifi- no hotel restaurant
review.locationRemarks: very good location , walking distance to attractions like Ghiradelli square, bike rental places where you can rent a bike to cross the bridge

review.title: Excellent hotel and friendly service.
review.reviewText: My daughter, granddaughter and I stayed 6 nights and loved this hotel. The room was clean and large and the king bed and sofa bed were very comfortable. The amenities in the room were nice with a safe, a coffee/tea maker, numerous outlets to charge phones, ebooks, etc., and a large TV with many stations. I loved the fact that the tub and toilet were separate from the vanity area. However, it would have been nicer to have separate lighting. My only real issue was the $25 buffet breakfast which was not really worth it; and neither was the $15/day charge to use WiFi in the room. But, I would stay at this hotel again without concern. All the staff members were friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The $25 breakfast; the $15/day WiFi.
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect. Only a block from the wharf and 2 blocks to Pier 39

review.title: Great place to see a ballgame
review.reviewText: The staff was very nice and the location was great. Everything was easy to walk to with the kids. We will stay here again!
review.negativeRemarks: a little noisy in the hotel at times
review.locationRemarks: great location and close to everything to walk to

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Perfect location for fisherman's wharf- Walking distance to everything:)

review.title: Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The room was nice, very clean for an older building. The location was great, close to shopping and transportation was easy to find and get to. The lobby and common area was small though, so not a lot of room to relax if not in your room. No restaurant in the hotel and snack options were limited. We would stay here again though, despite those things.
review.locationRemarks: Great location!!

review.title: Sheraton fisherman's warf
review.reviewText: Pictures on site are show rooms looking like new, this is not the case. Rooms and hotel were nice but tired. For a Sheraton I expected more. WiFi is pay only in rooms. Easy walk to The warf, Chinatown, and Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Room needed updated

review.title: First time visitor to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Good location for tourist a short walking distance to everything restaurtants,tour bus,ferry for the bay and alcatraz.Hotel room can be noisy if beside the road.Free wi hi in lobby.Hotel lobby look dated.Will stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Room can be noisy
review.locationRemarks: Good location in Fisherman Wharf

review.title: Excellent stay.
review.reviewText: The bed was very comfortable, the room spacious and the proximity to the pier was awesome!

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: The staff were less than thrilled to be there... They weren't the cheery staff that other (similar level) hotels have at the front desk / lobby bar but the hotel itself, the concierge team and the lobby area was awesome.

review.title: Great Wharf Location
review.reviewText: Great location for Wharf activities. If you have a car, you should consider the public parking located just a block away (only $10-$20 day - depending on the day of the week)
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet. Enjoyed the gas fire pits
review.negativeRemarks: Parking.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for Wharf

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText:
everyone was very friendly and helpful. Our room was ready and easy checkin and checkout.
We had to ask several times about how to get to certain places, and the staff was very helpful.
The bathroom was a little small .The beds was very comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: location, close to Fishermans warf , public transportation and eating places
review.negativeRemarks: small bathroom and shower in tub

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay. As we were checking out, the staff was striking. They have not had a contract since 2009. We hope this is rectified quickly.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location!

review.title: needs a makeover
review.reviewText: Room was small, toilet was short, chairs uncomfortable, lounge area ugly, outdoor area nice but too many smokers, could not help us get there from the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything else
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fishermans Wharf

review.title: Superstar Stephanie!
review.reviewText: We picked this hotel because we were traveling with our child. It was what I expected for the price, pleasant but not extraordinary. Staff was friendly and the rooms were clean, albeit small. The mattresses on the beds were not that comfortable, good pillows and down comforters, though. The location is convenient and there are stores right next to it (Walgreens, Safeway, Trader Joes), which made it easy to pick up odds and ends. We bought coffee at the hotel a few times (Starbucks in the lobby) but didn't eat there or order room service because I knew for what they were charging we could eat somewhere better. There was an exceptional woman working at the concierge desk: Stephanie. We bought our child a souvenir that wouldn't fit in our luggage and we had to leave before the mail center (next door) was open. I told her we would leave it with her to give away, but she offered to mail it to us when the mail center opened. She was so kind to go out of her way to help us and for her quality of service, I would give this hotel 5 stars. People like her really make all the difference.
review.negativeRemarks: The mattresses

review.title: Stay away!
review.reviewText: I'm certain I was given the worst room in the hotel. It was on the 2nd floor and looked out directly onto the street. It was the nosiest room ever. Hated every minute of my stay.

review.title: Will come again
review.reviewText: Great location, friendly and helpful staff, nicely appointed, highly recommend

review.title: a pleasure experience
review.reviewText: really nice bedrooms and services, near everything, competitive prices.

review.title: n/a
review.reviewText: No response in this section about my hotel experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Love the new update look to the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: LOVE the location. So close to wharf and cable car access!

review.title: review
review.reviewText: The 45.00 daily charge for parking is the pits. Did not know of this prior. Kinda ruined the trip for me.
review.negativeRemarks: 45.00 daily parking
review.locationRemarks: nice

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText:
Great staff and fabulous location! Staff were friendly and knew the area really well and had great advice. The rooms were spacious and clean and fresh. loved the design and decoration. There are 2 things that i could fault them on. our view was of a bus depot which was quite depressing and there was no fridge in our room which would have been lovely as we are travelling for a month, so being able to store basic groceries would have been great!
Would stay there again it was great.
review.negativeRemarks: view from room
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf and easy to get around

review.title: Vacaton in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel to stay for the cost. I wuold lke like to see the cost of parking included for all 4 nights instad of just 2 of the 4.
review.negativeRemarks: Fitness area.
review.locationRemarks: Not the best in the hotel. Between 2 buildings.

review.title: Great place to stay !!
review.reviewText: No regrets at all about this hotel. Couldn't ask for any better. The hotel was clean and well kept, the staff was very friendly and the location was perfect. Would stay there again in a heart beat. Hopefully they will have room available when we go back to San Francisco again.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was very clean and well kept. The staff very friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe towlel racks in the bathroom rather than a couple of hooks. That's about the worst thing I can say about the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: The location was awesome. Close to fishermans warf, safeway, cable car line. Great great location.

review.title: Fishermans Wharff
review.reviewText: A very clean and Tidy Hotel. Door staff were very helpful and freindly. Only 1 block away from all the action on fishermans wharff and pier 39. Good coffee shop in the Hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee shop not 24hr
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location for fishermans wharff and pier 39

review.title: Location, location, locatoin
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is excellent, just two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf/Pier 39. Within walking distance of Coit tower and many more attractions. The Concierge (Jesse) was knowledgeable and courteous. The view was sub par; looking at the bus parking lot was not pleasurable along with the noise that comes with the bus yard.
review.negativeRemarks: View - Opening the window and hearing the buses from the bus yard was not ideal
review.locationRemarks: TRUELY walking distance to the main piers at fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Excellent experience at Sheraton Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: The hotel was exceptional. We loved the ambiance of the decor. Our room was very nice and cozy. The staff was extremely cordial, polite and accommodating. We loved the fireplaces out front near the restaurant. We enjoyed our morning coffee and an evening cocktail there twice. Overall, I would give the hotel a 4.5 out of 5. We would highly recommend it to our friends.

review.title: pretty good
review.reviewText: Great location spacious rooms, the hotel is a little noisy we could hear people in the room next door but over all pretty good
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Great for the main transit and fishermans wharf

review.title: Nice Stay!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay and the convenience of the surrounding area. It has really been nicely remodeled since my last stay and I was pleasantly surprised about the inside appearance.

review.title: Excellent view and location.
review.reviewText: It's nice and clean, but the most important thing it's the location, so close to pier 39 and other sites. I will love to come back soon.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast menu.
review.locationRemarks: A+

review.title: great area especially for tourism
review.reviewText:
All was great except that the light for the bathroom is only on if the light for the vanity section is on. This means that you have to wake everyone one else in your room up if you need to go to the batheroom or take a shower. We brought our air purifier to block the significant noise that one hears above your head and from the street. The noise is common in all levels of hotels in CA in general and in San Fran in particular and not just here in this hotel. The area is excellent for the tourist. DO NOT eat at the Fisherman's Grotto. I had the pasta with prawns and found a rusted needle. yep. You read right. A rusted needle.
The beach (Aquatic Park#, the piers and all of the other fun tourisy stuff is at you door step here. enjoy! #except for the above mentioned restaurant...don't eat there)
Go to Golden Gate Park's botanical gardens and Japanese Tea Garden too!
review.negativeRemarks: light in bathroom on in room when being used
review.locationRemarks:
Beach, shops, restaurants, fun stuff all over the place
Go to Golden Gate Park's botanical gardens and Japanese Tea Garden too!

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at this hotel this weekend for just the weekend. The room was a nice size and the bed was super comfortable. There was a little noise because our room was on the corner of the building that just happened to be on the same side of the building where there was a service entrance to the building next door. That is my only complaint about this hotel. The staff was awesome and it is so centrally located to everything that if you get tired or forget something at your hotel it is very easy to go back out without losing a lot of time from your sightseeing. The parking is pricey but it is every where in the city. This parking is in and out as much as you want and the valet is the same cost as self parking. We highly recommend this hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: The noise
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located to everything

review.title: walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Excellent location within easy walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. Room was a little small but had everything we needed for our stay. The kids enjoyed the nice heated outdoor pool. Even though it was cool outside the pool was pleasantly warm.
review.negativeRemarks: 2 double beds instead of 2 queens
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Pier 39 attractions.

review.title: Great position
review.reviewText: Ideal location but hotel is very outdated. Would stay there again though
review.negativeRemarks: Needs updating
review.locationRemarks: Excellent. Close to fishermans wharf walking distance to tours etc

review.title: Great location for the top SF Bay tourist spots
review.reviewText:
We found our stay at this Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf enjoyable. It's within walking distance to the wharf so you really don't need a car. We booked our room two weeks in advance through Expedia, got a reasonable price plus free parking. We parked our car in the indoor parking garage and didn't drive it for our 3 day stay for no charge.
The king beds were very comfortable and found the rooms very clean. They have outdoor propane heaters with seating areas where you can have a drink and a cigar . . . if you so desire.

review.title: bigger beds please
review.reviewText: to small of beds. front desk folk need to be a little friendler

review.title: One could find a better hotel.
review.reviewText:
Overall the hotel was just OK for me. Nothing outstanding or memorable. It wasn't my first choice but I booked too late and there were no availability in my preffered hotels. The bed was comfortable. Location was good. Housekeeping was disappointing (there were hair strands from the previous occupants at the walls of the toilet upon check in. These remained in the following days of my stay. Totally gross!).

Having said this, I read the review from another guest regarding the noise and disturbance in the middle of the night. While I didn't encounter this, I don't take it lightly and I don't think anyone should. I had previously experienced something similar at another hotel. The least the management could do was offer a free night stay to the affected guests given the nightmare they had to endure. For me, if this can happen to one guest, there is nothing to stop it from happening to you or I so I guess it all depends on whether you dare to take such risk.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was good. But all the hotels in Fisherman's Wharf would naturally be located conveniently.
review.negativeRemarks: It's gross to find hair strands sticking to the walls of my bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf has easy access to all the favourite spots in SF.

review.title: Basic Basic Basic
review.reviewText: Minimum service for a Sheraton... Don't waste time and money staying around this Wharf!

review.title: Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Rooms were clean and the location was very convenient. However some sections of the building were not under the best condition (e.g. peeling paint on the walls etc).

review.title: NOT WORTH THE PRICE OF A SHERATON HOTEL
review.reviewText: LOT OF TRAFFIC NOISE ON THE MORNING. HEATER IN THE ROOM SEEMS OLD, MAKES LOTS OF NOISE AND SEEMS NOT VERY CLEAN AND CONFORTABLE, MAKING THE AIR VERY DRY
review.negativeRemarks: traffic noise on the morning
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is a very nice place to stay

review.title: Pleased
review.reviewText:
The hotel was great and located right at Fishermans Wharf so walking was a breeze. Staff was very friendly and very helpful as we were travelers not knowing much about the city.
the only negative review i have on the hotel was the thin walls. you could hear everything as people walked down the hall ways and the people aboe us were very heavy walkers.
review.negativeRemarks: the thin walls.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great and centers you right around all the attractions

review.title: 2 Thumbs Down
review.reviewText:
If you use Expeadia, you have to check out and check back in EVERY DAY.

The lobby and restaurant area is like a very poor school cafeteria with unpleasant staff. The management is dreadful and tone deaf to complaints, which is probably why the staff are so miserable.

Their market niche is very low end Time Share type sales organizations.

review.title: Great Location and Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: It was a great experience, the only issue I had was that I could here the early morning trash trucks outside the window at 3 AM.

review.title: General
review.reviewText: Great location. Walls are paper thin and you can hear everything in the room above you.
review.negativeRemarks: Privacy
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Great location but noisy.
review.reviewText:
Great location for our short stay in San Francisco.
Walking distance to tourist attractions,restaurants and shops.
Unfortunately our rooms facing the bus depot were so noisy overnight that we requested new rooms- staff were able to move us to rooms facing the roof. There was no view but rooms were pleasant, spacious and quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, liked the quirky decor.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy overnight.
review.locationRemarks: Great location- walking distance to tourist attractions, restaurants and shops.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and very well located. It is one block from Fisherman's Wharf. the Hop On Hop Off tour bus is close. There are restaurants nearby for a quick meal. Boudin Bakery is a good place to go for breakfast or lunch. The negatives about this hotel is that the bathroom is small and the decor is dated. They charge for wi-fi in the room; but you can use it for free in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Small bathroom - no free wi- fi in the room
review.locationRemarks: 1 block from Fisherman'Wharf

review.title: Decent for what we needed.
review.reviewText: Our room overlooked the Muni bus yard, but was surprisingly quiet. The hotel needs a general make over on decor. Carpets were like a flashback to the 60's and the windows in the hallway were the sliding kind and several were off track allowing wind to come into the hallway. The elevators had a high pitch squeal. Bathrooms were very small. Generally speaking the beds were comfortable and using it as a base to sleep worked well for us. Not a place we would hang out in, but decent for the price.
review.positiveRemarks: Location near the wharf and multiple attractions - close enough to walk to and far enough away to stay quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathrooms were very small and the food was expensive.

review.title: not recommend
review.reviewText: the room that we were stay was in first floor thr walker on street can see throuht our window can not open the shade 24 hrs
review.negativeRemarks: room assignment
review.locationRemarks: good per fact locatin in san fran.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: It is a nice Hotel sto spend a few days. It was a bit loud, beause of the trolley and the working at the pier. But i would go again.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensiv Parking
review.locationRemarks: nice and clean. Bahtromm very funcional. Nothing fancy.

review.title: FIshermans Wharf is the ONLY Positive thing
review.reviewText:
power was out when we arrived - no details on why or how long or anything..just "take the stairs - and oh yeah - they are outside in the rain"..

rooms were noisy - could hear people above us constantly.

shower sucked - felt like a drizzle... didn't feel clean til i got home and got into my own shower.. hotel showers are suppose to be amazing - this one i dreaded.

bathroom was soo small - i am a small person and i felt tight in it - can't imagine someone just a tad on the heavy side being able to deal with this bathroom.
review.positiveRemarks: fire pits outside were nice - but not always on...and hard to get to.
review.negativeRemarks: bathrooms/rooms
review.locationRemarks: location rocked

review.title: Great disappointment
review.reviewText: First they gave us a key that didn't work, then ended up changing our room to an interior one that the key was actually for, the room was noisy, so much so we thought the windows were open but they weren't. The noise from the room above us was louder than the noise from our own room, you could hear everything. The front desk clerk we dealt with was void of personality and not helpful at all. They wanted $3.31 for a little bag of chips, but didn't even have coffee or newspapers in the lobby for guests. If I had not prepaid we would have packed up and left the first night.
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: location was good

review.title: Good Hotel and Location
review.reviewText:
Had a wonderful stay. The location is fantastic. Close to everything and within walking distance of most attractions.The staff were all very friendly and helpful especially the Concierge and bell boys nothing was to much trouble and advise was given on what tours sights and restaurants. They were really helpful when our airport shuttle did not arrive to pick us up. The Hotel was clean and tidy, our room was excellent enough pillows etc., the in room tea and coffee making was always stocked although probably could do with more milk being left.
Step out side the door and your are on Fisherman's Wharf and right by a trolley bus stop so getting to other areas was really easy.
would really recommend they hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: fisherman's wharf San Francisco was excellent

review.title: too expensive and not nice
review.reviewText:
The hotel is expensive. You have to add almost fifty bucks to your total room charge for overnight parking.
For this price, I was expecting a better environment, free parking, and free Internet.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: No free internet in the lobby. Only one usable exit from hotel, opposite the pier. Loud in the rooms, not a problem from the staff, just other guest.
review.negativeRemarks: walking from room to exit
review.locationRemarks: good, better if exit towards pier 39

review.title: Great location - bad customer service
review.reviewText:
This was our first time staying at the Sheraton at Fisherman's Wharf. When we returned to our hotel after dinner, the electricity was out in the entire hotel. Staff said it should be back on in 15 minutes, it was an hour later...still no electricity. I called down to the Guest Services desk and the woman that answered was the rudest employee I've EVER dealt with at a hotel. She explained to me that she couldn't call PG&E b/c I called and she had to hang up - I asked if she had actually talked TO PG&E and she said "No, b/c you guests keep calling and I can't call them!" and I asked if she was the only one working and able to answer the phone and call PG&E, she said yes. No apologies AT ALL, just rude and waiting for me to hang up. I went down to the front desk and was not loud or rude and asked about the power - he said another 30 minutes and gave me a flashlight.
It was raining/thunder outside and I understand that staff were stressed out and the majority of those I encountered were friendly, but the operator answering Guest Services needs to not be dealing with customers. I didn't stay there for FREE and not only was the power out for 4 hours, but we had to pay FULL price for the one-night stay.
review.negativeRemarks: The operator
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: There is a Safeway right next door which made it easy to pick up food essentials for the family while keeping cost down. Hotel is located very convenient to all activities. Very, very clean and we all felt safe.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a little small for 4 people
review.locationRemarks: Great, very convenient for walking to sights

review.title: Sheraton Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText:
The hotel was very clean and one block away from Fishermans Wharf which is what i wanted. I asked for a fourth floor room when i arrived and was given one.

The beds were very comfortable and my children and I were very please overall with the hotel. The pool was warm enough to swim in even though it was in the 60's outside.

Room service was very fast although a bit pricey. Parking was $50 per night also too pricey but i guess thats just San Fransisco. Cheaper parking could be found accross the street. There is an IHOP on the corner and a Safeway market on another which was convienient.

My only complaint is the T.V. programming. My kids are 8 and 10 years old and the only two childrens station are the Cartoon network and Nickelodean and around 8 p.m. when my kids wanted to watch T.V. The Cartoon network was showing "adult swim:" which is totally inapropriate for children and Nick was showing "Friends" which has adult themed, adult content and i find it inappropriate for 8 and 10 year old children. It isnt just this Hotel, I have stayed at several different hotels throughout California and found the same two "childrens" chanels with the same inappropriate programs when my children are up and wanting to watch T.V. I would have been happier with the Disney Channel. I dont understand how hotels think that "Adult Swim" is appropriate for yound children but maybe the people making the programming decisions dont have children of their own.
review.negativeRemarks: The childrens programming available on the television (Adult swim, and Friends)
review.locationRemarks: Great location, one block from Fishermans Wharf

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay. It was a great location and the staff was very helpful and friendly. Overall a great experience in San Fran.

review.title: great time spent here.
review.reviewText: Great place. Clean and welcoming. Close to the pier and entertainment.

review.title: Mixed... Ok, but I'd try another hotel next time
review.reviewText:
Great location with good access to all the best attractions

Service was a little slow and fitness center wasn't locked even at 5am.. Security?

Parking was an expensive extra at $45 per day and no rollaway beds were available.

Liked the free wifi. Concierge desk was helpful and friendly

review.title: Comfortable!
review.reviewText: This was a great place to stay. It had a groovy feel to it when you walked in the door. It was comfortable and within walking distance to the Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: The room is a little bit small for a family of 4. But it is in San Francisco, can't complain. The decor of the room is very contemporary. Their outside patio seating area is very nice.

review.title: Sheraton Hotel Review
review.reviewText: This was the most awesome experience. The hotel staff was wonderful, the room was so clean. I most certainly would use the Sheraton again, anywhere I go.
review.positiveRemarks: The pool area, the fireplaces all around.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Sheraton at Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Nice hotel!
review.reviewText: Very pleased with the hotel location, staff, and most accommodations . . . except the bathroom. It was way to small for a group of 3 people. The valet parking was expensive, but in all was convenient if you wanted to take your car in and out everyday.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom . . . too small
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for everything we wanted to see and do.

review.title: Hotel review
review.reviewText: the a/c heater unit is too old,and I think the hotel gives expedia guests room view not so good,the one I got is ground floor,people outside the street can see us so we needs to place the curtain down ,overall everything is fine,good location,clean,nice n friendly ,will go there again but make sure get a better view !
review.negativeRemarks: view
review.locationRemarks: great location to the pier

review.title: Another opportunity missed...
review.reviewText: Room 4620... across from city bus depot storage where 30+ buses are started at 5am and idol until all are gone at 7am, and don't forget, they back-up first before they leave (beep beep beep). Outside in the lounge area and fire pits, several people smoking Marijuana, while valet walks buy!!! Complaint about not informing us was of the bus situation was handled by moving our room and discounting parking $10. The new room was greated with a person above us that continued to walk back and forth from 3am until 5:30am, at which the floor continued to creak - call to desk was unanswered... mind you, we went from the top floor to the second floor. We asked concierge where the best "fish and chip" place would be... he had to look in a notebook to even find a place that served it!! Wouldn't spend the money again, will stay at properties across the street.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing favorable, but located close to city transportation
review.negativeRemarks: Least favorite was that city transportation was readily available
review.locationRemarks: Three blocks from the Warf

review.title: We would go back again...
review.reviewText: Great location, beds were very conforttable, no water presure so we had to take a bath instead of shower, outstanding staff!
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of water presure to take shower.

review.title: Not what it used to be
review.reviewText: While this hotel is in a great location, the experience has changed drastically since our last stay. The "new" updated decor is awful and it looks like it was done years ago and not as recently as the website claims. The food and drink available at the hotel is extremely expensive. REALLY $24,95 per person for a breakfast buffet; perhaps for a Sunday brunch but not for an everyday carb-loaded buffet. Staff is so/so. The concierges we talked to were quite nice, but the front desk and restaurant/cafe staff were "chilly" at best. My next trip will definitely be somewhere else
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of coffee and food
review.locationRemarks: Perfect if you want to be in the Fisherman's Wharf locale

review.title: Family trip
review.reviewText: Great location and nice Hotel. Ouch on the cost of parking. $45 per day and a 14% tax is a bit high, but it is a major city.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Nice location and hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice and in a GREAT location for experiencing the wharf however the parking runs about $50 per day.
review.negativeRemarks: Price of parking

review.title: Over all Happy Traveler's!
review.reviewText:
This was a trip for our 3 year old, so being a block and a half from Pier 39 was great! IHOP is on one coner, and Safeway on the other!!! When you check in, ask for a 4th floor room...You may get lucky and get a peak of Coit Tower...but if views out of your room window are a must... this is not the place for you, as our first room was on the first floor with a view of a wall and a huge brown metal A/C unit. They were very kind to relocate us to the fourth floor, though!
The valet parking IS pricey right around $50 per night, but totally worth it, as you have in/out privilages and the valets are very kind, organized and helpful (giving directions and such)
Not a lot of perks or extras, clean room, no dvd player, bathroom is SMALL, limited towels and toiletries (chick thing)
Overall we'd stay again, mainly for the saftey and location...
