review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: Nice size comfortable room. Always clean. Biggest downside was the Safeway truck deliveries starting at 5:30 AM. Convenient location. Staff very accommodating. Normally we stay at the Hyatt, but we will be back to the Sheraton this Summer.
review.negativeRemarks: Light in the toilet area and vanity are both on same circuit. Turning on at night disturbs other person in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to most of the Wharf area and public transportation.

review.title: Disappointing for the price and Sheraton name!
review.reviewText: I had huge expectations about a Sheraton. Very disappointing. Hotel staff seemed to be amature and/or not listening.
review.positiveRemarks: Not much impressed me here. Room was only sort of clean, very noisy, and staff seemed new to the industry.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wi-fi in the lobby was spotty at best. When I complained, the staff treated me like I didn't know how to use wireless.
review.locationRemarks: Location--a couple blocks from the wharf--was the one redeeming quality.

review.title: Location Can't be Beat!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The room was very nice, comfortable bed and sitting area. The location was terrific...walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and North Beach. We parked the car and walked everywhere.
review.positiveRemarks: The comfortable bed and nice linens.
review.negativeRemarks: The bath area was too dark.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great.

review.title: Family trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Should have complimentary Wi-Fi in rooms. Smaller hotels do have this service. Both parking and breakfast are expensive, so we looked for both outside the hotel. Excellent location.

review.title: Great hotel and great staff
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, clean and comfortable with very friendly and helpful staff. The concierge was amazing and recommended several dinner spots and bars that were off the beaten path and tourist free. Overall our stay was great. Complimentary wi-fi would be nice in the hotel rooms instead of just the lobby and a complimentary breakfast would be nice, too, but no major inconvienience.
review.negativeRemarks: paid wi-fi in guest rooms
review.locationRemarks: great location, right on the wharf and close to local eats and attractions, too.

review.title: Jason's experience
review.reviewText: Very noisy room. No newspaper. Location good but hotel can use a facelift.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Very good.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel location is fabulous for visiting the main attractions of San Francisco. Close to everything you need to get to. The decor of the hotel is modern, very clean and had no problems with finding someone to help answer a question. Staff was extremely friendly. Room was not as large as I thought it would have been, but satisfied the need. Would recommend this property to anyone.
review.positiveRemarks: Location of this property is prime....you can access anything you want to from this point.

review.title: Great home base for a family visiting SF.
review.reviewText: Very family friendly. Close to the warf and heated pool. What more could you ask?
review.positiveRemarks: Heated pool, clean comfortable room, staff was friendly to kids.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for seeing San Francisco. Near warf and cable car turn-around.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: air conditioning system needs better seals around edges. cold air from outside could be felt coming in. no free wi-fi in the rooms was a bit of a drag.

review.title: Best place we have stayed on the Wharf.
review.reviewText: It was a great location and just wonderful place to stay .Very comfortable room and bed. The spacious room and bath were so nice. The only negative was we heard the footsteps and squeaking from above our room. The staff was very friendly and helpful . All and all the whole hotel was beautiful.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and amenities such as the fire pits outside . Grand idea!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Only a personal note but we did not care for the decor and color , not very warm and inviting but I am sure it is just our age .
review.locationRemarks: Great as it is close enough to everything but still quiet .

review.title: I'd stay here again!
review.reviewText: Absolutely gorgeous! It's a bit like a maize inside, but you get the hang of it after a while. Lots of turquoise decor, which was kind of fun. Comfy beds, amazing shower (wish I had one like it at home) and great access to downtown Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great location and the staff was very helpful. The only negative was that the hotel was in need of some cosmetic updates such as paint and carpet.

review.title: Outstanding Hotel, but...
review.reviewText:
I love the look and feel of the hotel. Staff is very courteous and attentive to your needs. The Location is PERFECT! What I do have an issue with, is the noise... While I understand the life of a hotel and it's potential customers that use it, it would not hurt to stress common courtesy of being "QUIET" for those who DO NOT party at the wee-hours of the morning or have children. Both times I have stayed at this Sheraton, this has been the only issue. While I understand some things cannot be helped due to demographics. I think other steps could be taken about being quiet after a certain hour, etc.

I have seen this in other hotels with something as simple as a sign on the wall or on the key that opens the door, etc. Regardless, I would and have recommended the hotel. Yet, with a subtle "but, the noise..."
review.positiveRemarks: Modern Look, friendly and attentive staff, great location!
review.negativeRemarks: NOISE, NOISE, NOISE
review.locationRemarks: Right near the Wharf and within walking distance of most activities on or near the wharf.

review.title: San Francisco - Business and Pleasure
review.reviewText: Excellent in all aspects. Rooms are clean and modern; Services are readily available; Check in was simple and staff excellent in all areas.
review.positiveRemarks: Very well kept, staff is excellent!
review.negativeRemarks: No comment
review.locationRemarks: Very handy.

review.title: great weekend
review.reviewText: Great location, nice ambience, clean, helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: small bathrm area
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: our recent stay
review.reviewText: Bathroom badly planned. Beds very comfortable. Old fashioned air conditioning system.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom

review.reviewText:
Great Location, no car needed.
Single Sink, Small closet.
Overall Pretty Clean.
Parking is too expensive!
Staff are ok.
Concierge instead of explaining the attractions tried to sell the bus tour.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking Expense, hassle
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: No Wifi, 51 dollars a night parking!!
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice and clean but their are downsides. First the parking is an additional 51 dollars every night not included in the room. Their is no wi-fi in the rooms you have to go down in the lobby which is a huge pain. The Radisson hotel which is across the street has free wifi in their rooms. So not sure why the Sheraton is not up with the times. The other negative is the cable. They have nice TV's in the rooms but only offer a few high definition channels. The quality of the standard definition channels stinks. Overall we will not be going back here. I think for the price that we paid the least they could do is offer free wifi and parking. Location is good but that's about it..

review.title: Not as good as this site leads me to expect.
review.reviewText:
Little things let down this hotel. Like a ten minute wait for morning coffee because they have a single inept employee where two good ones would be busy. Another problem, and I discussed this with another guest, the heater/ac unit sounded like an early sixties chevy V8. too loud to sleep with on. Also, loud, obnoxious jerks in the courtyard were loud into the wee hours, and even after I complained I couldn't get a decent nights sleep. Things like that should be handled at once and well.
Room was nice, management concerned about my feelings, and the location would be solid for a tourist experience. Overall, too highly rated on this website, would rather have spent a few bucks more and gotten a true 4 star experience elsewhere. Or, spent less and gotten the holiday inn vibe I just paid for.
review.negativeRemarks: let me down in the minor details, lousy elevators, inadequate staffing
review.locationRemarks: great location in Fishermans Wharf area

review.title: Just location is good
review.reviewText: Extra parking fee is 45$/day. Wi-fi is not free. No refrigerator, coffee maker is not clean. No laundary service and room. However, location is good.

review.title: excellence
review.reviewText: It was a pleasure and the staff made it a wonderful experience.
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: close to fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: parking in the hotel is expensive. can hear people walking upstair and street traffic in the room.

review.title: One of Our favorite placse in america
review.reviewText: Overall stay was great. We were upgraded, room was large, a little cluttered though.
review.locationRemarks: Alcatraz just do it! The warf at night was fantastic Peir 39 well worth the visit. Ride the trams! Do the loop tour on arrival gives you a good base to know what is where etc and try to get one with a tour guise not the recorded one.

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Great location easy walking access to the fishersman wharf and cable car station

review.title: Nice location to access to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: It was nicer than I thought because our room had balcony.

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText:
Great staff, comfortable room, and great location!

Easy walking distance to the wharf.

The concierge was great in helping me plan my day!!

I would stay here again for sure.

Pice was right.

review.title: HolidayInn Express
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff and family-oriented hotel. Room was large and a good value for the price
review.locationRemarks: Close to DLand and next door to Garden Walk shopping and dining

review.title: Would like to go back
review.reviewText:
Most of the staff were very friendly and helpful, particularly the lady who manned the spresso stall in the mornings on 22nd-25th December 2011. However the lead stewardess in the breakfast restaurant on 22nd was unfriendly and surly.

The rooms were neat and clean.

I would certainly go back and recommend to others
review.locationRemarks: Great for a tourist. Not so good for a business visitor

review.title: Super
review.reviewText: The Hotel was great, so was the service and the location was perfect. It was within walking distance of everything I wanted to see.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf - It has it all!

review.title: Good hotel... but busy / noisy neighborhood!
review.reviewText:
Overall, the hotel is really nice. A little "narrow" in some areas. Unfortunately, this hotel is in a very busy area about a block from Fisherman's wharf / Pier 39. Our stay was good till about 11pm when a concert was going full blast across the Parking Lot at the Hall.

When I asked the staff what was going on, I was hung up on and never received a call back. Overall, the hotel was very nice, weather was great and outside of the lack of sleep, the stay was enjoyable.
review.locationRemarks: This place is perfectly close to the Pier. Unfortunately, the hall across the parking lot does dampen it as it holds late night parties (as we found out).

review.title: Not impressed. Needs remodel
review.reviewText: This hotel is in desperate need of a remodel. Not even close to usual Sheraton standards. Service was excellent. Rooms very small and can hardly turn sideways in the bathroom. Will not go back unless substantially upgraded.

review.title: Thanksgiving stay
review.reviewText: We stayed 5 nights during the Thanksgiving period. The hotel is located within easy walking distance to all the site along Fisherman Wharf. Lot's of restaurants and shops within 3 blocks. Hotel is noisy because of busy streets on each side and a motor court in the middle for check in. Take ear plugs if you want to sleep. Hotel could use a facelift but staff was very nice. Parking under the hotel for $50.00 a day with in and out privilege.

review.title: San Francisco Trip
review.reviewText: The only problem I had with our recent stay was that there were animals allowed. In particular, dogs. Two of the mornings we awoke to barking before 8a.m. Not my idea of a vacation. We have stayed at the Sheraton Wharf in the past but have never seen dogs before. Had we known in advance, we would not have stayed there.

review.title: More like a BEST of the Best Western's
review.reviewText: We were a little disappointed with the hotel from what we had seen online to what was seen live.... Overall a good hotel but more like a Best of the best westerns than a Sheraton, didn't live up to Sheraton quality standards of hotels around the world but again, a good hotel and location. The vibe was more like a up market hostel feel than a family or couples feel as it has a very open plan lobby. If that is what you are after than you cannot go wrong.

review.title: nice to be by the water
review.reviewText: it was a decent hotel. Decent for the price, not amazing... bathroom was tight and right by the street but it was good enough for our one night in san fran

review.title: Good location, parking $51.00 daily
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean, very expensive parking, and services.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman warf

review.title: Lovely Getaway
review.reviewText:
My husband and I are "near-locals" (from Sacramento) and regularly just spend the day in SF but decided to stay the night near Fisherman's Wharf, and we're so glad we did. What a beautiful hotel! The interior of the hotel is bright, clean, and the blue and yellow color palette was refreshing. The room was very comfortable and such a great space- definitely larger than normal rooms. We especially enjoyed the rain against the sloped windows, very soothing. Will definitely return here next time.

Note: Valet parking is pricey; it cost us $50-ish for one-night. I'm not sure if the valet service is pricier than self-parking.

review.title: Typical overpriced, well decorated Motel 6
review.reviewText:
My room, 1106, seemed to be well suited for Lilliputians. The bath area was extremely small, and I have to admit, using the toilet was like going in a bucket. That was the smallest toilet I have ever seen! The ambient noise was about the same as if I slept outside.

It was clean, the help was very nice.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText:
The hotel was beautiful. I was travelling with my family and 2 young children. We requested a crib and a mini fridge in the room and it was there when we checked in. The hotel was considerate because they put us in 2 interconnecting rooms. I didn't even know it until I checked in. Wonderfully surprised. Had extra room for the kids to run around.
The hotel is within walking to everything that you want to do in Fisherman's Wharf. We didn't have to rent a car at all. When we woke up we just left the hotel and walked about 3 blocks to go have breakfast at the Boudin bakery. We had a wonderful vacation. Would recommend this hotel to anyone
Two complaints- Only get WiFi in the lobby and it's hit or miss and the lobby cafe doesn't have a lot of seating room. Very crowded in the morning.

review.title: Middle-of-the-road hotel
review.reviewText:
I realize that everything in San Francisco is expensive, but if I had paid full price for this room rather than getting a deal, I would not have been pleased.

The good:
Staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was comfortable, clean, and spacious, and even though it was in what seemed like a high-traffic area, it was very quiet. The hotel is only a few blocks from fisherman's wharf, within walking distance of Ghirardelli square, Pier 39, and the Alcatraz ferry. There's a grocery store across the street and plenty of good restaurants within a 10 minute walk. There's underground parking that felt safe.

The bad:
The nightly parking fee is astronomical, more than twice what I've paid at any other hotel. Seriously ridiculous. The decor in the hotel is...strange. Very bright, looked like it belonged in an airport. And some areas (hallways) inside the hotel seemed a little run-down. There's a bus depot right across the street, which made the area seem a little seedy until you got a few blocks away.

Generally, it was fine. I got a good deal on the room, but if I'd paid full price, it would have felt like a rip-off.

review.title: Dennis
review.reviewText: The hotel was only one block from Fishermans Wharf and from an abundance of restaurants
review.locationRemarks: All areas of the city were outstanding

review.title: Love the pillows
review.reviewText:
We all love the beds and pillows were so comfy !!
Everything worked perfectly (dryer, bath .etc)
Great location! Wish could stay there more..
better buy souvenirs at 7eleven by the hotel,same stuff much cheaper than the souvenir shop .

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was great. The ac unit needed to be updated. Maintenance was fast. Location was great. Great time there.

review.title: A nice hotel
review.reviewText: Overall, we had an enjoyable stay. The location is fantastic as you can walk to Fisherman's Wharf where there is plenty to see and great restaurants to visit. My only complaint would be the noise level. We stayed on the ground floor and despite all the windows being closed, we could hear people walking/talking and street traffic.

review.title: Superb Location, But Room Was Disappointing
review.reviewText: As far as location goes, this hotel couldn't be more convenient to the Fisherman's Wharf area. But for a Sheraton, we were really disappointed. The bathroom area was very cramped, but the worst feature was that the room had no soundproofing whatsoever. Our room was ground floor facing a busy street immediately outside, and we heard every single car, motorcyle, cable car, bus and person going by... all night long. If you're a light sleeper, you will hate this hotel, and can't avoid being woken up extremely early (prior to 6:00am) because of the escalating morning traffic noise. A passing cable car would definitely drown out the TV. I'd look for other hotel choices next time around if I were to return to San Francisco. The staff were very helpful and did a great job.

review.title: Parking fee 45$+ a day
review.reviewText: Everything was OK except the fact you have to pay 45$+14%Tax for parking for each day you stay at the hotel.

review.title: best position
review.reviewText:
We were originally staying at a horrible hotel and fortunately we were with short notice, able to get this room at a great rate, on a weekend!
very nice room
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco Fishermans wharf. Lots to do

review.title: Location great
review.reviewText:
The hotel is located just a block from Fisherman's Wharf. Close to the many tours and hop on hop off buses.

Our room was clean and modern and moderate in size. There was drink dispensing machine on each floor.

The only downside was that the location was slightly noisy on the streets.
review.locationRemarks:
Fisherman's Wharf has a great feel to the place. There is a lot of activitiy and the place to see Alcatraz if you are not going to do a tour. The Golden Gate Bridge is in easy view from the wharf. Here you can view the seals on Pier 39.

You can hop on a trolley to downtown and union square for great shopping. But hop on the trolley early as it get very busy later on in the day.

The bay cruises is also a great way the see the place and some are inexpensive.

review.title: Overpriced & appalling decor
review.reviewText: We stayed in 12 different hotels during our recent US trip. Most were excellent but the most expensive and most disappointing was the Sheraton at Fisherman's Wharf. Parking was ridiculously expensive and there was no fridge in the room (if you wanted one it was $15 per night and NO free internet access other than from the lobby where the speed was that of a ruptured snail. The decor is DREADFUL - think municipal swimming pool and the front desk staff were not particularly helpful. We thought this hotel very poor value for money and would not return. It has deteriorated since we last stayed there. I filled out the complaints form and was not even given any sort of response.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is a good base as close to major attractions

review.title: close to the pier will definately stay at this hotel on next visit
review.reviewText: the hotel was clean, close to the pier, restaurants , bus service and shopping it also had a really cosy meeting place outside of the hotel where you could sit relax and keep warm by the fire pits . A little noisy if your room is near the garbage entrance.
review.locationRemarks: Points of interest worth seeing. Napa & Sonoma The Wine Tour is great. A full tour of Alcatraz.. I would also recommend a visit to China Town.

review.title: Nice location scared staff outlooking
review.reviewText: The first time to see hotel man staff in a dirty look,long hair.

review.title: Better options for the price
review.reviewText: Was a nice room, clean with nice sheets, pillows & duvets. If you can get a deal it is worth it but what we paid was too steep for what we got - wifi in room was extra and the room service was ridiculously expensive. I expected more. Location was perfect though.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: good location, clean hotel

review.title: Not the typical Sheraton experience
review.reviewText:
We loved the location and proximately to the Warf. Our concierge was excellent helping using us find tickets and directions. I don't mind that this was an older hotel, since the staff was charming. Or, I should say, I wouldn't mind if it was maintained and clean.

Our door must have been overlook during the last renovation since a huge glow of light lit up the room each night, and my favorite was the mold in the shower. I called housekeeping and asked that it be cleaned from the wall, and we even showed the housekeeper. The gal did a terrible job and never cleaned it all. I would think a supervisor would have checked on a guest comment, but no. It's hard to get clean when your shower is dirty.

I didn't even attempt the pool since it had all kinds of floaties. I brushed it off since the hotel is on the Warf and the pool is outside, but not a highlight if you are looking for a place with kids.

I like the layout of the hotel, but if you do continue to say at this hotel, ensure you are not in a room directly above the main entrance like we were. There are a lot of people from various countries who don't have the same common respect to keep the noise down at night. Between my hotel made nightlight of a door and noisy main entrance, I was lucky to sleep at all. They should invest in a full bar to help make up the difference so travels like me have a remedy to finally catch some z's.

review.title: Great location, friendly service!
review.reviewText: Perfect hotel, except the bathrooms are small. Not impressed with Expedia, had major problems with SupperShuttle from airport to hotel which was booked through Expedia.

review.title: Great hotel, but location not for us
review.reviewText:
The Sheraton at Fisherman's Wharf is a well-managed hotel that offers clean rooms and comfortable beds. For a tourist-intensive city, the hotel offers great value. The only drawback to the hotel, and this is completely my fault for not understanding the different districts within SF, was that it was surrounded by tourist-oriented businesses (SF clothing, hats, shirts, etc.).

Again, not the hotel's fault, but if you're traveling to SF for the first time and want to stay somewhere that offers a true SF experience and feel, this hotel is probably not your cup of tea. We only really ventured into Fisherman's Wharf our first night and last night (we stayed four nights) - the first night because we wanted to check it out and the last night because we were exhausted from touring the city all day and grabbed a quick bite on our way back to the hotel.

review.title: Not great but not bad
review.reviewText: Nice place, older so it has the "old hotel" smell. Right next to a Muni bus terminal so can be noisy outside. Very clean and very nice patio area with small fire pits. Just a short walk to the Warf and Pier 39.

review.title: This is the hotel I would stay in when we go back to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great Hotel Close to Fisherman Wharf

review.title: Hotel in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel has a section connected to the main buiklding. Rooms in that area are smaller and noisier

review.title: Very Happy
review.reviewText:
Everyone at the hotel were very happy to assist, the location is wonderful, the only problem is the noise from outside is disturbing, we asked to be moved, and again the staff were wonderful, only the same problem, the hotel was totally renovated but the glass was not changed so you hear everything.
Other than that, it is a wonderful hotel

review.title: Would definitely stay again
review.reviewText: This hotel is ptrime location if visiting the wharf area. We were able to shop the wharf and be back to drop off packages and rest very easily. Close to tour bus pick up locations and felt safe enough to arrive back after dark.

review.title: Great hotel, noisy location
review.reviewText: This hotel was fantastic in terms of service, cleanliness and comfort but it was very very noisy - although the noise level may differ depending on what room you are allocated. Request one in the middle of the hotel and you may be ok. Our room overlooked a bus depot and the noise of buses stopping and starting went on till late (after midnight) and started at about 615 am.Otherwise it was in a great spot just down from fisherman's wharf and the staff were always very helpful.

review.title: San Francisco Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel was located conveniently and accomadations were good. The staff was hospitable. Access to room was difficult due to elevator location and load noises. The room was noisy due to the outside street traffic. We were very dissatified with the parking fee which was $45.00 before taxes, outrageous!

review.title: Convenient Family Holiday Hotel
review.reviewText: Conveniently located hotel with generous sized rooms. Lifts were a bit of a worry

review.title: Great Place to Stay--Clean, Great Location
review.reviewText: We had a great experience at the Sheraton. Big, clean room with a king-size bed, with plenty of room to move around. The location was great--just steps from Streetcar Line F and a couple of major bus lines. And only a couple minutes walk to the cable cars and the "attractions" of Fisherman's Wharf. Staff/maid service was great. Highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText:
Very good hotel, in great location near the wharf.
Parking is very expensive, but it is any where in downtown SanFran.

review.title: Beautiful building and rooms with no amenities
review.reviewText:
This hotel was nice, but was lacking some key features that would prevent me from coming back.

Starting with the positives, the exterior of the hotel is very pleasing, nicer than any on the Wharf. The front driveway is long and has outdoor seating near little cozy fireplaces, which unfortunately were crowded most times when my wife and I wanted to sit there. The room is nice inside and the traffic noise isn't too bad, at least from the room I stayed in. Also, the hotel staff is very nice and willing to help.

But this hotel has no amenities; no microwave (not even a public one in the lobby), no fridge in the room (possibly only upgraded rooms?) and limited TV channels. Their on demand entertainment was flaky, and only worked half the time; I guess that's actually good because the cheapest rental was 4.99 with most movies being 10.00 dollars to view! Plus everything in the hotel is super expensive (breakfast buffet is 20 per person!), so do not buy anything there.

Overall I would look around. There is a Ramada, Best Western and Marriott in the area as well, possibly with rooms as good and better amenities and prices that won't force you to take out a second mortgage.

review.title: location is good
review.reviewText: The location is so good. But the hotel is not to easy to find rooms.Ther are a lot of ailes and many times you feel lost.

review.title: Awesome Trip
review.reviewText: The Sheraton at Fisherman's Wharf was excellent. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The hotel was in walking distance of many venues. There were many shops and wonderful restaurants within short walking distance. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others!

review.title: Very Satisfied
review.reviewText: This hotel was in the perfect location for our family. There are grocery stores and restaurants nearby, and it is within walking distance of major attractions and/or bus stops. We will stay there again. My only complaint: there was no refrigerator in the room, a must for families with children.

review.title: Would definitely go back
review.reviewText:
Very impressed with the hotel, especially the location. The only complaint, which I am not sure the hotel can do anything about (perhaps they can mention to guests?) is noisy guests either walking down the hallway or in the next room. They don't realize how loudly they are speaking and it is very annoying to hear their loud conversations.

However, the rooms were clean, the staff friendly.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: I found this to be a nice and average hotel. Staff was very friendly. Concierge was very helpful. It was in walking distance to lots of shops, restaurants, Pier 39 and Pier 33 (where you catch the cruise to Alcatrez. No complaints.

review.title: One block from most popular pier...= Hotel in AWESOME tourist spot!
review.reviewText: On a tad bit of of the older side, but hotel was clean, comfortable, and in a great location for pier travel and tourist attractions. Staff was extremely pleasant. All-in-all our hotel stay was perfect. : )

review.title: Great Location, Exellent Service
review.reviewText: Sheraton-Fishermans Wharf is in a great location. We stayed there with our 2 kids(7,9) and were treated very well. We arrived at the hotel at 10a and wanted to check our bags. Instead, they had a room and let us check in early. Across the street there is Grocery. Liquor and Walgreens store for all of your traveling needs. The Wharf and Pier 39 is only 2 blocks away and the pickup for the F-line(highly suggest using) is only 1/2 block away. The outdoor pool was also nice and supplied towels as well. The conceierge helped us to book our Alcatraz and Muir Woods tour as well as was very helpful in getting us on the right, train, bus, trolly, cab, or whatever. We did not use the restaurante onsite as it was a bit expensive for us, but the food looked good. The beds were comfy, room was clean and the flat screen TV was nice as well.

review.title: Fabulous Location, Great cervice!
review.reviewText: An easy walk to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. Close to Alcatraz landing as well. Several rental car locations are nearby too if you are planning a self-guided trip to Muir Woods, Wine Country, or San Jose. Easy access to public transit as well. Service was wonderful, everyone was ready and willing to help! I would stay here again and again!

review.title: A great catch at Fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: We are a family of 4. Location was fantastic. 1 block from the waterfront and 'Hop on,hop off bus. We requested a room away from street (because of other reviews) and glad we did. The only thing we could have used in the room was a fridge. Really recommend .

review.title: Lovely San Francisco
review.reviewText: Had a great time. Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf was a great hotel and in a good location for all we did; open top bus tour, Golden Gate Bridge crossing, Pier 39, Alcatraz, Golden Gate Park, trams, theatre trips (two), cable car, Coit Tower, San Francisco Steps, Lombard Street, Union Square shopping, walking tour of the Castro, boat trip under the Golden Gate Bridge as well as eating in a lovely selection of restaurants. The only down side was flying with United.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText:
Room was clean, employees were courteous and helpfull. Loved the outdoor firepits.
Would have liked the Wi-FI to work in my room, not just the lobby and if the pool could have been truly heated.(it was slightly warmed)...After all the walking in SF, a hot tub would have been a plus.

review.title: Sheraton FishWarf
review.reviewText: Great location! Hotel had everything I needed. WiFi connection was a little slow, but free.

review.title: Great experience!!!
review.reviewText:
Great hotel and close to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. Super clean and comfy!
The conserige was very helpful throughout the week!
Requested a taxi for our trip to the airport and they provided us with the hotel Lincoln Towncar for the same cost of taxi. Great service!

review.title: Perfectly adequate lodging
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and comfortable and is very conveniently located for many San Francisco tourist attractions. I had no complaints and would choose the hotel again under the same circumstances. Good value.

review.title: No fridge in the room? No free parking at Hotel Sheraton?
review.reviewText:
If you use a refrigerator in the room, you have to pay additional cost.
This hotel do not offer free parking garage.

review.title: Just okay
review.reviewText: It was an okay hotel. It was clean and comfortable, but not overly big. The bathroom was tiny, and there was no pressure from the shower. The beds however, were very comfortable. And the location was really close to fishermans wharf.

review.title: ok, will return
review.reviewText: Hotel accomodation was very good. Very high priced for food and drinks. we had to eat breakfast at IHOP.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location...just don't buy anything there!
review.reviewText: My husband and I recently stayed at the Sheraton for our one year anniversary trip. The hotel was beautiful and was in a great location! We walked to most of our destinations and for those we coudln't, public transportation was near by. The room was large and the bed was comfortable. There was a decent amount of storage space in the room which always makes traveling easier. I have only have two small complaints. The elevators in the lobby are extremely slow and at least one of them was out of service at all times. Also, the food and drink inside the hotel was the most overpriced thing I saw in San Francisco! I would suggest avoiding purchasing anything there if possible. A great suggestions for breakfast (or any other meal) is Bistro Boudin, yum!! Overall a great experience with the hotel and we would definitely recommend it.

review.title: Pricey for what you got!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very freindly and helpful. The room we had was not very sound proof. We were on the main floor and thumping and banging around from the room above us was very loud. We were also by the main entrance to the hotel and the car doors slamming throughout the night was disturbing. The location was perfect for all acctivities that we participated in while we were in San Francisco. Now that I have stayed on the Wharf, I would look at staying outside of the city where it is not so expensive.

review.title: San francisico
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed our stay. I only wish the room would have had a fridge.

review.title: review
review.reviewText: good experience

review.title: Excellent place to stay
review.reviewText:
Staff were helpful and knowledgeable. Close to the tourist attractions. Food at hotel alittle pricey but it was good. Is is central location for any tour you want to take. Highly recommend this hotel.

Vince G.

review.title: Comfy pillows
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, but our room was on the ground floor right next to the street and we could hear ALL the traffic ALL night. I had to turn on the air to cover the noise but we could still hear it. I would recommend an inside room or higher up to cover up street noise. The rooms were very clean and the beds and pillows were very comfortable. I would return but I would not get a room next to street again. Car valets were very nice and quick in getting the car to customers.

review.title: First impression needs work
review.reviewText:
Arrived late evening with 4 bags and was greeted by a porter (man with beard) who was stood behind the concierge desk, head down, texting on his cell phone. When he finally saw us he verbally welcomed us and pointed us towards the reception desk, without leaving his desk and no offer of assistance, then he resumed texting.
Apart from this poor first impression everything else was satisfactory.

review.title: Love the Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
Great place, but if you get a room that over looks the bus yard good luck gettting a good nights sleep. Diesels idling early in the am and into the morning, loud and smelly.

Other than the rooms on that side of the hotel I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

review.title: Can't beat the location!!!
review.reviewText: Some of the previous reviews had me concerned but upon arrival and seeing for myself I was very satisfied. We did all of the "tourist" things and couldn't find anywhere that would have better located. Our room had been updated and the bed was very comfortable, even for my wife who suffers with a bad back and usually finds hotel beds very uncomfortable. Our only complaint (and its not really a complaint) is that there could have been a small fridge in the room but ice machine close enough so not a real problem.

review.title: "Don't get what you pay for"
review.reviewText: I had a great experience at the New York Sheraton which is why I choose to go to the one in San Francisco. But when I arrived at check in which was 2PM I was told that due to them being "over booked" the night before it was going to be another hour and a half before they could let me check in, and they were spectacle about that. When I was able to check in I was told about the $44 daily parking fee. I'm glad they told me upfront but was not happy that I had to pay for parking, especially on a daily basis and for so much. For the amount I was paying for my room I would hope I was only charged one fee for the duration of my stay, or even not at all. When I arrived to my room I was not impressed. When I think Sheraton I think luxury and class, and I got mediocre. The air conditioning was old and rundown, the beds were uncomfortable and the size was a full not a king like I requested, the toilet didnt flush right, and like most hotels they charged for internet ($14.99 a night) but offered it free in the lobby which was always cluttered. Lastly, when you self park and attempt to exit the parking lot its a hassle to get out. I figured I'm paying $44 a day to park you can at least make it easy to access the lot and even easier to exit. It took me literally 8 minutes to get the parking staff to let me out, and when on the intercom they were very rude. Overall I have to say I was disappointed and seriously considering staying somewhere else if I chose to go back to San Francisco.

review.title: DO NOT STAY HERE VERY POOR HOTEL AND POOR MANAGEMENT!!
review.reviewText:
DO NOT STAY HERE VERY POOR HOTEL!!!
Horrible Staff and Management and the rooms are small and dirty!!!

review.title: Overall great!
review.reviewText: Great place...felt new and clean. Only negative was the room was right on the ground floor corner by the street and entrance to the hotel, so there was a lot of street noise. Not a huge issue though. Really enjoyed the hotel and the staff was excellent as well. Highly recommend.

review.title: Great locations, cute and comfortable rooms
review.reviewText: If you're looking for something near Fisherman's wharf then this place is great. The room was pretty comfortable, the decor was very modern and cute, and the price was pretty decent. We had brunch at the Beach Street Grill a block away and the food was fantastic.

review.title: Moderate hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel needs updating

review.title: Charge for most everything
review.reviewText: While the room was clean and was maintained well, I was not impressed with the lack of in-room amenities - refrigerator, etc. The hotel also charged $15.00 a day for internet access, and the breakfast buffet was $22.00 a person. The Holiday Inn, just down the street, had rooms for the same price, free internet, refrigerators and breakfast was included. I get the same things at Best Western - clean room, amenities and breakfast, for less. What's so special about the Sheraton, the name? Will stay at the Holiday Inn next time.

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: The room itself was ok but the adjoining corridor smelt absolutely foul for the entire stay and was really off putting. Something not quite right with the sewage. The areacwas ok but very touristy. Breakfast was good but very expensive.

review.title: expensive parking
review.reviewText: nice hotel, expensive parking, convienient to everywhere

review.title: Understanding the environment
review.reviewText:
our stay in this hotel was pleasant enough, and the position to location was great, some of the more simple things I think were overlooked.

Staying for a week, It may have been my misconcept but I would think that the bed linen could have been changed at least once during this time. Whilst this was one odd point, I don't feel it detracted too much from our stay. Just something to note for the future.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: we had a great time in San Francisco. Location of Sheraton was great. Walking distance to Pier 39, Alcatraz wharf, all the Fisherman's wharf attraction. Supermarket over the road, car rentals within easy walking distance, good gym, wireless internet in lobby. Walk to cable cars etc. Had a great time. Would stay here again

review.title: Amazing!
review.reviewText: This was my first time traveling to California. I had no clue where to stay but I read the reviews and decided to lock in at the Sheraton. Best choice I made. Great location, walking distance to Pier 39 and Lombard st. Perfect location to all tourist attractions. The hotel was clean, staff was very nice and helpful. I will be going back again!

review.title: Good hotel in SF Fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel is very clean and comfortable. Close to Pier39 and many good restaurants. Internet fee and parking fee are expensive though.

review.title: Hotel is very good
review.reviewText: The hotel is good. But the parking is very expensive.

review.title: Great location, fair hotel, poor room.
review.reviewText: This is not your typical Sheraton Hotel so don't get your hopes built up. The rooms are advertised as renovated which means newer wallpaper and carpet. Bathroom is extremely small with barely enough room for the door to clear the tub when opened. The vanity is very small and poorly designed with a 3 inch gap on each end. Careful you don't drop anything. The room itself is quite small with minimal amenities for this price range. We were fortunate enough to have a ground level room facing the valet parking. The rooms are so poorly sound proffed we could here every car door, every conversation with the valet staff and ever footstep above us. The room next door had a wake up call at 5:30 a couple of mornings, and the walls are so thin we got the wake up too. There is no restaurant on site, just but there are a couple of breakfast type places close by. Fishermans Wharf is about three blocks away.

review.title: this is like motel six but costs a arm snd leg
review.reviewText:
First 50$ to park without saying on expedia is in called for. You will hear people walking above u when trying to sleep. Elevators close quick so don't loose your ARM. WiFi sucks and cost in top of room. No pool jacuzzi, or gift shop hotel is a home and sucks and Sheraton should and Sheraton should n
Be a shamed!

review.title: Excellent venue for the pedestrian!
review.reviewText: The Sheraton at Fisherman's Wharf was the perfect location for my family to make homebase. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. The accommodations were great and the staff was more than willing to help with any questions or needs we had. The outdoor fire pits were a huge hit as well. The view left a bit to be desired but that was the trade-off for its awesome location! I would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Spring time at thge wharf
review.reviewText: Great service with helpfull employees and great location,building is a little old and they really should offer free internet service throughout hotel not just in the lobby also parking rates really high other than that a decent deal.

review.title: Good stay in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel was convenient, clean, and friendly. Our only complaint was that it was very noisy one night - in the hallway, not from the outside.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Needs a good paint and freshening up but still ok

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: The Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf was among the best hotels in my last trip to USA. The people was very kind and I liked it very much.Clean, confortable and very well located.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: This was my family's first visit to San Francisco and did not know much about the city. We were extremely pleased with the hotel and it's location. Within walking distance to all of the tourist attractions that we wanted to visit. Convenience stores close by to purchase drinks and snacks for our room. IHOP across the street. We would highly recommend this hotel for travelers.

review.title: Great Stay!!!!
review.reviewText:
I was very inpressed wth the staff and the attention given to us upon arrival.
The fire pits are great for relaxing and people watching after a long day of tours. Breakfast buffet was a bit pricy but lots of options in the area.

review.title: Quite satisfied
review.reviewText: We originally got a room that faced a bus garage and it was quite noisy. We asked to change and were immediately settled into another room. Bed was somewhat uncomfortable, but rooms and hotel are nice and clean. Enjoyed the outside fire pits very much. Customer service was great. Hotel is in a great location.

review.title: one in a lifetime
review.reviewText: the rooms were nice size and the beds were comfortable. all of the hotel staff was very nice.

review.title: Will Definately Go Back There when I am in San Francisco again.....
review.reviewText: Loved the Hotel. Great location.

review.title: Very nice stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. The staff was super friendly and helpful, and had a GREAT location. Just a few minute walk to Pier 39. My only complaint would be the food. We ordered breakfast from room service, it came to $41 for cold sausage link, cold potatoes, and a bagel with no cream cheese. Other than the room service, perfect stay.

review.title: Great hotel, they treated us kindly while we were undergoing a family crisis
review.reviewText:
I had never stayed in the Fisherman's Wharf area of San Francisco, opting normally to stay near Union Square. After staying at the Sheraton at Fisherman's Wharf, I think I've found my new favorite neighborhood to stay in.

I made reservations very early the same day we flew in via Expedia. I had a special request for my mom's room, which they accomodated. I also got an amazingly great rate for how last minute I made these arrangements.

The hotel itself is very clean & modern looking. Our rooms were very quiet, and the beds were very comfortable. There are a lot of very reasonable dining options in the neighborhood, including a Safeway right across the street, and a Trader Joe's one block further. Since we were staying for almost a week, it was great to be able to save some money & not always eat at restaurants.

We had to go to the UCSF hospital daily, and we found the public transit options were very convenient & inexpensive. Cabs from there are a lot more, but you can easily get around using the bus & street cars.

review.title: Great Position for Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText:
Good position for Fishermans Wharf and for Alcatraz Visit (- advise to book before you leave UK.) Parking was an issue as it cost us $50 per night!!! But I think this is usual for San Francisco.

Rooms were newly refurbished and was very light, bright and clean. We had a room with 2 double beds as we were in transit with our daughter, and ideal for a small family for a couple of nights. Although view from our window was of the hotels flat roof. Free Wifi in lobby only.

Overall, very pleased with hotel and I would stay again.

review.title: Best Experence Ever!
review.reviewText: Our Sheraton Fshermans Wharf experence was so great. Near everythng, clean and decorated so up to date and brght. All personnel and valet very helpful (parkng so very close). Breakfast/lunch/snacks ready to grab and go or a quck bte whle checkng out your map for the day!

review.title: Good choice
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Great service. Good price. One of the best locations if you are visiting San Francisco.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is a good location for those individuals that wish to walk/cable car the city, and that enjoy the wharf/Pier 39 area. Nice, clean smallish boutique-like feel of hotel suited our needs perfectly. Could use a little help in the restaurant department though.

review.title: Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Very good option and low budget

review.title: Great San Francisco Location
review.reviewText: Hotel's location was excellent - close to San Francisco sites. Parking was expensive at hotel and system with voucher was antiquated. Rooms were small but clean. Hotel staff was great !!

review.title: Our trip to California
review.reviewText: The hotel was a lot less than I was expecting. I am not sure I would stay at a Sheratan Property again. this hotel was a glorified motel

review.title: decent hotel/good location
review.reviewText: as written above

review.title: Location is great!
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is perfect for a holliday to San Francisco. The hotel is clean, room large, and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. The "F line" trolly runs right outside the door and two cable car lines are within a few lines. Transportation to all attractions without a car is not difficult. Concierge staff is knowledgable about the area and can provide directions and public transit and route information. There is no restaurant per se (although they do offer a somewhat pricey breakfast) but there are a multitude nearby. We would recommend the IHOP across the street for breakfast.

review.title: Pleasant surprise...well maintained hotel; great location
review.reviewText: Great value and a surprisingly good hotel...the staff was remarkable. The fitness room/gym was better than in many higher end hotels. That was a great asset. The room was comfortable and very clean. We read previous reviews about noise in rooms facing the street, so we asked for an inside room. The view was of the roof, but better that than not being able to sleep all night. The location is superb...walking distance to so much near the wharf, cable cars, etc

review.title: Nice renovation/awful street noise
review.reviewText: Nicely renovated, clean family hotel, convenient to the wharf. Street noise in rooms on the whaf side of the hotel was unacceptable esp in the morning.

review.title: We'd go back again
review.reviewText: Close to everything near the wharf. Pretty lobby, nice little bar and sitting area outside w/ gas firepits. Concierge very helpful, although they tried getting us involved with some vacation package proposal. Be prepared for this.

review.title: Nice Room, Bad View
review.reviewText: The room was nice. Clean. I like the bed, but my husband thought it was too hard. But here's the thing. We go to San Francisco and book a room at the famous Wharf...and our view is the roof. Not even a street, but the top of the roof in the middle of a square of other rooms. This would be my only complaint, but the reason we might not stay there again.

review.title: Great location... good value for the money
review.reviewText:
Great location, good service. Hotel can be re-vamped... just older and not the best but good value for the money - considering the location is superb!! Close to everywhere... we can even walk to the best restaurant in San Fransisco, Scomas.
Cool outdoor fireplaces... nice touch for a nice atmosphere

review.title: great value.
review.reviewText: We loved the place. Large rooms great location for waling around and taking the trolley. very clean, staff was helpful. The breakfast at the hotel was expensive I would eat across the street next time. Nice fireplaces outside to sit around and have a glass of wine. Very Nice.

review.title: Too noisy to sleep!
review.reviewText:
We stayed this Hotel for three night.
Our room was near bus shed and along the street.
Outside was too noisy to sleep.
I claimed about that to hotel staff but he didin't change the room.

I think that that room is not suitable for staying and Sheraton!

review.title: I love this hotel - I will definitely stay there whenever I am in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
This is an extremely nice hotel. The rooms are clean and fresh, and it is ideally situated in what seems like a nice safe part of town. The walk to the tourist attractions of Fisherman's walk is short, as well as the cable cars. We felt quite safe walking around in the evening to dine and take in the views.

The hotel is nice as it has only a few floors, which gives it a relaxed feel. It has a pleasant bar with light snacks were you can take advantage of free Wi-Fi.

I have nothing but praise for this hotel

review.title: nothing more than expected
review.reviewText:
The hotel is fine but maybe it's time for a reform. The location is very convenient, that means, a very short walk to the fishermans wharf.
The mattress of my room was too soft, not good for those who have spine problems.

review.title: Noisy, noisy, noisy!
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was fine, but by late afternoon until late in the evening all we could hear was the "boom boom boom" of the bass of someone's music. The first day we put up with it, the second day we went out to investigate and even though it sounded like it was right next door, it turns out that it was coming from some street performer at the Wharf. We asked to be moved so we weren't facing onto that particular street. The staff were as accommodating as they could be and we were moved but then we were so close to the elevator so we had to deal with elevator noise the whole time. If you are looking for peace and quiet this is NOT the hotel for you. There were also issues with the internet service. It's not free if you have to use cables (and the hotel makes you rent the cables in addition to paying for the internet).

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
We found the hotel to be a pleasant surprise. The location is excellent and the accommodation is very roomy and light.

We highly recommend this hotel

review.title: Alex
review.reviewText: Clean and friendly hotel direct at Pier 39. Hughe and comfortable rooms.

review.title: Was OK - nothing alarming or exciting
review.reviewText: Reasonable base handy to the Wharf. Nothing exciting to write about but nothing majorly off putting other than parking charges. Had to go to Lobby to get free WiFi which was a little painful but better than nothing

review.title: Cheerful, Bright, Clean, Excellent Location!
review.reviewText: Loved it! It's clean, huge, the staff is friendly, it's in a great location, and the rooms are very, very bright and cheerful! The fire pits outside are awesome. It's very modern...and IHOP is across the street! The only thing I'd like is free WiFi in the rooms but the loung has it. It's a perfect hotel whether traveling on business or pleasure. My family absolutely loved it.

review.title: San Fran 2010
review.reviewText:
Hotel is conveniently located. Concierge a little aggressive, our first morning we wanted a map, and before we know it they were trying to book us on a tour. Given it was our first morning after a late night arrival we were not prepared to book anything.
Rooms were fine, but not the most comfortable and the room we were appointed was across from reception and lounge area, which did get a little noisy at times.
Bathroom was small, fine for myself and friend, however my husband would have had a difficult time.
Location sells the hotel

review.title: Room problem
review.reviewText:
Smoke or Fire alarm would go off if you had too hot a shower - stayed on for at least 15 minutes. Advice was to open a window (it was winter) or not have a hot shower.
Don't know if this was the same for other rooms or just ours.

review.title: Nice hotel at San Francisco Wharf
review.reviewText: It was a good hotel, with all the good things that you will expect. I didn't like The parking service it was too expensive, even for guests

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Very Nice hotel.

review.title: Fishermans Wharf great location
review.reviewText: Hotel is Older but maintained well. Long walks from Lobby to rooms. Very clean, quiet. Expensive Parking $44.00 per night !!!!

review.title: Very good
review.reviewText:
This hotel is in the wharf district and is very historic. There are electric trams of various vintages that leave outside the hotel. You can catch these and connect with the famous cable cars and shopping on Market Street.
It is an easy walk to all Piers for Alcatraz tours and ferries to Sausolito and Bay cruises.
The hotel bedding was fantastic and the outdoor fires (winter) for drinks/cocktails and snacks are cosy and inviting.
The breakfast was hearty and healthy and all staff very attentive to guests needs without being intrusive. They arranged tours and tickets for us at very short notice.

review.title: Great Place to Stay!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. Wonderful rooms and a great location!

review.title: 1st visit to SF
review.reviewText: The hotel was very convenient to most of the tourist attraction, accessible by muni, and cablecars. There is a Saver market, trader Joe's, and a couple of walgreens within walking distance. The rooms were very nice and clean.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The only problem I had with the hotel was the parking. It was hard to find a spot, overpriced and inconvenient. The hotel itself was amazing. The decor was gorgeous, the outdoor fire pits were a neat touch and I was thoroughly satisfied with the room. It was a great deal and I would definitely go back!

review.title: Great Wharf location - and more
review.reviewText:
The Sheraton had recently been completely renovated (as I can say that is true after staying opposite at the Radisson hotel !) and was a good choice for a Wharf hotel, not being directly on the water front with tourist streams constantly moving by. This hotel is perfectly situated for bus tours in all directions as the starting point is 50m away. The fitness room was small but had some of the latest Life Fitness equipment available that worked perfectly with iPhone/Pod.
Some of the nicest bars and restaurants around Columbus Avenue and Grant Street were easily within walking distance from the hotel. Be sure to check out the pizza at the Panta Rei Cafe on Columbus !

review.title: Wharf hotel
review.reviewText: See above.

review.title: Will visit again
review.reviewText: Very clean, comfortable room. Front desk staff was very friendly upon check-in as well as check-out. We needed extra towels at 6:30 in the morning, and they were delivered in less than 5 minutes. Overall, very pleased and will stay again!

review.title: steps to get in
review.reviewText: The room we were assisned was across the street from the hotel lobby. We had to walk back outside, go across the street, and then drag our luggage up approxiametly eight steps to get inside the hotel. We were offered no help in getting to our room. We both had a large suitcase and a carry on bag with us. Wasn't happy with this at all.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: The rooms were small, but fine considering you don't spend a lot of time in them. Perfect location, very close to the wharf and Pier 39.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very nice. We enjoyed our stay. The location is walking distance from just about anything that a tourist might want to see.
As for the service at the hotel, it took about 45 minutes to get a couple of extra pillows. They did however call down to check to see if we had received them.
The room was very pretty. The bed was hard and you can feel the springs, althought the bedding was very comfy. We ended up being put on the first floor next to the gym. At 6am you can hear people on the treadmill. If you are not a morning person get moved right away.
The only other thing that annoyed us was the price of parking. $45 per day. If you want to rent a car there is a rental car place, Hertz I believe, right there at the hotel. It is much more economical to rent by the day from them when you want a car. We only ended up using ours 2 out of 4 days and spending almost $200 to park.

review.title: "Be sure to wear a flower in your hair"
review.reviewText: Excellent location for all of the city attractions via public trans.. Room was very nice, possibly alittle too bright !! Hotel employees friendly and helpful. Loved the outside fire pits for relaxing around. Restaurants etc. all relatively convenient. Great trip, great weather, good times with good friends.

review.title: Overpriced hotel
review.reviewText: For a 4-star hotel, this is definitely not one. Room was not totally clean. Saw bath counters had glass circles (so not totallly wiped down) and vacuuming was so-so. Also could hear people upstairs..so not very sound proof for a 4 star hotel. Gym amenities was weak as well. Only thing going for it is its location..but overall a rip-off.

review.title: Close to all the fun!
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice, clean & close to most of the transportation options. Street noise being the only negative.

review.title: Sheraton - Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
HIghs:
Excellent location, right in the heart of the Fisherman's Wharf area.
Clean, excellent service.

Lows:
No refrigerator in room - I expected this to be included with the room.
WiFi available in room only via pay per use - I expected this to be included with the room.
The parking was pricey at $50/day.

review.title: Great Hotel at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
The hotel was within walking distance to everything at Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel concierge was extremely helpful with providing information and arranging reservations for tours, etc.
There were several areas outside the hotel entrance with furniture and fire pits where you could sit and relax or have a drink.
If you do not want to eat breakfast at the hotel, there is an IHOP Restaurant directly across the street.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: San Francisco was 'awesome' as the yanks say. Wasn't sure what to expect but just loved every minute of it - even the changeable weather! Can't recommend it highly enough and the children (aged 10-17) loved it too. Highlights were cycling over the Golden Gate Bridge down into Sausilito, the sealions, Alcatraz, riding the cable cars and, not least, the fabulous people. Everyone is just so friendly. There are a lot of homeless people around Fisherman's Wharf but they were always pleasant and offered to help us with map reading and were never threatening even late at night. Loved San Francisco and would love to go again.

review.title: One of San Fran's Best Hotel!
review.reviewText: We have no complaints of our hotel service, condition, cleanliness and comfort. The beds were very comfortable. The hotel location was excellent. We felt we were in the "thick of things" but yet far enough off the beaten path to be private and comfortable. EVERYTHING was in walking distance, especially if you are a walker! When I checked in, I told the young lady we were there for my best friend's birthday and it was her first time in San Francisco. She asked if we liked wine, champayne or beer and drinks were sent to our room in celebration. What a wonderful touch and customer service. We would definitely come to this hotel again, without a doubt.

review.title: NOT IMPRESSED
review.reviewText: We would not stay here again, the rooms were really noisy you can hear every movement from people above and around and the air conditioner motors outside were also too noisy. they also had no formal dining room just a tapas bar and a room for breakfasts.The staff were friendly and the room was clean but really overall not good enough.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: Fantastic location. Within walking distance of everything we went to see on this trip. Probably won't stay here again as we visit the city often and know of less expensive hotels with more reasonably parking rates. However, we wanted to be at Fisherman's Wharf this trip so were willing to pay the extra rate and the exhorbitant parking fees!

review.title: SF getaway
review.reviewText: We found the entire staff at the Fishermans' Wharf Sheraton to be most helpful in all contacts that we had. They were knowledgeable of the area and had good "hints" about activities in the area.

review.title: satisfied
review.reviewText: Nice, clean hotel, about 7 min walk from the wharf.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText:
The Hotel is in a parfect location.Rooms are clean and very comfortable.The service is very efficient and all the clerks are very kind,nice and friendly.If you need wi-fi connection there is a free connection in the lobby area.
If you have a car the parking fees and rate are very expensive,about 44 USD a day and it's better to go in there with no car or find an other parking.Also the starbucks inside is very expensive,for example 6 bucks for a mediocre cappuccino(WAY TOO MUCH!!).Overall other than those bad things i reccomended this hotel.

review.title: Very nice stay
review.reviewText:
We wer able to check in before 11 AM, which was nice, since we had luggage we wanted to store before exploring the city.

The room was clean and comfortable, and they VERY quickly dealt with a balky air conditioning unit.

We'd definitely stay there again, unless a very good deal was offered elsewhere

review.title: One great week!
review.reviewText: Vacation with spouse. Both about 60 years old. Sheraton is in great location. About 2 blocks from Pier 39. Safeway and Walgreen across the street. IHOP across the street. Didn't rent a car and not a problem. Used cable cars and street cars for all transportation. Parking is sometimes scarce and always expensive. Took bus tours to Monterrey and Sonoma/Napa. Enjoyed Sausalita and Muir Woods. Tour bus pick up points located nearby. Lots of good restaurants a couple of blocks away and not as expensive as I thought they would be. If you're going to be there a few days, invest in the one time fee Passport for use of cable cars, street cars and buses. About $26 for a week. Buy it at the cable car turnarounds. Sheraton was renovated two or three years ago. Very nice place to stay. Enjoyed the fire pits out front. Would do it again...hopefully soon.

review.title: Best way to visit San Francisco
review.reviewText: Excelent hotel!!

review.title: Very Nice - Fantastic Location
review.reviewText: Very professional & friendly staff. Room clean and good size, bathroom is small but adequate - thought mattresses should be higher end quality but slept fine. Fire pit lounging outside is a nice bonus but could see where noise would be a problem for some rooms (we just turned our a/c on and slept fine). Location is great for walking or connecting to transportation. Price a night seemed high compared to other hotels we stayed in during our trip with comparable rooms, but you are paying for location. Tip - if touring California book your car rental at the airport not the hotel - HUGE savings.

review.title: We would stay here again. Great location, nice room.
review.reviewText:
We loved the location of this hotel and our room was very comfortable and
clean. We faced the street and it was a little noisy, but not bad enough to
ask for a different room.

review.title: Awesome!
review.reviewText: The hotel was fantastic and really made our trip so enjoyable that we will be talking about it for years. It was great!

review.title: Not a happy traveler
review.reviewText: The room given to me I felt I didn't deserve

review.title: Would definately stay again!
review.reviewText: Great Location.

review.title: Always a good choice
review.reviewText: Sheraton FW hotel is fantastic....clean, comfortable, the employees are friendly courteous and always willing to help in any way. The rooms are spacious.

review.title: Best Place to Stay in San Francisco, in the center of it ALL!
review.reviewText: The Sheraton at Fisherman's Wharf was not only beautiful but it was right in the center of it all! Sitting by the fireside tables in the evenings looking out at the beautiful city was absolutly perfect!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Sheraton is in a great spot, nicely renovated and friendly staff.

review.title: One of the best places to stay at San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Great location, close to major attractions. Clean, comfy, and everything you'd expect from a decent hotel.

review.title: Would stay here again
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton. The room was spacious and newly decorated - it suited our needs very well. We were a little disappointed that there wasn't free internet access in the rooms - we had to go to the lobby in order to connect to the wireless internet for free. The hotel is very convenient for walking to everything - fisherman's wharf, the trolleys, Chinatown, the Italian district etc. It was a bit pricey, but worth it for the convenience.

review.title: Great choice for families
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel, great location, especially with kids. Close to Pier 39 and the Sea Lions, but far enough away that it's quiet. They gave us a great deal on parking too! They were prompt with extra towels, and fixed our air conditioner very quickly when it had a problem. We picked it because it had a pool for the kids. Glad we made the choice. Would be fine for couples too!

review.title: Not impressed, too expencive for what you get (especially 45 $ for parking??)
review.reviewText: The hotels location is really convenient and the hotel is nice. The only thing that really bothered me was that they were charging us 45 $ per night per vehicle for parking.So just to park 2 cars there for 3 nights was almost 400 dollars!!! That's crazy. The other thing they didn't really get was, if you have 4 people in one room you need to have 4 towels each. We had to tell them that every day again. Other then that, I would say it was OK to stay there, but not worth the money we spent.

review.title: Would go back in a heartbeat!
review.reviewText: Loved the location. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel. Parking was expensive, as it is everywhere else in the city, but they let us stay parked there for the day even after we had checked out.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf Sheraton
review.reviewText:
Simple hotel, conveniently located with excellent location for touristy fisherman's wharf area. Nothing special, just fine all round ticking all the boxes as a place to stay and explore San Francisco from. Pool is outdoor and shabby.
Avoid having a hire car during your time in SF- parking is very expensive and the city is difficult to get around by car if you're not familiar to US city driving.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location, a good hotel to stay in for fishermans wharf and trips to alcatraz and other boat trips around the bay

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText:
Not Satisfied to Expensive for what it is I would Rate This Hotel as a 2 Star Hotel, Cost more to park your car overnight than it would staying in a 3 Star Motel,
Have stayed at far better Hotels for half this cost. would not return

review.title: FIRST TIME IN SAN FRANCISCO
review.reviewText: the place is excellent. the location is perfect service is very good

review.title: Would definitely go back! A great place to stay on Fisherman's Wharf!!
review.reviewText: Location was central to everything on Fisherman's Wharf, neighborhood seemed safe, we had no problems. Staff was friendly, polite and efficient. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in this part of San Francisco.

review.title: Back in a heartbeat!
review.reviewText: Rooms were well kept and clean, as was the inside lobby, hallways and elevators. We purposely did not have a car so this a very good location for walking the area, catching Cable Car and Trolley to/from places of interest. Great area for food and entertainment. An excellent Sheraton Inn.

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: Arrived early before check-in and was given a room. All the staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was nice and clean. I was worried about the noise do to reviews that I read. But I did not notice any and I was on the street side.

review.title: Location is great.
review.reviewText: The location is great. The parking is excessively expensive!! The breakfast items were too expensive. The decor in the rooms is absolutely atrocious. The concierge gave us incorrect detailed directions and even marked the map on where to turn. He had us turning into a one way street according to the drawing he made on the map, as well as the verbal directions.

review.title: Location location location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel ... Location was great within walking distant to pier 39 ...room was comfortable....parking fee was to much at 50 $ a night !

review.title: Easy access to Fishermen's Wharf
review.reviewText: The staff was polite and helpful and we felt very comfortable. Perhaps the most important recommendaiton of all is that we would go back without hesitation. The hotel was close to everything we wanted to see and the concierge took very good care of us regarding our needs. The sitting area just outside the hotel with the gas fireplaces is a real plus and a wonderful gathering place.

review.title: San Fran is Great
review.reviewText: San Fran and the Sheraton are great, but bring your wallet and a helmet for all the times you will get hit over the head with unexpected charges. $55 a day to park your car. Pay by the hour parking at restaurants. Pay to park your bike. Great town to visit, couldn't afford to live there. Sheraton was a good deal, great location and nice rooms and amenities. Don't pack a swimsuit, too cold for that.

review.title: A great experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. It was clean the service was great and it included everything we needed.

review.title: It was a comfortable hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel location was great , within walking distance of major attractions.
The bellmen were exceptional, and housekeeping very attentive to our needs.

review.title: Good location, nice rooms, little noisy
review.reviewText:
We enjoyed the hotel. Rooms were nice, bathrooms a little small, but divided shower from sink, so it worked fine. We had rooms on the corner, and found them to be a little noisy. Muni bus went down street early in morning, noisy. Also, vent at end of hallway let in cool air at night, but also a lot of street noise, no way to close the vent. If you were further down hall, probably didn't notice, but we were next to it.
Great location, nice rooms.
Pricy to park car!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Everyone at this hotel was very nice and helpful. Hotel was beautiful and clean. Close to a lot of restaurants and attractions which was convenient for us. Only complaint was the noise level. Seemed to be a lot of traffic at all hours.

review.title: Fantastic Stay - Will definitely go again!
review.reviewText: Stayed over the weekend of July 4th - massive crowds. Hotel provided additional security that checked room keys before allowing you on the property - kept the noise and trouble away so we could enjoy our evening. Room was clean and comfortable, although there were no hand towels our first day. Dual paned windows on the pool side cut out a very significant amount of noise (always my biggest complaint at hotels), although the halls and doors were still quite noisy. The fire pits were lovely but always crowded. Hotel staff was terrific - location was perfect for walking - no need for a car at all. (Parking is quite expensive, so this was a real plus.) Beds clean and comfortable.

review.title: terrible stay
review.reviewText: unexpected low quality hotel

review.title: Perfect hotel for Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. Loved the outdoor fire pits. Rooms were "ok" would have like a better television. Very clean.

review.title: Great Family Vacation!
review.reviewText: Overall our 1st family vacation was a great success. The hotel was nice and recently remodeled. the staff was polite and friendly. In general the only negative I would say was that the fodd and activites were more expensive then what we had prepared for.

review.title: Satisfied
review.reviewText: We were satisfied with our room. The concierge was very informative. Room was clean.

review.title: Over-priced, nickel-and-dime-you waste of money
review.reviewText:
I was surprised they didn't charge for extra bath towels. This hotel is listed as a four-star hotel, but I felt like I was staying at a Best Western. The room was small, the bathroom was small, the shower was miniscule (I hate feeling the shower curtain on my arm when I'm showering, and I'm a small guy). That it cost a tremendous amount of money to park at the hotel I was a guest of was ludicrous. As mentioned above, they wanted a lot of money for even 15 minutes of internet access. Who doesn't provide free internet access to their guests?

Overall, this was a huge let-down. For what I paid, I expect to be treated like a guest, not a tenant. I don't expect Taj Mahal, but I expect more than Red Roof Inn. Don't waste your money here.

review.title: VERY unimpressed with new decor!
review.reviewText: This is my 3rd time at this Hotel. I am very disappointed with the new decor - so plastic and Ikea-like. It used to be so elegant and homey. Whomever decided on the change to stripes, circles and squares and plastic made a strange decision. Even my 2 teen grandkids made comments about it.
