I am hoping someone will eventually make the decision to go back to the "old" look. Other than that, the service, cleanliness, etc was great. The pool and firepits were so nice and we enjoyed them alot.. Before next year's trip, I will check first to see if any changes have been made.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was newly refurbished. Bathrooms were small, but that was the only drawback. Hotel staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Location was perfect. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends & family.

review.title: Parking is NOT FREE
review.reviewText: Parking at the hotel was not free. We were shocked to learn that parking would be $42.00 a night in addition to the room cost. We had to find cheaper parking across the street. And the parking rates could change from day to day. Better know you trolley and bus schedules if you want to get around. Also, the people of San Francisco were not very friendly.

review.title: Never Again
review.reviewText:
Just a few thoughts:

- They tout their free wireless internet, but it's only free in the lobby.
- Staff was rude and unhelpful.
- You want HOW much to park? (It's cheaper to pay for a parking ticket on the street.)
- The hotel layout made me feel like I was a rat in a maze.
- The bathroom toilet was as small as "My First Potty".
- Neighborhood is really loud in the morning

review.title: Absolutely top location
review.reviewText: A little disappointed there was no refrigerator in the room, and the charges to use internet on the hotel computers were probably a bit excessive considering most places have it as complimentary.

review.title: Great location, comfortable stay
review.reviewText: The Sheraton Fishermans Wharf is conveniently located and close to transportation. The concierges were pleasant and very helpful and knowledgeable sources of information regarding tours, transportation, restaurants, etc.

review.title: Not 4 star
review.reviewText: Great location, staff friendly and helpful, rooms small, hotel looks tired needs renovating, sound from room next door readily audible, no fridge or internet in room, shuttle service to airport is contracted out - our journey took 1hr 15 minutes due to numerous waits at other hotels for passengers that did not turn up, the brochure and staff said it took 40 minutes. Not my idea of a 4 star hotel.

review.title: Would go back at anytime,except cold weather months
review.reviewText: This was my first experience with Expedia. I am a timeshare owner as well. The only difference was a lack of a kitchenette;however I did not expect one as no request was made by me to have one. The only othere difference was naturally the cost of the hotel stay.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: The hotel is 100 yards or one block to the wharf. Then east 200 yards is Pier 39 or go west to Girardellis. Very convenient. Room was acceptable. Don't forget you have to add $xx for valet parking per day. the check in staff lady spoke English as a second language. She told me 3 times what my room # was until the guy next to her came over. I do not recommend Aliotos Restaurant. The fish dishes were all "french- fried" at best. This is not an upscale Restaurant.

review.title: Had a Great Time!!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very nice and helpful.

review.title: Great experience, great service !!!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, clean, professional staff, great experience !!! Keep up the great work

review.title: Location, location, location. Close to everything - great staff - great experience
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed our stay. Friendly staff, nice rooms, close to everything to do at the Wharf. Very impressed. Would recommend to anyone.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and had a quaint beach theme. I almost felt like I was in Cape Cod! It is within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39, which are both VERY touristy. Downtown San Francisco was only 2 miles away and is a nice walk. If you prefer public transportation, there was a cable car stop a few blocks away from the hotel.

review.title: Would stay again but not impressed but close to attractions
review.reviewText: The staff was hard to understand as all non american. I requested a king size room and was put in a double. The rooms reminded you of someone who decorated from an Ikea store not what I would think for the quality of a Sheraton. We stayed for 9 days and thought that they would offer at least a few breakfast or something as they had no free contenital breakfast. But the good thing is it's close to the Wharf and Cable cars so that somewhat outways the everything.

review.title: Perfect San Frnacisco stop
review.reviewText: My first time at San Frnacisco. Would go back to the same place next time. Preferred the Fishermans Whaft location over Union Square now having seen both. Better area to stroll and look w/o being to busy.

review.title: Just a hotel
review.reviewText: Expected more from a 4star sheraton chain hotel.No fridge,safe did not work,adjoining room door did not close properly.Would stay in city area next visit.

review.title: Excellent location if you like fresh seafood restaurants at walking distance.
review.reviewText: Good hotel location if travelling on leasure. Staff is courteous and by night it is not noisy. Very well located to several of the tourist attractions and to good restaurants.

review.title: Awesome place to stay!
review.reviewText: Great Motel! Awesome location that you can walk to many places. Clean, comfortable room!

review.title: GREAT HOTEL GREAT LOCATION
review.reviewText: WE WERE GREETED AS SOON AS WE WALKED IN.. THE ROOM WAS GREAT ,BED WAS COMFORTABLE.. THE STAFF WAS ALWAYS POLITE AND HELPFUL.

review.title: A trip to remember
review.reviewText:
Hotel was clean and modern. Great location being within walking distance to the safeway, buses / trollies , and fisherman's warf. Took shuttle to hotel from airport and rented 2 different days from hertz , cheaper than dollar at the hotel, down the street affording the $50 per day parking. Ate at ihop, dennys and other local resturants because unles your rockefeller the hotel was expensive.
Like any city there are homeless people asking for money and sleeping in the area but they don't bother you if you ignore.
I also recommend you ask for a room on the 4th floor. They are larger and have a high cealing and we had a few of the bay bridge as well.
Stayed 5 days and would stay there again. Do recommend to get the city pass. Saved a lot of money doing that.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Good Location

review.title: BAD, BAD, BAD!
review.reviewText:
Nothing good to say about Sheraton. They remodel with very cheap furniture and they don't value prepaid customers.
They put me by the fitness room, when I had requested a quite room. Fitness room was pretty noise specially the whole weekend.
I don't recommend this hotel at all.

review.title: Good, Not Great
review.reviewText: A nice hotel in the wharf area. They say "4 star' but more like a 3. Very friendly staff. Standard rooms, nothing special. Overpriced breakfast buffet and the coffee/drink area in the midst of foot traffic and noise.

review.title: Eat/drink with a coat on
review.reviewText: The hotel and room was clean and comfortable. The restaurant was the worst though. It's right at the main enterance, literally, so whenever the automatic double doors open, it gets really cold. I was there the first weekend in April and everyone was eating or drinking with their coats on! Some had scarves. The restaurant is also the lounge and lobby. The servers are rude and expect you to figure out where the menu is and how to order. It's the worst bar/restaurant in a hotel I have ever visited.

review.title: Great location next to piers
review.reviewText: The hotel is located 2 blocks away from Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel staff was very welcoming and had our rooms ready (4th floor). Rooms were good size for the price and very clean. Beds were super comfortable and we were able to manage the temperature all of the time. Cable cars were maybe 3 blocks away and we were also able to walk to Columbus where all of the italian food is at. Food is quite spendy at the hotel - go down the street to Hollywood Cafe for breakfast (Google map it) - large amounts of tasy food for a very decent price with great service. Great place to stay!

review.title: WisconsinLake
review.reviewText: The hotel was a perfect location for walking and near to Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf. Very hip hotel - decor was great. Only downside was the concergiege wasn't very friendly. It seemed like it was a bother at times to ask a question.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location, located near every major transit stop. Room service was mediocre. Rooms look and feel were as described. However, concierge was lacking, but a must if your on a buget.

review.title: Great location - fabulous staff.
review.reviewText: Hotel in close proximity to the Wharf and tons of restaurants, shopping, museums, etc. Front desk staff and room attendants were very polite and we found everything we needed and wanted. Starbucks coffee in room was great; altho the 'cafe' in the lobby was very expensive ($5.50 latte)! Pool was very clean and altho weather was not great, grandson swam several times. Concierge was very helpful. Would definitely use this hotel again when visiting SF.

review.title: Great service, Great location
review.reviewText:
We stayed here very recently with our twenty month old son and the hotel could really not be faulted. Check in was speedy and friendly, the luggage and infant crib were brought up very quickly and a malfunctioning tv remote was sorted out in rapid time.

The location is excellent 1 block from the boudin bakery, 2 blocks from pier 39 and 2 blocks from the Mason - Powell cable car stop.

We can't comment on the food as it looked a bit pricey given what you can get within a couple of blocks walk and the IHOP on the doorstep does a good job but can get busy.

I would recommend this hotel to any tourist making their way to San francisco.

review.title: Cheap to get in, expensive to get out
review.reviewText: The hotel is ok, very close to attractions. The room itself is on the small side with hallway light and noise coming thru the door. We booked two rooms and asked they be next to each other, which they were except for the hallway in between them. The hotel is charge happy, everything is an extra fee. They charge for the computers, printing, parking, a newspaper you don't request. They also charged us twice for 1 car, which we were able to get refunded by accounting. We received incorrect information from the information desk about locations and operating times on more then one occasion.

review.title: Too sqeezy
review.reviewText:
The hotel was chosen for its location and the group. Check in was sterile. Rooms were adequate but the gross lack of wardrobe and clothes storage was a let down.
The bathroom and separate vanity area was tight. Two people could not utilize this space. The tiny wardrobe was also in this area.
The staff were pleasant and polite. The restaurant was closed and the breakfast buffet was sparse.

We expected more from Sheraton and this will probably result in no repeat custom.
Being frequent international travelers who generally choose midstream hotels, this was a disappointment.
this is a lack lustre hotel

review.title: Fabulous Family Experience!
review.reviewText: This was our best experience in San Francisco so far! The hotel was conveniently located to all major attractions, family friendly with exceptional service and very comfortable. We plan to stay here when we return to San Francisco!

review.title: 4 star hotel?
review.reviewText: I thought the location was great, but the staff seemed indifferent and bored. It is very close to touristy areas, but none of the rooms had any kind of view (our room looked down onto a bus depot). There were no free local calls (something that was only apparent after I was charged $1.53 for a 1 minute phone call) and to receive your 'complimentary' newspaper you must specifically mention it (or you will be charged the fee of $.75 daily and receive nothing, which, I feel, is a bit underhanded). Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf seemed more interested in wringing a buck out of their customers than satisfying them. Next time I will try one of the many other hotels in the area.

review.title: Super Location
review.reviewText:
Room rates OK, Other services are expensive. Charged to make 1-800
calls.

review.title: fisherman wharf
review.reviewText: great time. great food. great sights. And yes I would go back and stay longer

review.title: Can't wait for our next stay...
review.reviewText: Great time. So close to Fisherman's Wharf. This was our second stay at the Sheraton. We loved it!!!!

review.title: Would recommend to anyone
review.reviewText: Overall great atmosphere. The outdoor areas were fantastic with the fires and lounges, excellent place where we met load of wonderful Americans

review.title: Great time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: as above.. Sheraton at Fisherman's Wharf is in the heart of activity and close proximity to transportation that wil get you to theatre district,downtown, the parks, ferries etc...

review.title: Love the Sheraton!
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the Sheraton. Perfect location. Very close to the pier, but tucked in away from the constant movement. The room was super comfy. Loved the decor and colors. Friendly & beachy feel. Nice fitness room and cozy fire pits. Everyone was super accommodating and friendly. Having Safeway directly across the street was convenient for all our needs. This hotel was perfect for our SF stay. I came with my girlfriend, and we both left with a great feel for the hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel Great Location Great Price
review.reviewText: The Sheraton at the Wharf was a wonderful hotel and I would highly recommend it. The Spressi Sushi was remarkable as was the room service. The hotel had cozy new gas fire pits, which promoted both family comfort and patron camaraderie, added a nice touch. The rooms were subtly contemporary and had a true "California" feel. The bed was huge and comfortable. The LCD television was an added bonus. The price and location were the two most appealing aspects. It was right next to the "F" stop, which is the main East-West street car route in the city. Just one block North is the main tourist street along Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Clean and close to the Wharf
review.reviewText: Great location close to Wharf and tour companies.

review.title: Loved it.
review.reviewText: Nice location. Very centralized. Staff was great.

review.title: Fine location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Well-located hotel near Fisherman's Wharf, excellent location to serve as a base for visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Great location and price, friendly and helpful hotel staff. The decor of rooms and hallways is playful modern which may not appeal to everyone.

review.title: We Liked It!!
review.reviewText:
We thought the location was great...some other reviews complained about the wharf being dirty, noisy, etc. We did not feel this way at all. The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The beds were very comfortable too!
We were in walking distance to most everything...except the golden gate bridge and Haight Ashbury...but the bus makes it very easy to get there!! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and decided that when we go back, we will stay at the Sheraton again!

review.title: Enjoyed the hotel..except
review.reviewText:
The stay was enjoyable...just didn't care for the parking fee..which we knew about in advance......and they need more hooks or something in the bathroom.

PS..Loved the fireplaces out front!!!

review.title: I'll be back.
review.reviewText: I immensely enjoyed the Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf. Location was perfect to the piers, cable cars, restaurants, grocery store. You name it, it was within walking distance. The entire hotel staff was wonderful and friendly to deal with. I would go back and stay again and recommend the Sheraton to my friends and family. A very comfortable home away from home.

review.title: Wanted to stay Forever
review.reviewText: The location and the hotel was excellent. The breakfast buffet was great and good. I would tell everyone and anyone to stay at the Sheraton. I loved the comfort of my room, the location and totally the overall comfort. Everytime I come back to visit the city, the Sheraton is where I will be staying. Thank you very much

review.title: A great location
review.reviewText: The Sheraton is very well situated, a couple of blocks from Pier 39 and within walking distance of cable cars and Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel buffet breakfast is expensive at over $20 but is good value. There is and IHop diner nearby for a cheaper option and a Safeway for buying water etc. Free Wi-Fi is available in the lounge area.

review.title: Bizarre decor
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a basic, well located hotel with good size, comfortable rooms, this is the place. The common areas and ease of getting around the hotel leave a lot to be desired. Decor is a little bizarre with odd shaped walls.

review.title: It was so great to be right down at the Piers!
review.reviewText: We had a marvelous time in San Francisco and the Sheraton at Fisherman's Warf really made it great. The rooms were gorgeous, and the service was more than adequate. It was convienient to everything that San Francisco has to offer, and provided access to amenities that were affordable at the Safeway across the street. Cost for this getaway came out really great!

review.title: Over the Sierras to SF
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel with friendly staff. The location of the hotel is perfect as it is within walking distance to Pier 39, Ghiradelli Square, the cable cars and great eating resturants along the Wharf. I recommend Nick's seaford resturant, with nice old Italian seaford atmosphere. Golden Gate Park is within 6 miles driving distance and a great view of Alcatraz and Golden Gate Park from the Wharf. However, the parking is horrible during the work week and parking at he hotel, if you chose is $43 per day! Yikes!

review.title: Good Overall Experience
review.reviewText: Very clean, easy access to surrounding sites, friendly staff

review.title: I shall return
review.reviewText: alkingdistance to everything on Fishermans Warf. Hotel and all its staff were beyond expectation. Food excellent . Room was very clean and spacious. Fire pits were a pleasant experience .

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
This hotel is in a very convenient location. Well suited for the tourist. The hotel has free wifi in the lobby areas but not in the rooms. The lobby is updated and welcoming for guests to hang out. The outdoor area has several seating areas with fire pits. Unfortunately, these areas were where the smokers congreagated, making it difficult to enjoy as a non-smoker. The rooms are adequate and the bed and pillows very comfortable. The bathroom area is very small and could stand to be enlarged.
The hotel gym is located in an adjacent building. It appears to be brand new and boasts some very nice equiptment.
Our room faced outside to the street. This was extremely noisy starting at about 6am each day. I don't understand why the hotel hasn't invested in quality soundproofing. Adding this to the room would certainly increase my score of our stay. I would stay here again, but would make sure that I had a room that didn't face a street.
Overall, this was a nice hotel and a great value.

review.title: Great trip!!
review.reviewText:
Loved this trip!! Our hotel was very reasonable, great location. We could walk anywhere within 15 minutes or less or a 5 minute walk to transportation. Alcatraz was amazing. Make sure you book early. The hotel Concierge service was so great!!!
The beds and pillows were great too!!!

review.title: The Best City San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Love the City, staying near the wharf was perfect!

review.title: Great Location - But I'd Rather Stay Elsewhere
review.reviewText: We picked this hotel for its reasonable prices and good location near Pier 39 and Caesar's restaurant, which we enjoy. The location was great; very convenient. Room was OK, but bathroom was tiny. If we were large people, I think we would have been very uncomfortable with the bathroom. This hotel might be a good choice for a weekend where parking is a premium, however, we were there midweek and the cost of hotel parking put us over what I normally like to spend for a hotel. I would prefer to stay a little further away and drive or use public transportation. There are nice hotels a few miles away with good prices, free parking and free in-room internet.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Close to the Fisherman's Wharf and sightseeing tours. Safe clean neighborhood. Hotel staff very accomodating in assistance around city, to airport, with taxi's and limo service. Hotel ambiance relaxing with outdoor firepits and plenty of indoor seating by breakfast/snack area

review.title: Friendly staff and convenient to the Wharf
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. This ranged from bell men, front desk, housekeeping to cafe. The only downside (and not a really big deal) is that the front desk gal always had a line because she was the only person. Her patience was stellar! There was a large grocery store in a building across the street that allowed us to get wine and cheese as well as snacks for hungry skinny people.
review.userLocation: Fort Collins, CO and Xiamen China

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Within walking distance to Wharf, plenty to do. Very helpful staff. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great location - Great value - Nice stay
review.reviewText: Nice, clean hotel for a great price. Great location - within walking distance from Fisherman's Wharf and other attractions.

review.title: Would stay again.
review.reviewText:
Convenient to the Wharf and transportation to get around the
city to other attractions. Would definitely stay again.

review.title: Close to Everything
review.reviewText:
This hotel was close to everything we could have wanted. Within a couple of blocks of the wharf and an easy walk to China Town, North Beach and others. The trolley is also extremely convenient, as are local car rental companies. Tip: Rent a car for the day and don't park overnight by the wharf - it's extremely costly. You can either park on the street and wake up at 7am to feed the meter or turn the car in and rent another one the next day - it's actually less expensive.

The hotel is well maintained and has really cool outside areas with fire pits for late night sharing. Great trip!

review.title: Great Place to Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Sheraton on Fishermans Wharf is a great place to stay. It's location is one of it's best features - easy access to pulbic transportation & is within walking distance to numerous places. Price was right. Employees very helpful & friendly. Rooms clean, beds comfortable - our only negative about the room was the small bathroom, not room enough for two to get ready and there was no shelf space to put our things. On the day we left we requested a cab for our trip to the airport, the conceire directed us to a gentleman outside (can't remember his name) who could help us. He was extremely pushy, wanted us to take a towncar instead which was more expensive than the cab for 4 of us. Told us if we wanted a cab we could find one on the street. We did not appreciate this at all. This would not stop us from staying here again. It really is a great place to stay.

review.title: Not Impressed with surrounding neighborhood
review.reviewText: The hotel is a very nice hotel and only 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf but I would not recommend staying at any hotel in Fisherman's Wharf. It has gotten very dirty, there is a lot of homeless people, and it smells. Plus the first night that we stayed at this hotel, the hotel allowed a local fraternity to host a party at one of the restaurants inside, we had to change rooms once due to the noise and around 1am, the hotel had to shut the party down because it became too rowdy and there were gunshots fired right outside our hotel window. Not a very nice experience for our vacation. I have no plans to go back any time soon. The hotel

review.title: Wharf's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was so clean & the staff were very friendly & helpful. We relied on the fron t desk to map us out any location we needed for touring the city. We loved that it was a street away from the Wharf. There is a Dollar rent a car right in the hotel where we rented a car for a day (very reasonable!) There are outdoor firepits that were so cozy after a day of sightseeing. We were at this hotel 3 times & will definitly go back. BUffet Breakfast looked amazing but we preferred to go down to the Wharf for something quick.

review.title: The best hotel I have visited in a long time!
review.reviewText: The hotel was amazing! Staff was the most friendly, courteous hotel staff that I have encountered in YEARS!!! They made this trip 10 times better then I thought it was going to be. If I had to say 1 negative, it would be that my stay was too short!

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: Perfect location, nice and friendly staff, clean and the most comfortable bed I ever slept in!!!!!

review.title: Good Deal at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: I thought the hotel was great if you are looking for a Fisherman's Wharf location. Room decor very modern and hip yet comfortable. Hotel staff friendly and responsive. I was very comfortable. The only drawback was the (approx) $45 per day charge to park your car at the hotel.

review.title: I would absolutely book this hotel in the future
review.reviewText: Great Stay!!!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: It was good for the price, rooms were clean and neat. Nice little lobby with a bar. However, rooms facing street can be a little noisy at night, but it is not a busy street.

review.title: Great location, nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and large, clean hotel room with contemporary decor. Bathroom was a bit dated but adequate. Would stay there again.

review.title: Great location for lovers of Fisherman's Wharf !
review.reviewText: Nice fireplace on walkways for guests' usage especially on the chilly evenings on early January !

review.title: eye candy
review.reviewText: This was visually the coolest hotel i've ever stayed in. The bed was super comfortable, and it's better than the photos on the webiste!! The only complaint is the parking situation. If you want to park there it costs 50% of what i paid for the room. Luckily there is free street parking if you're feeling adventurous...it's only a few blocks from the hotel. Either way it was my favorite hotel room ever!

review.title: Disapointing
review.reviewText: The hotel was cheap looking, confusing to navigate, and seemed to need repair. The bathroom was tiny and the bathtub was small and plain, the shower curtain was made out of beach towel material.

review.title: Booking my next trip!
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location! If you want to see what San Francisco has to offer I recommend this hotel!

review.title: fisherman's warf hotel
review.reviewText: hotel was nice looking and very close to the fisherman's warf/pier 39 atractions. the inside lobby was very nice, however once you got up to your floor, the hallways were dingy/worn and narrow. it was a bit of a maze finding our way to our room. we had poor sleep due to noise from our upstairs neighbor and multiple days in a row of garbage removal at 6AM! LOVED the outside fire/sitting areas. too cold to try to use the pool - would have liked a hot tub available.

review.title: Loved it, would definitely recommend to others!
review.reviewText: We really LOVED this hotel! It was very central to alot of the tourist attractions in San Franciso! We were a walk away from Pier 39, Lombard street, China town and much more! I loved the cozy area outside with the firepits! The customer services was excellent.

review.title: Not Bad
review.reviewText:
My room was clean and not too bad with the surround noise level
But I did asked to be on the top floor.
There's only one way in and out thru the lobby. Big hotel
Breakfast place across the street because inside was expense

review.title: Great place but don't use the phone you cannot afford it?
review.reviewText:
The hotel was fine - spread out but safe, comfortable and cozy. Rooms large by San Francisco standards we adequate with a large TV. Would be happy to stay there - handy to the trams, wharves and an IHOP accross the street for some cheaper and relaxed eating.

A phone call cost over $50.00 for a twelve minute call (within the USA) and even a quick call to leave a message was $10.00. A rip off - room service was fine but with the taxes, service charge etc. add 30% so be careful when ordering a meal can be much more than first though. Service was prompt and professional.

The hotel car to the airport was reasonable.

review.title: Very convienent and walking distance to the Fisherman's Wharf and stores
review.reviewText: It was a nice hotel. The only thing that I did not like was not enough drawers to store your belongings for a small family of four. It was crowded in that aspect. The food service is expensive and its better to go eat at a local restaurant. Other than that the hotel was pleasant and clean.

review.title: This was where we spent our honeymoon
review.reviewText: We spent our honeymoon in this hotel, so we came back for our 25th anniversary. It was completely redone a couple of years ago and the rooms were beautiful. They were not the standard hotel decor. Our stay was great.

review.title: It was ok.
review.reviewText: Our room was on the first floor right by the street. Needless to say that it was loud outside at night. For the most part, the hotel staff was nice but the parking attendants were down right rude. I may never use this hotel again because of the parking attendants. We were charged $50 per night to park the car inside the hotel. They should've been nicer.

review.title: Room Noisy...
review.reviewText: Great location, nice casual restaurant in lobby, nice outdoor fireplaces for hanging out. My primary issue with the hotel is the NOISE. We were on a busy street so all we heard were buses and trucks and the room above us sounded like there were elephants stomping on our heads...Very poor noise insulation. The bathroom in room was really SMall !

review.title: Not Impressed. Quality not at the same level as its price.
review.reviewText: won't go back again.

review.title: Very good service
review.reviewText:
Walking distance to Pier 39 and Cable Car. Very friendly staf and very good service.
Rooms were clean and comfortable.

review.title: Would definitely go back
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay and would definitely go back to this hotel. Good location and the price was right for us.

review.title: Just factor in $50 bucks for parking
review.reviewText: Dissapointed with such a high parking charge. Should be part of room rate.

review.title: Great LocationG
review.reviewText: Good price for the great location and service. We loved sitting outdoors by the fire pits in the cool evening enjoying a warm drink.

review.title: Great Warf Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel for a visit to Fisherman's Wharf. Everything was within walking distance. The decor, staff and amenities were great! I like the modern feel of the hotel. The only thing it was missing was a jacuzzi.

review.title: Best choice in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Clean, convenient, excellent location

review.title: Good hotel! Well Located!!
review.reviewText: Good Hotel! Well located and confortable

review.title: great time
review.reviewText:
Everyone was very helpful, and the hotel was decorated contemporary and tasteful. My 10 year old son thought it was very cool! Our only complaint is we wanted an evening tea in the lobby, and the cost was more than that of a whole box of tea at the market.
The area we stayed was perfect for family. It was in walking distance of all the activities children would be interested in, Alcatraz , Fisherman's Warf, Pier 39. Also, a short cab ride, or a long walk to great restaurants. Little Italy is just up Columbus St., and China Town is close.

review.title: Good location, decent hotel
review.reviewText: Very close to Fisherman's Wharf. The room was kinda small. Good breakfast buffet (though a bit on a pricey side).

review.title: Great Hotel and Location
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend this hotel, great service and location.

review.title: A very good souvenir
review.reviewText: I will return as soon as I can.

review.title: A comfortable refuge!!
review.reviewText: The beds were great; the service was excellent and it was nice and close to the wharf...easy to walk around...very centrally located. Get the "City Pass" and you can get to anywhere on plentiful public transit. City Pass allows you free admission to 5 main area attractions. We had a great time all around San Francisco.

review.title: Relaxing, fresh atmosphere, accommodating staff
review.reviewText: I find the hotel relatively accessible and easy to locate, within walking distance from fisherman's wharf. The room is very fresh, nice sheets, cozy atmosphere. The staff are very nice especially Front desk.

review.title: Great location, comfort OK, no free breakfast, mouse in the hallway
review.reviewText: I believe I'd never recommend a hotel where I found a mouse in the hallway. However the location made it worth, as it is really close to major attractions and bus/tram stations. Expensive breakfast is an invitation to eat at Boudin bakery just a couple blocks away.

review.title: Great Bargain on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The service at this hotel was wonderful. All the staff we encountered were extremely courteous and accomodating. The location of the hotel could not have been better. We were able to walk to Pier 39, Ghiradelli Square and Fisherman's Wharf within in minutes.

review.title: Safe location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, good and safe location, i totally recommend it!!!

review.title: Funky Decorations
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great location. Only a block and a half to Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel itself was decorated very funky, strange colors and carpets but other than that it was very nice. Comfy clean rooms, friendly staff. The best part was they have fire pit outside with comfy chairs near the pool and bar that are very relaxing.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great and close to attraction. The only problem was the parking. It was very expensive almost $50 per night.

review.title: FAB TIME!
review.reviewText:
what can i say - GREAT LOCATION, GREAT HOTEL!!!!
(check out the room service menu - the pizza was great!!!!)

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: You couldn't ask for a more convenient location if you love being down by the water, which we do. The only complaint we both have is that the rooms are NOT sound proof at all so you get alot of hallway and neighbor noise if they are noisy. I had to get up late on Saturday night and go into the hallway to ask people to please not stand outside my door and talk at the top of their voices! Other than that it was ok. Decor is not to my liking either but who really cares when in beautiful SF!

review.title: Great Fisherman's Wharf Find
review.reviewText: Great location - only 1 block from Fisherman's Wharf - very cool renovated rooms, flat screen tv's, very clean, A++

review.title: fun in SA
review.reviewText: hotel staff was great! good location, however, our view was to a bus lot . So we had to keep our curtains closed all the time, but other than that it was great!

review.title: Great Hotel / Great Location
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed this hotel. Recently renovated in a modern style. Room was clean and well keep. Great bed. Good location for getting around town. 2 blocks to Fisherman's Wharf - tram to Union Square right outside. Nice fireplaces outside for early morning coffees or late night drinks. Very nice staff. Would recommend and would definately return.

review.title: Do yourself a favor - go somewhere else - even if it costs more...
review.reviewText:
This Hotel was a disappointment. I will say that the staff was very polite and the Concierge was very knowledgable and helpful, but that is the only positive thing about the place.

The room was small and cramped and the beds were completely uncomfortable. The walls are very thin and I could hear details of conversations from the rooms next to and above me. Anytime a toilet flushed or a shower was run, it could be heard 3-4 rooms away.

Services that most hotels offer for free, this place charges for, such as:
In-room fridge - daily charge - one might be available from housekeeping, if you can find somewhere in the tiny room to put it.
Wireless internet - daily charge - I used the free wireless from the hotel nearby..
Parking - in understand that this is a premium parking part of town, but the daily parking rate for hotel guests was way too high, in my opinion.
Printer - I asked if there was a printer I could connect to so I could print my return boarding passes and was directed to the Business Center, where I could have used their computers to connect to their printers - at a high PER MINUTE charge.

I'm not sure how this place got a 4 Star rating, but it needs to be re-evaluated. Motel 6 would have been a better choice.

review.title: Great location!!!!!!! Nice Hotel!!! Would definitely go back!
review.reviewText: Location was great.....Fire pits outside of hotel were wonderful to sit with a drink and relax...people were nice and helpful....beautiful location!!!! Can't wait for our next San Francisco trip!!!!!!!

review.title: Not the best but not the worst.
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was perfect. It's only a couple minutes away from pier 39 and not too far away from everything else. I experienced a bit of noise from the street cars and from the room above me, when he/she was walking around, but the noise wasn't overbearing. I would stay at this hotel again if on my own or with friends but I would probably reconsider if I were staying with kids or a significant other.

review.title: Great hotel, but expensive parking
review.reviewText: Expect to pay around $50/night for parking.

review.title: Abundant kindness and care
review.reviewText: Everything was wonderful about the hotel, but it was the people who worked at the hotel who made the stay unbelievable. They bent over backwards to help, and were so generous and kind!

review.title: hit the jackpot with this hotel!
review.reviewText: All was great except for missing hangers for the towels near the bathroom sink. Also could stand another comfortable chair with a small table.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is worth the price, right in the heart of Fishermans Wharf. Really nice firepits outside for Cigar smokers!!!!!!

review.title: Very very close to all and convienient!
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Sheraton was very good. Staff were great, rooms were clean. Showers can get very hot for those of you who like hot showers! If you are touring the city EVERYTHING is within walking distance and flat. If you are a gym junkie like we are there is a 24 hour fitness south, across the street in the same building as the Safeway grocery store. There is also a Walgreens and 7-11 within a block away. There is an IHOP on the north side of the Sheraton and Fishermans Wharf is one block away. Stay away from the Wipeout Cafe all of the food we ate was excellent except for that place. Bland food yuck!! Nice 5-6 mile run from Hotel and along the Embarcadero to AT&T Park/ Stadium. Visit Alcatraz, Ghiradelli Factory, Union Square (huge place take a cab or cable car), Lombard St, Golden Gate Bridge, make sure you are really in the mood to wine taste if you desire to do this because the tour takes the entire day like 9am-6pm and can be fun but too long. Conciere at Hotel was very knowledgable and can point you towards any location. There are nice fire pits at the front of the hotel that can create an ambiance of intimacy for the lovers or folks who are here for social gatherings (no I dont work for the Sheraton).. We really had a great time and will return..

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent location, near pier 39 where I want to visit. Near by all tourist bus pick ups. Good location and very good price. My self and my 10 years old daughter enjoyed very much.

review.title: not a 4 star hotel
review.reviewText: my room was on the side of the bus terminal, very noisy, most rooms have no view, not wort the price ,try the niko in union square, same price much better

review.title: Great room layout
review.reviewText: Comfortable, clean, and great room layout - lots of room to lay stuff out! Convenient to everything we wanted to do. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and when you close the curtains and window, you are in a quiet cave, great for sleeping in!

review.title: Very convenient location,everybody very helpful
review.reviewText: Nicely updated older Hotel,close to all tourist attractions

review.title: I left my heart in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great spot. Just 2 blocks from the wharf. The room was extremely comfortable. We could walk anywhere and find interesting shops and cafe's.

review.title: deteriorating infrastructure marred stay
review.reviewText: We must emphasize that the people who work in this hotel are polite, willing to please and always available. The housekeepers kept our room spotless. Truly. That said, we must also tell you that the toilet was plugged when we arrived in the room. So, as we were settling in, a plumber was in the bathroom plunging away. About 9PM we realized there was no way to leave a night light on in the bathroom so one of us went to the front desk and asked for a plug-in night light. After several inquiries, they decided none existed and suggested we go across the street and buy one at Safeway. By 10PM we figured out the air conditioner was making the room feel like a sauna. Once again, a very polite repairman was sent to the room and within fifteen minutes told us he couldn't fix the AC but had to replace it. An hour later we had a functioning AC and were terribly tired. (We could have opened the windows but it was so noisy down below that wasn't an option.) Final thought: If you require a taxi, hail a bona fide taxi and don't fall for the "Sheraton" town car PLOY. It will cost you more and you may or may not end up at your destination in a timely fashion.

review.title: Check in representative was not knowledgable
review.reviewText: The room looked as though it were a 3.5 star but the ambiance of the lobby was nice!

review.title: Great location,,,,,Terrible experience.
review.reviewText: Great location.....Terrible deal. Rooms are very small. Staff is unattentive. Parking is way too expensive. The breakfast buffet was a dismal joke, yet unbelievably overpriced. I have stayed in S.F. 6 or 7 times before and i know you can do much better than this.

review.title: Mixed feelings
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is excellent, adjacent to Fishermans wharf, but if you are looking for old style features and comfort, this is not the place for you. The hotel has obviously engaged an interior designer who is in love with stripes, as everything (carpet, walls, paintings) is consistent with this theme. It comes across as a business hotel which caters for conferences, so if you dont want this type of atmosphere, suggest you look elsewhere.

review.title: Unique Decor
review.reviewText: On arrival the entrance is relatively private, on its own driveway, away from the crowded main streets. The decor is modern, even ecclectic. The lobby is efficiently arranged. Bell hop service is available if needed. The rooms are sufficiently spacious, clean, and the beds are comfortable. Street noise can be noticeable, particularly from the trolleys and early-morning trash collction. Fisherman's Wharf is a few minutes walk away. For more-distant places, the door man will call a cab. Limousine and town-car service is often available at the door. We did not try the restaurant, but the lobby bar provided a nice environment to meet the rest of our group and visit.

review.title: fun in san fran
review.reviewText: my husband and I took our 2 girls ages 1 and 3, we all had a great time. the hotel made it especially nice. great location, it was central to everything, trader joes and safeway across the street,super nice staff, and clean room, a little noisy at night, but thats the city for you. happy travels!

review.title: Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Great location, hotel was clean and a great place to crash after a long day of walking. We usually stay at condos or vacation homes, but were really pleased with the hotel. The location cannot be beat, even if you do not like the frantic atmosphere of Fisherman's Wharf, you are a nice walk away from Coit Tower and from there Chinatown and then a quick hop to Union Square. If walking is not your thing, you can take a cab for a few dollars, cable cars are fun but pricey and not a real efficient use of time (long lines depending on the day). The hotel was lovely, bright and updated nicely. Loved the martini bar in the lobby in the evening, great martinis but pricey!

review.title: Noisy, rude employees, bad service, NEVER AGAIN!
review.reviewText: Worst hotel stay I've ever had. The room was so incredibly noisy that my wife and I couldn't sleep. The room was tiny, cramped. Hotel employees were far more concerned with their co-workers and complaining about their boss than anything having to do with the customers. You couldn't pay me to stay there again.

review.title: Great Place to Stay!
review.reviewText: Great Hotel!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was located one block from Fisherman's Wharf and within walking distance of many places. Hotel staff are friendly. I used the Concierge service several times for dinner recommendations and reservations. Food is pricey at the hotel. $8.00 for two Starbucks coffees from the lobby. I'd definitely stay at this hotel again if in San Francisco.

review.title: Fabulous Location
review.reviewText: This is an short 1 block walk to the sights and tastes of the Wharf. Also has a supermarket and Trader Joe's within easy 1 block walk. This stay was business, but planning to come back with my spouse, its a perfect fit for a fun weekend get-away since there is so much within easy walking.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: I was really pleased with hotel,especially with stuff.Really nice people work for this hotel. The only thing I didn't like it was a little bit updaited.I know the room was 60's style.But it need some new showers (not plastic).

review.title: San Francisco in Late September
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. It is a large complex close to Pier 39. When I booked my trip, I could only get a room with two double beds, I wanted one with a King but I did not have that option. I wrote a note that I would pay extra if I could get a King but they did not look at this until I arrived. The fire pits are nice but can be full most of the time. I talked to a couple of other guest who had rooms on the east side of the building that heard many buses in the early morning. I would stay there again but I would make sure where my room is within the building.

review.title: Clean, but 70's style
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was clean, which s most important to me, and the staff was accomodating when I needed anything. The decor was straight out of the 70's...pink, blue, yellow and real funky mirrors; not real crazy about that. No fridge in room! The bed was really comfortable. If you're a light sleeper and outside noise bothers you, request a room away from the streets. Otherwise, it was a good place to stay and I would stay again. Entire place was non-smoking!!! I loved that!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: I was very pleased as the hotel was just as it was in the brochure, just as the pictures showed. Courteous staff, clean, room service & food was great. The location was tops in my book as it was within walking distance to all the sights I went there to see. I will one day be going back and this is where I will choose to stay. I am a native Bostonian and have never been to California before, as I was traveling alone, I felt comfotable and safe.

review.title: cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: great location close to all tours and shopping very clean and very attentive staff would definetly go stay here again

review.title: Friendly staff, great location
review.reviewText: The people at the desk were very friendly and helpful. One fellow at the concierge desk was less than helpful, but then the lady I dealt with in the morning handled the shuttle reservation very professionally. The room was clean and the air conditioning worked quite well.

review.title: The place is quite good
review.reviewText: The place is the most important of this hotel. Other elements are so-so.

review.title: Be carefull on your choice of room & dont take your car.
review.reviewText: A good hotel in a good location, let down by being next to a bus depot which operates almost all night. Considering the price of the room, I feel breakfast should be included as it is in many hotels across the states. Also it cost a fortune to park the car for one night!!

review.title: Great Vacation!
review.reviewText: The Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf was an excellent place to spend our vacation! It was centrally located to the Wharf and all of the transportation lines available to see the spectacular city of San Francisco. The hotel staff was very helpful and pleasant. This wasn't my first visit to San Francisco and it won't be my last!

review.title: Great location for a visit to San Fran
review.reviewText: Close to everything! Def. Would stay again.

review.title: Enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: The location of the Sheraton at fisherman's Wharf was great, as it was within easy walking distance to many of the attractions and tour operators. The cleaninless and room size were great. Most of the hotel staff were courteous and helful. Would not recommend the Express Airport service (recommendation and booking made by the conceriage desk), as the service was overbooked on the day we were picked up.

review.title: San Francisco in September
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel close to the wharf but no breakfast included in the room deal and an fixed-price extortionate extra, especially for those who only wish to have cereal/fruit/toast.

review.title: The best one so far!
review.reviewText: I really enjoy the modern look of the room. It was very refreshing. The bed was very comfortable and clean. Thank you!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The best outdoor fires places ever! Very close to Fisherman's Warf and my favorites resteraunts Scoma's and Fior D'italia!

review.title: best part was the great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was in walking distance to many spots including Fisherman Wharf,Pier 39, China Town and Little Italy. Unfortunately, the encounters with the concierge on two different occasions were offensive. I was treated like I was beneath them. The check in staff were so informative and gave us directions, etc. everything was great except for the interactions with the concierge.

review.title: Bright and clean hotel.
review.reviewText: We thought the hotel was in the best possible location, just a pleasant walk from Fisherman's Wharf, our sightseeing bus locale, Trader Joe's and IHOP, which was a godsend for breakfast. The downside of the hotel was the exorbitant prices they charged for food and drink. Really outrageous! Needless to say, we didn't even have coffee there. It's too bad they aren't more reasonable, because the outdoor firepits are an ideal place to sit and relax with a latte or a glass of wine. On the up side, the hotel is nicely decorated and very clean. Our room overlooked the pool and was comfortable and fairly quiet (except for the thumping footprints overhead now and then). Any requests we made were dealt with quickly in a pleasant manner. We would stay there (but not eat there)again.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great value for price. Staff could be more knowledgeable about places to go.

review.title: Worth the money
review.reviewText: Great location & cute fisherman's wharf theme to the hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Impressive location and property but some facts to be aware of
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is first rate. It is a block away from the main Fishermans Wharf and there is a supermarket and tram line within a block. Be aware if you are planning to park a vehicle at the location as the daily and overnight charges are significant. Dollar has a rental car office on site. The hotel was maintained well and is clean. The property is low-rise so there is a chance you could end up looking onto the lobby entrance or even the street so it is not going to be a quiet stay. In our room we looked onto the lobby. The noise wasn't excessive but the curtains did not neatly fit which created light pollution at night from the powerful entrance lighting. The gap also allowed for those outside to see into the room if they looked hard and as a result we re-arranged the furniture to push the curtains back into the window more which provided some relief. Free internet wi-fi was available from within the lobby.

review.title: Great Hotel and Location
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel. In my opinion, the nicest hotel in the area.

review.title: Great Location for Tourist.
review.reviewText: Staying in The Fisherman's Wharf area was a great location and this hotel was in walking distance to many activities. Hotel food was pricey. The outside fire pits were a nice touch to gather at the end of an evening. It took long for the Blue Van to get us to the hotel because we were the last stop.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: The Sheraton is a brand name and it did not disappoint. The main advantage of this hotel was the location in proximity to the Wharf. All else was standard. The beds were very comfortable.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Good location... Close to Street car and Cable car station! No need of TAXI... you can get around with Street and Cable cars with purchase of one day or muliple day pass of MUNI.

review.title: Great and so close to the wharf and pier 39. Would definitely go back!
review.reviewText: The rooms are very comfy, modern and cheerful. All the colors in the hotel are bright colors of the sea shore. The fires outside are fun and provide warmth when the days are cool. The staff are very helpful and friendly.

review.title: Very nice location, walking distance to Fisherman's Whalf.
review.reviewText: The hotel is very clean and family oriented. There is Safeway/Trade Joe just cross the street if you need to buy some drinks and snacks. Only the room is a little bit small than I expected. I will recommend it to my frineds.

review.title: We would definitely stay here again
review.reviewText: Great location and the hotel has been updated beautifully. We had our 2 young kids with us and the room was perfect for us.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: Very convenient and easy walk to most attractions. Room was clean and nice. Our room was somewhat noisy from the traffic as our room was street side. It is only 3 stories high so if you are looking for a view, look elsewhere. If you want to be close to the Wharf and the action there or the cable cars or bus tours it is a great place to stay. You are right in the action.

review.title: It was close to where we wanted to be so it worked
review.reviewText: Over all it was a good experience. We were glad to get the free breakfasts. The room was clean and quiet. There was no view from the hotel. It would have been great if there was an adult only enforced time at the pool, ie after 10pm. The garbages should have been emptied daily. The cost of renting a movie was too much. After a long day of exporing the city it would have been nice to watch tv but here was no tv guide to tell you what was on or what you were watching. We didn't see any other hotels that offered anything better in that area. It was nice to be close to the wharf and all activity there.

review.title: Loved the outside fireplaces at night and the buffet every morning. Would definitely go back
review.reviewText: Everyone at the hotel was very helpful and courteous. Any time I'm in San Fran would definitely stay here. Got a good rate too

review.title: Best hotel in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Loved staying. Would definitely go back. Clean and decent. Trendy yet relaxing. Very comfy and good atomosphere. Service was good. People were very friendly. Loved even the housekeeper. She was very nice and kind. Great hotel at Great location.

review.title: It was nice and close to everything
review.reviewText: It was nice and close to everything we needed to see.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Excellent location to Fishermans Wharf & local shopping area. 2 blocks to Pier 39 & 33 for ferry to Alcatraz. Conceige at hotel very helpful. Dont forget to tip. They will store your lugguage if your flight is later in the day at no charge. Thanks Sheraton, will definitely stay there again the next time we are in San Francisco.

review.title: A great experience overall
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel since it was about half a block away from Fisherman's Wharf and had great service. The room was immaculate and service was very good at all times. We will come back to this hotel definitely.

review.title: San Francisco's Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: hotel has been remodeled recently so all looks fresh and clean. rooms are quite comfortable and easy walking to all activities in Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Bad start in service, but made a decent recovery
review.reviewText: I booked a room with 2 double beds, but got a room with a king the first night. They said they didn't have a double bed available so I slept on the floor the 1st night. I was also told that if I packed my bags the next morning after I left the room, someone would move it to my new room with double beds. I packed my bags and left it next to the door in my original room. When I came back to the hotel, they had not moved me and said that I did not pack my bags. I went to my old room and without having to pack (because they were already packed), moved my bags to the new room myself. I didn't mind, but was disappointed the hotel didn't follow though on what they said. The great friendly service from the valets and housekeepers were so good that it made up a lot of the poor service at the beginning.

review.title: AWESOME PLACE TO STAY
review.reviewText: We wanted to stay close to everything as this was our first visit to SF. We couldn't have picked a better place. Within walking distance to many major attractions and within walking distance to the cable cars to ride to Union Square. Hotel clean, comfortable and staff pleasant and helpful. Would DEFINATELY stay here again and recomend this hotel to everyone!

review.title: Great hotel in great location
review.reviewText: A short walk away from Ferry Terminals, The Cannery, Fishermans Wharf,Pier 39, Cable car and buses, restaurants and cheap but big breakfasts, we were so glad we chose this area and this hotel to stay whilst in Frisco - only complaint the ridiculously expensive parking fees.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: My stay at the Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf was a great one. When I booked, my reservation said that I would have a room with two double beds, and my boyfriend and I were hoping for just one bed, a king. When we arrived at the hotel, without us even saying anything they gave us a king size bed on the top floor of the hotel! The location of the hotel was also really great for us, as we were there to check out everything we could. The hotel is 2 blocks from the wharf, Pier 39 is 5 minute walk, very convenient! Everyone at the hotel was extremely helpful, and we would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Nice Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay, resturaunts are plenty in the area and are walking distance.

review.title: excellent! location superb, in the middle of the action, will be back soon!
review.reviewText: very good hotel,service excellent!

review.title: Best Choice and Best Value
review.reviewText: The locataion is fantastic; the hotel is fresh and new; loved the fire pits outside; the price was very reasonable

review.title: Great Location for tourists
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with our stay at the Fisherman's Wharf Sheraton in San Francisco. The hotel is within walking distance of many tourist sites. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel to first time visitors to San Francisco like myself. Our family hopes to return in about a year and we hope to stay at the Sheraton again.

review.title: Great value for money
review.reviewText: Really good value for money. Convinient location, very nice room and good service.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf - great location
review.reviewText: Cute, "beachy" decor. Concierge very helpful.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: hotel was great, comfortable, good location, easy walk to nearby attractions & cable car access, staff was very pleasant & accomodating, in fact, we accidentaly left something in the room. we called once we arrived back home. they still had the item and overnighted it to us. great experience and a great city to visit!

review.title: Excellent location, great amenities for a great price!
review.reviewText: This hotel takes up a whole block within easy walking didtance to so many attractions in the Firsherman's Wharf area (less than 5 minutes to Alcatraz boat, Pier 39, and wharf; 10 minutes to Ghiradelli). The IHOP right across the street offers free kids meals Monday-Friday, so it's a great place to start the day (much cheaper that the hotel's food). The pool was kept very warm in response to the chilly climate and there are "warming pits" with gas fireplaces located off the front lobby and out at the pool. There are Muni stops for streetcar and bus right on the corner to get you easily to all the other great areas in the city. This hotel gets an A+ from our family!

review.title: Will definitely stay here again
review.reviewText: This hotel was very clean, quiet and the beds were very comfortable. Location is excellent to many attractions. Friendly staff....Would definitely stay here again...

review.title: We would go back again and again!
review.reviewText: Our room was great! We enjoyed sitting out by the pool and enjoying the sun. We also spent many hours sitting outdoors by the fireplaces visiting and reading. The staff was very helpful and the location was ideal! We could walk to the Fisherman's Wharf in just a couple of minutes.

review.title: not impressed, too expensive...
review.reviewText: the room was very small. the parking, at $49 per night, is outrageous.

review.title: No Customer Service
review.reviewText: The Sheraton does not know the term customer service. They put me in an old room on the bottom floor facing the driveway. It was loud, noisy and I had to keep the curtains closed so the whole world couldnt see in my room. They have a concierge but he was always to busy to help so the manager volunteered. I asked if he could help me get tickets to wicked, he couldnt. I asked him to help me get tickets to Alcatraz, he couldnt. Finally, I checked out and checked in at the Courtyard Marriott down the street. Upon arrival there, I asked the concierge if he could get tickets to Wicked. He did; Front row, center. I asked him if he could help us get tickets to Alcatraz. He did; Alcatraz with a two day hop-on hop-off bus tour. When I was leaving, I asked if they could take care of getting us a ride to the airport. They had a personal car pick us up which cost approx $50 plus tip. I highly recommend staying at the Courtyard Marriott. They are all about customer service! Sheraton, take a lesson!

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Given room facing street where street and truck car passed early in morning till late in evening. Ask for another room and was told "all sold out". Also charged $43.00 plus tax a night for parking. Was not told in advanced. Have stayed at other hotels in fishermen's wharf area without this parking fee.

review.title: Had a great time!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean. Bathroom a bit small!

review.title: Great room
review.reviewText: The hotel was very friendly and location was great. However, parking is an issue. The description should include that you have to pay for daily parking.

review.title: Excelent location
review.reviewText: Perfect Location Very Expensive rate fee for parking

review.title: Good location, too expensive
review.reviewText: We stayed 3 nights here, hotel had recently been "renovated" but the job they did was really poor. Could tell it was an old hotel with new wallpaper just put over the drywall. Definately overpriced for the quality, even breakfast buffet was $21/person and wasn't worth that. Parking was $49/night!!! Only good thing, was the location, could walk all over the wharf.

review.title: Fantastic Location
review.reviewText: Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf was the ideal site for our family vacation. It's convenient location, helpful staff and comfortable rooms made it the perfect hotel for family fun. We were able to easily walk to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 to enjoy all the fabulous restaurants and activities. Don't miss Boudin's for their world famous sourdough bread and Alcatraz Island for an amazing experience and beautiful views of San Francisco. Make reservations for Alcatraz before you leave home, tours fill up fast. We also recommend the double decker bus tour for getting familiar with the entire city and fitting in all the amazing sites this fabulous city has to offer. We're already planning to go back!

review.title: Don't ask for help!
review.reviewText: The concierge staff is clueless! We got a lot of blank stares when asking for help. We ended up using our own computer and searching for restaurants. Very loud hotel. We were awakened two of our six nights by people in the hallway. Slow service. Convenient location and clean.

review.title: so so...
review.reviewText: Hello everybody, this hotel was nice and clean but concierge did nothing with my requests. I was quite disappointed since I travel all around the world all the time and am used to count on concierge service. Also, breakfast was weak as well as the person working behind the desk. At the register desk things worked just fine. In conclusion, premises fine but service, a lot to improve... Thank you, Mike

review.title: Very convenient to all
review.reviewText: We stayed recently for vacation and were very happy with the location, rooms were clean and staff was friendly. Bed was so comfortable we'd buy one if we could. We accidently left something behind, and 3 days later we called - housekeeping had held it in lost and found, and they mailed it right out to us - awesome service! Was a little noisy at times, echoy hallways and could hear walking above - but not bad enough to say we'd not stay there again. Outdoor firepits were a great place to unwind and sip wine at night. Shuttle service to airport, and many tours did door to door service, and in walking distance of all Wharf activities.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: The bolster pillows on the beds to help you sit up to watch TV is a first for me and an excellent idea. I would stay there again. Only change would be I would have liked to see the waterfrom my room, although I understand none of the rooms have that view.

review.title: Great location...
review.reviewText: Stayed for two nights in mid July. Shops and Pier flat walking distance. Hotel offers free wi-fi in lobby but not reliable - kept dropping out and instead I ran up the roaming data charges on my cellphone as I was waiting for important emails. Room was quite comfortable but should offer free wi-fi in the rooms. Buy food from the nearby shops as the food offered in the lobby was very expensive. Used the BART to go to Concord. Enjoyed the outdoor firepits while waiting for the airport shuttle.

review.title: Great base to explore the city
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Sheraton for 2 nights. The hotel is in an ideal location situated very close to Fishermans Wharf. Definately the place to be if you are a tourist. The rooms were a very good size and the beds very comfortable. I cannot fault the hotel on cleanliness or service. However we had a room next to a road, which was very noisy during the day and early morning with the traffic. The firepits in the hotel are a great place to relax, meet other guests and swap experiences of your day.

review.title: Room was comfortable and location was great!
review.reviewText: Our room was clean and comfortable, the location was close to everything, and our only regret was not staying longer. We would definitely stay there again, when we go back if we can get another great Expedia price!

review.title: Nice hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location, within a few blocks of Pier 39. From the outside, it doesn't look nice, but on the inside it shows to be fully renovated. The front desk is always busy and since they have only one or two people attenging at the same time, you always have to wait in line. We were only able to "catch" the Concierge once during our four day stay and he wasn't helpful at all. We found it best to ask the bell boys, which were very nice and gave good tips.

review.title: Perfect Spot
review.reviewText: We took this hotel because of its location, sight unseen. It was perfect. Flat walking area (and that is important), one block from Pier 39 where the action is, and two blocks from the red and white cruises which we took the sunset cruise, (great). About 1/2 mile from the Alcatraz tour pier but very walkable. The F line trolley and bus lines, right outside and about two blocks to the cable cars. Really a perfect spot. The hotel is really clean and the service is nice. The bar and food are pricey but good. If you want to sit out by the fire pits at night with a drink, walk about a block away to 7-11 and buy the beverages or snacks. Breakfast is cheaper next to the hotel on Beach st. at IHOP. Our room was noisy because of the location next to the RF line trolley cars, but the view of Pier 39 and the Cruise ships made it worthwhile. The windows even open up. Travelers should be aware that San Francisco is cold and wet 1/2 of the time. Everybody was going to buy jackets and such. BRING A JACKET with a hood. Be prepared for the high sales tax as well as misc charges all over the place. One place had 1.00 per person for universal health care!!!! Watch your receipts.

review.title: Do not eat here
review.reviewText: This hotel has a great location. It was clean and well maintained. The only warning I will give is do not eat here. They charge $5.00 as a delivery fee! My local pizza place only charges $1.50. Walk across the street to IHOP and enjoy a good meal at a reasonable price.

review.title: good location. Walking to most toristic areas.
review.reviewText: Really expensive parking service.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Good hotel near Fisherman's Wharf. Lovely, bright rooms. Small but nice swimming pool. Breakfast is very basic and breakfast room is rather small. Good to have on site parking facilities.

review.title: Don't expect to be able to park
review.reviewText: We've tried this hotel on a few occasions, each time only to be denied parking of our average-sized vehicle. One time it was during construction, so we halfway expected it then; this last time, there was no excuse to be denied parking. After a few minutes of hassling the poor parking attendant, he agreed for us to leave our car and he'd hope a space opened up. One did and the car spent the next three days in their lot. Thank you parking attendant! The added disappointment was in the lobby staff's reaction to our discontent. They really didn't care that we were unhappy with the prospects of walking blocks to a parking lot, they didn't even appear surprised. This hotel should really consider not taking in the hourly, non-hotel guest cars that fill their lot -- at least not on the weekends. We will not stay here again. It's too bad, because they've got a prime location to get quickly to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Confortable
review.reviewText: Only complaint will be that we didn't get enough shampoo and soap in the second day of our stay..... Customer service excellent......

review.title: Great Location, Parking is Expensive
review.reviewText: From the outside this Sheraton does not look impressive but the inside was very nice and the room was spacious and clean. Front desk was helpful in answering our questions. Excellent proximity to Pier 39 and restaurants. The only downside is the parking - $49 to park overnight.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Our room was adequate with the following exceptions: Door to bathroom couldn't be closed off from rest of room, allowing too much light into rest of room. Bathroom tiny. Shower water pressure couldn't be regulated. Beds too small. Should be queens, at least. Wish it would have been interior room instead of facing the street, esp. when on the first floor. Would have liked to have known about car rental facility on the premises of hotel. Wouldn't have rented a car at the airport. Lots of transportation choices once at Fisherman's Wharf. Would have shuttled from airport then used public transportation or sightseeing tour busses and rented a car for one day only. They do let you bring your dogs! Ourdoor firepits with plenty of seating was a highlight of hotel. No jacuzzi :(, only pool.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: We selected this hotel for its great location and it did not disappoint. Easy walking distance to Piers, shopping, transportation.

review.title: Decor was unique and refreshing
review.reviewText: Great location, hotel staff courteous and friendly.

review.title: Conditional Recommendation
review.reviewText: We like this location as well as the atmosphere and layout which are very inviting. All of the services are delivered as expected. It's disappointing to be told at arrival that the king room you requested was not a commitment, and doubles would have to do. While advised of the parking cost, it's still a shock. Breakfast item prices are equally eye-popping. A personal dissatisfaction is the bathroom layout -- a phone booth sized toilet/bath with lighting that floods the rest of the room.

review.title: conveniant hotel for fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: nice clean hotel near to attractions of fishermans wharf, fire pits outside good idea but parking charges are high allow $50 per night

review.title: good location, restaurant is pricey
review.reviewText: Stayed at for two nights at the end of June. The room was comfortable an clean. The restaurant was nice, but pricey. We had sushi and drinks, but $100 was a bit high. The serve was good and we would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel, would visit again.
review.reviewText: Real nice hotel. Concierge service was on the laxed side, only recommended tours, not much help. Great location, close to everything. Only complaint, told us they had something special in our room for our anniversary - only thing we saw as a bottled water???

review.title: can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: my wife and i loved the outdoor fire place. it was a nice place to relax and enjoy a drink.

review.title: Great hotel by the wharf
review.reviewText: Most hotels by the whard are not that great, this one is as good as it gets. The only negative review I have is the bathroom is VERY SMALL! two people would have a small problem getting ready in the morning, let alone a family of four. The rooms are unique looking, fun, the hotel is clean, the firepits are very nice to site by at night with some wine. Besides the bathroom / counter space, i loved this place!

review.title: Sheraton Fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: We stayed for 10 days in June 2009. The positives, the price was very reasonable for the stay, the pool area was very pleasant and housekeeping services and the concierge were very helpful. Minuses -you will pay dearly for everything else including an exorbitant daily parking rate and high charges for Internet service, despite the fact that coffee shops a block away have free wifi, as do most motels in the country. The view from our window was of the roof top mechanical units, but we hardly spent any time in the room anyway. The hotel is located one block off of the wharf, a slighty seedy, very touristy part of town, kinda fun if you have kids as we do, but not the best place for adults with more refined tastes.

review.title: NO customer service...
review.reviewText: Rooms were an ok size but only 2 small drawers and 1/2 of a tiny closet. Internet not free. Lobby computers were told to me to be free but when my daughter came back with a bill for using the internet I wasn't too happy. Breakfast buffet was OK, not great nor worth the price. Hostess far more worried about you paying the bill and gratuity before you eat than about service. Parking excessively expensive.

review.title: Very nice.
review.reviewText: Location was great!

review.title: Will go back
review.reviewText: Clean and very close to the Trolley and wharf area.

review.title: Great Location and Service!
review.reviewText: I was so impressed by this hotel! The room was comfortable and cheery, the kids loved the pool. It was quite cool in SF when we were there (even in mid-June!), and there were outdoor seating areas with fires in the middle, which were extremely popular that evening. The next time we are in SF, we are definitely going back to this hotel!

review.title: San Francisco Trip
review.reviewText: The hotel employees were very nice and very accomodating. Its a nice place to stay since its close to all the nice place at the San Francisco Bay area. But the room is quite small, the the beds are not very comfortable and my son even found a bagel under the bed which I think has been there for a few days.

review.title: not impressed!!
review.reviewText: great location, nice clean room; but it ends there. construction style of this structure allows ALL sound from adjacent rooms to be heard in your room, the noices are constant. parking is $43 daily, but they park your car across the street for $21 which you could do yourself but they don't tell you this info.

review.title: Great location
