review.reviewText: The design was very modern and there were very nice fireplaces outside of the hotel. The hotel is perfect located at Fishermans Wharf. One thing I didn't like was, that the bathroom had no door.

review.title: Smashin' hotel
review.reviewText: At the end of a long journey, it's nice to be able to find that your booked hotel is first class - this one is, from the decor to the room comfort and facilities. The location is good - one block back from Fisherman's Wharf and there is a Dollar car rental office on-site too. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Adequate and well maintained
review.reviewText: We wanted a place to stay close to Fisherman's Wharf so this hotel was adequate for that purpose. Not much charm to it, as many other places in the area have. We would probably stay in North Beach the next time we visit San Francisco. The firepits out front were a nice place to sit on a cool evening. Would ask for a room with a view if we stayed there again since we faced a wall.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was a short walk from many activities like the North Beach area,Chinatown and the water front activities. However, the bathrooms were extremely small and narrow. I had a difficult time with my 6ft. 9in. body frame moving around in the small area that must have been designed by a 4 ft. designer. I am still looking for the gold plated parking garage. It is one thing to have an expensive general parking fee in a popular area, but to stick to hotel guests is another thing.

review.title: Good enough
review.reviewText: Very clean, modern, and well maintained Hotel with friendly and helpful staff. The rooms well well appointed and comfortable although on the small side, particularly the bathroom area, - no room for two people in there. This also meant there was little in the way of storage space. The breakfast was ok but a little expensive, - we ended up having breakfast at an Italian cafe just across the road. Car parking charges were also very expensive, - more than the cost of the car hire. As a result we cancelled our car hire for the trip and used public transport and bike hire. Overall though, a nice hotel and a great location for the Fishermans Wharf and Marina area. I'd stay there again.

review.title: Great location, lovely room but VERY noisy
review.reviewText: This is a lovely hotel which has recently been renovated to a very high standard. The room was spacious with modern welcoming decor and was a great base for our three nights in San Fran. The location is just about unbeatable and the overall experience was really good. HOWEVER: When the refurbishment was done, they clearly skimped on the joinery of the hotel which appears to be original 1960s vintage. We asked for a quiet room as we were travelling with a baby. What we received was a room outside the service entrance on one of the main roads. The single glazing meant that we experienced absolutely every sound in high definition from reversing rubbush trucks, trash compactors and passing heavy trucks all night. This was very disturbing for sleep but was really the only downside to the stay. On balance, I would stay there again but would probably demand a room away from the road.

review.title: There is probably a better hotel to stay at in the area
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was somewhat curtious, depending on who you spoke with. Parking was $50 a day for guests at the hotel. Unfortunately we had the room on the street car side on the second floor with the street lamp shinning in all night, which made the night brighter than the day in our room and very noisy. The decor was very fresh and swedish (ikea) looking; the bathroom was very tight. The proximity to fisherman's wharf was great.

review.title: Good price at the moment
review.reviewText: Location was excellent. The hotel's accomodations were very good but everything you have to paid extra. For starters the parking was "only" $45.00 per day, it doesn't matter you are a guest at the hotel. Wifi internet only at the cafe that was very expesive and you can eat were ever you want. We need to print our tickets for Alcatraz so we have to use the business center at the hotel. The rate to use the internet at the business center was very high. To buy our tickets through internet and print them we have paid $7.00 for no more than 5 minites. There is not fridge in the room only a coffee maker.

review.title: Extremely nice stay.
review.reviewText: Our visit to San Francisco and stay at the Sheraton was wonderful. The staff was extremely nice and all the accomodations were exceptionally clean and comfortable. I would recommend to anyone.

review.title: Very Nice !!!
review.reviewText: Everything at the hotel was great !! The only problem I had was with the parking!! $50 a day seems excessive to me if you are a hotel guest!! I really think they should do something about it....

review.title: Nice hotel on the wharf
review.reviewText: The Sheraton is a nice, clean, confortable hotel at Fishermans Wharf. Updated rooms are modern and attractive, as are lobby and public areas. The outside firepits and a nice touch on cool days. My only suggestion would be to offer free wi-fi throughout the hotel, not just the lobby. As with most if not all wharf hotels, there are no views from rooms.

review.title: Excellent trip!
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, staff were very friendly helpful. Location of the hotel is perfect. Very close to Fisherman's Warf and only a cable car away from Union Square. Safeway and Trader Joe's across the way. Will stay here again soon!

review.title: I would recommend!
review.reviewText: Easy check in...very clean room..customer service are great...Easy check out. Recommended Hotel to Stay. Just be aware of the parking fee, safe place to park your car but the fee's too outrageous and steep.

review.title: Definitely San Frans best hotel
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived at the hotel, we were blown away by it. From the friendly staff, to our comfy rooms, it was all good. The staff will help you with WHATEVER you need (with a smile). The room was great. Clean bathroom, flat screen, and a huge, ridiculously comfortable bed. They have these cool fire pits outside where you can hang out. Its two blocks away from Fishermans Wharf. There is a bus stop and a trolly stop right across the street in case you wanna catch a Giants game or go to a movie like we did. We had a great time in San Francisco and The Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf definitely contributed to it.

review.title: It was a great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful, I dont think it could have been better. The rooms were nice and the beds were really comfy. The hotel location was perfect it was walking distance to everything, which made it nice we didnt have to worry about transportation. I would definately go back and stay at this hotel again!

review.title: Sheraton Fishermans Wharf was Perfect
review.reviewText: Comfy beds, great housekeeping services. The concierge was really great in helping us figure out the bus/subway/caltrain/street car systems. The last hotel we stayed in had a "brand" name like the Sheraton but it smelled like old mold. This hotel was fresh, well maintained and well staffed.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf was a great hotel. Very clean, quiet and one block from Fishermans Wharf. Very nice location for families. If you want more night life, restaurants and shopping I would stay downtown. All in all the Sheraton was a very nice hotel and I would definitley stay there again.

review.title: Great hotel! Great Location!
review.reviewText: This is a very comfortable hotel in a great locaion. Fisherman's Wharf is where it all happens in SF and this hotel is right in the heart. Very near to Alcatraz and walking distance to trams & buses to get downtown. Also, very comfortable beds which is very important!!

review.title: Good Place!
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our hotel - it was really close to Fisherman's Wharf, cheap cab rides to downtown, easy access to shopping and the sites. The concierge was extremely helpful and gave us some fabulous suggestions on where to eat and where to go for entertainment.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location(1 block from pier 39), very friendly staff, clean rooms, overall it was aq great experience, would definately stay there agian if I visit San Francisco again.

review.title: Convenient, close to all facilities. Very comfortable.
review.reviewText: Very pleasant, clean hotel. Comfortable beds.

review.title: $53 for parking per day
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a very good location and is nice. The problem I have is how do you expense a $53 per day including tax for parking. I stayed 4 nights so you do the math.

review.title: Very satisfied deal
review.reviewText: The hotel sits on easily-accessible streets in Fisherman's Wharf, not busy streets of the downtown of San Francisco.

review.title: be careful
review.reviewText: The hotel personel were quite knowledgable of the area, i.e closet gas station. I had to swap out my room and they had no problem with that. The staff was A plus

review.title: Affordable,comfortable,convinent
review.reviewText: Newly renovated hotel, located two short blocks from the wharf. Hotel accents on nautical , ocean theme. Our room was spacious and very clean, the bathroom was a bit akward and small. We were quite disappointed in the view ( we overlooked a municipal bus lot)Overall a great value for the area, we would stay again, providing we recieved a room with a better view.

review.title: Great Location blocks from Fishermans wharf within walking distance
review.reviewText: I would recommend this Hotel. One note that I found helpful from another traveler was not to rent a car due to parking fees. So we just took a shuttle from airport to hotel. Very convenient! Hotel is within walking distance from most of the local attractions on wharf minutes from Chinatown. Resturants you name it. And you can always catch a ride on cable car!! Looking forward to visiting San Francisco again !!

review.title: Great for Pier 39
review.reviewText: Good location for the piers and entertainment on the Embarcadero. However the hotel decor in the east wing where we stayed was reminiscent of prisoners clothing (blue and white horizontal stripes)and it all looked a bit tired. Having stayed in several Sheraton Hotels across the world this was by far the least luxurious. The room was noisy from traffic, which could easily be solved with some decent double glazing.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Parking Fee should be included in Room Price

review.title: Highly recommend this hotel definetely 4 stars
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stayed there, I wish they had a jacuzzi tub, because at the end of the day, it would be greatly appreciated a nice dip in a jacuzzi

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: good location, cozy, clean, free star bucks coffee, but no parking there. ($50/day). across street safeway parking lot cost was just $25/per night time.

review.title: How a guest should be treated at the Reservations desk
review.reviewText: In my check of my hotel. I was rudely pushed out of line by another guest. The check-in person acknowledged that I was there first. The other person was told by the check-in person that I was there first. The check-in person continued to serve this person and even though he did not have a reservation. I did on the other hand had a reservation. I would have handled it in another manner if I was the check-in person. I would have explaned to the other person that we have rules in our hotel that make it manadatory that we serve the first person in line no matter what situation is dictated.

review.title: Location is perfect
review.reviewText: We did not stay in what I would consider the main hotel, our room was across the driveway from the main hotel. It was nice, just not special. Were on the ground level and there was some traffic noise. Exercise room and pool were nice, but we were looking for location, and if you want to be on the wharf, close to everything, this is the perfect place.

review.title: Great Hotel, close to everything.
review.reviewText: The Hotel was great. Very close to all the attractions at Fisherman's Warf. The only thing that was a bit much is that they charge you $43.00 a night to park your car; I thought that was a little excessive. I enjoyed the hotel and what it had to offer though.

review.title: Nice Clean but thin walls
review.reviewText: it was a great hotel but parking was 50 dollars which includes valet service...there is a dollar car rental there if you want to rent from them that way you dont have to drop off the car when yo are done. the only 2 thing i want to complain about is our card stop working on the last day and they had to reprogram it and the walls was so thin that you can here everything and people next door was so loud that it seemed like the episode in Friends...other than that it was good restaurant near by Pescatore was great and the cable car ride was also nearby.... will recommend it for sure but woldnt go back... want more provicy and also need to sleep more couldnt since it was too noisy

review.title: Nice hotel, expensive extra's
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed the stay and the room was nice, and the bed very comfortable. But the coffee bar and restaurant were very expensive.

review.title: Great hotel, Great location
review.reviewText: Buffet breakfast is expensive, but IHOP is just around the corner

review.title: Great location and excellent service
review.reviewText: Our room was comfortable and the concierge was so very accommodating. This location is so close to so much in San Francisco that it made renting a car unnecessary. The outside fireplaces were a lovely touch. The price was also very reasonable. The front desk and luggage service were wonderful. Bottom line: terrific. I would suggest this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Really friendly staff and great room. The fire pits outside were great! Location close to grocery stores, drug store, restaurants, and the piers.

review.title: Friendly Place
review.reviewText: Everybody was very helpful and polite.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Friendly staff...helped us get around town...the fire pits where cool & unique...rooms where bigger than expected & very comfortable...located in the middle of everything..didn't need a rental car for everyday...but did get one to drive to Monterry & Carmel Island for the day...had a great trip & would definitely stay there again..loved San Francisco!!!!

review.title: Super trip
review.reviewText: Great location and great service!

review.title: Clean and quiet
review.reviewText: I got a room at then end of the hall and it was divine. The bed was big, the pillows were soft and the colors were cheery. The room did seem a little bit rundown. I did ask for a bathrobe that never showed up and they did charge for internet when every other hotel in the area included it. Otherwise that, an enjoyable stay.

review.title: good place for one person
review.reviewText: I liked the location of the hotel. Most of the room was good but the bathroom and closet was the worst. You didn't even have room for your toothbrush on the counter. It was not a room for two people. When taking a shower you touched either the wall or the curtain. Way to small.

review.title: Excellent hotel!
review.reviewText: The room was large - especially by SF standards. The bed and bed linens were very comfortable and the room was clean. The location can't be beat - near Fisherman's Wharf and near the cable car turnaround. I highly recommend considering this hotel!

review.title: comfortable and clean
review.reviewText: accessible to sightseeings, comfortable room and good service

review.title: Great Place for Tourist
review.reviewText: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. The location was fantastic, next to all the tourist locations and for the price it couldn't be beat. Very close to the trolley and bus stops.

review.title: Less Noise
review.reviewText: The biggest issue we had with the hotel was the walls and windows were way too thin. You can hear every conversation through the walls and hear the action going on outside, making it difficult to get some rest. This was the only issue we had. Otherwise, the hotel was in a great spot.

review.title: will visit again
review.reviewText: hotel &staff very helpful. would recommend the Sherton to friends. Good location to wharf and other attractions.

review.title: nice location
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 1 week.The room was spacious and bed was comfy.Nice pool when weather was warm and fire pits in front are nice to talk with other guest and wait for taxi's.I was happy with hotel but not the dollar rental car that is in hotel.They are rude and car was disgusting and had a flat before we ever left the parking lot.The desk was no help to us.Easy to walk to all bus and trolley stops.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Clean- modern decor- bathrooms were a little small-

review.title: Comfortable hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We arrived in San Francisco after a long journey from New Zealand, and we were very impressed with the check-in service and the friendliness of staff. The room was a little on the small side, and a refrigerator would have been handy, but it did at least have a coffee maker and had interesting decor. We didn't use the pool as it was too cold but it looked nice. The hotel is in quite a good location, and we would definitely recommend.

review.title: Beware
review.reviewText: After booking online, we were informed by the front desk that although a room was guaranteed, the type of room was not.

review.title: Overall, an excellent Hotel at a reasonable price
review.reviewText: We stayed in a King room for four nights. The cleanliness and comfort were excellent although the toilet/shower/bath area was very cramped. The coffee maker was appreciated but a "mini" fridge was lacking. The location is excellent for touring S.F. and there are good eating places nearby. The pool is outdoors (although sheltered) and in April it was too cool outside to enjoy a swim. The service at the Desk, Concierge etc. was excellent.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: One of my favorite hotels in SF.

review.title: How Lucky Were We!!
review.reviewText: Before traveling it is important for me to research every option available in hotel accomodations. Therefore, one of the the reasons I chose the Sheraton at Fisherman's Wharf was because of the location -- only 2 blocks from the wharf. I also read it was recently renovated so I thought it had to be clean. Well, during our stay all I kept saying to my husband was this was an excellent choice, I couldn't have selected anything more satisfactory. Keep in mind I did consider higher end hotels in the area, but am so glad I did not stay in any of them. First of all it was truly immaculate (immensely important to me), and secondly it was centrally located. It was within steps of everything we wanted to do. Also, the hotel choice colors (soft blues, aquas and yellows) and flow of the main hallways and room was so soothing. Coming back to our room after a long day of touring was a reward in iself. I like staying at hotels that are nicer than my own living accomodations and this was it! The conceirge was always most helpful, staff always friendly and ready with a smile. The location was absolutely perfect. We were able to walk to the tour bus in the a.m. and be the first on line, didn't have to wait for a shuttle to pick us up to get us there. I would no doubt recommend this hotel to anyone for business or pleasure. Also, I would definitely return if I were again visiting the San Francisco Bay area and not bother to look for a different experience. It was perfect!!!

review.title: Beautiful hotel in the best location
review.reviewText: I went with my husband and two kids (ages 13 and 5) - we all loved the Sheraton! The location can't be beat - walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, the Trolley etc. There are great jogging paths nearby, and a great gym with yoga mats, weights, treadmills etc. The price was great but you have to pay extra for a frig. ($15/night) or a cot in your room. The pool is excellent with towels and loungers poolside. There are also gas fireplaces everywhere. There are coffemakers in the room which is also nice. For the price and location, it can't be beat!

review.title: GREAT LOCATION
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a very good location. The hotel itself is older and showing some wear, the showers are in need of upgrade. The room was bright and clean with the exception of the windows. The staff were generaly helpful. The restaurant is way too expensive! Much better food really close by especially for breakfast.

review.title: Well located
review.reviewText: The staff were friendly and very helpful. They even offered good advice for finding a good restaurant. We had rowdy neighbours but the security staff quickly responded to our call. The following day the staff were apologetic and offered us another room. The hotel is located one block from Pier 39, it is very well located.

review.title: Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: I highly recommend this hotel. We were able to check in early. The beds were super comfortable, the bathroom was clean and the TV was great. It was close to all the attractions that we wanted to see in San Francisco. Everytime we left and came back our room was cleaned and ready for us. It was a very good hotel.

review.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: Overall this was a nice place to stay. Our only complaint was that our room overlooked the city bus lot. Every morning @ 6am the buses started up and for some reason the all beeped even when not backing up. Automatic alarm clock every morning. On the bright side we didnt lose any time by sleeping too much.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: Stayed 6 nights with family of 4. Rooms are bright and modern. Close to Fishermans Warf and a number of restaurants. Great Location, friendly staff

review.title: Close to Tourists attractions
review.reviewText: The hotel was very close to Pier 39 and Fishermans Wharf. It was maybe a 10 minute walk to both. The Sheraton is located across the street from a supermarket and walgreens for those who forgot to pack something and an IHOP right on the corner of the hotel. We walked to Lombard Street/Ghiradelli Square from our hotel and it took us about 45 minutes, but it was definitely worth it. Very accessible to touristy attractions and cabs and public transportation. Definitely stop by Boudins Sourdough Bread House for breakfast.

review.title: Great place to stay while visiting San Francisco
review.reviewText: No comment

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton at Fishermans Wharf. It is walking distance to the Wharf, Pier 39 even Chinatown for a great meal. Or you can jump on a cable car a few blocks away and check out the town. The hotel is very clean it is lite and and decorated with bright colors.It is kid friendly as well. The staff was very attentive and they had a great resturant in the hotel with a delicious breakfast buffet. I would definately return.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: we had a nice time at the hotel. It was comfortable.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: The bed was wonderful

review.title: Great value holiday
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was very spacious and well set out. Room facilities were great. The fire pits outside provided a relaxed atmosphere and gave you the opportunity to chat to people from all over. The hotel food was also to a good standard.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Everything and everyone working at this hotel were so helpful and kind. Highly recomend

review.title: Our San Francisco trip
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, very comfortable. Right next to Fishermans Wharf Only downfall was the cost of parking at the hotel ($49/night)

review.title: Good hotel to stay
review.reviewText: Good hotel to stay

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Great location, close to all transit connections. Excellent service and helpful staff. Lots of good restaurants within walking distance. Hotel parking was very expensive but we parked on the street (free from 7pm-7am) then just got up and plugged the meter for an hour before we headed out. Could hear movement in the room above us in the morning, but apart from that the hotel was very quiet. The outside firepits are a nice touch. We'd definitely stay here again.

review.title: excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Service was great, concierge was EXTREMELY helpful with any and all plans we wanted to make.

review.title: NOT ACCOMMODATING
review.reviewText: SERVICE WAS NOT FRIENDLY ROOM WAS NOT CLEAN

review.title: Not too shabby...
review.reviewText: This hotel had a great location...a mere block away from Fisherman's Wharf, and within a short walking distance to the Cablecar Turnaround which can easily get you downtown to shop, sightsee, or link up with other main transit lines. My biggest issue with this hotel is the NOISE. I would HIGHLY recommend that if you book this hotel, insist on not staying on the first floor. We were located in a room at the beginning of a hallway, where everyone had to pass thru to get to their rooms....we could honestly hear everyone's conversations word for word. Further, our window looked right out to a main street, where many cars, buses, and people passed by. The noise from the hall combined with the noise from outside made it impossible to get a good nights sleep for our 4 nights there. In hindsight, we should have asked to move, which is super inconvenient but probably would have been worth it. Not too much else to say about the hotel other than that. The price was right, and it did the trick. The staff were friendly enough, but didn't really go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Not once did someone offer to help us with our luggage.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Everything was great (location, service, room etc), but soundproofing. Try to get a room on the top floor!

review.title: Well overpriced hotel
review.reviewText: We had many difficulties with the hotel. They said over the phone that refrigerators are in every room. When we got to the rooms there was no refrigerators. We called the desk and had to fight in order to get one as originally promised. Parking is extremely expensive. Way overpriced for staying in a glorified Motel 6.

review.title: Enjoyed our stay, convenient location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, but a bit too modernly styled for my taste. Staff was friendly,very clean. Prices in the restaurant for breakfast were very high, missed the option of a continental breakfast. Location near Fisherman's Wharf was perfect,great to use as home base.Rooms don't have any view, but we weren't in it long enough to care, also kind of noisy, lots of traffic going by. It sounds like I am complaining but no, it was a pretty good deal we got for our money!!

review.title: location & value can't be beat
review.reviewText: This modern and beautifuly furnished hotel far exceeded our expectations. Located one easy block from the restaurants, souvenir shops, and nightlife of Fisherman's Wharf, the hotel is popular with visitors from the US and abroad. Close-by are upscale Italian restaurants as well as more modest places like IHOP and Subway. Dollar Rental Car has a branch in the lobby, which made renting a car incredibly easy. The hotel provides wireless Internet access. Unfortunately, we did not take our laptops. When we went to the hotel's business center, we were not pleased to find that there was a 59-cent-per-minute charge for using one of their computers.

review.title: can't wait to return
review.reviewText: If you like a modern updated-retro 60's color scheme this is the place for you. The staff was excellent answered all question quickly and efficiently. Everything was ready when we arrived. Fabulous service.

review.title: Top hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel - service, location, quality of room and value for money.

review.title: The Good and the Bad
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great location. We were able to walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, and the cable car station. There were also many places to eat within walking distance. The hotel was clean, but not full of amenities - you have to pay for parking and internet.

review.title: Great service and location
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfectly located near Fishermans Wharf, the staff were all friendly and the rooms were bright and clean. The bathroom was very small, but nice. Loved the fire pits out the front - great to enjoy an afternoon cocktail by.

review.title: looking forward to coming back
review.reviewText: This is hotel was very nice, inside and out.... When I go back I will go back to the sheraton I will recommend it to my friends

review.title: Good location for Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Room was very clean and tidy and a reasonable size. Great location for the Fisherman's Wharf area and public transport system is good and easy to use. Safeway Supermarket was across the road - very handy for groceries, alcohol etc.

review.title: Everything as expected....EXCEPT FOR PARKING!
review.reviewText: Beware.....this hotel is lovely, great location, etc. BUT, be prepared to pay approximately 50 dollars for parking EACH day. I picked this hotel cause it was slightly less expensive than another 4 star, but was shocked at the cost to park in the hotel lot.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, gentle and quiet place near cable car, trolley bus, pier. Just a remark: parking for rental car very expensive.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel & location
review.reviewText: We were so pleased by the newly updated hotel decir and the location could not be beat for exploring the city. Considering the fair toom rates and wonderful accomodations the hotel is wonderful!

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: Was up above entrance to hotel and outside seating which had enclosed fireplace very noisy did not provide shower caps, clean linen overall not satisfied also would not give receipt when checking out was told only had zero balance would not even provide had written statement

review.title: Sheraton at the Wharf
review.reviewText: The only problem we had was the people up above us had a little kid that they let run around and stomp for hours at a time. We called the front desk and they did take care of it the first night but it happened every night all night long.

review.title: Pretty good for walking around Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The wharf and pier 39 are easily walked to. The room service is good. The only problem is that the sink area is not enclosed, so there is no room to change privately (the toilet/shower area is too small to be comfortable). Valet parking works very well but is expensive, as is the food. But San Francisco is amazing. I am sure that this is one of the most conveniently located hotels on the wharf. (The Radisson is right next to it.)

review.title: Wonderful Stay
review.reviewText: The staffs were really friendly and helpful, the hotel room was kinda small, but really clean and comfortable...The design of the hotel was nice, one thing we regret is we didn't get to sit outside to enjoy the fire place...it seem sooo relaxing...i will definitely go back to this hotel for my next visit!!

review.title: Great Location for San Fransisco attractions
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a weekend away, and found due to the close proximity of public transport and the area that all of San Fransisco and its attractions are accessible. Great hotel!!

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Good location, Nice Staff

review.title: good location , clean, small hotel
review.reviewText: overall , its a good hotel at a best location to stay, only disappointment is extra noisy heating system that did notable us get enough sleep at night and rooms were not as clean as you expect at Sheraton hotels. be aware of the extra expensive parking charges and in room internet connection. all together not a bad place to stay once, but there are much nicer places in the area for the same price

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel staff very friendly and extremely accomodating. The rooms small, bathrooms very small especially with two women getting ready and not enough mirrors. Housekeeping our dishes, trash etc, all remained they only made beds and restocked any items such as soap etc. Overall not satisfied. Old hotel, gym was decent.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: For the price you paid, the parking should be comp or discounted. Over-rated.

review.title: sheraton fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Nice, large hotel. Room had a not to practical balcony, with view to the valet parking of the hotel. Free internet only in the hotel lobby, couldn't access in my room. Cosy fire burning at the hotel lounge. Nice bar at the lobby.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Loved the location, quiet, centrally located for all the touristy attractions. Room was larger than normal, bath area was smaller than I'm used to but would definitely recommend the Sheraton.

review.title: Not Bad
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Free internet would have made the stay that much better.

review.title: Hotel without a soul
review.reviewText: Poor customer service. A hotel lacking atmosphere. Unfriendly staff.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: It is a nice hotel situated near the attractions but with no view.

review.title: great place
review.reviewText: the staff was really helpful and the location was great...

review.title: Contemporary designs and feel
review.reviewText: Contemporary style of hotel, not my style, however, I would go back. It was a very convenient location to Fisherman's Wharf and to public transportation. Overall a good place to stay.

review.title: Had a blast, we will be back soon
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay very much however the parking fee was way over priced

review.title: Average quality
review.reviewText: Lobby looks very good with fireplaces. But outrageous was a parking fee (with tax 49.02 per night) and in other hotels you can get parking for free. Also room was small and hotel floor has cheap "Ikea-like" motif. It is supposed to be 4 star hotel, but I would give it only 3 stars. Next time I will book a hotel with free parking.

review.title: Should Have Gone to the Ramada Across the Street
review.reviewText: The only nice thing about this hotel is its proximity to Fisherman's Wharf. Staying here is a very basic no-frills experience, because all they have are tight, smelly, oddly furnished rooms and little else in the way of the normal amenities such as a restaurant, bar, business center or anything else that a traveler might expect to find at an alleged four-star hotel. There is a little breakfast cove in the lobby -- that doubles as a wine bar through the rest of the day -- but everything here is tremendously overpriced, poorly presented and stale to boot. All in all, it was a very disappointing experience.

review.title: Very good location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay very much and would go back to stay there in a heart beat. Next time we go back to San Ftrancisco we will be staying at the Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf. Great staff!!

review.title: Quite cozy looking forward to our next visit
review.reviewText: The hotel was lovely and the location was close to the wharf, beautiful outside firepits. The only thing that bothered me was the price of parking. Outrageous.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location, just don't park there!
review.reviewText: The Hotel is great, only two blocks from Fisherman's wharf and Pier 39. The rooms are not the largest, but they are clean and the beds comfortable. The outside firepits are a wonderful idea since you can sit by them even during the rain and enjoy a cozy get together. The only drawback is parking which is with taxes $50.00 per night! Ouch!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Loved the location of this Hotel. Easy walking to shops, restaurants and attractions.

review.title: Can't Wait to go Back
review.reviewText: This hotel had everything to offer great location, friendly service etc... The hotel made for a pleasurable experience.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is near all the hot spots...Fisherman's Wharf, the boat that takes you to Alcatraz, shopping, dining, and even the trolley station. A definite must stay if you are planning on seeing the Fisherman's Wharf area. Also there is a Trader Joe's nearby which comes in handy in case you want to purchase a beverage or snack. You will not want for anything if you stay here. You can't beat the location! Also the room is decorated in vibrant colors and is very cozy.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Very happy with the hotel, the only problem we had was that our room was located across the street from the bus depot and we encountered a lot of noise, especially at night. You might want to ask where the room is located before accepting it.

review.title: A Great Deal
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very friendly and professional. Nice, clean room although a bit small but for the price and location, I can't complain. Nice, bright decor. Overall, I enjoyed staying there and would choose Sheraton's Fisherman's Wharf again.

review.title: Sheraton Fishermans way to go!!!
review.reviewText: It was the perfect hotel for the perfect weekend..

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: except for small bathroom/dressing area, hotel is great. love the fire pit - wish they have more.

review.title: Loved this hotel!
review.reviewText: Stayed over Valentines/Presidents Day weekend. The grounds and rooms looked like they were recently updated to look more modern. I stayed on the 4th floor (top level). There was a couch in it and a slanted window. If it werent for the rain, I wouldve had a great view of the hill. The bed was king-sized and very comfy. There was also a flat screen TV. What I enjoyed most is the location. It is not on the Wharf, but a mere two blocks away. Its a quick walk, and despite the rain, it was still very convenient to jaunt around the area. Its right across the street from a Safeway so if you forget any toiletries or need a cheap snack, just go there. What I didt like about the hotel were the costs of parking, room internet and room service. But I suppose thats to be expected. Parking came out to $49/night after taxes. My understanding is that this is a pretty general rate for any of the hotels in the Wharf area. Wifi for my room cost $15 per 24 hours. I saw people using their laptops in the lobby area so perhaps Wifi is free in the lobby? If so, then I guess Im the fool. :) As for room service, I ordered an ice cream sundae listed as about $10 on the menu, but after the "service charge" or bringing the food to your room, it came out to about $17. Much more than the exorbitant sundae I had a Ghirardelli and not as good. I shouldve just gone across the street to Safeway and made my own sundae! :) All in all, I would gladly stay at the Sheraton at Fisherman's Wharf again.

review.title: Great Location, friendly staff!
review.reviewText: We traveled to San Francisco for a week in February '09. The hotel was great! Perfect location to all means of public transportation, the cable car stop is just 2 blocks away.. My only complaint would be the $16 charge for internet and the walls are very thin. We could hear everyone walking above us!

review.title: Was good until...
review.reviewText: A fire alarm when off at 7:00 am in the morning of check out because of a small fire in one of the elevator shafts. Glad to know that the fire alarm works. The staff member checking me out asked how my stay was, and I said other than the fire alarm that woke me up early it was great. Staff member automatically assumed that I was requesting a refund/discount and with a slight attitude told me because it was an actual fire that wasn't possible. I had no intention of asking for refund or discount and was simply responding how my stay was because I was asked.

review.title: Great Hotel Near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel was all we needed. There were these great fire pits outside for evening hanging out that we just loved. We sat by them every night we were there. The staff was knowledgeable and helpful. The rooms were comfortable, but the hallways were freezing while we were there, not sure what was up with that. However, since the hotel was in such a touristy area, there weren't very many places open early in the morning. We were early risers and couldn't find anything more than IHOP for breakfast. But the grocery store was right across the street, so that was very convenient.

review.title: would go again
review.reviewText: the hotel was very nice, clean and fresh the decor would probley not be every ones taste though,the bed was lovely ! and a great location only downside drinks and food expensive in the hotel but would recommened this hotel and would definatly use it again.

review.title: OUT STAY IN SAN FRAN
review.reviewText: HOTEL WAS GREAT LOCATED IN A VERY WELL CENTERED PLACE WELL WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE FROM ALL ATTRACTION AND CLOSE TO TROLLY STOPS AND BELL HOP, CONSIGER VERY HELP WITH ALL REQUEST. LIKE ALWAYS OUR STAYS A SHERATON HAVE BEEN GREAT LOVE, THE BED AND PILLOWS. (SOFFFFFFFT) 0

review.title: Thoroughly Enjoyed My Stay But.......
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the perfect location, just a block from Fishermans' Wharf (Pier 39). This was my 2nd stay at the hotel and it appears to have undergone renovations since my last visit. The hotel and rooms were beautifully decorated. However, a much needed enhancement was definitely overlooked...better room soundproofing would have made time in the room significantly better.

review.title: Great place to call home base
review.reviewText: room was lovely and comfortable, but the bathroom was tiny and uninspiring and incongruous with the rest of the room.

review.title: Very good
review.reviewText: The hotel is very well located for tourism in San Francisco. It has a very nice and modern decoration in the roons. I really recomend this hotel.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: A nice hotel in a very touristy area. We were disappointed that there wasn't free WiFi in the room; although it was available for a hefty $15 per day.

review.title: Great hotel, great service
review.reviewText: The only complaint that I have is that the rooms were a little small. Other than that, the bed was comfortable. There was a flat screen HD t.v. in the room. The concierge was helpful and friendly as was the rest of the staff. My wife and I went there for our one-year anniversary and took the wine country tour that was offered, this was beautiful as well. There were fire pits outside of the hotel where you can smoke and have a drink while you soak up the atmosphere of the city. Great location. Would definitely recommend!

review.title: I'll go back
review.reviewText: Great location, close to all transit transpontation a Safeway across the street. The Hotel is newly renovated but, the room didn't have a minibar and the air condition a bit noisy.

review.title: WEEKEND GET AWAY
review.reviewText: Had a great time there the area near the hotel is right in the middle of everything and any thing for a short trip food shopping the sights and the out door fire pits was a plus due to the weather doing our stay and oh yes do ride the[F] cable car to everywhere fast and not expensive not a car friendly place to stay due to price of parking.would stay again.

review.title: very impressed with service on chrestmas day
review.reviewText: decor was pleasant and clean and modern

review.title: No Fridge No MiniBar - but otherwise ok
review.reviewText: The hotel was comfortable enough and in a decent location for Fisherman's Wharf. The big problem is it fell into that middle ground where it's too high a class to have a fridge but too low a class to have a minibar. The one thing I really dislike is having no form of fridge in a room. I probably should have checked that more carefully before booking, but in this day and age it's strange to be in a hotel lacking such a common item.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: Very pleasant Hotel, friendly and clean. The beds were very comfortable.

review.title: Nice place, great deal
review.reviewText: The location is great, walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, and an awesome breakfast place. They have little firepits outside of the hotel where you can sit and have drinks on even a cold winter night. My only complaint is that it was really noisy on the top floor with rain and wind banging against the window and the heater turning on and off, but it was otherwise a really nice stay.

review.title: satisfied
review.reviewText: Overall, the staff was friendly with the exception of the guy at the coffee counter.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: We booked a standard room. The room was exactly furnished as the picture on the website. My husband and 12 year old son thought it was to retro for their taste. I thought the colors were warm and inviting. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and always pleasant. The only real problem we had was at night we could hear the peolpe staying on the 3rd floor above our room walk. We recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be near the Wharf. No comment on the restaurant we never ate their. It would be nice to have a continental breakfast though. They do offer drinks/snacks in the evening where you can enjoy them by the outside fire pits.

review.title: More than we expected
review.reviewText: The serviceon desk exceeded our expectations! During a very hectic weekend wedding with mutliple functions around the city the staff was able to get us to events on time. Service with a smile was the order of the day.

review.title: internet reservations... what can you expect
review.reviewText: When we got there the reservation was for 2 double beds in a non smoking room, when we had paid for a single king smoking room so we weren't to pleased with that. They moved us to a king room but the whole hotel was non smoking making us a little upset that we couldnt even change if we wanted but we made the best of this and the hotel other than this was quite nice.

review.title: Excellent hotel with a great price/location
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Sheraton at Fisherman's Wharf over a 4 day, 3 night stay, and I was extremely impressed with what I got for the low price (granted it was December and off-season for San Francisco, but still...). The room was great with a very nice LCD television and two great beds with plenty of space. Everything was clean, and relatively noise-free. The service was excellent and everything was a far-cry from staying at the Hilton in the Business District earlier in October (which had a miniscule room and was higher priced).

review.title: It was worth it.
review.reviewText: Me and my lady definitely enjoyed the hotel and all its amenities. Really nice and comfortable room. 32" flat screen which is a lot better than 99.9% of hotels ive stayed at before. Also the location was unbeatable.

review.title: Sheraton Wall Centre
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and the service is fine but it was let down by the decore which needs a lot of refurbishment. Make sure you don't eat in as the room service was late and the food was bad! Value for money was poor. If the rate was cheaper then the hotel would have been acceptable!

review.title: newly redecorated rooms with great location
review.reviewText: walking distance to attraction in the area. Take the Super Shuttle to the airport.

review.title: Watch out for exorbitant parking fees
review.reviewText: At this hotel, we had to pay $43.00 a day for letting our car in their parking. We were not expecting this! Be warned!

review.title: Would highly recommend to other travelers
review.reviewText: We were very satisfied with many of the amentities of the hotel. The concierge was very helpful with ways to get around the city. The rooms were clean. We did not eat in the cafe so I cannot comment. The hotel is one block from the cable cars and 1/2 block from the streetcars. Beautiful accommodations!

review.title: vagabonds
review.reviewText: Very comtemporary styling of hotel. Good location. Great customer service. Confined San Francisco influenced lack of roominess in bathrooms. Awesome Treadmills in workout room. Parking was unexpectedly very very expensive.

review.title: I would recommend this hotel to anyone!
review.reviewText: Hotel was in great location, walking distance to shops, restaurants, public transport and tourist attractions. Hotel was really clean, had really comfortable beds, very little noise, nice atmosphere with the fire pits outside and very helpful staff. I would definitely stay there again and recommend the hotel to others.

review.title: Great Vacation
review.reviewText: Hotel was great and my wife and I had a great time. Hotel is located very close to all the attractions. My wife and I would go back next time we go to San Francisco.

review.title: Best Place to Stay In San Francisco
review.reviewText: I have been going to San Francisco for both business and vacation. Each time I go I stay at the Sheration Fishermen's Wharf. The hotel is great and since they have re-model it is even better. I love the outside fire pits. You can sit and either read, eat or work on your computer. Also since it is so close to the Wharf and Pier 39 it is the best. When I there for business, again everything is right there. I will never stay anywhere else.

review.title: Didn't feel like a 4-star hotel
review.reviewText: The main attraction of this hotel is its locations, a block from the Warf, two from Pier 39. The property is decorated in a art deco look, with bright colors. If you prefer a more traditional look or a contemporary look, this hotel is not for you. The hotel doesn't feel like a 4-star hotel, as it's categorized.

review.title: Great location and friendly staff
review.reviewText: The place was nice and the hotel staff was very friendly. Great location. We were disappointed when the concierge tried to talk us into attending a time share seminar so watch out! Overall good experience.

review.title: Will not go back!
review.reviewText: Lacking quality of service and they do not seem to care for the overseas traveller. Food quality was a little short when compared to other US destinations we stayed at.

review.title: Like a rock star!
review.reviewText: I was treated like a rock star. Everyone was extremely pleasant and eager to insure that my stay was exceptional. And it was. Thank you.

review.title: close to everythign
review.reviewText: It is was small room, nice bedding and small beds. Nice tv and pretty quiet room. It has updated decorations. The concierges is wonderful and so helpful. Heated pool, and Safeway nearby! Quick check in and out, and car services available. Just a great location for fun at the Wharf! No refrigerators or microwaves. We had a poolside room which was quieter probably than the street side. Darren's was a good cafe!

review.title: New renovation room
review.reviewText: Just renovated, everything looks new and clean. bed feel comfortable. just facing a big bus parking log, little bit noisy, but it can be tolerated.

review.title: Great hotel close to attractions
review.reviewText: Hotel was very accomodating. Staff was knowledgeable on how to get around. Close to attractions. Would go back again.

review.title: Great, Relaxing Hotel in a Wonderful Location
review.reviewText: I recently visited the Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf hotel for a girl's weekend out and had a great stay. The room was comfortable and clean and the atmosphere of the overall hotel was relaxing. In an effort to extend the weekend throughout Monday, I had to make arrangements to take business calls in my room. The hotel was very accomodating and pushed my check-out time back to 1:30pm. The location can't be beat as it was next to the Powell Cable Car Line that heads up to Market St. and the F Line that takes you down to the Ferry Terminal. With that being said, taking advantage of mass transit in San Francisco is a must because parking is very expensive. I'm glad I called ahead because the hotel charges $50 a night for parking!

review.title: Good hotel for the buck
review.reviewText: Overall decent hotel.

review.title: I enjoyed my stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was great! two drawbacks: internet was not free and neither was breakfast.

review.title: Clean, redecorated, comfortable but a tad small
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel with a great location just one block over from the wharf and a 2 minute walk from the rainforest cafee and ripleys museum. It's a 10 minute walk from the main cable car terminus for the hyde/powell line. Very clean, looked newly decorated in very summery colours - a beach look with a trendy twang. Rooms were a little small for such a pricy hotel, especially the bathroom, however the hotel does have a nice modern feel with a very smart trendy lobby, bar and communal areas. I was stunned at overnight parking costing 43 dollars (even by San Francisco wharf areas), and the bar was a little pricey - although the outside firepits were great to sit around and have a beer. Staff service was exceptional - only marred fractionally by bar service. Reception could do with more people working there however they were friendly, helpful and efficient.

review.title: Fairly Okay
review.reviewText: People providing services were very nice and aimed to please. Decor was kind of lackluster, but people's tastes vary. One thing that was really disappointing was finding a pillow covered in lots of hair one day after room had just been serviced (we found out only after flipping it over. It didn't give a good feeling as to the throroughness of cleaning. Another very disappointing thing was that you had to pay for internet service in the room..and along with so much other nickel and diming that we ended up spending much more than we had intended. Breakfast is overpriced and not that great. Valet services were excellent though. Overall though, the location is great and it was a fairly good stay.

review.title: Pleasant stay at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: If you like clean, neat, laid-back San Francisco, with outdoor pool, Starbucks coffee, and seclusion from the trolleys and buses, the Sheraton is a good choice and at a good price and in a prime location. I hated to leave and I usually hate staying in hotels. A+

review.title: Great, great, great
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Great location, Great and helpful staff. But request a room off the streets!

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Stayed here for 3 nights and did the tourist thing. Excellent location for Fisherman's Wharf- we were only 1 block away from the action and easy lunch and shopping options. Lots of sightseeing tours depart from within a block, and 2 Starbucks within walking distance! Extremely happy with the hotel staff, service, condition. Could hear the cable car go by and soemtimes the room above, but not bad. Love the light, bright decor and little cafe off the lobby for breakfast!

review.title: There was a mouse in my room...
review.reviewText: ...and when I called to let them know, the front desk agent let me know that "they sometimes come into the hotel to get out of the rain!" The food was horrible and the accomodations seemed dated and dirty.

review.title: very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very good location, nice hotel, recently renovated. I would recommend it

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was located right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf, and had a tram stop within 20m, making it extremely convenient for getting around. The hotel was quiet, the staff were excellent - I was able to check in at 10am when I arrived instead of 3pm. Plenty of restaurants around made up for the lack of an in house restaurant for dinner. Good value too.

review.title: pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText: was a little nervous about staying there after reading some of the other reviews. Hotel was great! Good location, room was recently renovated, clean and well decorated. The firepits outside are a great idea. Definetly would stay again and would not hesitate to recommend for others to stay.

review.title: good and clean
review.reviewText: recently remodeled very nice

review.title: Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The Sheraton was billed as a 4 star hotel but, although the staff were all very helpful, the hotel itself was not much more than the equivalent of a Travellodge of Holiday Inn Express. Very disappointing.

review.title: Geat time again !!!
review.reviewText: The remodel is very nice, enjoy the fire pits, heated pool is chilly!

review.title: Good Place to Visit Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel was in an excellent location and the staff was great. Parking was pricey, it's cheaper across the street.

review.title: Fantatic Location - woulld stay again next time
review.reviewText: Great service and location. Several forms of public transport stop outside the door. Easy walking distance to local attractions. 3 blocks from a laundromat - cheaper than hotel sevice and easy to get your washing done. Safeway across the road for snacks and drinks.

review.title: very clean and fresh
review.reviewText: Upon entering the lobby,I found it to be rather cold. The decor is very California, with what seemed minimal furniture.The rooms were nice,again minimal decor. Very comfortable beds.Our a/c didn't work well,but was quite noisy. It was rather noisy at night.I would not recomend a room facing the street.All in all it was a great place to stay .The location was perfect and the hotel staff very friendly and helpful. We eally enjoyed sitting around the outdoor fireplaces in the evening, rather than being stuck in a hotel room.

review.title: A comfortable hotel, adjacent to all the attractions and seafront.
review.reviewText: Four floors, good lifts.Ample restraurant in the Hotel. Staff very good, ready to help.

review.title: Hotel was in a convient location and had everything that we required.
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Sheraton for 2 days as a stop before flying on to Hawaii. The hotel has recently been refurished and is very modern. The rooms were very comfortable the only down side that there wasn't a mini bar. Staff were friendly at check in and also helped us arrange a taxi to the airport on departure. We picked this Hotel mainly for it's location and we weren't disappointed, Pier 39 is just a block away with has many excellent places to eat and has a great view of the Golden Gate and Alcatraz. A great place to go for breakfast was just around the corner IHOP which is open 24 hours which is really good if your going on a early morning trip. Getting around on the trams is also very simple, it's $2 a ride and they go all over. There's a stop just outside the hotel which will take you to the main shopping centre.

review.title: Not worth the price
review.reviewText: If you are on foot and want to spend the majority of your time at the warf it is still a little expensive considering the room quality. The air conditioner didn't work very well. I was impressed with the lobby then disappointed when I got to the room.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel has great modern interior. The outside fire pits are very nice. Located in heart of Fisherman's Wharf. The only minus- since the hotel is located by a busy street- the outside noise (bus, cars) was little bit annoying. In general great place to stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel :)!

review.title: great
review.reviewText: excellent services

review.title: Loved everything about this trip!
review.reviewText: We booked a king bed at the hotel for 4 nights. The first night we got there they explained to us that they did not have any king rooms available, so that was a little disappointing. He explained to us that you are only guaranteed a room, not necessarily the room you "Requested". (same with all hotels when booking through a 3rd party) But the man that checked us in was extremely helpful and he said we will have some king rooms available the next day to make sure all of our items were packed up and come back in the am. We went down nice and early to ensure we got a king room when it became available. We went off for the day and when we came back not only did he get us a king room, he got us a king room with one of the few balconies in the hotel and he had all of our stuff moved to the new room so we didn't have to do anything, which was great! The hotel is in a good location, because it is close to the touristy areas, but you could also hop public trans. (right outside the hotel) pretty much anywhere you want to go. It is within walking distance to the Alcatraz tours, Pier 39, Ghiradelli Sq, & the cable cars. Our flight wasnt until 11pm and we didnt have a hotel for that day, so the bellman held our luggage for the day so we could get the most out of our trip. The fire pits outside/lounge area came in handy, when we had no where to go while waiting for our shuttle. Overall we had a fantastic trip and really enjoyed the hotel and all the great staff that they have there.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Great little hotel in a great location. The outdoor firepits were a big hit.

review.title: Great location, friendly staff, would go again
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful (honestly). Upon check-in I asked for a crib and the staff had one to our room almost immediately. The room was very clean and comfortable, everything felt very up to date. Nice bigger than expected flat-screen tv. The location is terrific being right near the Warf and the surrounding shopping. It was very helpful having a grocery store literally next door. Mass transit and bus route stops are within one block, can go almost anywhere in the city. I would recommend avoiding the expensive hotel breakfast and go to the IHOP a block away. I will definately stay here again.

review.title: Weekend in San Francisco
review.reviewText: see travelers tip

review.title: Nice European Style Hotel
review.reviewText: The proximity to Fisherman's Wharf is ideal. The decor is retro European circa 1970 and very nicely done. Great ambiance. I will definitely stay here again. Budget $45 per day for parking.

review.title: Everything was great including the location
review.reviewText: The staff from the beginning could not have been nicer. They were very helpful, and provided us with maps and festivities going on while we were staying there. The rooms were really cute and comfortable. The location was great, within walking distance to just about everything with easy access to the cable cars. Can't wait to go back.

review.title: Not bad for the money
review.reviewText: Great location and close to everything. You can walk almost anywhere from this hotel. It is very nice, but the rooms are very small with no counter space in the bathroom. It's okay if there are only two of you, but very cramped for a family of 4. You have to pay for wireless and it is only moderately reliable and it's expensive. Restaurant was closed every time I went by, so I cannot comment. The bar was nice, with outside seat and fireplaces, but also very expensive.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is a very practical location for everything you need to see in San Francisco. Within walking distance of everything on the wharf and very close to the historic cable car to access the central area of the city.

review.title: well located
review.reviewText: If you require a room that is quiet at night, do NOT stay in a roadside room - request a room facing the pool. We moved rooms and found the pool facing room excellent.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is very convenient to all of the major attractions and easy walking distance to others. Friendly, helpful staff. Clean, well maintained hotel. Only breakfast buffet but 100's of restaurants within a short radius of the hotel.

review.title: Great location, new rooms, but staff not so friendly..
review.reviewText: Overall, the hotel was very good. On the negative side the bathroom was small, the price for breakfast, drinks etc was quite high but definately one of the best hotels for the price in the area.

review.title: Just what we wanted
review.reviewText: The hotel is very central to the tourist centre at pier 39 and has a very relaxed feel. The room was well equiped and clean. The king size beds are so good. My 15" laptop fitted inside the safe. It is a hotel that is towards the upper end of the market but you don't feel out of place. Not stuffy! Would stay here again.

review.title: Only recommend if you ask for a room that is NOT street side!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: Overall, the hotel was clean with friendly staff. Also, was within walking distance of numerous shops, restaurants, grocery store, etc. The breakfast buffet in Sol was very good with excellent wait staff. On the negative side; not all of the fire pits were operational, parking fees were incredibly expensive, trucks/buses/Muni/emergency vehicle sirens could be heard street side all hours of the night. Garbage trucks run all hours of the night as well (?).

review.title: Pet friendly hotel
review.reviewText: I was traveling with two dogs, and they were able to accommodate my special request of being on the ground floor, close to an exit. The location was within walking distance of several activities. One negative was that parking was very expensive.

review.title: A good hotel
review.reviewText: My little family stayed at the Sheraton at Fisherman's Wharf on our honeymoon. We had never been to San Francisco, and had always wanted to see it so it was the perfect opportunity. The Sheraton is in the perfect location. It's in short walking distance from all of the attractions on Pier 39 and about 10 blocks away from Ghiradelli Square. The hotel staff was friendly and our room was cleaned perfectly every day. The only negative things about the hotel are: Parking is ridiculously expensive- about $43 per day... but there is little parking in San Francisco, so we had to give in and pay. Also, the accounting department charged us for the hotel when we had already paid through Expedia. They fixed the problem very efficiently, so it wasn't a big deal, but watch your Folio at the end of your stay just to make sure.

review.title: COMUNICATION
review.reviewText: I AM FROM MEXICO, I SPEAK SOME ENGLISH, I GOT TO THE HOTEL VERY LATE, VERY TIRED, AND THERE WERE JUST TWO CHINESE GUYS IN THE DESK, IT WAS A GREAT PROBLEM TO UNDERSTAND THEM !!!!!

review.title: Good class hotel with extremely friendly and helpful staff.
review.reviewText: We spent 4 nights at the Sheraton Hotel in Fisherman's Wharf. We were pleasantly surprised by the comfort, newness and cleanliness of the hotel overall. The room was a good size with nice furnishings. The washbasin was outside the bathroom with the wardrobe behind. The only complaint I have is that the light in the bathroom (which also housed the toilet) was a bit dull. But that could only be beause I like a bright bathroom particularly where there are no windows. The housekeeping staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We asked for more sachets of coffee and more milk cartons which they readily gave. The concierges were particularly helpful. One recommended a ferry trip to Sausiloto which we didn't know about. Another made a reservation in a top class restaurant which is usually booked up months in advance.

review.title: Good hotel but noisy
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, completely renew, excelent location only problem is the sound of the street and above floors...

review.title: Good location, bit overpriced
review.reviewText: Exelent location, but should be chipper. Free internet in the lobby. I was on the first floor and got the lobby connection.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed 3 nights at the Sheraton and was extremely happy that we booked with them. Great location (although based in a slightly touristy area), easy access to Motorway, Golden Gate Bride and Fishermans Wharfe restaurants and bars. Also all public transport just outside the door so very easy to get around. Rooms were clean, bright, newly decorated and large enough for 3 girls. No need to book per person, just book twin beds as all rooms have double beds as I was told after paying the extra person fee. Def recommend.

review.title: Hidden High Cost for Parking
review.reviewText: When I stay at any hotel I usually assume that the parking for hotel customers is free or at a low minimal charge. I was wrong because at this hotel they are trying to make easy money on their parking. I arrived at the hotel late at night and parked on the hotel premises. I was shocked in the morning when they told me the hign cost of the parking fees. Maybe that is why I received a small discount on my room to subsidized my high parking fee. I became even more disappointed with the hotel when all I did was park outside the Hotel and my fee was free. Is this hotel trying to make a profit on their parking? Is it because they are not making a profit on their rooms. Well, it doesn't matter I would not recommend this hotel to anybody because of this incident. I ended up staying in San Fran an extra couple of days but I am pleased to say that the other Hotel treated me like a King but at a much lower rate and "free parking". Thanks,

review.title: A Perfect Travellers Hotel
review.reviewText: Very clean & welcoming. Staff very polite. Service excellent. Walking distance for all amenities in Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Free Internet Access to rooms would be appreciated
review.reviewText: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, and found it more very comfortable. Free internet services to the rooms would have been a great asset. The charge of US$14.50 for 24 hours was not someting we were expecting. I think that for the quality of the hotel, free internet services would have been a nice touch.

review.title: What a delight...
review.reviewText: The Hotel was a delight. From the quality room service, Open Bar, & Outdoor Fire Place, to the scenery, great price, cleanliness, and friendly staff. The highlight wasn't the comfortable bed although it was a nice surprise but location, location, location...The hotel was in walking distance to the famous Fisherman's Wharf! The Restaurants, the Boardwalk, and entertainment.

review.title: Most comfortable beds.
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with the Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. I booked all of our outside excursions through the hotel with ease.

review.title: Loved It. It was different from other hotels.
review.reviewText: We were really impressed with this hotel. All the staff was courteous and friendly. The front desk clerks were helpful on the best room choice, the bellman was prompt and friendly, and the staff at the lobby cafe and bar uncorked the wine we had purchased in Sonoma that afternoon. She even gave me two wine glasses to enjoy the wine in the comfort of our room. The decor is bright, colorful and cheerful. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to all my family and friends. I've travelled alot and stayed in many hotels. Most times I would choose a different hotel if I travelled to the same destination again, but next time I'm in San Francisco, I would definitely choose Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Nice enough but, expect extra fees for everything.
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was comfortable enough, fine and satisfactory. I was, however, amazed that everything else was an additional charge. A small coffee in the lobby (morning) was $3.00, the newpaper in the hotel was .75, parking my car was $43.00 per night, using the computer in the hotel business center to print a airline boarding pass was $5.00, etc. My point is that absolutely nothing aside from your room itself is included in the nightly fee. I travel for work quite a bit and all the incremental charges did surprise me, as I usually get these same ammenities for no additional charge. Parking my car cost more than the actual rental for the week.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed for 3 nights (2 people). The rooms are clean and decent size. Service is friendly. You have to pay for wireless access in your room but it is free in the bar/lobby area. 42" LCD TV was a nice surprise. Only thing missing for me was a mini-fridge. Food & drinks at the hotel are expensive but there are plenty of other options outside. Location is perfect; close to Pier 39, walking distance to the Italian neighborhood and chinatown.

review.title: A Really Good Deal
review.reviewText: Newly refurbishments to rooms make this a very good quality and reasonably priced hotel. Rooms very, very comfortable. Unfortunately we were allocated a corner room overlooking a cross roads which was extremely noisy at nights and from 3am in the morning due to street cleaning, rubbish removal and traffic. Friends occupied another room in another location which was very quiet.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: exellent hotel but car parking very expensive for guests

review.title: Rooms good size.
review.reviewText: Great vacation location.

review.title: Would happily stay again
review.reviewText: End August / beginning September, booked in for 4 nights so we were allocated a room on the fourth floor as it would be quieter and it was. Superb location close to Fishermans Wharf. Room a good size. Beds very comfy. Recently refurbished and very bright and cheerful. Great coffee machine.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Thoroughly enoyed our stay and didn't want to come home. Hotel was bright and clean and in the perfect location for everything we wanted to do. If we had one critisism it would be that a hotel of that size could do with a seperate bar area away from the reception and lap tops but we would definate stay there again and recommend it to friends and family.

review.title: some issues
review.reviewText: I was disappointed in the conincierge. He/she didn't know a lot which was suprising.

review.title: As always very good place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a very good location for someone looking to tour the sites. I wouldn't recommend it if your looking for great food at a reasonable price. Too touristie!

review.title: VERY IMPRESSED
review.reviewText: VERY CONVENIENT TO WALK TO WALF AND NEARBY SHOPPING EATING AND CABLE CAR AS WELL AS OTHER PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION. GREAT LOCATION.NO VEHICLE MEEDED TO GET AROUND WARF AREA.VERY EXPENSIVE PARKING FOR PRIVATE PARKING EVEN AT THE HOTEL.

review.title: hotel recommended
review.reviewText: Nice location. Very nice room.

review.title: stereotypically brilliant usa service
review.reviewText: it's proving hard to say anything bad frankly. the location's ideal for the wharf in particular and easy and quick transport to all points san franciscan. all staff were top notch without exception but not cheesy, sucky or ott. hotel decor is very unusual, modern in style and the hotel's condition is generally good. free ice and cheap vending on each floor. pool and poolside and external ground floor terraces very pleasant and relaxed. pool was a wee bit chilly bearing in mind it was supposed to be heated. poolside and terrace heaters were roaring as and when required. our room was delightful, great air con, tv set up, in-room internet (pay), free lobby internet, good fixtures/fittings, storage, safe, iron&board, hairdryer. if anything, bathroom was a weak point but only in relation to fantastic other features because actually not bad at all. no view from our room but we weren't there to sit about our room looking out! downstairs bar and reception areas are all very pleasant and well maintained and if you have your laptop with you the free wireless access is gold (in room wireless is approximately $15 u.s. per day). we would have no hesitation at all recommending this establishment to all.

review.title: Fantastic holiday
review.reviewText: Fisherman's Wharf itself is a bit touristy, but the hotel is set a couple of blocks back so the surrounding streets aren't too crowded. There are good bus and streetcar links (we particularly liked the f line)and a big supermarket on the next block for water/fruit/snacks etc. The room itself was bright, large, modern and spotlessly clean. It looked out onto a sort of internal court so there wasn't any view, but that wasn't important to us. We were there for a week and the only thing I would criticise was that (for the four of us) we could have done with more clothing storage. Our holiday was in the last week of August and the American children seemed to have gone back to school, so the attractions weren't too busy (although Labour day was).

review.title: You can find better
review.reviewText: The hotel is Ok. However, it is very noisy and the walls are paper thin. We had to change rooms as the 1st room we were given had a tram and bus stop outside the window. Location is good.

review.title: Excellent stay
review.reviewText: For our first trip to San Francisco,staying at the Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf was the perfect location. There was easy access to the different areas we wanted to visit. The hotel itself was nicely decorated, the staff was courteous, and the rooms were spotless. The only fault that my husband and I found were the outrageous parking fees.

review.title: I liked it!
review.reviewText: Every service person we dealt with was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was a good size and had lots of comfy pillows. Also, the TV was awesome! One downside to the room: you can't use the light in the bathroom w/o also turning on the light in the room with the sink, which doesn't have a door. So if you need to use the bathroom in the middle of the night, the light will likely wake your fellow guests! A highlight: the outdoor firepits. It was quite pleasant to sit at one at night with a drink and a friend. It's also a great location: one block from Fisherman's Wharf, and right next to a grocery store and a convenience store.

review.title: Buffet restaurant isn't that good. Quite expensive.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel room. Very clean and comfortable. Except the restaurant isn't that good.

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: THe hotel is in great location. The concierge staffs are very helpful and professional. Great stay. Would consider to stay again if I am in the same area.

review.title: We will be Back!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location. Minutes walk to fisherman's wharf and pier 39. Cable car turnaround just 2 blocks away. Will return to this hotel when in town.
