review.title: Close to everything; restaurants, wharf attractions, sightseeing tours
review.reviewText: Overall I liked the hotel, clean, eficient service and pleasant peronnel. I would go back. But, on the minus side...first, the prices of the hotel food (water, muffins, snacks, fruit, coffee) were absolutely outrageous at a four-times the mark-up. Buy as much as you can at the pharmacy chain store located on the next block. Second, we ate meals out anyway, but, since we were there for three nights, we wished the room had a small refrigerator to at least keep water cold.

review.title: Everything's great
review.reviewText: Beautiful decor and really clean. Great location, close to most things. Love the fire pits.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The Sheraton had a great location to Fishermans Wharf and public transportation. However the location of the rooms in the hotel on the street side were very noisy. It was disruptive to sleep. The room was very small and I was told there were no rollaway beds available at this hotel even though the option was available upon booking. Internet should be free in the Lobby and breakfast in the lobby was a little overpriced at 20.00+ a head. The location was great but next time I would opt for a more comfy hotel in a less convenient location. Also was musty smelling and a lot of people smoking very close to or in the hotel itself. Employees didn't seem to care.

review.title: Convenient and Clean
review.reviewText: The Sheraton is walking distance to the wharf. The entire Hotel breathed friendliness and comfort. Our family of four enjoyed our weekend trip

review.title: Better the first time
review.reviewText: Second trip to this hotel - liked it better before the "modern" renovations. Still a good location, great service. Higher end of pricing.

review.title: Noise
review.reviewText: The hotel had a was in a good location, had a good gym and a decent pool. However, the room we were given overlooked the valet parking area and was extremely noisy. In addition, it had no air conditioning and the windows barely opened. Overall very poor value for money.

review.title: We loved it!
review.reviewText: My family and I stayed at the Sheraton for nine nights in August and thoroughly enjoyed the stay. We chose the hotel mainly for its pool but little did we know how cold and windy SF was so we didnt get as much use from this as we thought. Everything was clean and the staff were very friendly.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: For the price and location of the hotel I was truely not impressed with the hotel at all...

review.title: Extremely impressed with service, location, and hotel features
review.reviewText: Extremely impressed with service, location, and hotel features

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was located in a very good place. Walking distance to many attractions. Staff was great with providing directions to local attractions, dining and shopping.

review.title: Nice . . .but. . . .
review.reviewText: We had a great deal to stay, but was not told about the $46 a night parking charge until the day we arrived. It was a short walk to Fisherman's wharf and other local areas - which was good. Eat outside of the hotel, cheaper.

review.title: don't move from one room to another without being aware of the risk
review.reviewText: Hotel staff lost item when moving our stuff to another room. Staff, although apologetic, simply were not helpful. We moved to another room because of noise, creaky floorboards overhead, and elevator reverberating through room. Staff was aware and notified us that it was noisy room, but all available when arrive later. Great Location!!!! but amenities do not offset lack of customer service and inherently noisy hotel!

review.title: bathroom
review.reviewText: The bathroom in our standard room was on the small side, especially compared with other cheaper hotels we stayed in on our trip.

review.title: Lovely Wharfside Hotel.
review.reviewText: Very clean hotel, the beds were very comfy - great night's sleep every night. Staff very helpful and friendly. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the Fisherman's Wharf area.

review.title: Our 1st choice when we visit again.
review.reviewText: We will stay here when we go back to Fisherman's Wharf. It's location was perfect. We were in walking distance of all the attractions. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, and the staff were always curtious and helpful. I would recommend this hotel for anyone wishing to stay at San Francisco's waterfront.

review.title: Service great but not a comfortable hotel.
review.reviewText: The first room we were given was right onthe corner of two busy streets in Fisherman's Wharf. So noisy we couldn't even watch TV. No towel rack in bathroom. Where do you put your towel? Very tiny room. Asked for a quieter room. Second room quiet but again no towel rack next to sink. Had to run across the bathroom to dry hands. No vanity whatsoever in bathroom. Had to leave all toiletries in suitcase. I have to say the service was excellent. Sorry to say the rooms do not meet this standard.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Convienent to the whole city. I especially liked the fire pits by the pool and outside the registration area.

review.title: Upgrade has downgraded this hotel.
review.reviewText: Booked for 14 nights. Was given a room directly above the service entrance. 5am, 3 drivers laughing and joking outside on the street. Next, along comes the lorry to uplift the rubbish skip. This is dragged out from under along the sidewalk. So after a long 11 flight from the UK we are wide awake for 6:30. There are only blinds on the windows so when we are dressed at 9:30 I open the blinds and there virtually at room height is the open top tourist bus, so we are now one of the sites to see in San Francisco. Needless to say we immediately got a room change. We stayed here 4 years ago and really like the reception area with large couches and chairs and a big fire at the top. This has now been replaced with small tables and chairs, plastic coated, with a bar now at the top. Needless to say the prices are way over the top. Outside they have small seating areas with hot coals, when they work. Didn't like the maid casually advising me she would "be off now for 2 days and won't see you again" meaning can I have my tip. Don't think we will stay there again. Internet at $0.59 a minute is an absolute rip off. Most big hotels offer it free.

review.title: Could be a lot better!
review.reviewText: Firstly, San Francisco is a great place to visit. However, there are probably better places to stay than the Sheraton. First the plus points: The hotel is clean and smart in appearance and the rooms whilst not big are adequate and comparatively well equipped. The cleaners do a good job and are honest; I accidentally left our safe open one day with my laptop, passports and $1500 on show, all still there when we returned at the end of the day. Now for the negatives: For three people they provided just two sugars and two creams per day. More were available on request, but you had to ask everyday. The room was noisy at night as our room overlooked the 'fire pits' outside the bar; earplugs are a must if you want to get to sleep. Speaking of the 'fire pits', they were continually blown out by the wind and requests to relight them were often ignored by the staff. BTW San Francisco is cold at night, even in July. So, if you're a smoker, you'll find it chilly drinking outside without a working 'fire pit'. If you're brave you can light them yourself, but you'll loose all the hair on your arm and you have to sit with your foot on the gas valve to prevent it being blown out. As for the bar, the drinks were expensive and I never saw the barman smile once in two weeks. There is no restaurant to speak of, although you can order bar snacks. For breakfast I recommend ihop over the road. My biggest gripe is the extortionate $50 (inc. taxes) per night parking charge, outrageous!

review.title: Sheraton
review.reviewText: Overall good experience. Try to get a room that does not face the bus depot because it can get noisy in the early AM

review.title: Location is Great and Loved the Outisde Fireplaces!!
review.reviewText: We loved the location of the hotel - just a short walk to the water and far enough from the crowds. Outside fireplaces are nice to sit at in the evening. Decor was nice/modern. Beds could have been more comfy/newer, but overall hotel was very nice.

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: We stayed for 4 nights - we were pleased with the room, hotel and service. Only complaint was shower head had weak water pressure - water conservation measure? Very convenient location, Safeway and Trader Joe's grocery stores about a block away. Coin laundry 2 blocks away. Everyone says never to make long distance calls from your hotel room - it's true! Very expensive!

review.title: Comfortable and great location
review.reviewText: The hotel location, service and the renovated rooms were excellent. It is a business-oriented hotel, however. We did not eat there (example: $20 per person for breakfast buffet).

review.title: fabulous hotel and perfect location
review.reviewText: A contemporary hotel, very modern, very clean and comfortable. The whole family enjoyed staying at this hotel, the facilities were perfect for a family and the location also perfect for Pier 39 and everything else. Pier 39 and all the sea front shops were less than 5 minutes walk away. If you do not want to splash out on the hotels buffet breakfast, then across the raod is the IHop which is open all day and night serving fantastic breakfast at a very reasonable cost. Don't miss out on the Franciscan if you like seafood. Also within minutes walking distance.

review.title: Very poor at this standard
review.reviewText: We got a great deal at this hotel through Expedia, also our first choice of hotel had no rooms left at the time we wanted. The price we paid was very good value - so in some ways we shouldn't complain. However, the hotel is very modern, but the minimalist, bare interior made this hotel cold and unwelcoming. The staff were surly and uninformed - with the exception of the parking valets who were great (and also full of useful information and tips about the city. The concierge was hopeless). Our room was clean, but stark and rather cramped. The tiny bathroom was unforgivably small for a hotel in this category. Skip breakfast, it is expensive and very poor. If you want accommodation in this area, stay at the Hyatt or even the Best Western Tuscany.

review.title: Great hotel and location for the price
review.reviewText: Funky fabric, facilities, and atmosphere for a well run and organised hotel. Just behind the main wharf area, hence quiet at night for sleeping, but only 2 minutes to all the attractions and places to go. Nice touch with the Starbuck's coffee in the room, a welcome start to the day.

review.title: Great guest service
review.reviewText: The guest service was fantastic and very consistent during our entire stay. I highly recommend this hotel

review.title: Fishermans Wharf - One Short Block
review.reviewText: Great hotel, look forward to our next trip. June, July and August are not San Francisco's summer. We were there the last week of July and experienced highs of 63. September and October are the months to go and the Sheraton is the place to stay. I'm not sure San Francisco is a town that caters to children. The area is for adults anywhere in the city. I'm not sorry we took our 10 and 14 year old children, but they were up front in letting us know they were tired of the repetition of the Wharf and bored with things in general.

review.title: Probably would try elsewhere
review.reviewText: Very small bathroom Could hear neighbours and people walking in room above.

review.title: Amazing Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location and such great hotel service.. Hotel is sooo close to the wharf and walking distance to basically everything around. After walking around all day you can kick it outside where the have fire pits and chairs to sit around, it is very comforting as well as romantic.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Located near the Warf and walking distance to all the attractions there. Lots of good resturants in the area. Can't wait to go back.

review.title: Great convenient location
review.reviewText: This hotel is within walking distance to all of Fisherman's Wharf. Cable car stops are also very close by, and the "F line" street car goes right past the property. The rooms are adequate. Beds and linens were good. The bathroom and shower was weak, the carpet was heavily stained, and the air handling unit in the room had quite an accumulation of dust. The staff was very nice and helpful. Dollar car rental has an outlet on the property- this was mega handy. Cheap eats are nearby.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and the service was wonderful. My only complaints would be the double beds (queen would have been great), the air conditioner was very noisy and there was no fridge in the room. Other than that, I would recommemd this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great Location and Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: Close to Fisherman's Wharf, municipal transportation, a grocery store and pharmacy. Room was very comfortable and clean. The hotel staff, from the front desk to housekeeping, were friendly and courteous. Definitely worth another stay while in San Francisco.

review.title: We would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Warf.
review.reviewText: We were highly impressed from the moment we checked in with the character,location,decor and the friendly service we received.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: personel very friendly. The consierge was very helpful and pleasant to work with

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location (Fisherman's Wharf). The staff is courteous and accommodating. The outside firepits are very nice to lounge at outside with a cold one. Request a first floor room with an outside patio. One negative, the parking is $43 dollars a night, regardless of whether or not you are a guest!! You would be hard pressed to find a hotel with cheaper parking, although, I think that the Marriott Courtyard might be cheaper. If the prices are comparable, I would recommend the Marriott over the Sheraton. But, the Sheraton is an excellent hotel.

review.title: Location is everything.
review.reviewText: The location of the Sheraton is absolutely perfect as it allows a visitor to walk to most tourist sites. But, there is extremely minimal food service and it was locked up so tightly (perhaps that is necessary) that guests could not easily access courtyard areas. The modern decor is also, in my opinion, a bit cold.

review.title: Great location and friendly staff
review.reviewText: The hotel was very accommodating. It has a good exercise room and pool which are accessible but not well used. It feels secure and is clean and friendl. We would definitely choose it again.

review.title: Great remodel! Great location!!
review.reviewText: The new decor makes you feel like you're in a Cape Cod Cottage. It's fresh and comfortable. The outdoor firepits are comfy and the indoor lounge is a perfect place to gather with friends. All this and only two blocks away from Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Good Hotel wish they have Queen beds
review.reviewText: This is a good hotel is very close to pier 39. The only thing is that they don't have queen beds, only double beds. I traveled with two kids one 3yrs old and 13 yrs. So I usually stay in hotels with queen beds or 2 doubles and a king size. But the options are very limited. Nice and friendly hotel staff can't complaint. Parking is very expensive. I don't know why they charge for parking this is the first time I have to pay parking staying on a hotel parking. Maybe because is San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel, Great location
review.reviewText: The location is unbeatable - 2 blocks from the wharf (across from Pier 39), and just across the street from Safeway and Trader Joe's for those who care about that. The size of the room was amazing for the SF area, considering that the other hotels I have stayed at in the SF area are the smallest I have ever been to. My room was large, open, and like a typical room you'd find in another city (but for SF, it would be considered huge). The fitness center had brand new machines which were nice, and there was even an outdoor pool. The only thing I didn't like was that there was a charge to use internet in your room. The lobby area had free wireless though, so many people would sit there with their laptops.

review.title: Modern
review.reviewText: we really enjoyed our stay here, everything was just what we wanted and was very modern.

review.title: Good comfortable room and bed
review.reviewText: Nice room, would happily stay again. Without knowing the area we were thinking there would be good views but it seems most hotels in area are low rise so no views to speak off - but a block from the bay and easy walking distance to all parts of Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: will be back
review.reviewText: the room was small very different from what you see on expedia, but all in all we were satisfied. close to everything ,grocery store is just accross the street. if you can find a place where to park your car on a cheaper price i recommend that you do it.parking fee here is so expensive. but we'll definitely going back here.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: If you want to stay close to Fisherman's Wharf and San Francisco most popular attractions, this hotel fits the bill. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and the staff was very courteous. The hotel also has a small cafe in the lobby which is very convenient for those taking early morning tours. Would definitely stay there again

review.title: good place to stay on the wharf
review.reviewText: Great location on the wharf, but a block away from the main street noise. Minor goof up on some room service, which was rectified quickly to our satisfaction. Ok b-fast buffet, maybe a little costly. Staff was helpful and courteous. Checking in and out was a breeze. Knowledgeable, useful concierge (recommended an awesome seafood restaraunt - Scomas). Would stay again in a heart-beat. Good value for the buck in a world-class city. Didn't give full stars as all was pretty darn good, but not 'knock-you-over great'.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: If you want to stay close to Fisherman's Wharf and San Francisco most popular attractions, this hotel fits the bill. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and the staff was very courteous. The hotel also has a small cafe in the lobby which is very convenient for those taking early morning tours. Would definitely stay there again

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, Superb Location, Good value

review.title: A wonderful place to stay
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay. The location of the hotel is ideal. It is close to everything. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Service is excellent. My only complaint is that there is no complimentary internet available in the hotel. The price for the use of the internet at the business centre is bit high as is the room's internet rate.

review.title: Convenient and the beds are dreamy
review.reviewText: Our car was parked the whole time we were there, the hotel is very convenient to all transportation and you can work everywhere. Parkins is expensive, even if you don't use the car and the only thing that was a surprise was that internest was over $15.00 a day when at most hotels wireless internet is free. Very kid friendly

review.title: ease of touring
review.reviewText: this hotel is situated a block from fisherman warf and had all the transit acsess you needed right at there door step. Very helpful in telling you where to go and how to get there. We would stay there again for sure

review.title: this hotel is good for bueiness only, not for vacation.
review.reviewText: This hotel is good for bueiness only, not for vacation.

review.title: Good deal for location
review.reviewText: chose hotel because of location and since it is pet friendly without a fee. the style of the rooms is a little weird (retro), but they are clean and comfy.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location. Hotel was clean and nice but very basic. Not a lot of extras.

review.title: nice rooms, but poor totel design
review.reviewText: its a very big hotel annd designed really bad. it took us forever to get to our room. its very confusing! another minus is $45/night parking. other than this hotel is pretty nice. really good location!

review.title: Good spot...
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location, close to everything, and only 4 blocks or so from the Taylor street Cable Car stop. As with everything in this area, it is slightly pricey. And parking was / is way to expensive. If we got a price cut on parking due to being a hotel guest, I would hate to see what the rates would be for a non guest. The room was fine. Nice large lcd television that did recieve an HD signal. The staff was kind and brought us a crib for our infant. The best part of the Sheraton though was the location. Being able to walk 3 blocks and be right on the Wharf was the best part.

review.title: Nice surprise
review.reviewText: At first I was not impressed with the our room because it overlooked the roof and refrigeration units. I went down to the front desk to request another room, and without any questions my family & I were given another room with a view of the courtyard. Other than that the service and all the employees were GREAT! The bathroom area a bit small, but we managed.

review.title: would definitely stay again
review.reviewText: great location, very contemporary and modern decor, helpful staff, pool is protected from winds and good sun exposure, great gym and restaurants and shops very close... would definitely go back to this horel

review.title: :average
review.reviewText: not enough amenities in lounge area:no television;no entertainment

review.title: Excellent hotel in a great location on the Wharf
review.reviewText: The rooms are very comfortable and clean. Brew your own Starbucks coffee every morning in your room. Great location on the Wharf with public transit (cable cars, Street Cars and Buses) close by. Starbucks, IHOP, Denny's and all kinds of restaurants all only a few blocks away. Very friendly accomodating and helpful front desk and concierge staff. Highly recommended hotel.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: We recently visisted San Francisco for the first time and had a wonderful time at the Sheraton. The best asset of this hotel is its proximity to all the sights of Fishermen's Wharf. You can walk to everything and easily catch public transportation as well. The staff was very helpful in answering our questions about getting around town. The room was very comfortable, clean, and had a great shower. Lots of people swimming in the heated pool. Loved the fire pits outside for those cool nights!

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Everything was in walking distantance. We were amazed how close we were to everything.We will definately be going back.

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: the hotel was conveniently located. Munni stop right on corner. Cable car pick-up 2 blocks. I hop right across the street. Safeway across street. Walgreens and denny's a block away. Within walking distance to Pier 39

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: great location, good for the whole family, accesible to all transportations, walking distance to all the piers, downtown

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: This hotel was just remodeled, and was bright and cheerful. It was convenient to Fisherman's Wharf and all transportation.

review.title: Nice Hotel and close to the Pier
review.reviewText: The room was colorfully decorated, and there was a large flat screen TV. It would have been nice if the pool was indoors though. We went during Spring Break and the temperature never got above 65. Nice weather...but not good enough to swim outside. The pool was heated though. I liked how the hotel was located only a couple of blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. Every morning you could walk a block or two and have breakfast before making your way down there. You want to eat somewhere besides the hotel. They are ridiculously expensive. Also, the hotel only has 4 floors. I thought it would be taller.

review.title: Nice and convenient hotel
review.reviewText: If you like seafood, it is the best place to stay. Two blocks from Pier 39. Travel to other part of the city is easy with street car and cable car a block away. However, overnight parking is pricey.

review.title: Worked well for us
review.reviewText: Very satisfied with this hotel. Location was perfect for the tourist traveler. Convenient to some sites if you wanted to walk and mass transit for exploring. Was disappointed that rollaway beds were not available.Three of us were traveling together. Grocery and drug store close if needed. Helpful concierge, but you must have some idea of what you want to do and know that more than one tour company is available. Would stay there again.

review.title: Not a bad place to stay near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel was simple, clean, and just two blocks from Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf. The rates are about what you'd expect to pay for the location, and it's quiet and comfortable. There's also an IHop, open 24 hours, right across the street. My only complaint is minor and comical, and it's directed at the hotel's design and decor. There's only one bank of elevator's and stairwells that don't all open to the ground floor. The layout is really quite odd, and it's not unusual to run into people lost in the halls commenting on how they wish the hotel provided its guests with GPS equipped golf carts to navigate the seemingly endless corridors. And what the heck is with all the stripes?!

review.title: Awesome location
review.reviewText: The location was awesome, it was close to all the things we wanted to do. plus, transportation was right there by us. The Trolley cars and the System was within walking.

review.title: hotel right in the middle of everything!
review.reviewText: the hotel was clean, although we did not know construction going on. no ice or pop dispenser close by. also we were under impression it had resturant, it did not. was close to all our activities. would try again.

review.title: Great Staff
review.reviewText: Great Superbowl party!

review.title: Not Imprressed at all
review.reviewText: For Sheraton's brand, this hotel is under my expectation. FOr the price, the room is not spacious at all, which makes our stay a very uncomfortable trip, the hotel and room concept is unclear. For relaxing and shopping, I really wouldnt recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel to stay near the Wharf.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: The hotel was overall really good, the only surprise I had was the parking fee at the Hotel; nobody mentioned that I had to pay for the parking. I stayed there for 3 nights. Loved the fireplaces outside the hotel, very cozy!!

review.title: Perfect hotel and location
review.reviewText: So close to the Wharf and Pier 39 just two blocks away. Trolley's within walking distance. Loved the outdoor fire pits. Rooms were clean. Parking way to pricey and don't eat at the hotel very, very expensive. Staff was helpful and loved the Starbucks in the room.

review.title: Great to visit San Francisco
review.reviewText: GREAT location all is close to this hotel, EXCELENT service from Staff, they are always giving you tips to enjoy San Francisco. If I'm back to SF by sy=ure i'll stay here again.

review.title: will def go back again
review.reviewText: So much to see and but not enough time. The rooms were very roomy. the staff was very courteous. Nice idea with fire pits outside very cozy Cant wait to go back again and would def stay at the Sheraton again.

review.title: GREAT HOTEL!
review.reviewText: Newly renovated; excellent in cleanliness, maintenance and comfort. Staff was superb - went out of their way to may the stay enjoyable. Reasonably priced; close to every attraction you could possibly want in San Francisco. Highly Recommended!

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Service was found lacking in all areas of the hotel. Room cleaning was sporadic and depended on who was doing the service. Front desk lost a welcome gift and took over 45 minutes to find it and then lost it again while we were coming to get the bag resulting in a further wait of 20 minutes. Local calls are charged.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The location is great! Easy access to many attractions. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Location Location Location!!!!
review.reviewText: This is a fantastic hotel. The staff is very friendly and knowledgable, they took very good care of us. The location is PERFECT! It's right at the Wharf, it's a ten minute walk to Alcatraz, there is a street car pick up right outside. Room service is expensive, there is an IHOP across the street for an inexpensive meal. Will definitely stay here again!

review.title: Great Location at the Wharf!
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a nice location. Hotel was comfortable and cozy. Staff very friendly and helpful in points of interest. Second time in city and basically just blending in with the locals. Everything within walking distance, Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, Trolley Cars, Lombard St., Piers and much much more.

review.title: Satisfied with stay
review.reviewText: Clean room and helpful staff, in a good location. Parking in the area can be difficult and the hotel parking lot is expensive, so keep that in mind if bringing/renting a car.

review.title: Great beds!
review.reviewText: Hotel was not quite finished with renovations. A funky decor, but it kind of grew on you. No views from any of the rooms. Loved: outdoor fire pits, beds, friendly and helpful staff, housekeeping, location, TV. Suggestions to make it more loveable: hot tub, fan in bathroom and bigger vanity area, more TV channels, indoor pool.

review.title: Excellent location and very good overall hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent location very close to Pier 39 and the other attractions at Fisherman's Wharf. Close to Cable car stop too and just next to the point where the tours start. The breakfast buffet was very good with a good variety of food and fruit. The one upsetting thing is that ther is no free internet (16 dollars for 24 hours!!) We will surely Go Back Will sure

review.title: Perfect, would stay here again.
review.reviewText: Location location! Within 2 blocks of Taylor Street shopping, IHOP family restaurant, 7-11, Trader Joes for food and wine. About an 8 block walk to ChinaTown. A block from the Cable Cars (three day pass a great deal)Walking distance to Pier 39. Room was VERY nice,and big. Most comfortable beds ever! We had the outdoor pool to ourselves every night. Must have been the only guests from Saskatchewan!!

review.title: Just the right place to stay
review.reviewText: Courteous ,helpful and warm staff! Good security. Great location ! just walking distance to Pier 39 and Fisherman's wharf. I would recommend this hotel for travellers.

review.title: Great Vacation
review.reviewText: Hotel was under construction when we stayed. Rooms were a little outdated as if it were a throw back to the seventies. Gym needs new equipment. Spa was not open. Overall not to bad. Hopefully the renovations will make everything better. Great location and walking distance to Fishermans Wharf and area attractions.

review.title: Loved the Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is right at Fisherman's Wharf and within walking distance of streetcars, cable cars and stores. It is currently under renovation but was still a nice place to stay. One bathtub didn't drain properly and it needs an ice machine.

review.title: hotel was fine
review.reviewText: It was fine for what I needed, to be close to the wharf for dinner and close to napa for business

review.title: Enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: Good location Buffet breakfast excellent Staff very friendly and helpful Overall one of the best hotels

review.title: Not as pictured or as described
review.reviewText: The pictures of this hotel do not look anything like the hotel at all! Yes they are undergoing construction but they tried to give us a brand new room that still had the carpet and glue smell. Who can sleep with those fumes? So they gave us an old room that had stains all over the window curtains and the bed skirt. It was disgusting. The beds were not at all comfortable i got a crick in my next every morning. They were sunken in and i kept rolling over to one side of the bed. Other than that, the housekeeper kept our room very clean. The other reviews are absolutely correct that you do hear all the street noises when your roomis facing the street. Try to get away from the street rooms if at all possible.

review.title: Not impressed, extra fees outrageous
review.reviewText: Upon our arrival, we were first put into a terrible room with torn curtains, looking down into a courtyard under construction and renovation. We were moved to another room which had no towel racks in bathroom, and so small you could barely close the door. No refrigerator in room, unless we were willing to pay extra for it, we already were paying top dollar for the room. No business channel on TV unless willing to pay extra for it and the hotel parking fee was outrageous, and then they put tax on top of it.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Hotel very convenient to all sightseeing locations, restaurants, Lombard Street, piers, Starbucks, Dollar Rent A Car on site, grocery store literally yards away from hotel so you don't have to eat all meals out.

review.title: Misrepresentation
review.reviewText: The pictures of this hotel do not look anything like the hotel at all! Yes they are undergoing construction but they tried to give us a brand new room that still had the carpet and glue smell. Who can sleep with those fumes? So they gave us an old room that had stains all over the window curtains and the bed skirt. It was disgusting. The beds were not at all comfortable i got a crick in my next every morning. They were sunken in and i kept rolling over to one side of the bed. Other than that, the housekeeper kept our room very clean. The other reviews are 100% correct that you do hear all the street noises when your roomis facing the street. Try to get away from the street rooms if at all possible.

review.title: Both couples were very happy with the location & hotel.
review.reviewText: Staff were very cheerful, helpful, accomodating. Location is outstanding. Car valet very prompt and helpful. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Maid service also very good. Only complaint is that we could not get Fox News on the TV. I like to get news that is not slanted all one way. But then we were in San Francisco. Highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Would stay here next time!
review.reviewText: Although our intitial opinion of the modern "decor" of the lobby and the hallways was not good, we later enjoyed the cheerful atmosphere...the location to enjoy the Warf was perfect and sitting outside by a fire enjoying a glass of wine at the end of our busy day was the highlight of our stay, especially with the wonderful service and sincere friendliness of Edwin who keep our wine glasses full and shared his San Francisco knowledge.

review.title: Very Comfortable
review.reviewText: We loved being so close to the wharf and bay area. The staff was extremely helpful. We could walk to anywhere and the weather was perfect.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: great hotel and location for any one wanting to spend time in san francisco

review.title: I always stay here!
review.reviewText: I stay at the Sheraton Fisherman's wharf each trip to San Francisco - it's in a perfect location to get where I want to hang out and is comfortable as well.

review.title: Excellent stop in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in an excellent location on the Wharf. Close to everything for sightseeing and restaurants. Bus lines and cable cars close by. Hotel staff very helpful and courteous. Rooms were comfortable.

review.title: Good location when visiting
review.reviewText: I thought the Hotel was great. The room was a little small but everything else was good. Great staff. Everyone was very helpful.

review.title: Great spot!
review.reviewText: We wanted a place where we could walk to the Wharf & sleep in a comfy place... perfect.

review.title: Will use this hotel AGAIN when we go back
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. Within walking distance to the wharf. A huge plus is that there is a Safeway/Wal-Greens within walking distance if you were to forget your toothbrush, like we did. The room was clean, we appreciated the fact that they were conserving water and would only wash towels that were laid on the floor, same with your bed sheets, and that was fine by us. The staff was great, even calling the Super Shuttle for us when we had to leave. Downfall: smooshy pillows, no support at all. Balcony view of the pool was to be desired, but still, everything was fantastic! I would recommend this hotel to others, plus, we'll use it when we go back.

review.title: Wireless service / parking
review.reviewText: Internet wireless access available but there is a charge. The charge is not disclosed at time of booking or did not see a reference to a fee in thier information untill atempting to use it. Parking charge per day is quite excessive.

review.title: nice and pricey
review.reviewText: Our hotel room was nice and clean. Staff was very courteous. This hotel is huge with apparently only 1 entrance/exit. To buy any anything at the hotel snack stand/bar is very expensive (more than any restaurant we went to). Wifi at the hotel is unreliable and $16/day.

review.title: Near all the places
review.reviewText: This hotel is with-in walking distance of everything along the water front. You can also walk over to the trolley station or the cable cars and get any place you want. Great room with a king size bed and friendly, helpful people working there. Within the day they knew your name and greet you like old friends giving a secure feeling to being there. Will be back to San Fran soon and will stay there once again.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Had a great time!! Great location - a block away from Fisherman's Wharf - Beds were very comfortable and the staff was very helpful and pleasant.

review.title: Comfortable Rooms
review.reviewText: I was impressed with the bed in our room. It had a down comforter, very fluffy pillows and the mattress was soft. I slept great every night.

review.title: Very clean and comfortable loved the quietness.
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and quiet hotel.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The location to fisherman's wharf was excellent. We took the BART from the airport and just walked to the hotel from Embarcadero. The hotel to airport transportation towncar seemed to have hidden cost. The towncar cost was more than quoted use a taxi if needed.

review.title: great location to fishermans wharf and to other sites
review.reviewText: nice size room, we had a double, maid service was very good. didn't eat at the hotel, a little pricey, excellent restruants within walking distance.

review.title: Great Hotel, even during a remodle
review.reviewText: Great location, updated clean rooms, & the cost was not excessive. The only problem we had was several ice machines were out of order.

review.title: Not up to normal Sheraton Standard
review.reviewText: We were really not satisfied - very expensive and not the normal Sheraton Standard - facilities are really substandard and a huge disappointment.

review.title: Services a little pricey
review.reviewText: Although the hotel is very nice, expect to pay premium prices for services. Budget for parking in the hotel per day at competitive rates. The restaurant is shockingly expensive considering there is an Ihop next door. Room Service is also very pricey, even for what you would expect for room service. However, there is a 24 hour Safeway across the street. Keeping these in mind, this is an otherwise excellent place to stay if you want to be very near Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Best Location
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, clean room, bed comfortable. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 and much more. Well situated. Close to many restaurants and shops.

review.title: We can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The hotel was under some upgrade work. We never heard any of the workers while we were there. The staff was extremely helpful and the hotel is located in a prime Fisherman's Wharf location and close to transportation stops.

review.title: Very friendly staff. Great location to everything.
review.reviewText: I can't wait to return. Had a wonderful stay and the staff was always very nice and would help out with everything we requested.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Well located hotel within walking distance of restaurants, city tours and night life. Currently undergoing construction, which definitely was an inconvenience during our stay. Our room was also not completely clean when we first entered. Otherwise, good hotel for the location and price.

review.title: Under Renovation But Still Pleasant
review.reviewText: Conveniently located in Fisherman's Wharf; very helpful staff; Hotel is being renovated, so only one entrance (on Northpointe) was accessible in mid-July, 200--just a slight inconvenience. Extremely comfortable bed! Our shower and bathroom was handicapped accessible--very nice for my husband. All in all, a nice stay.

review.title: Extra Payments
review.reviewText: $41.00 Car Parking is absolutely rediculous!

review.title: Under Contruction!
review.reviewText: The hotel is currently under renovation, which wasn't a huge inconvenience but did reduce my overall rating. The biggest concern is the parking cost - $41 overnight - although this is probably similar to other Fisherman's Wharf hotels - though it would be worth checking.

review.title: Good and getting better
review.reviewText: The Sheraton Fishermans Wharf is a nice hotel, friendly staff, and currently undergoing renovations. The hotel staff are doing everything they can to minimize any inconvience to their guests while renovating. Even with the "construction dust," it is a nice hotel.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great! The place was clean and the service was wonderful. The concierge was extremely helpful in booking day trips out of San Francisco and good at giving directions. The hotel restaurant was excellent!

review.title: Not a good choice
review.reviewText: The Sheraton is undergoing extensive renovation, which has disrupted virtually every aspect of the operation. Parking is difficult - and gets an additional charge of $41 per day. The hotel restaurant is temporarily in a ballroom - buffet only, and it is tasteless (and very expensive). Stay away for a while.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Good location, one block from Fisherman's Wharf. Kt's an older hotel. Parking is very expensive.

review.title: Best Location
review.reviewText: Our first time in San Fransisco, no need for a rental car if you plan on staying in the immediate area. Hotel staff was very knowledgeable, friendly and professional. The standard room (w/king bed) was just the right size, but the bathroom was a little small. The hotel is under construction and first morning noise can be anoying. Overall a great place to stay, close to everything around the Warf.

review.title: Nice place near all the action
review.reviewText: The hotel beds were great and the location was perfect (near the pier, Ghiradeli square etc). The restaurant was under construction and the parking fee of $41 was excessive but otherwise great.

review.title: Great Sleeping
review.reviewText: Bed was great, room clean, staff very friendly!

review.title: Impressive
review.reviewText: Clean and very close to everything. Staff are friendly and helpful.

review.title: Stains on the beds
review.reviewText: Common! Four stars hotel ???? First they say they giving you upgrated room, I'm thinking "Cool!", then you open door... Smell, dirty beds with stains and hair, dirty windows. When ask for other room the answer was "No problem, we"ll send there cleaning personal to fix it. Did you use anything in the room as a towel or whatever?" -This question make me wonder will they really clean it? Next room: not bad smell, but same problem on the bed so we just drop the top cover on the floor and use whatever was looking clean. Thank you for your 4 stars services! - Maybe you should see some four star hotel first! Also we must put Yellow Pages book on some world war II. model box which they call Air condition because of loose parts which are pretty loudy when in use-I wonder why? - Ooo.. maybe because this AC is older then me? I'm 35 now!

review.title: Had fun!
review.reviewText: The hotel location was its strongest asset. The hotel itself was average and a bit worn. They were doing some remodeling.

review.title: Overcharged for telephone
review.reviewText: Charged $68 for three 2 minute local calls and one to the SFO airport

review.title: missing information
review.reviewText: we booked at this hotel because it advertised that it had a restaurant. When we arrived we found that the restaurant is being remodelled. The hotel has set up a place in the ballroom and will charge $18 for a buffet breakfast. I eat only oatmeal in the mornings so $18 is ridiculous. Had we have been aware of this we would have stayed elsewhere.

review.title: Convenient location and friendly staff
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very helpful, the rooms were attractive and the location was excellent!

review.title: A vacation to remember...
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful trip to San Francisco and were impressed with the Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf hotel. From the moment we checked in until the moment we left the personnel were wonderful - friendly, helpful, even made suggestions on places to go and things to see. Our room overlooked a beautiful courtyard and our maid service was excellent. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to stay in a clean, safe environment, friendly hotel. Yes, if we get the opportunity to return to San Franciso - we know where we will stay. Thanks for a wonderful memory.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location for family vacation. A lot of places to walk to right from the hotel, and only a block from Fisherman's Wharf. Room was nothing spectacular but was fine.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location. We were able to walk to China Town, North Beach, Coit Tower & Union Square. Also walking distance to two cable car turn-arounds. Lots to see and eat in Fisherman's wharf. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: We loved it! Location was more than adequate and room was always clean.
review.reviewText: We couldn't have done better for the price. Only problem was the room's location. I've heard this alot about the wharf "don't get a room near the street", but or course we got a room by the street. It was noisy especially early morning (6 am) at delivery time. Try to get a room near the center of the hotel on the inside, facing the courtyard. Otherwise, no complaints.

review.title: Great Location, Convenient to many SF attractions
review.reviewText: The location of the Sheraton at Fisherman's Wharf was excellent. The week we were there, the weather was sunny and pleasant and from our hotel we were able to walk throughout the city to Union Square, Chinatown, Lombard Street, Fisherman's Wharf, The Cannery, Ghiradelli Square - so many of the tourist sites. It's also located within walking distance of where the boat for the Alcatraz tour is (Pier 33).

review.title: Extremely happy with the location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, great location. We were in walking distance to all modes of transportation. Fishermans Wharf had many places to shop and eat. I would definately go back.

review.title: Great location & excellent service!!
review.reviewText: Not only was the location of this hotel perfect for tourists, but the quality & service was top level. The only thing I would have wanted that this hotel didn't have was access to a mini fridge in the room. Other than that, I couldn't have had a better experience!

review.title: Satisfied and recomendable 100%
review.reviewText: Close to the atractions Confortable and easy access Good service

review.title: Parking fee Outrageous!
review.reviewText: When we checked in the parking fee was indicated to be $41 a day. When I checked out the fee was not only $41 a day but, also added was a parking fee tax of $5.74 each day. Why not tell people up front about the tax? Across the street from the hotel was a public parking lot that was $20 a day. I believe the hotel was taking unfair advantage of the traveler.

review.title: No typical Sheraton standard
review.reviewText: Good service, dark and small rooms

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: We had a great time! Room was clean and hotel was nice overall. Staff very helpfull and location is perfect!

review.title: Satisfactory
review.reviewText: Very close to Fisherman's Wharf..very convenient. Shower took a little while to put out hot water, but the beds are comfortable and rooms serve their purpose.

review.title: Sheraton SF Fishermans Wharf Location
review.reviewText: Hotel location in reference to Pier 39 is excellent. The service was friendly & helpful and the place was clean. However it is older and hte walls are thin. Footsteps could be heard from upstairs and noised from next room. Taxi service for the 25 mile ride there is pricey but return shuttle can be arrandged via conceirge.

review.title: Great hotel, excellent location!
review.reviewText: If your vacation plans call for staying near the piers, this is great. The hotel staff is awesome, anyone that we asked for directions or help, they all did it with a smile. From checking in to the hotel to checking out of it the hotel was fast, friendly, and courteous.

review.title: This hotel is just great!
review.reviewText: This was truly the best hotel I have ever been at. Everyone from the Bell Desk to the Maids went out of their way to make my stay wonderful. The room was big and beautiful and looked out onto a flower filled courtyard. The swimming pool was heated to a comfortable 80+ degrees and was great after a long day of walking. The location cannot be beat - only a couple blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 and a few blocks in the other direction to the Cablecar Turnaround. Bus transportation was just across the street too. This is a great place to stay if you do not want to rent a car to get around. Believe me, you can get anywhere in San Francisco from this location. The people at the Bell Desk are great map drawers too!! I cannot wait to go back again soon.

review.title: Basically clean, nothing spectacular
review.reviewText: There were a lot of families with young children at this hotel, so if you're not travelling with a family you may not want to stay here. The hotel was pretty average: clean and mostly comfortable . Parking is very expensive, so be ready to pay more if you're bringing a car.

review.title: Close to the Wharf
review.reviewText: Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf is in a great location from Fisherman's Wharf (1 block). Getting to public transportation is easy and the F-line streetcar is across the street.

review.title: Clean and Comfortable
review.reviewText: Loved everything about the sheraton fisherman's wharf. Staff was friendly, room was clean and comfortable, location was excellent. Bathroom was a little too small, and the lamps and overhead lights were very dim, and there was no free breakfast, but otherwise it was a great place to stay. I'd definitley reccomend it. There were lots of other places to stay in the area, but I would trust the Sheraton over almost all of them. The bed was very comfortable.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Close to all attractions, clean and nice. Concierge very helpfull. Friendly staff except restaurant staff...

review.title: A block from the Wharf and at the crossroads of all public transit
review.reviewText: The hotel was excellent, especially the room we stayed at off of Mason Street, two floors up, with a balcony. If we could stretch out necks out, we could see the bay cruise ships on the bay from our balcony. Hotel swimming pool was outdoors and heated. Great concierge team, really helpful. Parking on grounds outragous ($42 a day). better parking options elsewhere in tips. Maid service the best. All tv/pay for tv features. Wonderful feather/down pillows you can buy on Sheraton web site/super firm beds. Near parking lots, Wharf, public transport, walking trails, restaurants, fast foods, sports bars, tourism sites. Lots in walking distance. Overall rating: EXCELLENTCONVENIENCE STORE: 7-11 is just north of the hotel on Mason Street. PUBLIC TRANS: Trolley cars and buses go right by the hotel ($1.50 a ticket versus $5.00 cable cars). Near cable car stop. SHOPPING: Old colored trolley cars go from hotel to Market Street (major downtown shopping ctr. strip with new five story Westfield Mall-across from 3 story Forever 21 for teenage girls). Dollar Rent A Car in hotel if you rent Dollar. TOURS: The tour with self-guided audio head set of Alcatraz is a must, even for teenage daughters and sons. Take a sack lunch with you on the ferry on a nice day and eat it at the Alcatraz pier before your tour. City of Salsalito and the Muir Woods redwoods are great side trips. Get your SF Ghirardelli chocolate cheaper at nearby Walgreens and say you got it at the factory when you get home :)

review.title: A pleasant surprise
review.reviewText: We received an amazing rate on Expedia and had our doubts about the quality of the hotel before checking in but were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is clean, like most other Sheraton's, and the beds are very comfortable. There was a review or two complaining about the dim lights in the bathroom - they use energy efficient bulbs which brighten up within a minute or two. You can definitely hear kids if they're running up and down the hall but it didn't happen very often and they were just kids being kids so we didn't mind. The doormen and front desk were not overly friendly but not rude either. We just got the impression they'd been doing their jobs along time and it was just a job to them. The concierges on the other hand were very helpful and enthusiastic. There are lots of great places to eat and things to see near by. North Beach is an Italian area close to the hotel (10-15 minute walk) with lots of cafes and great restaurants. We highly recommend a Brazilian/Italian restaurant called Manga Rosa.

review.title: Location was perfect!
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for four nights and we had a fabulous time. It was walking distance from many tourist attractions and it was clean with comfortable beds, which is all that we ask for.

review.title: Great location, great value
review.reviewText: Walking distance to the wharf, cable cars, restaurants and double decker bus tours. The double decker bus was a good value because we road for two days for a single day rate. Much cheaper than other tours of the area.

review.title: Great Location without the noise!!
review.reviewText: Thought this hotel was comfortable, and had a great location to the Pier 39! Almost everything was in walking distance, and if not walking distance to jump on the cable cars, and electric cars. Bellmen very helpful!

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: This hotel was affordable and a wonderful location. It was in walking distance to all attractions. The room was cozy and the bed was just what you needed after a day of sightseeing. The only thing is that the hotel was dated for a the properties namesake. You can aslo hear alot of neighbors activities, i recommend the top floor. Otherwise this is a nice place to stay.

review.title: Great location for Pier 39
review.reviewText: Our room was quiet, with very little road noise. The walk to Pier 39 was about 2-3 blocks. It was nice to be so close to everything. There is a grocery store across the street, and the cable car pickup is about 2 blocks away. There is a Dollar car rental office on the hotel property. I wish we would have known this before the trip. The walk to Fisherman's wharf and great food is equally as close. I would recommend this hotel. If you require Internet access, be prepared to spend about $15 per day.

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: Affordable, clean and convenient. We look forward to our next trip.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Hotel was very up scale for the price and very close to everything. This hotel gets a 2 thumbs up

review.title: Would reccomend
review.reviewText: The hotel location could not get much better. Very close to Pier 39 and easy access to public transportation.

review.title: Great location! Nice large Room!
review.reviewText: Great place to stay!

review.title: Great hotel to stay when vacationing in SF
review.reviewText: My family found the hotel to be ideally located in San Francisco for siteseeing. Located only a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. Close to the Cable cars, short walk to Chinatown,Lombard Street, and the ferry to Altatraz.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a great location. Easy walking distance to many attractions, with lots of things around to do. The hotel's employees were the friendliest I have ever encountered. However, some bad things about the hotel: The concierge desk was not particualary helpful, maybe it was the employee at the time, but they were no more helpful than any sightseeing book you could pick up off the sidewalk. My biggest problem with the hotel was that the rooms were horrible for soundproofing. I was able to hear whole conversations from the rooms next to mine as if they were in the same room as me and outside traffic sounded as if the window was open. Although the rooms were modern, nice, and clean, you may not get the best sleep due to all the noise around you.

review.title: Fine hotel, although little free services
review.reviewText: This is a fine hotel with a good location, but espect for pretty much everything extra: breakfast, bottle of water, internet, everything will cost you. Other then that, it's a good hotel.

review.title: Cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: One of the BEST hotels at San Francisco. Close to all atrraction(walking dista). The room are large very clean and modern

review.title: 2nd visit and can't waite to go back
review.reviewText: Everyone was extremly helpful and always upbeat.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf is very convenient for exploring SF.Easy walks to Ghiradelli Square,Cannery,all the wharf-front activities.Easy walk to North Beach area,and both cable car lines.A day pass on cable actually fun and useful for getting to Chinatown,Union Sq,Market St. Hotel is nice,good deal when Expedia packaged w/car.Concierges need more familiarity w/local restaurants and directions.

review.title: We'll stay there again.
review.reviewText: This hotel has a very safe feeling. People see you leave and return in a public area. It's easy to get back to after all the adventures in San Franscisco. Thank you.

review.title: Nicely located
review.reviewText: The Sheraton was nicely located to Fisherman's Wharf, Giardelli Square and Pier-3. The srevice was less than atentive during check in and the rooms although complete with ameneties could have been a bit cleaner and "odor-free"

review.title: A great place to stay
review.reviewText: I liked the Hotel, it was upscale, and treated the guests with courtesy and made my stay very pleasant. I was surprised at having to pay for parking at a hotel I was booked at. Overall, a very pleasant experience.

review.title: Excellent warf hotel
review.reviewText: The Sheraton is an excellent place to stay close to the Warf. Walking distance from Pier 39, North Beach, China town, and Alkatraz ferry.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is located a block from Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Nice choice for the area
review.reviewText: The Sheraton at Fisherman's Wharf was clean, quiet, and conveniently located. All the staff were friendly and made great recommendations for dining. The only thing I found disappointing was the Fitness Center since I'm accustomed to higher quality cardio equipment and they didn't have any free weights. I also found the strength training machine very hard to adjust.

review.title: - September 2006, Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf. San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean. The staff were professional. The location is great. It is within walking distance of many tourist attractions. We had a room overlooking the pool so we did not hear the street traffic. The blackout curtains are great. The pool area was clean. At a warmer time of year the pool area would be a nice place to relax. The hotel room was smaller than I am used to for the price range I paid. I did not use the hotel bar or hotel restaurant, so I cannot comment on them. The airport pickup was poor. We had to wait a long time at the airport sitting in the tranfer vehicle. This was exhausting after a long day and a long flight. There was confusion about our departure date. One day when we were trying to rest, the maid had been wrongly informed that we were leaving and she needed to clean our room for the next guests. She knocked on the our door 3 different times as she did not understand that we were not leaving that day. I would stay at the hotel again..

review.title: Would definitely stay there again!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very pleasant and very accommodating. Concierge folks were eager to help and assisted us in making dinner and tour reservations.

review.title: 1 Block to Pier 41
review.reviewText: Great place to stay! Close to the piers, shopping, restaurants, cable cars, buses, and tours.

review.title: Great Location, Family Friendly
review.reviewText: A little costly, but worth the money. Great for kids, staff was wonderful.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: I had heard Fisherman's Wharf described by some locals as the "tourist containment area". Well, for us this was the best choice of areas and hotels. It was close to restaurants, tours, activities for the children, and an easy drive to anything you couldn't walk to. The hotel has a nice lobby and our room was plenty big enough for the 4 of us. The beds were extremely comfortable. We found the staff to be helpful. The only downside to the room was the showerheads were made for people under 5'7".

review.title: Great Location and very comfortable
review.reviewText: I was very happy with this hotel. The location was perfect! It was two blocks from Pier 39 & Fisherman's Warf. It was very comfortable and clean. The concierge was very helpful. I highly recommend it to anyone traveling for business or pleasure. It took me 15 mins on the F Train to get the financial district on Market St.

review.title: I highly recomend staying there
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very helpful, check-in went very smooth, great location close to Fisherman's Warf, confortable room, I would stay there again.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Room was clean and beds were comfortable but the room was very, very small....hotel is centrally located and very close to Fisherman's Wharf shops and restaurants, Ghiradelli Square, and public transportation. Restaurant was good but way overpriced-breakfast for four was just under $100.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Asked for non smoking room when reservation was made not told until after I checked in that none were available. room small and old. Parking better save up.

review.title: Location was good for our requirements
review.reviewText: Expedia price was very competitive and Sheraton lived up to its reputation. Restaurant options a bit limited, but there is plenty of choice nearby.

review.title: We would stay here again when visiting San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Hotel had a rental car company in lobby--very convenient for a one day rental for us. Staff very helpful with reservations @ restaurants and information to help us get around town.

review.title: Good Value - Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful with the exception of the concierge who always seemed "bothered". Compass Grill dinner, while a bit pricey was unexpectedly exceptional in quality, price and portion. Room was dated but comfortable. Location to attractions was great. Safeway grocery accross the street, pancake house accross street in opposite direction. Would stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel service
review.reviewText: Our original room was extremely small room with a queen bed(we had requested a king). Our TV went up in smoke within the first 5 minutes of our arrival. They were very prompt at changing our room immediately to another room which did have a king size bed. The room window overlooked the driveway where deliveries started around 4:00 a.m. which was a little unnerving. When we asked, they did offer to change our room again, but we decided not to move since we were leaving at 6:00a.m. the next day.

review.title: Wharf memories
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Sheraton Fisherman Wharf was very pleasant and the staff were excellent. I would recommend to anyone traveling to San Francisco. The hotel made our trip have good memories!

review.title: Simple Accomodations in the Heart of Tourists
review.reviewText: We prefer a slightly higher class hotel, but the Sheraton was very comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful. It is in a high tourist neighborhood.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay, close to the Pier. We could hear footsteps above us...a little noisy.

review.title: Comfortable hotel within two blocks of the Wharf
review.reviewText: This was a simple hotel with quality reliable service and help from their staff. Nothing extraordinary offered, but a good reliable choice.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Beware of noisy street level rooms. On an off season weekday they were not able to acommodate room request on a multi-nite stay.

review.title: Great Concierge!
review.reviewText: All in all it was a very pleasant stay. We were very curious as to why there wasnt any type of fan or ventilation in the bathroom. Other than that it was great. Great location, the concierge was very helpful and it was surprisingly comfortable for the price. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking to stay in this area.

review.title: very good location, near pier 39
review.reviewText: beautiful hotel, near pier 39 and 43. the most visited zone for travellers.

review.title: Nice place to stay close to Warf
review.reviewText: Parking I thought was excessive at $45 a night but the hotel was clean. The maid service did an excellent job cleaning the room everyday. The beds were very comfortable but small. The food in the hotel's compass grill is expensive but extremely good. Hotel staff was helpful but everything cost extra. The hotel is just somewhere to sleep though in San Francisco because there is so much to do everywhere you go you are hardly at the hotel. The hotel is a quick 2 block walk to the Warf.

review.title: Sheraton - Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Very accomodating staff. Great location.

review.title: best service
review.reviewText: grate service

review.title: Great location and friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Not to happy with mandatory parking fees. If you get help unloading your luggage expect valet to take you vehicle into the parking garage. This is was the only downfall. Other than that, the hotel stay was great!

review.title: It Served its Purpose During my Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The room I had was very spacious for my needs. Everything was sparkling clean. The only problem I had was all the bedding and linens had a strong chlorine smell which was a bit overpowering. The bed was very comfortable, the mattress was good, and the duvet cover was very soft. They give you lots of pillows on the bed.

review.title: Might expect more for the price
review.reviewText: The room was clean and comfortable and when we first arrived a bellman rushed out to help with our bags. That was the best I can say. The concierge was always busy, and when I put a call in to have them phone a shuttle for the airport, they rushed off the phone and I never got a call back. I called for the shuttle myself. Room service was expensive and the food was okay. Being by the Wharf was noisy (as I expected) but I didn't expect to have people talking, yelling and drinking in the hallway outside our room at 3:30 am. In all fairness, it was Memorial weekend and, I realize, a very busy weekend. All in all we had a great trip, but I don't think we'll stay at the Sheraton at the Wharf again.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is two blocks from the Wharf...just far enough to be quiet! The rooms are very well kept, and very clean. The parking is expensive (it is everywhere!!), but the valet service is excellent. Would go back if given the chance!

review.title: Great price Good hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel isnt your typical Shearton, it appears to be a little outdated, but we didnt spend much time in it as we were sight seeing the whole time there. Our first morning there we were rudely awaken by tile cutting outside our window due to the swimming pool remodel. We were never notified about this, and when we complained we were quickly moved into a new room on a different wing of the hotel. We never received any type of compensation for our rude awakening or our inconvenience. This place is overall a good place to stay, it is one block from pier39, it has a 711 convenience store 1/2 a block and if you start craving pancakes or a very affordable diner there is a IHOP down the street open 24 hours.

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: Helpful and friendly staff, big comfortable room, quiet, great location! Will be back!

review.title: Excellent experience !
review.reviewText: My wife and I were VERY pleased with this hotel. Everyone there was totally interested in making sure we enjoyed our stay at the Wharf. THE MOST comfortable bed we have ever slept in!

review.title: worst hotel in San francisco
review.reviewText: if the Sheaton Fisherman's Wharf was the only hotel available in San Francisco, I'll sleep in my car!

review.title: Beware !! high $/night for parking!!
review.reviewText: I was surprised at the high cost to park our rental car at the hotel. I requested a non smoking room and they told me there wasn't one, and the smoking room had a strong smoke smell, strong enough to make the stay uncomfortable. The pool was not open. The rooms were cleaned very well and well supplied with towels, shampoo, etc.

review.title: Will not be staying there again.
review.reviewText: Just got back from a four day stay. We found the hotel to be very expensive for not offering much to the customer. They charge an extreme price for continental breakfeast, hotels that were much less expensive that I have stayed in have not charged in the past. We were very surprised. I was told the pool construction would be done by the time our vacation came around. Pool was closed and will be closed thru April. We had the concierge confirm our airport shuttle, she gave him the wrong day. We contacted the conceirge again on the day we were leaving and she did not pick up the phone and never returned our message. Thank goodness we got a hold of the shuttle co. finally on our own. We also found that the staff is not as helpful as they proclaim to be. The cashier in the gift shop was extremely rude to us. My last complaint is we did not have consistent hot water during our whole stay, it either went hot/cold or just stayed barely warm. I will not be staying at Sheraton again, especially in at Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: love San Francisco,hotel OK
review.reviewText: Good location but e room lacked a lot. The people working at the hotel were all outstanding...friendly helpful and really seemed glad you were there. The maid service was good too. The room needed to be updated. Could of used a lot more closet space. And bathroom space.

review.title: Super San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is ideally located for any San Francisco Adventure. The main point of our visit was Fisherman's Wharf and Alcatraz, so thishotel was a perfect fit. No rental car was needed as we could walk everywhere we wanted to go. When we did decide to venture out the cable car system was perfect. It was fun and easy to use. The Sheraton has always been one of my favorites and once again proved the best. Compliments to the hotel staff who were all accomodating and helpful during our stay. The front desk was especially to be commended for upgrading my room to make up for the weather delay we experienced when trying to fly in. And the rest of the staff was also helpful when I needed to check my outgoing flight status and also allowed me to do the online checkin right there at the desk. Sure saved me time since the weather was getting bad again. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and stay here again on my next trip to SF.

review.title: Overall OK
review.reviewText: The look and feel were a bit out of the mid-80's but overall it's a nice place with a comfortable bed.

review.title: Bus Maintenance yard at one end.
review.reviewText: There was a constant level of noise from the bus yard across the street that all but destroyed any chance at sleep until about 3AM.

review.title: Good value hotel
review.reviewText: Great value for a hotel in S.F. (especially so close to Fisherman's Wharf. We ate fresh cracked crab for breakfast every day. The hotel staff was attentive and responsive. I would definitely recommend.

review.title: Great location, people and service to please!
review.reviewText: Great location. Convenient to attractions, hwys, dining locations. Service employees are happy and eager to serve! Rooms are very clean and well designed for comfort. We will return to this one!

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel located just two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and the cable cars. I have now stayed at this hotel twice, several nights each time, and highly recommend it. The hotel is dead quiet at night and is spotless. Unlike other hotels in San Francisco, this one has air conditioning (evidently not that common). Service is excellent.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Approximately three short blocks to Pier 39 -- a happening place -- restaurants, shops, "Menopause, the Musical," and lots of action going on. In fact, it's tough to get a cab as they say "It's only one block."

review.title: Not worth the $$
review.reviewText: Although the rooms were quite comfortable, the front desk service was horrible. The representatives were rude and quite unhelpful. We were charged $36.00US/day to park our rental car and then were charged an ADDITIONAL FEE to call from the room to pick the car up from the hotel garage! We are returning to San Fran in November and will NOT stay here.

review.title: Not worth the $$
review.reviewText: Although the rooms were quite comfortable, the front desk service was horrible. The representatives were rude and quite unhelpful. We are returning to San Fran in November and will NOT stay here.

review.title: Maid service could be better
review.reviewText: The only thing we were disappointed in was the maid service. While our room was cleaned daily, they often forgot to re-supply our room with such items as clean glasses or an ice bag for the ice container.

review.title: I will not hesitate to stay in the hotel in future.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were friendly and helpfull throughout our stay. The hotel's proximity to Pier 39, and MUNI transporation system was indeed invaluable. I strongly recommend this hotel for anyone who has less than 4 days in San Francisco but intending to experience the beautiful experience of the city.

review.title: Sheraton
review.reviewText: Friendly staff. Easy walk for kids to Fisherman's wharf and pier 39. Good breakfast and buffet. Would stay here again.

review.title: best I have stayed at !
review.reviewText: Best beds of any hotel ever, even the pillows are wonderful.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: -Expensive parking, but that is true everywhere in San Fran. -Good buffet -$10 High Speed Internet -Close to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Great location to experience Fisherman' wharf, It's perfect walking to several sites.
review.reviewText: My only complaint was that I requested not to be by the elevator. On our first nite, we were awaken by this intense noise from 2:00am to 7:00 am, which i found out was a problem with the elevator, which they did fix shortly afterwards.and the parking was shocking.I had to pay $32.00 a nite to park in the hotel parking.I feel that the hotel should have brought this to my attention. Over all the hotel staff was great.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: The hotel was great and the location was even better. I had a regular room with a king bed. The size of the room was good. That can be an issue with San Fran because rent is so high and other hotels' rooms are very small. It was one block from fisherman warf which is fun at night and during the day. I definitely recommend this hotel. THe only negative with the hotel is it was under construction on the outside. This won't be an issue in a few months. You may want to call to find out when the contruction will end. Even with the construction, I would visit this hotel again.

review.title: close to the bay
review.reviewText: we were able to walk to fishermans wharf where we spent most our time.  It was a very comfortable hotel and very convient.  hte service was good.

review.title: Not a 4 star hotel!
review.reviewText: My husband and I brought our 2 kids with us and our immediate reaction to the room was that it was very small and very cramped. Besides the 2 double beds, and the TV/Closet Armoire, there was only enough room for a desk and one chair. The storage space was limited. For a room that was supposed to sleep 4 adults, there were only 3 small drawers in the armoire for clothes plus it doubled as a closet so we ended up storing the luggage underneath the bathroom vanity. The bathroom was so small you have to squeeze in and out to use it. This room may be okay for a couple but NOT for families. And definately not for 4 adults!
